review_text: After a brief wait I was treated in a friendly professional manner by all three staff I interacted with.   The receptionist had to help my old self with the check in computer choices which she did in a friendly efficient way.  Should I need urgent care in the future I‚Äôll definitely be back.  It was almost fun.

The ladies at the front desk had very good and nice hospitality!!! Very polite. Helpful and friendly! Clean atmosphere. Very fast with getting the patients in the back! Thanks for making me a happy customer.

First time at this location. Friendly and caring staff. Very clean waiting area with plenty of space to sit inside. Had a brief wait before being called but the staff apologized for that which I appreciated:) Definitely would return and recommend their services.
Easy checking in and my wait time in the waiting room was very short.  The person who did my vitals was very pleasant and easy to talk to. The PA was very professional.

Such a wonderful hidden gem! It‚Äôs free to get in, but they accept donations‚Äîwhich is amazing considering how well the farm is managed. The place is spotless, the animals are clearly well cared for, and it‚Äôs a perfect outing for kids. The staff are incredibly kind and helpful, making the whole experience even more enjoyable. Highly recommend supporting this special place!

What a special place! Free to visit and so beautiful. It‚Äôs not a petting zoo but many of the animals are friendly and do enjoy pets. Every farm animal you can think of, and it‚Äôs huge! There is space for the kids to run, plenty of shade, and tables to sit and relax or have a snack. There‚Äôs a big handwashing station as well as large bathrooms. Plus a little free library was a great bonus. The activity barn is beautiful as well, and the staff are so sweet!! Love love love, can‚Äôt wait to come back!
It was an amazing experience & its free! Small space but clean, the animals are social and their staff is well prepared they will answer all the questions you have!

Awesome place with a wonderful staff that truly seem to love what they do. They are always finding ways to improve the experience and enhance the farm for the animals and the community. Keep up the amazing work!
Such a great farm run by wonderful people. We had a field trip here and our preschoolers loved it. We hope to come back every year!

I can‚Äôt say enough good things about Paw Haven Animal Hospital. From the moment we walked in, the staff treated us with kindness, professionalism, and genuine care. The front desk team was welcoming and efficient, and the technicians handled my schnauzer with such patience and compassion that it immediately put us both at ease.

My schnauzer was viciously attacked by a much larger dog, and the doctors at Paw Haven Animal Hospital quite literally **saved her life**. They acted quickly, provided expert treatment, and guided me every step of the way through a very stressful situation. We are forever grateful to them for giving my little one a second chance.

The doctors are extremely knowledgeable and take the time to explain everything in detail, making sure I fully understood my pet‚Äôs needs and treatment options. What really stood out was their balance of professionalism with a true love for animals‚Äîyou can tell they treat each pet as if it were their own.

The hospital itself is very clean, well-organized, and well equipped, which gave me confidence that my pet was in the best hands. On top of that, their services are reasonably priced, especially considering the exceptional level of care they provide. They even followed up after the visit to check on my schnauzer, which meant a lot and showed how much they care beyond the appointment.

If you are looking for a veterinary clinic where you and your pet will be treated with respect, compassion, top-quality care, and fair pricing, Paw Haven Animal Hospital is the place to go. I highly recommend them!

I own a small Chiwauwau-Cockerpoo, and I phoned and made an initial appointment to have My Little Kaede girl checked for good health. I met Dr.Sutton ( a Michigan State Graduate) and I‚Äôm from Michigan; Dr. Sutton was very pleasant, knowledgeable and observed a complete check up on Little Kaede. She has been back, and completed all Her Vaccinations and worm/ gummies. We love the office personnel,Dr.Sutton, and the Tecnicians  that take great Care of Little Kaedeüêæüêæ. We love this office, Our Dr. Sutton and the Techicians, that performed Kaede‚Äôs injections and Medications! Thank You for such great service üêæüêæüê∂üíï

.The staff is very friendly and helpful. We take both of our fur babies to Paw Haven. Our 5 yr old German Shepherd  and 8 pound, 6 yr old, Toy golden doodle have had the best care. Our  golden doodle just had her teeth cleaned and Dr. Orange was fantastic. There were no issues and Ruby was back to her old self later that evening. Our German Shepherd is very nervous around vets, but they have always been about to keep her calm and feeling safe. I would highly recommend Paw Haven Animal Hospital.

This place is filled with a bunch of females that don't actually CARE about animals. A dog DOES NOT need a rabies shot every year. They only want money.  Make sure to NOT take your babies here. There's lots of AMAZING vets in Winyer Haven. This is DEFINITELY NOT a good one. The so called acupuncture was nothing but b12 shots and they definitely over charged for that.

I want to give Paw Haven Animal Hospital a shout out. I don't ever do this but these people, Ellie, Dr.Orange, Heather and Jalynn, are the best human beings I ever met. If I could give more than five stars I would ‚ò∫Ô∏è
Everyone here went above and beyond for our fur baby. I have always had fur babies so l've been to just about every vet office in Lakeland and not one of these people or vets have ever done what Paw Haven did. These people are awesome and if you're looking for a new vet or vet in general check them out you will not regret it. I called almost every vet in town and no one could see my fur baby till like 3 days later and they were the only vet to get our baby in and they did an emergency surgery the very next morning and thanks to them our fur baby is still alive and for that and everything else they did and I will always be grateful to them for that and just being great, kind, and supportive people who care as much as we do for our fur babies. Again thank you so much for everything yall did for us, you all are the very best!

This was our first time bringing our dog Jade here, and we had such a great experience. The staff were very friendly, professional, and welcoming, and Jade was treated with so much care. Her grooming turned out beautifully, and she looked and felt amazing afterward. It‚Äôs clear they truly care about the pets they work with. We‚Äôll definitely be coming back and highly recommend them!

If I could recommend any boarding/day care facility it would be Paw Printz! The staff is so kind and they go above and beyond to make you feel safe and content while your pet is in their care. I‚Äôve never seen my dog so happy somewhere and the daily photo updates on their Facebook page always make me smile!

I took my kitten Jade to get her nails trimmed, I was in and out in under 10 minutes! The staff was so friendly and gentle! Definitely going back and recommending to everyone for their fur babies needs!

I‚Äôve been taking my boy here weekly for months now. He absolutely loves going, he runs right in and is ready to play. I love knowing that he is safe and having fun while I‚Äôm at work. They get some of the best pictures and I love that they post them so I can see them too. The staff is very friendly and makes it super convenient doing any grooming needs while he‚Äôs at daycare. They are the best!

We have been takin our dog Lucky here for over a year now and she always comes home happy and tired!! The staff are super friendly and you can tell they care about all of the dogs. Cannot recommend Paw Printz enough!

For over a year now I have had my dogs being watched after by them. I can safely say this is one of my best home routine investments!
With a very busy schedule and leaving very early for work it seemed impossible to get a dog daycare service that fulfilled my household needs until I met them. They have a reasonably priced pick up and drop off service which makes it possible for me to have the dogs in daycare during the week. They also do boarding which is my safe go to when out of town. I have had one of my dogs there since she was a puppy.

I absolutely love and trust them!

Nicole and the entire Pawfect Pals Team are outstanding. I was referred to Nicole, through a neighbor, 7+ years ago. We remain loyal, committed clients.

I trust the walkers implicitly with my fur-baby.
They are compassionate, reliable, and communicative with each walk or playgroup.

The highlight of my day is receiving the post-walk update with pictures.

Plus, the Wednesday playgroup is a must. My fur-baby is entertained, socialized and attends several parties & holiday observations, with fab photos.

I HIGHLY recommend Pawfect Pals and easily rate the company 5*.

I‚Äôve been using Pawfect Pals Miami for over 9 years now for my dog (who is more like my child). They have always treated him like he is one of there‚Äôs and really understand his high maintenance needs. They‚Äôre very communicative and send lots of pic and updates both from walks and play group and daycare. They really go above and beyond, highly recommend!

I‚Äôve been a Pawfect Pals client since January of 2024. When I started a new job that required me to be in the office 5 days per week, I visited and interviewed every dog walking service I could find for my (reactive and admittedly difficult) 6.5lb long-haired chihuahua Tuco.  Nicole and her team go above and beyond all the rest, and you won‚Äôt find another pet care service that is as communicative and trustworthy as Pawfect Pals!!

After having walkers come get him for about a year, Tuco was exhibiting some aggressive behaviors if anyone besides his favorite walker was available. Rather than drop Tuco and me as clients, Nicole suggested that Tuco may do better going to daycare. I was extremely hesitant at first given Tuco‚Äôs reactivity towards other dogs on walks, but I can honestly say without a doubt it is the best thing I could have possibly done for my baby.

Over the last 6 months, Tuco‚Äôs true personality has come through and he is even making a few bark buddies, which is translating so well to his reactivity training. When Tuco realizes we‚Äôre pulling up to daycare, I no longer exist to him; he‚Äôs looking out the window, wagging his tail, and practically jumping out of the car as soon as Nicole or Karla open the door. Other than an all you can eat buffet, I‚Äôm pretty sure Tuco would say Pawfect Pals is the most magical place on earth üòÇ.

Nicole and her team treat my spicy chihuahua like the VIP (very important pup) that this overly neurotic millennial dog mom (that‚Äôs me) raised him to be. In short if you‚Äôre looking for someone to help you care for your pet, you couldn‚Äôt do any better than Pawfect Pals!

Nicole and Karla have been looking after Spot for several months now.

They take really good care of him and he enjoys going to daycare and interacting with all the other pups.

They offer a drop off service which is awesome as I often have work events in the evening.  Spot is delivered home and fed dinner.  I come home to a happy tired puppy.

The Time to Pet app that they utilize is also very user friendly and allows for me to quickly request services and see photos of him enjoying his time

Highly recommended

It went very well for IS-O, MO-JO and, Luna-tic.
I appreciate the effort you all made to accommodate we four in a room and, work to make the visit as positive as possible. After all, they were going to the vet not the park or the pool. So, one can expect a little uncertainty from pups. Thank you again

Everybody there is professional and polite. They listen to my needs and concerns for my pet and try to adjust them the best way possible. My dog is on the hyper side and they‚Äôre so patient and kind to him.

I wish they were more clear with products and services done or needing to be done. Maybe I misunderstood but I expected my last appointment to be one way and it came out completely different and a lot more expensive but still a great vet! I wouldn‚Äôt take my dog anywhere else!

Our rescue Louie had a great first visit for his first check up! The staff was great and everyone took the time to answer all of my questions. I didn‚Äôt feel rushed at all. Louie was treated like he was one of their own pets.

Dr Mitchell and team were very kind and took the time to explain everything. She ensured we went home with a  treatment plan that she and I both agreed on. They followed up a couple days later to see how my dog was doing and the best news is he is doing much better.

We took my 2 pet rats here and were able to be seen same day for urgent care visit. They were nice to our rats and the vet seemed very knowledgeable about them. We waited a while for the results of the cytology but that is understandable because we were walk ins. I will bring my rats in again for future care.

Paws 4 Liberty has been a life-changing support for me and my service dog, Mia. From the very beginning, they went above and beyond to help us train together and make sure we were not only a good match, but also safe and successful as a team.

What really stands out is that their support doesn‚Äôt end when the training ends. They trained Mia with me over two years ago, and to this day I can reach out and they treat me as if I just entered the program. They never ‚Äúwrite you off‚Äù, they truly mean it when they say, ‚Äúwe‚Äôre here if you need anything, now or in the future.‚Äù

Everyone I have ever met or spoken to through their organization has been kind, patient, and genuinely committed to helping. They care deeply about both the veteran and the dog, and they‚Äôre always ready with resources, encouragement, or hands-on guidance.

As a 20+ year veteran, 100% permanently and totally disabled with mobility challenges, I can honestly say Paws 4 Liberty has helped me tremendously, and continues to help as my needs evolve.

I highly recommend this organization to any veteran in need of a service dog. From one veteran to another: trust them, respect them, and give them the patience and kindness they so freely give. They are truly a wonderful organization.

This my service dog Milo and he's been working with Mycaela since he was about 4 months old. Her knowledge and training tactics are awesome and Milo is always on his BEST behavior when we're out and about. Due to her training he is welcomed and embraced everywhere we go! Paws for Liberty is an awesome organization! I couldn't have picked a better organization to train my boy Milo.

I can‚Äôt recommend Paws for Liberty enough! McKayla is the world‚Äôs best dog trainer she has an incredible way of understanding dogs and veterans with unique needs. My service dog in training, Cooper, has made amazing progress in the program, behavior, and reliability thanks to her guidance. McKayla‚Äôs approach is compassionate, effective, and tailored to each dog‚Äôs role and personality. If you need a trainer who truly cares about both the dog and the handler, this is the place to go!

I wish there were more than 5 stars. This organization has changed my life. My bestfriend Doc (he‚Äôs a German Shepard) was introduced to me since a young pup and we‚Äôve been rolling ever since. I have no one else to thank but the Paws 4 Liberty team. Great training, flexibility and commitment to helping me out as a veteran and my pup. Thank you P4L.

Always a great experience for the whole family.  They have been training for me since 2017 with Cooper my chocolate lab and most recently with Harley our mixed breed.  Everyone is very understanding and professional in the way that makes it pleasant for me.  Very nice to work with such an amazing crew.

provider_name: Paws On The Ground Dog Training
review_text:
Absolutely the best decision we made for our dog!
We spoke with several trainers before finding Paws on the Ground, and none of them felt right‚Äîuntil we met Kristin and Corey in St. Petersburg. They immediately made us feel safe and supported. Our dog Beatrice is a rescue, and I was so nervous to send her to a board and train, worried she might feel abandoned again. But from the moment we dropped her off, they treated her like their own‚Äîsweet voices, gentle pets, and so much kindness.

They kept us updated with pictures and messages (which I loved!), and the difference in Bea after training is incredible. Before, she pulled hard on walks, jumped on us constantly, and tried to dart out the door. Now she walks beautifully on a loose leash, rarely jumps, and waits patiently at the door. She still has her happy, quirky personality‚Äîjust in a much more manageable way!

The fact that they offer free lifetime refreshers and training tune-ups during boarding is such a bonus. I was hesitant about the cost, but now that I‚Äôve seen the results, I‚Äôd do it all over again. If you‚Äôre thinking about training with Kristin and Corey‚Äîgo for it. You won‚Äôt regret it!

provider_name: Paws On The Ground Dog Training
review_text:
Kristen and her husband are absolutely amazing! We started Baylor (German shepherd) in their 2-week puppy class, and we loved it so much that we sent her back for the 2-week adult training. The change in Baylor was incredible , she came back so much calmer, more confident, and well-behaved. I honestly get compliments on her all the time when we‚Äôre out and about!

What really sets Kristen apart is how much she truly cares about the dogs. You can tell she isn‚Äôt just going through the motions,  she genuinely loves working with them. I always felt completely comfortable leaving Baylor with her, knowing she was in the best hands. She also would send me cute videos of her progress!

If you want a trainer who‚Äôs skilled, kind, and truly cares about your dog, Kristen and her husband are the ones to trust. I can‚Äôt recommend them enough!
They‚Äôre truly the best!!!

Below is an example of Baylor being in public and just relaxing and staying in place!

provider_name: Paws On The Ground Dog Training
review_text:
I can't say enough about POTG training.  Kenzi and Kellen were amazing. They are so knowledgeable, talented,professional and trustworthy.  Our 4 month old german shepherd puppy Jett was such a handful that we needed help!! Kenzi and Kellen are just what we needed.
Jett is a work in progress (he's still a puppy) but they gave us the skills and tools needed to make Jett the perfect dog.
If you need guidance with your dog then POTG is exactly what you need. You won't be sorry

We finished our 3 week board and train with Kellen. At first we were hesitant about leaving our puppy for 3 weeks but after Jett went through his 3 week hybrid training and getting to know Kellen we felt so much more comfortable leaving Jett. He is so much more manageable at home.  Kellen did an amazing job with Jett. He gave us the tools we needed to continue his training at home. In addition,  we had a family emergency and needed Jett to be boarded. Without a moments hesitation were able to drop Jett off for a few days. His "place" command is a lifesaver.

provider_name: Paws On The Ground Dog Training
review_text: I can‚Äôt say enough good things about this dog training place! I brought in my Frenchie and Pocket Bully. Two very stubborn but sweet dogs and the transformation has been amazing. The trainers are super knowledgeable, patient, and truly understand how to work with different breeds and personalities.Both of my dogs now walk on leash without pulling, listen to commands, and have way better manners around other dogs and people. Definitely recommend!!!!

provider_name: Paws On The Ground Dog Training
review_text:
I trusted POTG (new port richey ) to train my dog , as she isn‚Äôt always good with other dogs. I was told 4-5 weeks wil be enough time for this training. I won‚Äôt get into the promises that I was told that were completely untrue, but I will say this‚Ä¶.i repeated myself a minimum of 5 times at how worried I was about the heat and her overheating (she‚Äôs a big girl)‚Ä¶I repeated a minimum of 5 times  that I needed to see the facility of where she would be staying and training, as I was told her training would be mostly indoor due to it being August in Florida and she overheats‚Ä¶.
Long story short, I was told that everything would be just fine‚Ä¶just pay and go and trust us.
Well, I don‚Äôt trust them and I will never again go to a dog train/board unless there are cameras and I suggest nobody else does either.
I can only thank God that something kept telling me to go get my dog. I ignored the nagging voice for 1 week and then it was too much to think about. I sent my brother and sister (unannounced) to get my girl. They were right near the new port richey facility.
I truly believe , had I not finally listen to my instinct, my dog wouldn‚Äôt be here today.
My dog (after 1 week) had lost at least 5 pounds‚Ä¶.her breathing when she got into the car was terrifying. My sister took video once she got home to give water (too long to upload)
She was bleeding from a big sore on her leg and it was infected ‚Ä¶she  was so thirsty she couldn‚Äôt stop drinking water. It was dangerous how dehydrated she was.
To top it off, she had a horrible urinary tract infection  (probably from not having water) .
Lastly, for at least a week after I got her, she wouldn‚Äôt stop chasing her tail. Makes me wonder if she was ever out of her ‚Äúcage‚Äù.
I don‚Äôt know if I can forgive myself for only going by ‚Äúreviews‚Äù. They have good reviews, but they‚Äôre shared with all the other locations , so I don‚Äôt think it‚Äôs a fair assessment.
I plead with Paws On The Ground , change your practices! I was told after the fact, that water is kept from the dogs as a training tactic!!!! You cannot do this . Especially in Florida!
Anyone considering training anywhere, unless they have cameras full time, don‚Äôt send your precious animals to them.
Transparency is sooo mandatory.

provider_name: Paws and Claws Animal Medical Center - Dunedin
review_text: Everyone in this office has been incredibly caring and kind since my first visit. I have a puppy with some persistent issues and they have always gotten me in quickly and make me (and the pup) feel comfortable. It can‚Äôt be easy to take on so many clients with just one doctor, but her time and attention to each patient is outstanding. Highly recommend.

provider_name: Paws and Claws Animal Medical Center - Dunedin
review_text: This place was outstanding in all aspects! They treated me AND my puppy with care and provided great insight for my puppy. Walked in and the staff was super welcoming and kind. Dr. Culpepper is such an incredible person in general, I could tell she cares for her patients as if they were her own pet and she is one of the most personable vets ever. My puppy and I really enjoyed going to this clinic since all of our concerns were addressed and the pet care was thorough and genuine. I recommend this clinic to anyone and everyone especially if you want your pet in the best hands:)

provider_name: Paws and Claws Animal Medical Center - Dunedin
review_text: Dr. Culpepper and her staff are absolutely amazing. I brought my dog, Sheba, to an appointment and I was absolutely blown away by how caring, respectful, and attentive Dr. Culpepper and her staff were with Sheba. They get you into a room very fast and seem to clean each room out after every dog which I appreciate. Dr. Culpepper is the only vet at the clinic so you might have to wait a bit after your appointment time until she makes it into the room but it‚Äôs so worth it because she gives both the pet and the owner all of her time to truly figure out what is wrong and come up with a treatment plan. Bonus is they are very reasonably priced which I appreciate because my last vet was way overpriced and I felt like I didn‚Äôt have the same experience or connection that I had at Paws and Claws. If I could rate 10 stars I would! Highly highly recommend to bring your pets to Dr. Culpepper. I know I will!

provider_name: Paws and Claws Animal Medical Center - Dunedin
review_text: I am so very appreciative of Dr Culpepper and the entire staff at Paws and Claws.  I was in need of a home visit for a very sweet large dog who had been abused by a prior owner and as a result she needs heavy sedation to visit a veterinarian‚Äôs office ‚Äî however, once sedated I cannot get her into my car.  None of the mobile vets listed on google traveled to my area so I called my dog lover friends and one suggested I try Paws and Claws.  So pleased with the friendly and helpful staff and amazed at the patient, professional care my dog received from Dr Culpepper.  Such a relief to know this service is available!

provider_name: Paws and Claws Animal Medical Center - Dunedin
review_text:
Dr Culpepper and her staff our truly amazing caring and compassionate people!!
I can‚Äôt say enough of how happy we are to have found them!!! My little Rocky was not stressed at all and you could see how he was content to be there. They treated and within a few hours he had instant relief. They even called a couple days later to see how he was doing. So thoughtful! They were not only very nice to us but also treated Rocky like their own.

Tried to scam us.
We went there to try and see what they could tell us about my conures broken leg.
and the doctor confirmed to us that it was a broken leg and They gave us a price estimate of $800. The doctor said that the way he knew was because he felt his bone with his hand and knew it was out of place. Then later he told us that he knew because he took an X-ray (He took the x-ray before we decided to go through with any procedure, and we did not ask him to take an x-ray). We decided to go through with the procedure and then the doctor told us that he did not want to do the procedure because the birds bones were already mending. MIND YOU, HE TOLD US AFTER HE ALREADY SEDATED THE BIRD. Well, he‚Äôs about to bring us the bird when they tell us we have to pay $267 dollars for an x-ray. We NEVER approved or asked for an x-ray before we decided to go through with the procedure. He did the X-ray for himself before we even agreed to anything. Then later, they had the audacity to try to charge us for anesthesia that was given to the bird EVEN THOUGH he never actually did anything with the bird. He should‚Äôve known that the bones were already mending BEFORE he gave the bird anything.

The doctor was nice and gave us some good info and tips, but the way he just tried to get money out of us, that‚Äôs where he lost a customer. Don‚Äôt come here if you don‚Äôt want to lose your money.

I brought my blue tongue skink here for some concerns I was having about his health.
The staff was very polite. There was a little bit of a wait to be seen, but it wasn‚Äôt a problem or anything excessive.
The doctor was professional and kind. He was thorough in explaining what kind of tests he recommended, and answered all of my annoying questions. I really appreciate his patience because I can be a big worrier when it comes to my pets.
I feel comfortable trusting them with my reptile‚Äôs veterinary needs and recommend them highly.

I would recommend Paws and Claws Medical Center for your beloved fur babies! The entire staff is very professional, welcoming, knowledgeable, and caring. They are easy to get in contact with and respond quickly. We are seen by Dr. Ramon and he has been very helpful and empathetic. The front staff are always friendly and responsive. The office is clean and organized and they always offer coffee and have treats out (for us humans)! My bunnies and I are very happy that we found them üíï

This an amazing practice !! They treated my dog (my third baby) very nice and kind ü•∞ The clinic was very clean and professional environment. Since arriving, staff from the front desk greeted us and made us feel at home. I would definitely recommend Dr. De Armas and staff.

Paws and Claws is the BESTü•∞ü•∞ü•∞!!! Staff extremely welcoming and friendly. Very attentive to my üê∞ fur baby‚Äôs needs. They will treat your fur baby just like one of their own. Boarding my üê∞ fur baby has been a breeze. You can communicate with them directly through text. The staff answer right away. Scheduling an appointment has been a simple and easy process. Droopy loves them!!! I highly recommend Paws and Claws!  ü§óüòäü•∞

provider_name: Paws and Tails Reiki & Therapeutic Massage
review_text:
My 10+ year old dog Finnegan, a large Great Pyrenees mix, had lateral suture surgery on both of his hind legs on the same day to stabilize his knees.  The trauma was further multiplied when the callous on his elbow burst, and next when he became lethargic and we found out that the NSAIDs may have caused possible liver and kidney issues.  He also was emotionally out of sorts and would not venture out in his beloved back yard where he had once ruled the roost.

The cascading health events caused a delay in the mobility therapy I had planned for him.   I felt overwhelmed until I found Jill at Paws and Tails Reiki & Therapeutic Massage.  After clearing with the surgeon, I bought a package of Reiki and massage.  I can honestly say it has not only helped Finn with mobility, stress, and healing, but it has helped me too so that I can be armed with knowledge, healing homework, and tools to manage both of our stress levels brought about by the traumatic health issues.

Jill's kindness mixed with professional experience has helped both Finn and I cope with this trying experience.  Thank you so much Jill for all your help so far.  I really especially enjoy watching you work your magic during massage and loosening up that facia!  The pro tips are golden and much appreciated including ‚Äúinch worms‚Äù head to tail, support knee and hock while working on PT's prescribed range of motion exercises while being careful never to dig into the groin, flexing foot exercises, healing hands when in proper frame of mind and doing the all-important light work, meditation, that is part of Reiki, etc.

Thank you for your patience, wisdom, tutorial/instructions using charts, diagrams, 3d skeleton, all conveyed with both big words and in layman‚Äôs terms.  It is all very much appreciated and we are looking forward to our next session!  You are an absolute gem!  So glad we found you!

provider_name: Paws and Tails Reiki & Therapeutic Massage
review_text: Jill possesses an in depth knowledge of caring for pets and connecting with them energetically. She is truly gifted and dedicated to helping animals heal while uniquely having the ability to support the owners during stressful times.

provider_name: Paws and Tails Reiki & Therapeutic Massage
review_text: Very interesting

Lori is an absolutely amazing trainer. Her love and compassion for our dog Gage is evident in every session. Gage has made great strides quickly picking up commands due to Loris approach. Lori has also done a great job training us and helping us through the puppy months. I highly recommend Lori.

Lori is a skilled and patient trainer who helped both of our Huskies thrive.

Lori trained our first Husky five years ago, so when we decided to add another furry family member we knew exactly who to call. Our second pup, Wembley, turned out to be a whole new level of challenge. Crate training, obedience, potty training, and leash walking were all uphill battles. We enrolled her in the Dream Dog program just like we did with our first, and Lori not only trained Wembley but also coached us through the chaos of raising a spirited Husky puppy. In those exhausting early weeks with sleepless nights and endless accidents, she was our go-to lifeline, reminding us it would get better. And she was right.

When Wembley first met Lori, she
screamed with excitement for a full ten minutes. Not to be left out, our other Husky joined in, and suddenly we were living one of those wild TikTok Husky videos with two dogs howling in perfect sync. Lori never missed a beat. She calmly helped us settle them down and dove right into the work. Under her guidance, Wembley went from ignoring every cue to being laser focused during training sessions, excelling in obedience, and growing into the sweetest pup.

We are so grateful that Lori has been part of both our dogs‚Äô journeys. Her skill, patience, and support have been truly invaluable, and we cannot recommend her enough.

Lori is amazing. She was so patient, kind, and knowledgeable with my toy poodle Lucy. I saw such a big improvement in Lucy‚Äôs behavior and confidence. Training with Lori was fun, effective, and such a great experience. We highly recommend! üêæü©∑

Lori Hill is a patient and deliberate dog trainer. Her consistent, positive reinforcement makes training easy for both dog and owner. I have an extremely large and powerful Bullmastiff puppy. She is 80 pounds at 6 months old. Lori has transformed her into a wonderful, well behaved pet.
Lori has been a great help with our puppy Abby. She is very good at what she does and has a lot of patience with pups and the owners. I recommend her services highly. Abby loves her!!

We just loved Tyler (Tallahassee). Smart, compassionate & knowledgeable. I‚Äôd recommend him for problem canine behaviors for sure. He totally knows what to do and in the most efficient way possible. Thank you, Tyler. Little Barbie is now smiling - as are we!

Lisa Matthews is just wonderful!  From her many certifications to her joy and caring, I would recommend her to anyone who needs help with their doggo. She knew when our dog was ill (it took us/vet a long time to figure it out). She knew what the dog‚Äôs temperament would be and what was coming for us (all true). She has so much experience that she knows how to treat whatever problem you might face. Lisa is stuffed full of dog treatos and ‚Äú good decisions!‚Äù Haha. She‚Äôs simply the best!

We rescued an 18 month old Australian Cattle Dog/ German Shepherd/ Pit Bull mix in January of 2022. When we rescued her we had no idea of the extent of her issues but they became apparent very quickly. While she is extremely smart, she is also very reactive, fear aggressive and exhibits a great deal of anxiety. My husband could not really go near her or pet her without her growling at him and showing her teeth. We had no idea how to help her and I even had a vet suggest that we euthanize her because she was beyond help. That wasn't going to happen so I started researching behavior training and behavior training facilities. I read so many great reviews for Pawsitive Practice so I contacted them. I cannot begin to express how incredibly grateful I am for Pawsitive Practice and especially for Tyler.

Tyler possesses a wealth of knowledge when it comes to dog behavior and training. He was able to recommend a Veterinarian who was also very knowledgeable regarding behavior issues in dogs and using medications to help with reactiveness and anxiety. We got Ari on a medication regimen and booked a 5 session training with Tyler. I am not exaggerating when I say that because of Tyler and the medication Ari is a completely different dog today.

It was so wonderful to witness the bond that developed between Tyler and Ari. She doesn't trust easily yet she would get so excited every time she saw him. He had so many great suggestions as far as resource materials and books that would be helpful. He showed us how to redirect her when needed, how to use positive reinforcement to get her to do what we wanted her to do and how to build trust with her. She still has a ways to go, but she is miles from where she started and we now have the tools needed to continue to train her and help her to become the best dog that she can be.

It is very evident that Tyler truly cares about the dogs that he helps train. He would call weekly to check on Ari and ask how she was doing or to give me some recommendations on things to try. He sent me some articles that he came across that he felt would be helpful and even took time to come to a couple of her vet visits. He far exceeded any expectations that I had regarding training and Ari and I will be forever grateful for the help he was able to provide.

Lisa was amazing with our 6-year old rescue who came to us displaying anxiety, some fear aggression, and limited basic training. The main problem areas we wanted to address were: lunging and snarling at cars or people that passed us on walks and also growling/snapping at new visitors that would come to the house. We signed up for a 5-session package. After a couple sessions, Lisa advised us to speak with our vet to find a medication to help calm her anxiety. I'm so glad we did! When we combined the medication along with Lisa's training techniques we have been able to achieve a much happier, responsive, calm, and self confident dog.

As a trainer, Lisa is patient and effusively positive. She's all about the love and treats. She was very knowledgeable and always explained the reasoning behind the various techniques and how to effectively employ them.  I liked that we were able to train both at her facility and in our own home depending on the skills we had to work on.

Finding Lisa Matthews with Pawsitive Practice was the best thing for our furry family member. She deserves every one of those 5 stars. And more!

Piper had been a part of our family for 2 years when my son moved out, taking his dog, Audrey, with him. Audrey was Piper‚Äôs BFF and, unknown to us, her calming factor. We‚Äôd known that Piper was an anxious dog but it‚Äôs severity surfaced with Audrey out of the picture. It was when Piper destroyed the kitchen door moldings and doorknob that we knew we needed more help than medication could provide. I thought the situation was hopeless and those fears were reinforced when I spoke with a trainer who said Piper‚Äôs problems were out of his league. He referred me to Lisa Matthews. I wasn‚Äôt very optimistic, but as soon as I explained what we were going through with Piper, Lisa put together a plan of action with amazing results. She was Piper‚Äôs saving grace.  Today, we have routines in place and Piper knows that she can handle being alone.

Lisa also helped with Piper‚Äôs leash frustration. I was terrified to take this 85-pound baby on a walk. With Lisa‚Äôs training and reassurance, I now have the confidence to handle Piper.

Dr. Green has been our family vet since we moved to Florida 9 years ago. She and her staff are amazingly caring, knowledgeable, and compassionate. All of my animals have loved them, and I know that they are getting the best veterinary care. I can't imagine going anywhere else.

The entire care team is absolutely The Best.
My pup, Piper, runs up to the door like it‚Äôs her favorite place in the world! ‚ù§Ô∏è üêæ
Thank you Dr. Green and crew ‚ù§Ô∏è

I‚Äôve taken 3 dogs to see Dr Green now for
more than 10 years. She is super patient w my nonsense questions and my initial questioning of her judgment when we first met. The whole practice cares and they go out of their way to help. Again and again. And it‚Äôs a tiring profession. Highly recommend this well respected doctor.

I'm the owner of a local dog walking and pet sitting company.  A few of my clients bring their dogs here and now I know why first hand.  The staff very compassionate, professional, and provide excellent customer service.  They helped me out with a tough situation this week and I really appreciate what they have done.  I highly recommend them!

My dogs (Jax and Maggie Mae) and I have had Dr. Green and her team as their vet for I believe over 14 years (Buddy).  Dr. Green and her team are amazing with their support, education,  knowledge, and approach to providing the services, care, understanding, and treatment with honesty,  compassion, and love.  Shawna and her team have gone above and beyond to care for my dogs through the years, even in their last moments, my dogs knew they were in great hands.  I am forever grateful.   Thank you all, you are appreciated.  I will return when I find my new loves...‚ù§Ô∏è

provider_name: Pawsome Pet Care Nurses / Poulin Ventures LLC
review_text:
I can‚Äôt say enough wonderful things about Diane and her mobile pet clinic. From the first phone call until they left, it was clear they truly care about animals as if they were their own and go above and beyond to make both pets and owners feel comfortable and informed.

DIane was calm, patient, and incredibly knowledgeable‚Äîtaking the time to explain everything clearly and gently handling our senior dog with compassion. When we needed a prescription, Diane worked with a local DVM and even brought the medicine out to our house for us!

After the visit, Diane has been in contact with me to ensure everything is going as expected and was available via text when I had follow up questions.

What really impressed me was the convenience and personalized care. No crowded waiting rooms, no stressful car rides‚Äîjust professional, high-quality veterinary service delivered right to our doorstep. She was communicative and always on time, allowing us to continue our normal daily activities.

If you're looking for someone who genuinely loves animals and offers top-tier veterinary care without the hassle of a clinic visit, I highly recommend Pawsome Pet Care. It‚Äôs clear they treat every pet like family.

Thank you again for taking such great care of us and our big baby!

provider_name: Pawsome Pet Care Nurses / Poulin Ventures LLC
review_text: Diane has such compassion for the animals she cares for. My dog Dallas had a front leg that lost total ability to move. Vet said nothing we can do and wanted to euthanize him. Diane came over every day giving him massage and cold lazer therapy. In a week he was walking again. My dogs love going for dog camp days and spa days. Diane is definitely the one to call for all your pet needs. Highly recommend!!

provider_name: Pawsome Pet Care Nurses / Poulin Ventures LLC
review_text:
Diane and the team were amazing, hats off. She and her team took on a special project for a 200 mastiff.Our Emma was post surgery with a serious infection
And all vets turned their backs on us to help. (Except one that Diane knew to help)Well I am here to say Diane showed up and treated Emma back to health after three weeks of cleaning wounds walking her and even taking her back to her facility. This was the best experience ,I could have ever asked for and the daily follow up still to this day she calls to check on Emma. Also yes her team did travel from over an hour away(amazing) when you need daily pet care or specialized services this is the place to go!!!!! Hands down the best thank you Diane and team, we could not be any happier to have Emma back and doing well

provider_name: Pawsome Pet Care Nurses / Poulin Ventures LLC
review_text: Diane along with her team, Lu Victoria and Dylan went above and beyond to help us and our injured girl Emma due to misinformation from Kinetics Vet Specialists. Our girl had severe injuries to her under belly from a harness that was put on at this clinic which caused severe open wounds to her belly. After calling for help in our home to numerous facilities, Diane came to our home driving 45 minutes to help with Emma. I can‚Äôt say enough about her professionalism, empathy, skill, knowledge, care, compassion, commitment and follow up. Diane and her team tirelessly came to our home for 2 weeks and then boarded Emma at her facility for another 2 weeks to nurse and heal her wounds. She also trained Emma to learn how to walk again. She sent videos everyday to update the improvements and followed up with daily phone calls. Diane is an exemplary professional and animal lover. She was a huge factor in healing , love and professional care for our Emma! From the bottom of our hearts, THANK YOU AND YOUR TEAM, DIANE!

provider_name: Pawsome Pet Care Nurses / Poulin Ventures LLC
review_text: Diane and Victoria at Pawsome Pet Care are simply amazing and loving humans who only have your fur baby's best interests at heart. They might love your pet more than YOU even do! At least, that's how they make you feel. Our dog, Apollo, fell in love with "Miss Victoria" and has had the best time running around their yards on play days and he comes home exhausted, happy and obviously well cared for. We don't live in Homosassa full time but come here frequently and it gives us such peace of mind to know we have somewhere that will care for our buddy aso well when we are away.

Kate is the best! She makes our dogs feels safe and training ready and in turn makes us so comfortable when we drop them off. We have dropped off our two 60 lb boys multiple times for training. You can see in the photos how happy they are!

Pawz-itive and Kate were incredible and saved me in a very difficult situation! I had a foster dog who came to me extremely stressed from the shelter and was basically unadoptable.  Kate spent a few weeks with him and he completely changed. He went from high energy all the time and aggressive with every other dog to being able to be taken down to low energy and we found out he likes dogs his size! We also were able to take him on a meet and greet at someone‚Äôs home with their dog and he did AMAZING! Like a different dog! I could not believe it. Huge thank you - you helped my foster dog be adoptable and get adopted!

Kate is amazing! I would highly recommend her to anyone who has a puppy or dog he needs training. She trained and certified my dog Jake who recently passed. She is super professional and responsive. I can not say enough amazing things. I will be bringing my next dog Hank to her to be trained as well. Below are some pictures of my late Jake ‚ù§Ô∏è

Kate is the best dog trainer out there! She treats each dog as if they were her own giving them all the discipline and love she has to offer. My Australian Shepherd, Zeus, absolutely loves her and comes home a better trained dog every time we have him board with Kate. Kate has been a tremendous help as Zeus continues to grow and change. She will give you all the tools and tips you need to have a well trained pup! She is also super flexible with time. Highly recommend!

With dog training being an unregulated industry, it‚Äôs hard to know whether trainers are credible and even harder to put our trust in them to care for and train our beloved dogs. I can tell you with utmost certainty that Kate is the REAL DEAL. She has the knowledge and experience, and then still continues to fill her toolbox with new knowledge and build her skillset all for the betterment of our dogs and their success. But what I love most of all is that she truly cares about our dogs, and gives her heart and dedication to every dog and owner she meets. I could easily see from the first day I met her that this was more than just a job, this was her passion. For all those reasons and more, it is why her training program is successful and I will always trust her with my dogs and her training. I don‚Äôt say all this lightly, as anyone can claim they are a professional dog trainer, but I instantly saw with Kate her genuineness, care and intent she puts into her training with each dog. Her training truly stands the test of time and I will always be grateful for her expertise as a trainer and for her friendship.

I cannot say enough good things about this place! From the moment I walked in, I felt welcomed and genuinely cared for. The entire staff is so sweet they're not just professionals, they're truly compassionate people who go above and beyond to make you feel comfortable and supported.
Every session, they listen to how I'm feeling, adjust what we‚Äôre working on, and explain everything clearly. Their positive energy is contagious, and it honestly makes me look forward to coming in.
It‚Äôs clear they‚Äôre not just doing their jobs they care.  If you're looking for a place that combines expert care with real kindness, this is it. So grateful to be healing here!

I‚Äôm so grateful for the incredible team at Peace of Mind Rehab Inc. From the front desk to the therapists, every single person made me feel welcomed, supported, and cared for. The staff is not only highly skilled but also genuinely compassionate. My therapist took the time to understand my needs, explained everything clearly, and created a personalized plan that helped me make amazing progress. The clinic is clean, well-organized, and filled with positive energy. I always felt motivated and encouraged at every visit. Thank you all for making such a difference in my recovery‚Äîyou truly go above and beyond!
Peace of mind has been amazing. After my accident I was experiencing a lot of pain and I‚Äôve gotten so much better. Javier was always so helpful and attentive.

Peace of Mind Rehab has been amazing with my therapy, as well as my daughter‚Äôs, after our car accident. The team is caring, professional, and truly dedicated to helping us recover. We feel supported and in great hands every step of the way. Highly recommend!
It‚Äôs an amazing place! the staff is incredibly welcoming and understanding. I would definitely recommend that anyone who is looking to treat any kind of injury comes to this clinic. ‚≠êÔ∏è

Dr Liu and her team are great. Dr Liu is knowledgeable on medications and conditions and she actually takes time to listen to you. She  also approaches things holistically- often asking me if I'm practicing coping skills, grounding, in therapy, etc. Her front desk girls are great too - I often have to communicate through email because of my job and they are always so responsive and Dr Liu is always able to answer my questions in- between appointments.  The girls are really friendly and quick to help. Would highly recommend this office.

I've been seeing Dr. Liu for almost seven years for ADHD diagnosis and treatment after my PCP referred me. I really appreciate her caring approach and I feel listened to. Through many highs and lows of mental wellbeing, she has been a constant, accessible, provider key to my self-management.

She helped me find a compatible therapist when I was struggling to, and the office staff are helpful with various pharmacy and insurance conflicts that have popped up. Patient & kind, with a comfortable office and telehealth options. I seek many of her practice's qualities in other providers and am usually disappointed, so it's about time I review her exceptionality. From the first few visits without insurance to choosing a plan that allows a reasonable copay, it has been well worth it to see her every few months, even during some periods of a holistic approach without prescriptions.

This is a review not of Dr. Liu herself - she has been very good to me. However, her office staff is literally impossible to get a hold of. I have been trying to contact them for over a week to get hold of medical documentation needed to medically withdraw from some classes. No response to emails or follow-ups. I called them a day before the deadline, and a receptionist dismissed me with no other explanation except, "call again tomorrow." I tried, but no one is picking up the phone. I am very distressed.

Edit: Thankfully, the issue has been resolved.

I have seen Dr. Liu for almost 3 years. I really like her. She is responsive, and she is willing to try new medications if you are not making progress. She also works well with my therapist. The bad reviews seem to be about problems with the insurance companies -- not Dr. Liu. Also, the woman writing about "slavery" -- what? That makes no sense at all. You have to wonder about some of these reviewers. Why would that even come up in medical management meeting?

Dr. Liu and her staff have been attentive and responsive to date.  I'm thrilled to have a doctor who is familiar with body chemistry around females my age and hears and helps me with my mental health needs.  Highly recommended.

This place is beautiful, clean, and takes the utmost care of all their animals. They do amazing work to help animals in need. We had a great day riding horses through the park and forest and everything went so good. The barn cats were so well taken care of. Truly worth visiting

Magical place. Victor is such a great person and really loves animals. It‚Äôs like walking into this beautiful place full of wonderful people and all the animals are so happy and loved. No detail is missed. We really loved seeing all the animals including the goats.

I spent several hours here in the morning and had a fab time interacting with all the animals. Arturo was a sweet and very calm horse for me as I‚Äôm an inexperienced rider. I loved watching the young colt playing with his toys!
nice place to keep your horse in. they do a good job taking care of the whole animals there, i used to volunteer there and i see everything closely.

A wonderful experience. The horses are very well taken care of and the barns are clean. Most of the horses are rescued from race tracks but some people board their horses there. Beautiful trails if you wish to go for riding. Appointments are necessary and no small children are allowed because they run around screaming and upset the animals. Victor, the owner, is very protective of his horses and reserves the right to refuse anyone he deems unsuitable for riding. This is a charitable organization and donations are welcome.

I had a fantastic experience working with Andrea! Her approach to treatment goes beyond just pelvic floor and she offers recommendations for total body wellness.
I truly appreciated her professionalism, knowledge, and genuine care. If you're looking for a skilled and compassionate physical therapist who takes a whole body approach to health and healing, I highly recommend Andrea!

I‚Äôm so happy I was recommended to go see Andrea for my postpartum experience! I went into the first evaluation 4 months postpartum feeling afraid I‚Äôd never feel like myself again, and left the appointment feeling so validated in my concerns and confident in her personalized plan for me. After working with her for just one session, I already started to see improvements with my concerns, and after three sessions I‚Äôm so happy to say my body feels so much more healed and my concerns have been addressed! I highly recommend Dr. Andrea to anyone looking to get a better understanding of their pelvic floor health and how it connects to other areas of the body. She doesn‚Äôt leave anything out of her evaluation process, making for the most personalized & effective treatments!

I've had the pleasure of doing both 1:1 physical therapy training and participating in group workouts with Andrea and both experiences have been 5-star.

The 1:1 training is something everyone should experience. Andrea‚Äôs holistic approach to assessing the entire body and identifying the root causes of any issues is remarkable. She provides tangible exercises and stretches that truly make a difference. After two C-sections, I was experiencing back pain, but thanks to Andrea, the pain has subsided. I‚Äôm now more aware of my movements when working out and running, and I have the skills and stretches to maintain my progress on my own.

The group workouts are equally impressive. The small group size is perfect, and the complex exercises are both challenging and enjoyable. Andrea‚Äôs guidance and corrections on form are incredibly helpful, making each session highly effective.

Even though I do a fair amount of strength training on my own, the unique combinations and stations provided a fantastic workout, and I really felt the burn! I‚Äôm looking forward to continuing to learn from Andrea and highly recommend her sessions to anyone looking to improve their fitness.

In June of 2024, I had a robotic pelvic floor lift surgery, 5 hours long.
The surgery was successful BUT I was left with urinary incontinence, which was not a problem prior to surgery.  The solution offered by the surgeon was to wear a pessary or to have surgery again to fix the problem‚Ä¶‚Ä¶I was now wearing diapers 24/7.
A friend referred me to Dr Andrea Higgins, a Dr of physiotherapy, who specializes in Pelvic issues.  I had my assessment with her, the 3rd week of August. She was empathetic, gentle and thorough‚Ä¶and said that I had only 5% contraction strength of my pelvic floor muscles; no wonder that I was leaking when I walked, sat, turned in bed, or tried to exercise.  I  couldn‚Äôt even drive the car.  I never wanted to leave the house, and the diapers were humiliating for such an active person as myself. No one was invited over to the house‚Ä¶. I felt like a prisoner of my own body.
At my first session, I told Dr Andrea that my husband was planning a cruise for us to take in January; I asked her how much improvement she thought that I would have by then, after 10 sessions that I had booked with her. She replied with her laid-back S. Carolina accent, that I‚Äôd be pretty much normal.
Her studio is fully equipped with exercise balls, resistance bands and weights‚Ä¶.super clean‚Ä¶.very private and she makes you feel valued and comfortable right from the beginning. Each 75 minute session included testing my pelvic muscle strength, and working with me to learn various exercises for strengthening my entire pelvic and abdominal core. These were NOT your Grandma‚Äôs KEGELS!!  Designed to strengthen the glutes, thighs, abdomen and internal muscles‚Ä¶.to make a tight band around your mid-section‚Ä¶this was homework which I gladly did. At times, Dr Andrea used other modalities, depending on what was needed that day‚Ä¶cupping, massage, etc.
I graduated to overnight pads, for day and night. My confidence was coming back‚Ä¶.and what a relief to go shopping or dine out, and not have to run to the restroom when I  arrived and before I left.
During my final session, before the cruise, Dr Andrea said that I had attained 95-98% of pelvic muscle strength!!
Dr Andrea Higgins truly is a miracle worker- a gifted therapist who listens with her heart, and works with her sizable IQ and healing hands to restore women (and men) to their best selves. ( she also works virtually with  clients who cannot meet in person).  She has a new baby herself, and works wonders with new moms both pre and post pregnancy, with natural methods.
Thank you Dr Andrea‚Ä¶..you gave me the freedom to enjoy a full life again !!!

We recommend our clients to peak movement regularly! Cody isn‚Äôt a boring physical therapist who gives you a sheet of exercises and leaves you in the corner to complete them alone. He goes above and beyond for his clients and he brings an array of corrective exercises to the table that athletes need! Stop seeing your generic PT and check out Peak Movement. You‚Äôll be glad you did!

This is the right school!!!!  As parents of a child with a disability, we fear leaving our children in the hands of others because we are afraid no one could take care of them like us. Pedipec have made me feel comfortable in leaving my baby. My son have been attending this location for a couple of years now. And still, I am so grateful to have such a dedicated team care for my baby. When he comes home, he‚Äôs clean, he‚Äôs fed, he gets his meds on time and the best part he‚Äôs happy! He gets speech therapy and occupational therapy. They also have in house He literally comes home and talks about the entire staff. I know everyone‚Äôs names because of him. Ive witnessed the staff nurture and gently cafe for not only my child but others children as well, as if the children were their own. It‚Äôs so beautiful to witness. I can‚Äôt be more grateful for them and I feel I‚Äôve made the right choice. And not to mention I think they are pretty flexible, transportation, hours of operation works for busy mommies or moms with other children, like myself. Also, the process was super easy to sign up. Don‚Äôt hesitate being apart of their amazing family. You won‚Äôt regret it. Mya, Tati, Michelle, Shay, Dawn, Javonna, Beverly, Giselle, Fonzo, Chu chu, Jorlin, Loydia, i know I‚Äôm missing names but you all are amazing!

My son started PediPec when he was 1 year old. And it was a scary feeling to send you baby to a daycare, at such young age, especially when he has special needs and cannot talk or walk. But medical personnel and staff of PediPec took amazing care of my baby. They were like family away from home. My son always returned happy and well taken care of. For years that we have been going there, he never had a diaper rash or a single scratch on him. The therapists are awesome too - i have seen so much progress over the years, thanks for hard work of the PediPec professionals. And the Director at the Plantation location, Dawn, - she is like second mom to my boy. I totally recommend this daycare to anyone, who has special needs kids, and you and your kids will be happy and safe!

Amazing Amazing,
There is no place I ever want my child to go besides here. It's her piece of heaven on Earth.
Daily activities child and parent engagement.
Rest assured I know she's learning, playing and my mind is at ease.
Awesome staff  fun of energy and very transparent.

Never new this place existed but now that I do it‚Äôs one of the best places I have become familiar with the way they love on my daughter is amazing I can honestly say I trust them with my child the way she lights up when she sees them is the best feeling a mother can have thank you to all the staff at pedi Pec
Absolutely love this center. The staff here is so friendly and attentive to the kids. My son has developed so much from being here.

My daughter has been seeing Dr Brie Since birth and I just started seeing Alicia whom both are absolutely wonderful, knowledgeable, friendly and have addressed every issue. I am truly so thankful to have found them ‚ù§Ô∏è‚Ä¶
I cannot think of one thing i do not like about this practice.
The front office staff is great, the assistant is always amazing and the hours work well with my work schedule. They are always busy but i have never had an issue getting a day or time that works for me. I always recommend this practice to anyone i talk to.

Edit to 5 months later for my daughter and a cpl months for me. My hip concern is gone and my daughter is doing great. Her gas, tight neck and lip tie all taken care of.. we will continue routine maintenance as long as this practice is open.

I can‚Äôt believe it took me so long to come here or to find out how amazing perinatal chiropractic is versus a chiropractor. I am shocked and speechless at how I felt when I left and the care and attention is absolutely phenomenal. I never knew chiropractic care like this and I worked for a chiropractor at one point in my life it is so well rounded and they cover every thing even things that you couldn‚Äôt even imagine. I recommend this place for any mama and all her babies and children I am still in awe and obsessed with every single person that works there. They are so kind so beautiful so attentive, warm and inviting and they care and love you back. I found myself saying I‚Äôm sorry for my children acting like children but you don‚Äôt have to worry there. They encourage normalcy, and they have toys in every room so that you can feel at ease and enjoy, and receive the care that they give you. Dr. Alicia is so educated and does a phenomenal job with whatever you need.

I absolutely love this office. My kids are there every few weeks for the Logan treatment and I can see such a difference in them. The whole staff is amazing and extremely knowledgeable about holistic options.

Dr. Brie and her staff are truly exceptional! From the moment my kids and I started seeing them earlier this year, their patience, kindness, and genuine care have made all the difference.

Initially, it was a challenge for my boys to get comfortable, but Dr. Brie and her team handled every step with compassion and understanding. Now, after just a few visits, my kids walk in happily, offer hugs, and lie on the table without hesitation.

The holistic approach Dr. Brie uses has brought tremendous improvements to our health, and we are so grateful for the positive changes we‚Äôve experienced. I highly recommend Dr. Brie to anyone seeking a chiropractor who truly cares for their patients and delivers outstanding results!

If I could find all the words to express my gratitude for Dr.Brie, Dr.Sierra, Corrine and Karina, I would fill an entire book. This practice has made their mark on my heart for the way they care for my children and the way in which they support and uplift me. Not only do they support you through your health journey, they make you feel valued and loved as their patient. I‚Äôve walked in some days in tears from a rough day and I always walk out encouraged to take on the day and countless warm hugs from all the staff. Dr.Sierra did a home visit for me after the birth of my child when I was suffering epidural migraines and Dr.Brie was in constant communication to make recommendations on how to heal faster. I can always count on this staff for my family whether my kids are battling sickies or a strange rash to my chiropractic needs. I am beyond grateful to Corrine, Karina, Dr Brie, & Dr Sierra for the outpour of support, love and healing they bring to my life. I honestly don‚Äôt know what I would do without them!

provider_name: Pediatric Advancement - Behavior Therapy | Speech & Language | Occupational Therapy | Special Education
review_text: Pediatric Advancement has been a huge help for both my son and our family. We‚Äôve seen so much progress in his communication, behavior, and independence. The therapists are caring, professional, and have taught me strategies that make a real difference at home. I‚Äôm very thankful for their support and highly recommend them.

provider_name: Pediatric Advancement - Behavior Therapy | Speech & Language | Occupational Therapy | Special Education
review_text: From the moment I started working with Pediatric Advancement, I knew right away that this was the agency where I wanted to offer my services. Their genuine commitment to the care and progress of the children truly captivated me.

provider_name: Pediatric Advancement - Behavior Therapy | Speech & Language | Occupational Therapy | Special Education
review_text: This place is amazing. I‚Äôm so happy to be working here. They treat their kids with so much respect and love. There‚Äôs also a lot of unity within the staff.

provider_name: Pediatric Advancement - Behavior Therapy | Speech & Language | Occupational Therapy | Special Education
review_text: I can‚Äôt thank you all enough for the quality care Pediatric Advancement has provided for my kiddos. I‚Äôve seen so much progress in my children since they started. Everyone is extremely professional and knowledgeable! I want to personally thank the owner Liset, Antonia and Ms. Arlettys and Ms. Yane for their dedication to my kids‚Äô care. We are very grateful for you!

provider_name: Pediatric Advancement - Behavior Therapy | Speech & Language | Occupational Therapy | Special Education
review_text:
Had the pleasure of moving Liset into her new business. She was kind, helpful and all-around a great person to work with.

Thank you

We absolutely love the entire staff here. Everyone listens to our concerns and we never feel rushed. Dr Chiong is great with my kids, he is kind and thoughtful, my children are at ease talking to him.

Every time I call it‚Äôs a 20 min call and most of it is being on hold. It‚Äôs like talking to an AT&T representative. I don‚Äôt get it. You never get to speak to someone in the actual office. I have issues using their portal more than half the time.

Other than the annoying phone calls the office staff themselves are always nice and helpful. Docs have been great and patient with our kids.
I take my kids for there check up great staff and good customer service no complaints wait time is ok

I love the doctors there, however since they changed everything from the way it was when it was physicians for children to pediatric associates it has gone down hill. To get an appointment you have to call into a call center that says they don‚Äôt have same day appointments for a very ill child, it use to be you could get in that day or the next morning early. Now you have to wait 2-3 days? Also the online check in every time you go to the office, most of the time I never get it and when I do I can not fill it out in the office be the I have no service. I believe technology is good but in some cases if it‚Äôs not broke don‚Äôt fix it. I had to change one of my children to another doctor be a he has medical conditions that when he is sick he needs to be seen ASAP and that is not an option with this office any more. I have also had a couple of the staff tell us they hate the way things are run now‚Ä¶. They are throwing the reputation of the practice down the drain with all this change and not allowing for the medical care and ease of access that it use to have. Again it has nothing to do with the doctors they are awesome! But the bus running the office needs to reevaluate things before a lot of people leave. I know a lot of patients and parents that go there and are fad up and are thinking of switching.

Dr Chiong‚Äôs office is amazing but very upset that he joined with pediatric associates.  When you call for referrals the representatives do not speak good English and don‚Äôt understand what I am asking.  I recommend any pediatrician not affiliated with pediatric associates. If I could give negative stats I would.  Very unsatisfying.

My daughter saw Dr. Taylor and Ray today they made her feel very comfortable during a filling! They even allowed Ellie, who is a service dog to come and sit with my daughter during her procedure. Ellie was amazing and kept my daughter super calm during her procedure!
Kim, the hygienist is also very nice friendly and outgoing! We always have a wonderful experience coming here. I wish they did adults also.

We love Pediatric Dentistry of Cape Coral! The entire staff is incredibly friendly, and they always make us feel welcome. The doctor is fantastic very patient and kind and the dental assistant is amazing with kids. They know how to make little ones feel comfortable and even excited about going to the dentist. Highly recommend this office for any parent looking for a caring and professional pediatric dental team!

My girls had their cleaning appointment today at Pediatric Dentistry of Cape Coral and we had such a great experience. The hygienists Jake and Ray (hope I got their names right) were amazing with the kids, patient, gentle, and made them feel so comfortable the whole time. The doctor was also wonderful and very thorough. Everyone made the visit easy and stress free for both me and my girls. We are so happy to have found such a caring and professional office and would definitely recommend them to anyone looking for a pediatric dentist in Cape Coral.

I took both of her daughters for their first dental appointment with them today. Had an amazing experience. They were very patient friendly and educational. Great news no cavities. All looks well. Looking forward to the next visit. The girls even asked if they could come back during Christmas lol

Everything that my son and I experienced at Pediatric Dentistry was  amazing.  Short wait times, brushing instructions, friendly dental hygienists, friendly doctors who explain thoroughly what needs to happen in the more major processes, the time they took with x-rays, all of it.  Dr. Taylor and her assistant were so great with my son when he had to get a crown and a cavity filled.  They even brought in their amazing therapy dog to put him at ease.  The best thing was that we went in for two separate appointments to do a little at a time so it wasn't overwhelming for him and the pain from them was gone in just a few hours, not even a day.  I highly recommend them for their amazing overall team.  Their staff is great at the front desk as well.  They help you understand all of your options so you can get the maximum at a more minimal cost, even without insurance.

After several attempts in the area trying to find help for my son, we finally  found Sarah and Joan. I'm so thankful for the amazing work they have done helping my son with feeding and speech therapy. As a result of the therapy he has received with them, he has improved significantly his food intake, behavior and sleep. His growth percentile improved remarkably since last years' well visit to the pediatrician. The doctor even asked what were we doing for such remarkable improvement. They are the best in the area and I highly recommend them.

Joan has been an angel sent from heaven for my family. I brought my now 7 month old to her when he was 4 months old after three months of wasted time at the local children‚Äôs hospital outpatient speech therapy department. She immediately saw many issues that needed to be addressed that I was suspicious of but was told was not the case prior to seeing her. Since then my son has made a lot of progress with bottle feeding and is now learning how to properly spoon feed and drink from an open cup. Joan makes herself available to me for questions when I need outside of appointment times which I am incredibly grateful for. My four year old is starting with Sarah soon for speech and feeding therapy as well! I can‚Äôt recommend Joan and Sarah enough. They are educated, caring, and seek nothing but progress for their patients.

Ms. Sarah is amazing she has been working with my son for a while now. She is very patient and when she see my son is losing focus or shutting down. She will try different  activity to get him engaged again. My son looks forward to his weekly visit with Ms. Sarah

My 5 year old has been having challenges with picky and avoidant eating behaviors as well as some speech challenges. Ms Sarah has been very helpful in teaching us exercises and strategies in improving his quality of eating, which has given him some confidence to actually eat or at least chew foods that he would have otherwise at most poked. We have also seen improvements in the quality of his speech. We still have a journey ahead of us, but with the valuable information we have been given/taught we can see the light at the end of the tunnel.

Ms. Sarah is amazing. My daughter started going to Pediatric Feeding and Swallowing for almost 8 months now and I seen a major improvement in her speech. Ms. Sarah is always so kind and patient with her and I‚Äôm truly grateful for all the hard work she has done with my daughter.

This is the most unprofessional and rude office staff I have ever encountered. I read all of the negative reviews before making an appointment,  but since there isn't a lot of options I tried them anyway. I had an appointment made in advance, drove an hour to get there only for them to refuse to let my son see Dr. Liu.  This was a simple case trying to figure out what we could do for my toddler who wasn't talking.  Because the appointment was so far out I was able to see a neuropsychologist shortly before and I provided the results. Neither myself, the pediatrician, or my sons SLP agreed with the diagnosis and suggested to still see Dr. Liu.  After waiting in the office and paying for the visit, they took my son back for height and weight and then sent us out in the waiting room again.  I was then called back 3 times later for stupid questions.  The assistant that I was dealing with had her back to me for most of the conversations except when she turned around to make a face at me like I was the dumbest person on earth. She asked what I wanted out of the appointment and I told her I wanted to see what we could do to try to get my son some help. She informed me there's nothing I can do.  She conti used to question me and I politely told her I would prefer to tell the doctor instead since the entire waiting room could hear our conversation.  My husband and kids were in the waiting room. Finally, on the 4th t time they called me up they told me the Dr wouldn't see my son because I had already seen the neuropsychologist.  I had to ask for my money back since I had already paid and had been waiting 40 minutes after an hours drive there.  They said the paperwork I submitted was much more extensive than what Dr. Liu would do and he wanted to look over it and would reschedule. It has been over a month later and no one has bothered to do anything except send me a message that I missed the appointment.  I have no desire to ever go back anyway and hope future potential patients read this and stay away. After. Hours drive back, we went immediately to our pediatrician and told them what happened so they can avoid referring anyone else to Dr. Liu in the future.  Our pediatrician is wonderful and was so embarrassed that any pediatric Dr or their staff would act like this.  I also mentioned it to my long time family Dr who is just down the street and she said she had heard awful things about Dr. Liu and his staff as well.

My daughter was seen in 2024 for a concussion.  Now in Sept 2025, she has migraines and her pediatrician sent a referral (in Aug 2025) for her to be seen. No one called to schedule an appointment  and when I called, they were not helpful.  I left several messages with no call back from them. Finally speak to someone and the excuse is.... they receive a lot of referrals. Then get to the administrator who tells me that my daughter hadn't been there in over a year as if that's a factor.  She has a referral.  Then she lies and tells me that they did call. Let's compare phone records. I told them I'm concerned about all of the children they over look with referrals. The administrator then tells me they are not a good fit for my daughter.

Extremely Disappointed With Pediatric Neurology

I reached out to this office after my daughter suffered a serious head injury in a car accident. We had valid insurance they accept, and I followed all their instructions‚Äîincluding faxing hospital discharge papers, as demanded by the person scheduling appointments (who spoke to me rudely and showed zero empathy). Despite complying with their requests, I was denied care simply because we are working with a lawyer for the accident. That decision felt cold and unethical.

It‚Äôs heartbreaking to realize this practice seems more concerned about financial implications than the well-being of a child. We were treated like a case number, not a family in distress. I wouldn‚Äôt recommend this place to anyone seeking genuine, compassionate care.

I am not sure if I should leave the review for the neurologist, or the practice (PNPB). We switched to Liu after changing insurance, and in less than a year we are switching back. Liu was only able to see my son through telehealth. Our most recent appointment was scheduled months in advance, and at some point I received notification that the appointment we had tried to schedule in-person was suddenly moved to telehealth. I called and attempted to reschedule it in-person, and was then told he no longer goes to the PSL office, so I kept the original telehealth appointment. After pulling my son from his therapies and routines for yesterday, I was informed, after the fact, that he was no longer available for our telehealth appointment. I am not sure who's error this was but it is extremely unprofessional.
