I am inclined to believe it was the office's as a manager then later falsely told me they tried telling me of this change, Liu no longer being available telehealth or otherwise, on a certain date when they most certainly did not (no phone call records, text, email, voicemails on the date given). Someone was clearly covering or made a note that they contacted us, and then didn't. All our contact info has stayed the same. My son has a brain condition that should be closely monitored, and it is not being treated that way at this practice. We are now switching to someone who will hopefully care about my son, and will at least keep appointments.

If I could give zero stars like many others on this platform I would.
I am appalled after almost 4 years of my daughter going here I‚Äôve had such a HORRIBLE experience with all administrative management and workers.
The rudeness and pure laziness at the Port St. Lucie office is sickening. These are children we are dealing with!
This office has continuously given me misleading information which seems to be dependent on if they want to put in the extra work or conversation or not. Which it seems they don‚Äôt.
I had an appt today that was canceled because I was called ‚Äúcombative‚Äù after I was called 4 times just this morning regarding my appt. I‚Äôm
I have done telemedicine before plenty of times and was told I can‚Äôt anymore because my insurance isn‚Äôt paying for it. I said okay. They called yesterday telling me they got permission to do the telemedicine as the insurance WILL pay for it. (Florida blue primary and Medicaid secondary)
I could not attend a telemedicine that day as my child was in school and I was at work and they offered me a 1:15 slot. I then proceeded to ask if I could do telemedicine rather than my in person appt today they said they would call me back never called back. So I proceeded to call this morning to clarify. I was met with rudeness and misinformation multiple times. First it was yes I can do the telemedicine and then it was no I couldn‚Äôt then it was yes I could then it was no I couldn‚Äôt. Meanwhile this whole time I‚Äôm at work telling my boss yes then no then yes then no. How embarrassing and unprofessional. At this point I‚Äôm frustrated as anyone would be so I let them know it. Do you not understand you‚Äôve had me on hold you‚Äôve interrupted my work morning, with misinformation multiple times. So I told them to get it together this should not be happening. Since they didn‚Äôt like that or even like to listen to my situation the ‚Äúadministrative manager‚Äù Rosa HUNG UP on me and told me she would be canceling my appt as I am the stepmother of my child and I were to have the biological parent call. 1. MY child‚Äôs biological mother isn‚Äôt here and her father works. The entire time I, as LEGAL guardian, have gone to every single appt done every single sheet of paperwork and will not be dismissed. So I call back to also try to explain that. Was met with another lady ‚Äúoffice manager of 25 years‚Äù who was extremely rude! Wouldn‚Äôt let me inquire what changed with insurances. She wouldn‚Äôt explain things to me nor did she give me her name. She too canceled my appt for a second time because I was asking questions. Back story I‚Äôve previously had to do a coordination of benefits to show that Florida blue was primary and medicaid secondary. I asked if Florida blue was paying for the visits why does it matter that Medicaid doesn‚Äôt cover the telemedicine? She said because they don‚Äôt know whether Medicaid or Florida blue will be primary so I said isn‚Äôt that what the coordination of benefits is for? She immediately dismissed me saying basically that‚Äôs it Medicaid isn‚Äôt going to pay so I can‚Äôt do it and she‚Äôs canceling me again. At this point I am LIVID my daughter has been out of medicine for over a month because only one or few doctors travel to PSL and apparently only at certain times now. So as I‚Äôve been waiting for this my child sits out of school in the back of my office, yes I am PISSED!
I don‚Äôt care that they dismiss me from the practice I‚Äôd never step foot back in that building. Which is a shame because I love Alyssa and I think she is a great physician!
This review does NOT require a response from any of the incompetent team at that office.
Thank you!

My children and I have recently started ST/OT here. The director, Kristina, managed to get us perfect times so that both of my children could be seen in clusters for their sessions. We are loving Lorraine, Sara, Cristina, Heidy (sorry for misspelling and leaving someone out)

Everyone here is kind, caring, gentle, professional. The area is kept clean, smells good. The toys/therapy tools are unique and diverse! The kiddos look forward to therapy and when they‚Äôre done for the day they come out smiling and bouncing.

I have already told two friends about this place and I highly recommend Pediatric Potentials Therapy!

My daughter had Speech Therapy for almost 2 years and graduated this week. Her improvement was 100%. She speaks fluently and is a confident and happy girl.
Mrs Lorraine was our therapist, and we only have amazing things to say about her. She changed our lives for good and opened millions of possibilities in our daughter‚Äôs future. Our daughter did have a few sessions (once in a while) with other therapist and can say they all are great!.
Kristina, the owner was always responsive and hands on with our insurance and with anything we needed along the way.
Pediatric Potentials Therapy changed our lives and we will be forever grateful!!!

My child had been coming to this office for over 3 years. In the beginning it was good. We ended up doing both Speech and OT later on. After finishing OT, my child continued with Speech for over a year with the same therapist. After a while, my child did not want to see this therapist because, in their words, "she is mean".
One time, my child said she pounded the table with her fist because he sighed. That was taken as disrespect to her I guess. I was shocked. My child is verbal and would tell me things that would happen. Apparently he was not progressing or doing any better, according to them. I decided to leave this office and find someone that would actually help us. The therapist always seemed annoyed with us (my child) every week we were there. It just wasn't worth it.

If I could give this office negative stars I would.  We were referred by our pediatrician and waited over a month for our appointment. We arrived 30 min early for our appointment; however, there was no acknowledgment of our arrival or that we were waiting. Just a bunch of signage saying not to bother anyone. We were called in for our appointment and therapist was wearing a mask. My son is 2 and there for speech therapy.  Masks are known to cause delays in speech development. The fact that the therapists wear masks that over their mouth is unprofessional. Wear a clear shield if you are scared of germs. The office then sat us down for an OT appointment. I never scheduled an OT appointment and then we were not able to be seen for our speech appointment. Completely unprofessional handling of appointments and the lack of a first impression just made it an unapproachable office.

I have been taking my son here for about a year. Everyone I have met, including all the therapists are so amazing and kind.  They have so much patience and they truly care about the kids that come into their facility. They work around my child's schedule as much as possible and its so appreciated and recognized. 10/10 I would recommend this place to anyone who asks.

My son has been with Pediatric Potentials for over 2 years now. I have seen such an improvement on the fundamentals that concerned me when I brought him there the first day. We got blessed and assigned to the therapist Kristen, she has truly made such an impact on our lives. From being so frustrated about motor skills and eating habits , Kristen has spent many hours focusing on those specific concerns and I have seen such improvement! Kristen has also educated me to continue certain exercises at home. I am truly grateful for PP and Kristen!

Pediatric Potentials is truly an amazing place where a child is set up to THRIVE. They will work with you on schedules and even travel to local daycares. Communication is clear and timely. Most of all, they care about your child. You're not just a number. Leigh has been fantastic for speech. She will incorporate what our child is learning in school into the sessions. We've received compliments on improved speech! Alison, for occupational therapy, listens and works toward defined goals, whether those are handwriting, tying shoelaces or self-regulating. We've received great tips for school and daily life. We highly recommend Pediatric Potentials. We had gone to another place with our older child, and Pediatric Potentials is by far the best in the area ‚Äî truly a team effort in every respect.

Pediatric Potentials has been a great choice for speech therapy for our child. Ms. Leigh has been so wonderful and is very experienced in her profession. We have significant and continued progress with our child over the last two years. We are so grateful to Ms. Leigh for her dedication to helping our child thrive!

Kelli Arnone has become a trusted advisor to our family.  She worked with our older son and now our 4 year old to help them improve their fine motor skills and impulsivity.  She does an amazing job and makes it fun for the kids.  My son can't wait to see Ms. Kelli every week.

My son loves coming to see Mrs. Leigh for speech therapy. He has made great strides in his speech development since starting and I have loved watching his confidence grow as his speech has grown. I highly recommend Mrs. Leigh and the other staff for your child's needs.

We've been having an amazing experience with Karli for our daughter.  She takes initiative and has been trying different strategies in the short time that she has been working with her and we're starting to see some changes.  Karli is lovely and we are so happy to have found her.

My son started a couple of months ago and the progress that he has shown has been incredible with the help of Valentina! She has been such an amazing person in our lives and in my son‚Äôs live! Truly has made her imprint, and we are super grateful for everything that she has taught him. The customer service is impeccable! I‚Äôm truly grateful to have found this place. I definitely recommend 100%. This is your sign to start your child. Because it honestly only gets better from here.

We‚Äôve only been with this speech therapy practice for two months, and I‚Äôm already seeing such a big difference in my daughter‚Äôs progress. The therapists are amazing. they truly care about her, and it shows in everything they do. She absolutely loves going to her sessions, and that means the world to me as a parent. It‚Äôs such a relief to find a team that is not only professional and skilled but also kind, patient, and genuinely invested in helping her grow. I‚Äôm so grateful we found them!
Allie is fantastic. She always comes up with fun activities to incorporate speech into it. My son absolutely loves her and Karli is such a great communicator and works with your schedule.

Karli and her team are incredible! They have helped our family thrive by providing expertise in language therapy to our boys. We have been clients for a long time and see a tremendous positive difference in our children since beginning services. We highly recommend Pediatric Sunshine Therapy!

My son has been going to Pediatric Therapy Associates for over 2 years now and I can honestly say they are absolutely amazing. The staff and therapist are very knowledgeable, patient, and kind. My son loves to be go to therapy and work with him team of therapist, doing OT, PT and ST. I am so blessed to have found PTA. They feel like family! I would highly recommend to any parent looking for a therapy office.

Rude arrogant reception.
‚Äò We don‚Äôt have availability‚Äô no matter what the question is.

She is unfit  to be  in hospitality business

My son, Liam, has been with PTA for over three years now. We could not have asked for better teachers or a more experienced therapist. Everyone who has helped Liam has gone above and beyond to help push him to his very best ability. The knowledge, effort, communication, and sacrifice that comes from the employees of this establishment exceeds anything we could have asked for. I highly recommend PTA for any parent looking for guidance, progress, and nurture for their child.

Title: Disappointing Experience at Pediatric Therapy Associates

Rating: ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜ (2/5)

My wife and I had an eight-month experience with Pediatric Therapy Associates (PTA) for my daughter's speech therapy needs, and unfortunately, I must express our disappointment with the services provided. While the staff appeared friendly and accommodating at first, our overall experience left much to be desired.

Firstly, we we‚Äôre disheartened to discover that PTA did not allow parents to observe therapy sessions. As a concerned parent, we had hoped to actively participate in our daughter's progress by understanding the techniques used and learning how I could support her at home. However, PTA deemed this time as "me time" and denied our request. This lack of transparency and involvement left us feeling disconnected from our daughter's therapy journey.

Furthermore, despite the considerable time and financial investment we made at PTA, my daughter showed no significant progress in her speech development during the eight months of therapy. It became evident that the approach used by PTA was not effective for our child's needs. This realization left me frustrated and concerned about the quality of care she was receiving.

In an attempt to find better alternatives, we decided to switch to another therapy center that allowed parental observation and involvement in the sessions. To our relief, the change made a remarkable difference in my daughter's progress. Within just one month at the new center, she showed significant improvement, which was a clear contrast to her lack of progress at PTA.

Adding to my dissatisfaction, PTA has  sent us an exorbitant bill of $960.00. Considering the lack of progress and the restricted access to observe the therapy sessions, it feels as if we were merely paying for a babysitting service rather than effective speech therapy. This unexpected financial burden has added insult to injury and further solidified my negative experience with PTA.

In conclusion, my experience with Pediatric Therapy Associates has been disappointing overall. The lack of transparency, limited parental involvement, and the absence of significant progress in my daughter's speech development make it difficult for me to recommend their services. The substantial bill we received for what seemed like a minimal impact on my child's progress only served to exacerbate my dissatisfaction. As a concerned parent, I strongly advise others to explore alternative therapy centers that prioritize open communication and active parental involvement in their child's therapy sessions.

I am an international client, I must say for the first time in 6 yrs I saw the difference good therapy made in my sons life. He has global developmental delay so receives speech, occupational and physiotherapy. The therapist are friendly, kind, and you can see that they genuinely love kids. My son looked forward to being there everyday! His therapy activities were structured in such a way that he had fun while doing them. Plus they have so much great equipment! Each time we return there is always something new that grabs his interest.  Because of PTA I have hope that he'll learn to walk and improve his communication skills.
Nancy is the best physiotherapist I have met, she pays keen attention to small but important details and is so interactive with the kids, my son loves her!
Monica his speech therapist is also a gem. I have literally watched his attending and communication skills evolve before my eyes.
Alyssa his occupational therapist has literally sold me on the benefits of OT. He's now so motivated to do things himself. They truly are the best.
Thanks PTA!! Forever grateful !

I‚Äôve been to numerous occupational therapy clinics. Ms Kelly is by far the most invested, the most knowledgeable, and the most experienced clinician. My children have done the ‚Äústandard‚Äù plan of care of involving shaving cream, cutting paper, scooter board, and other ‚Äúcookie cutter‚Äù therapy methods. From the very first session, Ms Kelly made my kids feel comfortable, excited to play and explore around. I love that she uses open-ended play, wooden toys, and non-toxic materials ‚Äî it feels so natural and safe like how normal children should play and learn. Since starting, I‚Äôve seen such a difference in my children‚Äôs learning, their core strength, and most importantly, their self-confidence. They come out of each session proud of themselves, and I‚Äôm so grateful to see them growing in this way.

Mrs.Kelly is a wonderful occupational therapist with extremely good knowledge and understanding with her patients and parents. It has help my 5 year old daughter tremendously reach her goals in her school. Thank you so much for your hard work and dedication. Also she has the most amazing Montessori toys that truly teach kids how to engage and learn.

Mrs. Kelly is an amazing occupational therapist. She is passionate to help all kids reach their full potential. All the activities, books, and toys she uses are always researched and updated by her to help ignite her kids imagination. My 4 year old enjoyed all his sessions with Mrs. Kelly. Thank you for your care and kindness.

My son has been going for almost a year now and Ms. Kelly is the best!! She has helped my son so much. She has always been very helpful and kind. She does whatever she can as far as scheduling and will do whatever needs to be done for the benefit of your child. She truly does what she does with love! The therapy room is always clean and tidy and she decorates for every holiday and season which is nice as well! She does it all on her own! She‚Äôs a rockstar and I would recommend her to anyone that‚Äôs looks for OT

Absolutely LOVE coming here! My daughter took right to Ms. Kelly and is thriving! She looks forward to therapy and I love seeing all the new, creative things set for the kids! I‚Äôve gotten so many ideas to incorporate at home and love that everything is clean, non toxic and not full of Plastic! We feel
Valued as clients and appreciate the time she takes with us and I‚Äôve seen it with other families that have been there before or after us as well! Ms. Kelly is a found gem and I‚Äôm so grateful we found her for our therapy!!

Cannot say enough positive things about Pediatric Therapy Links! ¬†Our son has been receiving speech therapy along with occupational therapy there for the last four years . We have seen tremendous progress in our son‚Äôs speech and communication skills under the stellar care of the owner Kerri Ungar. ¬†She is knowledgeable and intuitive in addressing our child's needs and always makes it fun to practice and attempt new things. We have seen multiple therapists within the company and every single staff member is absolutely wonderful. We owe so much to Kerri and her team. Would highly recommend them if you‚Äôre looking for qualified, caring, and professional therapists. Best in town!

We've been going to Pediatric Therapy Links for about a year, first for my son for speech therapy and now my daughter for occupational therapy. There's so many good things to say about them. So just to name a few:
Kerri, the owner, operates so efficiently. She works so hard to get every family the most help possible within their situation. She is the most knowledgeable person I know about insurance. She has been so flexible with us as we've changed insurances multiple times. Roxanna at the front desk always greets us with a warm smile and is so kind and inviting. She truly desires to make everyone feel comfortable and welcomed all while juggling administrative tasks. Hannah, the occupational therapist is so full of joy. You can tell she really enjoys what she does. Christina, Jackie, Mary Beth and Erin are so full of care and knowledge in speech therapy. They are patient beyond belief. It truly takes special people to do what they all do here. Everyone works together for the betterment of the kids and families they serve, and we are so grateful to all of them. Thank you!

We are so lucky to have found Kerri! She has been an incredible speech therapist for my 2 year old son. Since working with Kerri my son has dramatically improved in not only his language and communication skills, but also has gained confidence. Kerri is extremely intelligent, compassionate as well as professional. She always makes time to address all my questions and concerns and truly cares about my son. She is completely dedicated to his progress and his well being as a whole. If you are looking for a speech therapist,  look no further. We feel so incredibly blessed to have her and are so thrilled with her service.
~ Michelle B

Kerri from pediatric therapy links has worked with my son for almost a year. He had a prominent speech delay and did not speak when starting therapy. She originally started teaching him sign language to communicate. My son was able to communicate in this way while working on his speech. His frustration that was present from lack of communication immediately resolved. Through his time with Kerri, he has drastically improved and is currently using 4 words phrases. Kerri makes therapy fun for children and my son enjoyed going into the office. When Kerri was unavailable, other providers in the office stepped in to work with my son and treatment did not lack. Pediatric therapy links is superior and I highly recommend them to any parent looking for individualized, loving, and high quality speech therapy. Thank you so much Kerri for everything you did for my child! Although we are relocating, I will keep you updated on his progress. You are an amazing educator, therapist, and person as a whole.

Pediatric Therapy Links has been god sent for our son and family! The entire staff is beyond amazing and loving. Kerri, the practice owner, is extremely professional, accommodating and understanding. After a year and a half of receiving therapies (Speech and OT) at Pediatric Therapy Links; I know I made an excellent choice for my son!

We have been bringing our son to PTS in Brandon since 2012, over 13 years now. He was just 2 when we started and he‚Äôs now 15. I think that qualifies us to leave a balanced and fair review.

Since the first session we have been treated so well by PTS. The therapists for our son have been AMAZING to him, so caring towards our family and have really invested themselves in us. They have been so patient, so gracious, so kind. For many years we had the same therapists for our son‚Äôs OT, PT and Speech. Talk about amazing consistency. They loved having me or my wife sit in on the sessions and participate, or stay more hands off as each session allowed. The therapists always make time to talk with us about our son‚Äôs progress or see how the family is doing. Our son has older siblings that care about his progress, and we were even able to bring our other children in one at a time to see our son in his sessions and even participate in his therapy, which is amazing.

The office and admin team have also been amazing ‚Äì from all the crazy scheduling and rescheduling requests we‚Äôve made to dealing with insurance and resolving those issues.

It is obvious from the top down that excellent customer service and the utmost care for families is paramount, and I would wholeheartedly recommend PTS to any mom or dad seeking the best therapy care for their child.

I completed the online inquiry form in March and was contacted promptly by the scheduling coordinator. After I replied with my child‚Äôs information I did not receive a call or email back. I do not recommend this facility as they do not look forward to the opportunity to work with you as their email states.

If I could give this place 10 stars I would! I absolutely love this place and so does my son! He works with Ms. Amy and Ms. Marley and he absolutely loves them! He always looks forward to his therapy days! Everyone at this office is unbelievably nice and professional. They treat you like family! My son has come such a long way since being in speech and OT here. We always get a run down of how the sessions go as well as tools that we as parents can use at home to further the therapy progress. I am so impressed with everyone here! Gail at the front desk is amazing too! Always so happy and smiling! We will definitely be staying with these therapists for as long as they will have us! Such a great place!

I am leaving 1 review because that's the least Google allows. What a financial disaster this place is. They keep a mediocre records of payments. I have 3+ years of experience between 2 kids with them and I had 3 separate issues where they asked for more money for "missing visit payments". It is ridiculous. They even use the same script every time "We are doing a cleanup and discover that some visits do not have payments records attached". Really? At the same time, their policy is to pay for the visit before the kids go back for service. How the kid got therapy that day if no payment was done?

My last visit was last year and up to today they keep making up visits for missing payments. This is the 3rd time this happens between 2 kids. To make it even worse, they NOW (yes, few months ago) have a "billing manager" (her name is Taylor - not a friendly one) which is nothing less than calling out customers liars because she can only rely on their very own inefficient payments records that got them here in the first place. A real financial disaster, a business with no operations whatsoever. Now, our kids therapist (Becca) is a keeper. Lovely, passionate, and professional. She should not be represented by such business operations.

I brought my daughter to this facility and the practitioner (or whatever you want to call her) Melanie. Was outright, RUDE! She has NO skills when working with small children, nor humans at all! She‚Äôs rough, impatient, and has no idea what she‚Äôs doing! My daughter is non verbal and expresses herself through fidgeting when she‚Äôs uncomfortable. I don‚Äôt mean, full body fidgeting, it‚Äôs nothing extreme. Melanie told my 5 year old daughter to ‚Äúchill the hell out‚Äù with a snarky attitude. Are you kidding me? It took all of me not to get up and walk out right then and there. I‚Äôve never met this woman a day in my life and this is how we were treated at your facility! I demand something be done about this! And upon talking to others I know who have been to this place and had the pleasure of meeting Melanie, have similar stories! Why do you allow this type of behavior within your practice? I know I‚Äôm not the first to complain. Patients come first! This is just blasphemous !

I feel like my daughter was just a number at this office. She was tossed around to more therapists in the 7 months she was there. We moved from south Florida and there she was receiving 3 hours a week of speech and 3 hours a week for OT. When I finally got her a appt for OT I had to keep calling because they never called me to tell me she was up next on their wait list. Speech however took longer to get a spot. So OT they evaluated her in July 2024. She stated she will need 2- 30 min sessions a week which is super drastic from what she had only a few months prior in Miami. I agreed and then from July to March 2 therapists left and my daughter each time in limbo with no OT. Then when they did the re evaluation the ot never spoke to me as to why they moved her to 1-30 min sessions a week.i asked to speak to the ot and the next day they sent the speech therapist. Who also told me they bumped her to 1 30 min session as well.i asked why and she told me she doesn‚Äôt know that my daughter is 7 months below her age. When I asked for a second opinion they wouldn‚Äôt give me one. I also did not like that every time my daughter came for a session she had a different therapist and most times it was just a temporary therapist because the one assigned to her was out or left. How can my daughter progress if she does not have a stable relationship with her therapist. How can she trust them if she doesn‚Äôt know them? When I told the front desk person she didn‚Äôt care and just looked at me like I was crazy. So I told her to cancel all her appointments and I‚Äôll go elsewhere. Now I‚Äôm in limbo again because my daughter won‚Äôt have the services she needs. Oh and for them stating it is a insurance issue as to why they won‚Äôt give her more then 1-2 30 min sessions a week sis a lie I spoke to my daughters case worker who said it isn‚Äôt true and she qualifies for more. She has CMS Medicaid!  If they were more compassionate and really cared whoever is in charge would have reached out to see what happened and how can they fix it.

My daughter been going here for about a year now, it‚Äôs truly amazing the kids always comes out with happy smiles. My daughter loves her therapist. She‚Äôs very caring & loving not only to my child to another of her patients she works with. My daughter has shown so many millstone it‚Äôs truly amazing. The place is super clean & my daughter has asthma they truly understand when I have to cancel as time. Thank you to the whole crew there ‚ÄúLakeland area‚Äù

PTS has been SO wonderful for my kids. We have seen a lot of the speech therapists and every single one of them is incredibly talented and helpful and SO great with the kids and communicating with us as parents. Office staff is top tier and makes the entire process easy for us!

My daughter couldn't and wouldn't jump at pts they were able to get her jumping and strengthen her legs in PT. In OT they worked on strengthening her hands. She loves it there. Everyone the whole staff is absolutely amazing we love them at PTS!!

Easy to call and set up appointment. All papers sent online. Organized easy to follow. Warm environment. Receptionists were all kind and informative. Wait in waiting room wasn‚Äôt long. The fact that they have all three therapies in one place physical, occupational and speech this place is a gem.

provider_name: Pediatric Therapy Services of Greater Orlando
review_text: My son has been attending Pediatric Therapy Services of Greater Orlando for a few months and has improved a lot with the speech therapy received. Shakira is an excellent bilingual therapist who gained my son‚Äôs trust quickly. She truly cares about him and puts all her energies in making sure he is developing and learning. He gets happy when he sees her and wants to go learn while playing. She has excellent didactic ideas for young ones to be excited about learning. Also, she provides feedback to us as parents and ideas to continue helping him at home. My son loves to get stickers after doing a good job each session. At the front desk, Loraine is always very helpful and every time we need a schedule change she makes the best to accommodates us. We are very happy to have found this place and that our son is able to attend here. Definitely recommend this place.

provider_name: Pediatric Therapy Services of Greater Orlando
review_text: Hands down the best staff and therapist there are. Not only are they extremely knowledgeable in their craft, but they are so compassionate when it comes to the kids they work with. My son has been working with Katy for PT , Kendra for Speech and Jan for OT for a little over a year now. All therapist and staff are very friendly and know / say hi to all the kids that walk through their door. Lorraine in the front office goes above and beyond to work with you, your insurance or even doctor‚Äôs office to make sure all paperwork is good to go. PTSGO staff makes this sometimes overwhelming process for parents seamless. They all have given us so much support, tips, tricks and guidance for our son in his Early Childhood development period. When you walk in you feel part of ‚Äúthe family‚Äù. I can‚Äôt recommend them enough for your children‚Äôs therapist.

provider_name: Pediatric Therapy Services of Greater Orlando
review_text: My 4 year old has been seeing Kendra for awhile now and has made huge improvements in his speech. His confidence is up and he loves going to see her. She's very knowledgeable, kind, and patient. Highly suggest!

provider_name: Pediatric Therapy Services of Greater Orlando
review_text:
I can't say enough wonderful things about this incredible team! Kendra, the speech therapist, is absolutely amazing her knowledge, patience, and care have done wonders for my son. When she went on vacation, Maple stepped in, and my son absolutely loved her! It‚Äôs not every day you find someone who can connect with a child so easily and make therapy fun. Honestly, my son looks forward to every session and sometimes even doesn't want to leave
what better testament to how great they all are!!!?
Kim is amazing she respects my parenting style and such a caring sweet woman! She super duper knowledgeable! And my son absolutely adores her and so do I!
The best part is how involved they make you feel. You can sit in on the sessions if you like, which really helps you understand the process and progress. Plus, the feedback they give is always helpful and useful and very informative! And any questions or concerns I have, they take the time to answer in detail so I always feel confident about the steps forward.
Kendra and Kim are incredible, huge shoutout to them and Shakira such a sweetheart as well like the rest of the women, she a problem solving type of women! Always have wonderful conversations with her. They have been absolute lifesavers with helping my son‚Äôs speech. It‚Äôs been a game-changer in his therapy.
Loraine, the front desk receptionist, is also beyond sweet. I sometimes run late with my young babygirl, and they‚Äôre always so understanding and accommodating. They really go above and beyond in every aspect, and I love that they even give out their personal numbers if you need anything, talk about a dedicated team!
I‚Äôm so grateful for this whole team. They've been such a huge help in my son‚Äôs development, and I couldn‚Äôt recommend them more highly!

I forever cook brownies and bagels for my girlies! ü´∂‚ò∫Ô∏èü•∞

provider_name: Pediatric Therapy Services of Greater Orlando
review_text:
The team at Pediatric Therapy Services of greater orlando is great overall. Their therapy team truly puts love into their work and it shows. The front desk team is always welcoming, understanding and accomodating. They are great with documentation requests as well when needed.
My son has been receiving services here for over a year, and continue to receive services.

This place stop to give services to my child with 5 year old because of his dad ! I had to be arguing with the manager about my child and she was making decision about my son like she was the mother !  I can see this place can be everything but they don‚Äôt care with patient care , but what a dad decide without contact the mother of the child  because she was at work all the time she thinks I have to be on therapies with the child ! What she doesn‚Äôt know ‚Ä¶ his dad is the one who received the child SSI and is home all day smoking marijuana ! May be she knows and that‚Äôs why she so afraid of him , maybe she is afraid to get shot !
I will not recommend this place because they not professional and she doesn‚Äôt know how to deal with divorce parents ! I will make sure I find another place to fit my kid STAT

My son has been seeing Angelena and Michelle and he's made tremendous progress. They are highly skilled, compassionate therapists who truly care about children and go above and beyond to address any and every concern. This whole office is amazing, has family atmosphere. I could not be happier with this place and I highly recommend it!

I absolutely LOVE this facility!!
My daughter's therapist Maddie is WONDERFUL, CARING, AND PATIENT. My daughter adores her so much and she has come a along way with her speech. If I could rate 10 stars I MOST CERTAINLY WOULD!!

My son sees Abi and absolutely loves her! We‚Äôve been doing OT for about 3 months for some fine motor and core conditioning and have seen huge improvements! All of the staff is welcoming and friendly!

Bridget is awesome!!! She's been my son's speech therapist for almost two years. I'm very pleased with the improvements he's made as a result of their sessions. Bridget goes the extra mile to provide exercises and activities to incorporate at home to expand upon what my son learns during their time together. This "hands-on" approach enables our family to actively participate in his growth and success and for that, I'm extremely grateful.

We were referred to Bridget by my son‚Äôs school and I will always be grateful for that. I knew my son‚Äôs speech was delayed but the idea of needing any sort of extra services was very stressful to this first time mom. If you have kids, you know what I mean. Bridget made me feel comfortable the moment I met her. She makes sure I know what is going on and gives me resources to help at home. I have been so impressed in my son‚Äôs progress in speech over the past year, even through the pandemic. Bridget somehow made speech teletherapy with a 3 year old work. She is flexible, knowledgeable and caring. I know she cares about my son and wants to see him succeed. I would recommend her to any parents looking into speech therapy.

Bridget is the best of the best, and her services have been an invaluable investment for our family!  As a mom and experienced special educator/early intervention provider, I can be a tough critic when it comes to therapists.  My standards are high because I understand that not all therapists are created equal and that the skill level and dedication of a therapist will have direct impacts on how (or if) a child progresses.  When one of my own children presented with mild speech and expressive language delays, I began my search for a highly-qualified therapist.  From the first time I met Bridget, she exceeded my expectations!  Some previous professionals had difficulty identifying my son‚Äôs needs, but Bridget intuitively understood where he needed support and how to provide it.  Upon initiating services with Bridget, my son immediately began to make progress; teachers, family members, and friends all commented on his improved language and intelligibility.  Bridget spent time at the end of each session discussing what they had worked on and how we could carry over those skills at home.  This was key in allowing us to maximize his learning opportunities and generalize skills across people and environments.  After approximately two years of services, my son has made immense progress and, as a result, now demonstrates increased confidence and reduced interfering behavior.  In fact, his progress has been so significant that he no longer needs weekly speech sessions.  While we are so sad to discontinue services (because we adore Bridget!), we are also grateful to be at a point where we are comfortable with that decision.  When a child makes so much progress that services are no longer necessary, that is the ultimate evidence of a fantastic therapist and a job well-done!  Bridget is warm, dedicated, knowledgeable, creative, and consistently professional.  I recommend her services without hesitation!

We are so incredibly thankful for Ms Bridget! She has been a huge part of our daughters speech journey and we have seen an incredible improvement over the last year! Ms. Bridget is kind hearted and has such a gentle approach to her work- highly recommend!!!!

Bridget is amazing! Finding a SLP for your child(ren) is daunting when there are an abundance of providers & you want the best for your child(ren) but rest assured Bridget is extremely skilled in her profession and is patient, kind and nurturing. My three year old twins see Bridget at their school. She worked with me in tailoring a plan that meets my goals. Bridget is an expert communicator and takes the time to send videos, worksheets and emails with visuals and instructions on what I can do to supplement my twins progress in expressive language at home. I really appreciate her effort in taking the time to follow up after each session as it makes all the difference. She is excellent in giving me the big picture goals and keeping me updated on my twins progress towards their goals. The thing I love the most about Bridget? She makes learning FUN! My twins adore Bridget (they will run & give her a hug when they see her and talk excitedly about how it‚Äôs their day to see Ms. Bridget) because she incorporates movement and play with learning and is patient and kind with my children :)

We love Ms Julie! She's so great with our son and is so helpful with pointers and tips for us to try.  He has come a long way since working with her.  His speech is so much better and we enjoy our weekly visits!  Such a wonderful place! We 100% recommend them!

We LOVE pediatric therapy center! They are absolutely amazing with my daughter. She loves going every week and we look forward to every appointment. Julie (speech) and Ashley (OT) are amazing! I would recommend this place to anyone.

We‚Äôve had an amazing experience at Pediatric Therapy Center! The therapists are incredibly patient, knowledgeable, and truly care about my son‚Äôs progress. We‚Äôve seen so much improvement since starting here, and the staff makes every session fun and engaging for him. Highly recommend!

My twins have been here for feeding therapy, OT, and speech. One of them starting as early as 3 months old. They are wonderful with my kids, and we‚Äôve seen amazing improvement in our time here and we‚Äôre forever grateful. The staff are extremely caring and attentive, and are truly passionate about what they do!

We were referred to Pediatric Therapy Center for feeding therapy for my 12 month old son. He really struggled with eating solid foods. We began seeing Julie and my son quickly became very comfortable with her. Julie did a wonderful job slowly introducing therapy techniques and she always gave great suggestions for tools and resources I could use at home with him. I am happy to say that the therapy worked wonders and my son is no longer in need of feeding therapy. Thank you Julie for helping us during such a stressful time.

My son Joshua has been going to Pedikidz of Palm Beach, and I can‚Äôt say enough good things about the care and attention he receives. The staff is patient, loving, and truly invested in his growth and happiness.

They make learning fun. He comes home excited about the activities they do, like counting pumpkins and learning numbers. It‚Äôs clear that they see every child‚Äôs potential and meet them right where they are.

I‚Äôm so thankful for the kindness and support they‚Äôve shown my family. Pedikidz has been a blessing!

am truly grateful for the incredible care and dedication of the team at my son‚Äôs PPEC. It means the world to me to have a place I can trust wholeheartedly with his well-being. The love, attention, and expertise they bring to his therapies and daily care have opened up unlimited possibilities for his growth and development.

Knowing they are part of his life gives me peace of mind and hope for the future. Thank you for being such an essential and wonderful part of our journey!

Sincerely,

Scarlette O.A.

What a truly amazing center filled with beautiful,  caring, and compassionate energy!! The minute I stepped inside to take the tour I was warmly greeted by Marian, the owner and guided from room to room to meet the all the wonderful staff.

The nurses were very gentle, nurturing , and engaged with the children. It was obvious to me that these women were caring for each one of their patients as if they were their own children. I observed the therapists working with one child who was smiling and having so much fun while practicing her walking skills. The therapists explained to me in detail their process of planning uniquely creative and fun programs specific for each child.

The center was impeccably clean, the walls were painted with beautifully serene colors, and a constant stream of calming music played lightly overhead throughout the center.

I was so impressed by my visit to Pedikidz and I have confidence that my daughter will thrive here. I feel so blessed to soon have this center and their beautiful staff in our lives.

Two of my boys attend pedikidz and I absolutely love them!! They are the best. No matter what the situation is, they will try their very best to accommodate you. They communicate with you in regards to anything with your child which I adore because sometimes life gets hectic and you may forget to do things. I also love that they are very patient with my boys!! I highly recommend this PPEC.

We are so happy to have found this place for our daughter.
The entire staff is amazing!!! Very clean Environment. They take care of the children as if they were their own. They‚Äôre extremely supportive, always pleasant and professional, incredibly patient, and understanding of my daughter needs. Every time we walk in the door, we are greeted with a smile. I love them all!! Highly recommend! Bilingual too.

If I could give more than 10 stars, I would without hesitation! The staff at peek a boo are truly exceptional. Every person we‚Äôve come across has been incredibly caring, attentive, and reassuring, creating a space where both-kids and parents feel safe, supported, and understood.

A huge thank you to Elvia, who has gone above and beyond to work with our scheduling needs. Her patience, flexibility, and dedication have made such a difference in helping us stay consistent with our child‚Äôs therapy.

We‚Äôre also so grateful for Jenny, our daughter‚Äôs speech therapist, who has been doing an amazing job. We‚Äôve seen such positive growth and feel confident that our daughter is in the best hands. And Maria, her occupational therapist, has also played a key role in her progress. The improvements we‚Äôve seen are a true testament to her skill and care.

I also want to acknowledge Natalie, whose leadership is clearly reflected in the phenomenal team she‚Äôs built. It‚Äôs obvious she took her time selecting staff who are not only highly qualified but also truly passionate about the work they do. Every person here is outstanding.

Thank you all for the love, effort, and dedication you pour into your work‚Äîyou‚Äôve made such a meaningful impact on our family! Xoxoxo

I have to say... I'm impressed! This facility is the most visually pleasing and inviting from all the others I've visited. My son has been so happy here and he is excited to get to all the vibrantly colored toys every morning. The owner Yamilia, she's awesome with the children and so is the staff! The place is super clean and very well lit, just the ideal place you'd want to leave your child. My son comes home happy and full of joy everyday so no complaints on my end. I love it here! Hands down the best so far!

My child has been attending daily for almost a year. Amazing Staff all round! Very involved owner who has every child's best interest at heart. Facility is very clean and well kept. Thank you ALL for your incredible service!
There are phenomenal! I love them!
I absolutely love it here it's so clean and the staff is so friendly and caring. My daughter is excited to go to school ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è

Pelican Therapy partners is one of the greatest places I have found for my special needs daughter and also my son who is not autistic or has no special needs. He just needs help with occupational therapy and physical therapy. Racheal, who is one of the occupational therapist. She is one of the best occupational therapist I have met. She is very kind, very well knowledge in what she does she tells me in detail of what my  kids do every time they see her every week. We love all the therapist there all the OT‚Äôs all of the PT‚Äôs and all of our speech therapist's. It‚Äôs very nice to come to a place with everything in one place. My daughter has been in therapy ever since she was three years old. We had to go to multiple different places for her therapy and then a friend reached out to me and told me about Pelican, we‚Äôve been there going on 3 years now and they welcome us in like family very professional place too.

My autistic daughter was non verbal and now using her words. She not only is seen for speech but PT and OT as well. She has made so many gains and I can‚Äôt give this Staff enough praise and thanks for everything they have done for her so far.

I am glad I found this place. My daughter has had great improvement. She receives ST, OT, and PT. The team is amazing and very helpful. Having a military background, I believe communication and teamwork are paramount. The therapists are always very professional when communicating progress and what we can do at home to supplement her treatment. Having an autistic child can be difficult, but at Pelican therapy, they always make every session fun and interactive for the kiddos. They are very supportive and understanding if we have to cancel an appointment if our little one is having a bad day. I'm grateful!

As a special needs parent, I highly recommend this clinic over any other in the area! My child has been here since they opened over a year ago and was even with the therapists at a previous location for years before then. The fact that we followed and switched over to here at that time says a lot. All the therapists are amazing at what they do and love their jobs, and this clinic is such an amazing place to bring your children to receive the care they need! Also can't ask for better advocacy for your children! Don't take you children anywhere else.

Highly do not recommend this place. Took our 1 month old in for physical therapy and they were rough with him. Pulling him by his arms from the laying down position to the sitting position while his head flopped back like a rag doll. He‚Äôs a month old. Zero care. Won‚Äôt come back. Case has been opened with Tricare.

UPDATE: The owner Christy reached out to us and apologized for the lack of communication from the physical therapist to us. The PT didn‚Äôt inform us of the above test, which is what‚Äôs done during said exam. All in all, very professional to reach out directly and apologize.
Always excellent care.
The nicest and most compassionate People I‚Äôve ever met. They truly do care about your health and well-being. Would recommend 100% (:
All the staff are super nice and friendly, while maintaining a professional atmosphere.

I cannot speak highly enough of Dr. Robyn Power. From our first consultation to post-operative care, she demonstrated not only exceptional surgical skill but also a level of compassion and attentiveness that truly sets her apart. Throughout the entire process, she made me feel like I was her only patient. Taking the time to listen, explain, and reassure me every step of the way.

It‚Äôs rare to find a doctor, specializing in women's health, who balances expertise with such genuine kindness. Her calm and confident demeanor put me at ease, and her attention to detail gave me complete trust in her abilities.

If you're looking for a surgeon who is both an expert in her field and deeply caring, I wholeheartedly recommend Dr. Robyn Power.

Staff is great, friendly, inviting. Doctor is great. Very informative. They don't make you feel uncomfortable. The give you comfort So that your comfortable. So far effective methods have resulted. They are holistic which is good because you want to end the pain not temporarily stop it with a pill but find a permanent pain free result in the end. Definitely recommend....

Dr Sandhu is an expert of this field. Her knowledge and understanding of pelvic pain due to endometriosis truly changed my life. It‚Äôs so hard to find specialists who understand and can treat issues related to women‚Äôs health, particularly reproductive health. Her team is compassionate, professional, intentional and provided care. They even fed me when they realized I hadn‚Äôt had breakfast before a procedure! This place provided a service I hadn‚Äôt found anywhere. I did the treatment offered. I‚Äôm not immediately pain-free, that‚Äôs not how it works. But I am far from where I was three months ago and I have Dr. Sandhu and her team to thank for that.

The reason I'm giving this clinic a low star is due to the fact that this is a "cookie cutter" treatment. Although everyone in office was extremely friendly 10/10.....I would be cautious. I somewhat felt pressured into getting the treatment and everytime I would ask questions regarding when I would see results or anything regarding getting better the answer would be let's see how you feel come next treatment or it takes all 6 injections for results. I was warned about this business but I took the gamble of $6k and lost out. After coming across so many other pelvic pain patients many of them felt this was a waste and did not help them at all. Unfortunately I feel into that trap. I wish they would find the root cause into each patient's pain rather than injecting into different spots not knowing what is the culprit.

This place is amazing! Dr. Sandhu explained everything well and really made me feel like she cared. The staff and nurses were also very nice and polite. I definitely recommend coming here if you‚Äôre having constant pelvic pain!

Chrissy is amazing! After years of struggling with constipation and trying every medication and supplement with no relief, she helped me finally get to the root of the problem. She is kind, professional, and incredibly knowledgeable. I‚Äôm so grateful for her care and highly recommend her to anyone dealing with pelvic floor issues.

Dr. Chrissy is a gem! She helped me navigate a tailbone injury and my endometriosis diagnosis. Dr. Chrissy takes a gentle, individualized approach and wants to understand your unique goals and help you reach them. She is very easy to communicate with and makes you feel so comfortable when dealing with some uncomfortable topics. I highly recommend her and Pelvic Solutions for any and all pelvic floor needs!

Chrissy is absolutely amazing! She made me feel so comfortable at every appointment and truly did wonders in helping me learn the tools I needed to help me in my recovery process. She is very insightful and knowledgeable about what she does and it was a pleasure working with her!

Chrissy was amazing! I saw her starting in my second trimester through 12 weeks postpartum and I know it made a world of difference in my delivery and recovery. I will 100% be going back with future pregnancies or pelvic floor needs.

My experience with Chrissy was incredible! I had an idea on what to expect when coming to Chrissy since I had received similar help in the past, but she far exceeded my expectations. She is a great listener and personalized my plan for what worked best for me. She ensured a holistic approach that not only included stretches and exercises, but also methods for regulating the nervous system and ideas on how to maintain a positive mindset. With her help, I‚Äôve been able to see such a positive change not only physically, but mentally and emotionally. I highly recommend Chrissy for pelvic floor therapy!

‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è 10 out of 10!
I can‚Äôt recommend Ben enough! Working with him has been a game changer for my overall health, posture, and strength. He‚Äôs incredibly knowledgeable and uses evidence-based training and programming that‚Äôs both effective and personalized. Every session is purposeful, and I always leave feeling stronger and more confident in my body. Ben‚Äôs professionalism, attention to detail, and dedication to long-term improvement truly set him apart. If you‚Äôre looking for a physical therapist who delivers real results, Ben is the one!

Ben is an incredible Physical Therapist. After breaking my ankle in three separate places (trimalleolar fracture), I have been able to do much more than I did before the injury. He is patient and purposeful in his approach. So grateful for his professionalism and overall work with me!

Ben‚Äôs the best physical therapist I‚Äôve had without a doubt. He‚Äôs very clear and meticulous with how he explains things. He‚Äôs patient and very knowledgable. Trust me, I asked a lot of questions. I‚Äôve had a reoccurring issue that wasn‚Äôt properly targeted until Ben and his team did so. I‚Äôm very grateful a friend of mine recommended him and I can‚Äôt wait to recommend him, with full confidence, to anyone I come across in need of physical therapy.

I had a great experience at People First PT! Ben is so knowledgeable and can truly work with anybody, regardless of what they‚Äôre in therapy for. He always made sure that I was being challenged the perfect amount. I came such a long way from when I first started here and it was very reassuring when he acknowledged this progress! I 100% recommend People First PT for anyone looking for physical therapy.

They recommend Ben and I couldn‚Äôt be more happier! I feel amazing I am able to move and workout with out pain! I had a shoulder injury and if I didn‚Äôt do physical therapy i was going to end up in surgery. He not only took my pain away but I am getting stronger.   I am able to move and be myself again. He is Excellent and  professional and more important the THERAPHY sessions are  one on one!!   he gives you his fully attention and I love how clean he keeps his office, I would recommend it 100 percert !!!! Thank you

Natalie is FANTASTIC, she is so kind, you can truly tell she loves her job and the puppers. My 1.5 year old cocker spaniel had extreme grooming anxiety due to a horrible experience at 14 weeks old at petsmart. I didn‚Äôt know what to do, I knew she needed grooming and I couldn‚Äôt do it. So I searched high and low for a reputable, mobile groomer and I found Natalie. My dog does so well with her and you can tell she‚Äôs happy and not afraid after her groom. I never thought I would find someone she would trust. Thank you so much Natalie for all your love and dedication in the dog community. I wish I could leave 10 stars!

Natalie has been grooming our babies for a long time now.  She is the MOST amazing groomer I have ever been around, let alone a fantastic human being.  She is patient and kind and prompt.  She is absolutely amazing with our Millie and Strickland.  Her prices can't be beat and she's just the BEST!  Someone left a message about "them" nicking their dog.  Natalie does this all on her own, so this wouldn't be her.  And I know a lot of people who have her come to them, so I'm almost certain that the 1 star review was done by a person that didn't actually use Natalie.  I can't thank her enough and our doggies couldn't love her more.  YOU ARE A ROCK STAR NATALIE AND WE LOVE YOU!  See you in 6 weeks.
Natalie is THE BEST!!!  She does a perfect job with our mini-doodle!!  She was here today and he looks fantastic!  Prices are competitive & reasonable and she is so good with him!
Natalie was great with our 5 month old puppy Cooper,looking forward to using her services again.This was Cooper's first experience with a groomer and he did well.

Natalie is the owner/operator of Perfect Pooch mobile dog grooming and she does a fabulous job. Her attention to detail and patience with my 3 dogs is outstanding! I highly recommend Natalie, she makes grooming an easy event even with my 3 crazy dogs!

Grieving for a pet is the hardest, but being able to say a final farewell is a big part of the process. I am grateful for the opportunity it was giving to me today to spent one more time with my big boy. Melissa at the Fort Myers location was extremely kind and has a huge heart.

They handled the services for our sweet little angel, Sammi. We sincerely appreciate the job they do to make the loss of a family member, just a little bit easier. Thanks for your compassion and for doing what you guys do. Sincerely, thank you.

These people are fantastic,  I have had so many rescue, Loving everyone of them ,  And this Business has been nothing but great and compassion, during these times, they have helped us through out the years , taking care of our babies üê±üê∂üíîüôè

Sadly we had to put our little guy Bentley to sleep on 2/19/2022 due to cancer.  It was a hard time for our family but things were made a little easier considering our vet worked with Pet Angel Memorial Center for a private cremation.  Within a week his urns & paw print were back at the Vet's office ready to come home.  We appreciate what you do and thank you for taking care of our little guy Bentley.   ü•∞Thank you...Dawn & Paige McNichol

I was so happy to find this place last year when I lost my kitty who was 17 years old. It was very tough because so many places were not allowing you to come in with your pet because of Covid. They were the only ones gracious enough to allow me to stay with her through the whole process. I will forever be grateful and they are very good people I would highly recommend.  Katherine was the lady who took care of us.

Update‚Ä¶.her daughter passed last year from kidney disease sadly,  and we brought her here as well. Very caring, sweet people.

Last Update; September 4, 2024   I just lost my baby girl who was soon to be 22 years old. Catherine was the lady who worked with me years back. She is sadly no longer there. The new girl really didn‚Äôt care  much she  barely got out of her seat from behind the computer. Seemed very apathetic. I would not go back now that Catherine ‚Äòs not there. She didn‚Äôt show much care concern at all. Just asked which urn  I wanted,  basically was it, and took my credit card.  After she took my credit card I had to ask if I could have a couple moments alone with my baby girl and maybe some privacy. Otherwise I guess she just would‚Äôve said bye and closed the door.

She agreed but seemed very surprised that I would ask something like that. I‚Äôm sure a lot of people do. And they should offer. Then I had to ask for my blanket back since I wanted to keep something that had her scent, and she just kind of stood there and I said well can you wrap her in one of your blankets and she still kind of stood there just a very awkward interaction. She needs more sympathy training.  And  to get out from behind her computer and actually interact with people who have just lost their fur child.  It‚Äôs a very sensitive time and it might just be another customer to her but for the fur parent, it‚Äôs the loss of a family member. At least OFFER some quiet time and a private place to say a final farewell.  The customer shouldn't have to ASK. When I picked  up my baby‚Äôs remains, just a bag. I had to ASK to see the urn and paw print. They‚Äôre emotionless.  No care whatsoever.  ASK your  customers if they‚Äôd like to see the urn they just paid for instead of rushing them out. Never again.

Overall poor service

So...my urn turned out great and the lady at the front desk was really sweet but I will say people trust this company with their dogs and in my case my baby, my family. The least they could have done was get the memorial items right. I wanted 2 paw prints and we discussed in office that I wanted 1 of them for a tattoo. Both paw prints(which cost $62.00) were in my opinion too smudged for a tattoo. My dog had an extra toe which made it unique and I could not even tell in the print. Of course All of their sample prints advertised in their office looked perfect though. The dogs coming in are unable to move or fight the process so there should be NO reason they can not get a good print unless they are rushing. I also asked for some ashes to be set aside for a charm I bought elsewhere. When I got there to pick up they had forgotten. She had to take him to the back to get me some. When I got home the amount she set aside was not even enough for my charm. So in my grieving process I had to open my baby's ashes and go thru them myself. Nobody should have to do that while grieving!! I am very dissatisfied and disappointed at the whole process at this point!! These are all memorial items that I can not get back! They did reach out and said they would "try" to make this situation right but of course a week has gone by and I've heard nothing. At this point I feel like they are blowing off the situation. They did ask me to take my review down which I did and now i have gone from sad to pissed so I am reposting. The passing of a fur baby should not be this aggravating especially when it is already an emotional process. Everyone's baby deserves the best in their passing. I will definitely be doing something else in the future if needed

I unexpectedly had to put my 11 year old girl Fuji to sleep and this past weekend after the onset of a sudden and aggressive illness, and I was heartbroken and am still processing that grief. Pet Angels made it very easy to arrange a private cremation for her- She passed on a Saturday evening and I was able to pick her up the following Thursday. I got my girl back in her wooden box I selected and it was packaged carefully in a blue velvet bag. Savannah was the staff member I interacted with and she was so kind and compassionate, even the tone in which she spoke was incredibly gentle.

I have a 14 year old senior at home still, and while I hope I don't have to make this arrangement any time soon, I would confidently use this company again for her cremation when that time comes.

From 7 years ago, when it was called Paw Prints:

Last year I knew I was going to have to deal with Lucky's passing, so I did a little research on crematories in the area. I met with Hilary Vessels of Paw Prints Pet Crematory and discussed the basic info regarding the services provided. It was because of Hilary's compassionate discussion I decided to use Paw Prints.

Lucky passed on a Friday and Paw Prints arranged for one of their vans to pick her up on Monday. I received a call on Tuesday informing me Lucky was ready to come home.

Arriving at Paw Prints, by chance, I was greeted by one of the owners, Nate Ferguson. He was very polite and truly compassionate. When bringing out Lucky I was pleasantly surprised. She was handed to me in a custom made fabric carrying bag. As I informed them I was awaiting delivery of an Urn, they provided a very nice complementary wooden container. Also provided was a clipping of Lucky's hair, A paper heart with wildflower seeds for planting, a prayer, a poem and a sympathy note from Paw Prints.

Nate took some extra time to ask me about Lucky. It helped to have someone listen, the owners and the staff do that very well!

I am very thankful and comforted to know that Lucky's final journey was provided by the loving family of Paw Prints Pet Crematory.

It will be one of the hardest days of your life, but this is the place that will provide your pets with the respect and compassion that they deserve.

Grateful, grateful, grateful for this company.  My beloved large dog died unexpectedly (he was still fairly young for a shepherd) over the weekend at home and they were able to come out to pick up his body the day he passed away (on a Saturday) instead of waiting for the work week.  Paid for his cremation and the pick up today and they were hugely respectful.

I have to say that for it being our first time having to make the difficult decision of putting out precious Kitty to rest. It gives me so much comfort and peace for some reason because Paw Prints were so compassionate and empathetic for our loss. Not only was the urn perfect but the little additional touches made it so much more comforting. The poem, sympathy card, wildflower seeds but what mostly touched my heart and had me in tears was the print of his paw and his snout.  It‚Äôs like he made sure he sent us a kiss before he crossed the rainbow because we were always giving him lots of kisses. üòî üò¢ This really touched my heart and I am grateful for it.  Thank you Paw Prints‚ù§Ô∏è

I have only the highest praise for Dr. Villamil and his wonderful team.  We had taken our sweet toy Yorkie, Gigi, to another cancer center down south and she was newly diagnosed.  It was a horrible experience.  She had three treatments and we were only "allowed" to see the vet oncologist once.  He never gave us an update after the initial consultation and he was very negative from the start of her lymphoma treatment.  Their team was also so rude.  So we decided to make the move to Pet Cancer Group.   It was a great decision.  Dr. Villamil was so caring with our Gigi and the staff was always cheerful, kind and very professional.  Dr. Villamil came out to talk to us about her labs and check up each and every time .  We didn't think that she would be able to tolerate her treatment for very long so we braced ourselves.  However under Dr. Villamil's care, she lived well beyond what was expected (over two years).  Sadly, we lost our Gigi a couple of months ago but we have only positive things to say about the doctor and his staff.  They were a blessing to us and our fur girl.  They even sent a sweet card upon her passing and the Dr. called us as well.  If you're considering a place to treat your beloved pet, I would highly recommend Pet Cancer Group.

These Doctors are Amazing my Dog Angie have Cancer and this Friendly Doctor Dr Villamil helps her in every way he can , so shes doing Great. Hes an Excellent Doctor Thank you so much Doctor Villamil you gave us so much hope and support and compassion. Thank you very much and God Bless every one of you working there ‚ù§Ô∏èüôè I recommend this place Service is Excellent.

Dr.Villamil has been amazing helping guide us through Noah's cancer journey. His positive attitude stands out. He explained what my boy has and the best ways to maintain his health. He expertise gives me peace of mind knowing Noah is in the best hands. Thank you Dr.Villamil for everything üôè

Our fur son Bruce was diagnosed with intestinal lymphoma in February. We met with Dr Villamil and chose to begin chemotherapy based on the prognosis. Dr Villamil gave us hope of ‚Äú80% remission with 4-5 years of life after treatment‚Äù. We started chemotherapy in April. In August, the day of Bruce‚Äôs last chemo treatment, we called to inform them that Bruce had taken a sudden and drastic decline and was being seen as an emergency at his vet. I called Dr Villamil to advise them of the situation and all they said to me was ‚ÄúI‚Äôll let the doctor know‚Äù. No other words. We had to euthanize our sweet boy Bruce the next day.  We were heartbroken. It‚Äôs been almost 3 months since and they have never contacted me since about Bruce, his status or if we were even coming back, to reschedule, etc. They have never reached out to us or followed up. We lost our fur baby 4 months unexpectedly after beginning treatment. We knew that is a risk you take with chemo treatment. But the absolute lack of compassion, sympathy, care, follow-up is very upsetting. You feel like a dollar sign and just a number. To chose to do chemo and put your pet through this is extremely difficult, emotionally and financially. It‚Äôs a huge commitment. We feel let down and disappointed by this office. They provided medical care but that‚Äôs about it. If you‚Äôre looking for compassion and support, sympathy, we did not find it here.

Dr. V and the entire staff really do care.  Everyone is obviously proud of what they do there and their kindness is comforting.  I was given cost estimates for the complete protocol for Roxy Rose's chemo prior to beginning treatment for her Stage V lymphoma.  She is eight weeks into her treatment there and doing really well.   They respond to every call and email promptly.   I highly recommend.

This vet has been super nice. I have brought three pets to him. I have never felt judgment from him when asking about prices. He removed my cats eye and everything was really good. They were there for me when I had questions after I came home as well. He explained stuff, even if he breaks open books and shows what he thinks is going on. I really like this vet‚Äôs office and they are affordable as well. The whole staff has been super nice and caring. Everyone was calm and it was very easy for my cats and they‚Äôre not being hyped up or too scared. I would definitely recommend and continue going to this office. And for a pet office, it smells really nice as well. It isn‚Äôt a smell covering a smelly animal smell it just smells nice and clean. I had no allergy issues while I was there which I will with some offices because strong dog odors. They are five stars vet for me. The pics are Summer before, healing and healed.

Dr. Lockhart and his staff are amazing and caring!  After moving to Lakeland I went searching for a good veterinarian. After a visit to Petcare on Highland we found our place! Dr. Lockhart is very honest, trustworthy and very fair in pricing!  From the front desk to the technicians and the veterinarian all is truly top notch!
Highly Recommend!

We wish we would‚Äôve found Petcare on Highland years ago. Dr. Lockhart & his staff are great. Friendly. Caring. They are so kind. No wait on the phone when you call. The ease of scheduling is such a relief. He takes care of our large breed dog as if she were his own..saved her life. He cares. He takes the time and explains. I never feel rushed. HIGHLY RECOMMEND. They‚Äôve been awesome.

Dr Lockhart and his staff are the best!  He goes above and beyond to give the best care to your pet. My puppy was extremely sick and Dr Lockhart took him in and got him through it. Now he is almost 2 years old and thriving.

I can not recommend this veterinarians office  enough. We found them after rushing our dog, Buffy,  to the urgent vet after finding out she has arthritis. They were the best part of a bad situation. My dog is very vocal and has high anxiety but they have never once made me feel like she‚Äôs annoying or a problem. Their vet techs are great too, Abby heard my concerns and made me feel validated. They recently surgically removed a large mass off Buffy‚Äôs chest and the whole process could not have been smoother. They even said I could text them while she was in surgery with questions or if I needed an updated, I was very anxious. Buffy and I have that in common lol. This vet is fast and efficient and scheduling appointments is so easy. Thankful for them.

I want to give a huge thank you to the staff at Pet Paradise Tallahassee for giving my dog Bear a great first day.
This visit meant a lot to me and Bear because it has been his first day with other large dogs since his older sister GSD passed away in May.
Bear is deaf and I was worried how he would interact with other dogs he didn‚Äôt know. The cameras were great to see how he did. He played in the pool, really loved his counselors and played with other dogs. The staff gave a great report after and Seth at the front desk gave my mom and I a thorough tour and explained all the packages in detail for us. The front desk girls were also very nice, helpful and they loved Bear. This dog mom is more than satisfied with Pet Paradise hospitality, cleanliness and care for it‚Äôs clients. Bear came home happy and exhausted from a full day of fun! Thank you, thank you, THANK YOU! We will be back soon. üêæü§ç

I could not be happier with our first two experiences at Pet Paradise!  Everyone with whom we had contact was professional, patient, kind, and helpful. Seeing how the staff interacted with all of the dogs gave me a great peace of mind, and I was thrilled that my pups were excited to return for their second visit. I gladly recommend Pet Paradise!

JJ and Pet Paradise is such an amazing groomer! She is very patient with my rescue labradoodle. He came to us not taken care of and has anxiety,  but JJ takes the time to work with him and helps him feel safe. She gives him the cutest cuts too and pays attention to detail.
The Groomers do a Wonderful job on my Great Pyrenees! Also, Love the Boarding with the ability to see my dog on video!‚ù§Ô∏èüêæ‚ù§Ô∏è

I was extremely nervous boarding my two Goldens here, since the last place I boarded them at they came home ....off. At the other boarder they had come home and were almost scared, so I definitely was apprehensive trying a new place.

Westley & Serena had the BEST time here. I picked them up soaking wet (in the best way) from playing in the pool. They stayed for 3 nights and seemed to have really enjoyed themselves. I was happy when they came home and I did not see a personality change like I had at the last place they stayed. I was even more impressed with the add-on of a nail cut because my 3 year old had never had one done because she absolutely hates having any type of grooming done. I'm so glad she is no longer scratching me with the long nails. We have several trips coming up and I do plan on returning.

provider_name: Pet Passages - Melbourne, FL | Dignified Pet Cremation
review_text: I have used this service more than once and I‚Äôve always been treated with kindness and professionalism. It‚Äôs exactly what is needed at such a sad time. This organization is very professional as I said before, but also very sensitive and caring about your losses. I have other dogs and when they pass, I‚Äôll be returning to pet passages to get the very best sendoff. My animals could receive. and that would include my cats as well thank you so much pet passages!

provider_name: Pet Passages - Melbourne, FL | Dignified Pet Cremation
review_text: Pet Passages staff are amazing, they are so loving and compassionate. They handled my beloved pet with respect and dignity and I received the cremains back quickly. If anyone is going through the difficulty of losing their fur-baby, I HIGHLY recommend Pet Passages to help them. In addition to their 5 star service and staff, they have packages for all budgets. I can't thank them enough for the care they provided to my pet and the compassion they showed me.

provider_name: Pet Passages - Melbourne, FL | Dignified Pet Cremation
review_text: This crematory is incredible. They give you a way to track your pets journey from the time you entrust them with the care of your pet, all the way until they are ready to come home. The compassion they show made me comfortable trusting them with the care of our loved family member.

provider_name: Pet Passages - Melbourne, FL | Dignified Pet Cremation
review_text: The efficiency and communication of Pet Passages went above and beyond what I expected. A pets sudden passing is traumatic to the entire family and Pet Passages was the easiest part of the entire experience. They were sympathetic and made us feel like they really cared about our lost loved one. I would highly recommend them to any all who seek this type of service.

provider_name: Pet Passages - Melbourne, FL | Dignified Pet Cremation
review_text:
So with a heavy heart I am writing this. My beloved Gucci-Love of almost 14 years had to be put to rest this past Saturday 7-6-24 our vet is amazing and my family is so deeply touched with the partnership that both companies have put together. What a beautiful urn you have put my sweet little girl in. Thank you for her paw print and the lock of hair. It's really touching. You have gone above and beyond. I was not expecting all of this.
