provider_name: Positive Behavior Services, Inc.- Autism Therapy
review_text: I had a truly wonderful experience with Marcia at Positive Behavior Therapy. Even though their services aren‚Äôt covered by my insurance, Marcia went out of her way to help me find the information and resources I needed for my daughter. Her kindness, professionalism, and willingness to assist‚Äîeven without the promise of a client relationship‚Äîspeak volumes about the integrity of this practice. I‚Äôm incredibly grateful for her support and would highly recommend Positive Behavior Therapy to anyone seeking thoughtful, compassionate guidance.

provider_name: Positive Behavior Services, Inc.- Autism Therapy
review_text: Marcia is a very kind and well informed family resource navigator. She was incredibly well informed and helpfull. She was also very generous with sharing important infos to navigate autism in adulthood.

provider_name: Positive Behavior Services, Inc.- Autism Therapy
review_text: Positive Behavior Services was so helpful with helping me locate the right services and solutions to help meet my son's needs. Maria Morales was so informative during our family resource consultation. Great provider willing to help!

provider_name: Positive Behavior Services, Inc.- Autism Therapy
review_text: Marcia was so helpful and kind when explaining all the details I needed to know about my son‚Äòs ASD diagnosis. She provided tons of information that can help me in the future, and I look forward to speaking to her again.

provider_name: Positive Behavior Services, Inc.- Autism Therapy
review_text: Attended an exceptional training today! The program was well-designed, engaging, and provided practical knowledge and skills. The trainer's expertise and passion were truly inspiring. Truly grateful for the opportunity to learn and grow professionally. Highly recommend this training to anyone looking to enhance their skills and knowledge in this field."

Positive Development changed my entire family's life. Unlike most therapy offered to children with ASD, Positive Development not only works closely with their patients, but they also incorporate the parents. Before PD, I didn't know how to connect with my son, but they've taught me to be the kind of mother my child needs and deserves. My son looks forward to therapy because he has such a great time. The play approach is FUN which makes it the BEST teaching tool for kids. My son is connecting, thriving, growing, and more confident than ever. My family and I are forever grateful to PD and their incredible staff. If you were on the fence, RUN to PD and give it a try!

We have seen tremendous progress with our son since beginning therapy at Positive Development utilizing the DIR Floortime Approach. The team behind our son is fantastic and genuinely has his best interest in mind. My husband and I also benefit greatly from the parent/family support that works in conjunction with direct sessions with our son. Overall, it's been a wonderful experience for us and highly recommend it!

After a year of using the DIR/Floortime approach at Positive Development, the progress my son has made is truly remarkable. Positive Development has become a place where he feels understood and supported, learning essential tools to thrive in a neurotypical world.

I chose Positive Development because I wanted professionals who would respect and build upon his autistic traits rather than trying to change them. At six years old, my son is now highly aware of his strengths and weaknesses . He has developed exceptional self-advocacy skills and has mastered emotional regulation to a level surpassing many neurotypical peers.

Though every autistic child is unique, I wholeheartedly recommend giving DIR Floortime a chance, and Positive Development in South Florida is an outstanding place to start. Their commitment to nurturing and empowering neurodivergent children is evident in every aspect of their practice.

Perfect? No. But I can tell you they are probably one of the best therapy centers out there at this time for autistic children. Yes DCC‚Äôs can be better trained and more qualified (and receive better treatment to ensure longetivity in the workplace) - I appreciate that PD listens to parents voices and they are willing to roll with the punches together. Their integrative model is easier said than done it‚Äôs been a hit or miss but I do believe that my child has improved with this therapy. He is centered, happy, and connecting with his parents and other people. That was our priority when we started this therapy and we are seeing it come to fruition.

I went with great expectation with my son. My son loved the place. His speech and OT therapists were great. Unfortunately , it didn‚Äôt last for long. Both therapists quit suddenly. This place cannot keep their employees. Many parents are disappointed. It‚Äôs extremely challenging for special need kids to go through changes frequently. They came to my house for home therapy and that was a disaster. Those home therapists don‚Äôt know how to handle the child and one day I had to call another therapists to come home to help. The team from positive development didn‚Äôt like that and they cancelled the next session with no communication. Extremely poor communication. It‚Äôs not organized. They don‚Äôt know basics of customer service. Place has a lot of potential. But need new management who cares. The current management doesn‚Äôt care. Extremely disappointed.

Very unprofessional people.They're lost on appointments' time. It doesn't look they really know about kids. They observed my 3 years old for 2 hours, and decided he was no cooperative so they can't see him anymore. So a child's psychologist observed a child for more than 2 hours but can't grasp anything,  oh wow what a professional! The interesting part is that they never communicated that with me, I figured out when I showed up for my appointment,  yes because even though they knew they weren't going to see him anymore, they gave me an appointment. Places like this one shouldn't have license.

Rick is extremely easy to talk to and non judgmental. I knew from the first time I called his office I was in the right place. He actually answered his own phone and took time to hear what I was looking for and to explain how he could help me. I felt progress pretty quickly into my sessions and actually look forward to my appointments. I always walk away having learned something and am grateful to have found him.

Rick is a very helpful. He helped alot with helping me and my partner make progress in the right direction. He is very understanding and honest. He is truly there to help. I highly recommend  him and if I ever need another counselor it would be him every time.

I have been seeing Rick for about 2 months now and have nothing but good things to say. In our first session about 20 minutes in, he revealed something to me that has changed my life. He also encouraged me to go home and research several topics we discussed in session which turned out to be extremely helpful as well. We continue to make progress each week and Rick really cares about me as a person. I wasn't sure what to expect as I had seen another counselor months before that did not help and made things worse but I am so glad I reached out to Rick for help. His patient portal is also very helpful and convenient as well. It not only contains details about past and upcoming appointments but also self help documents and audio than can be used for research outside of session. There is also a between session worksheet you can fill out that let's Rick know how you felt about the last session and what needs to be discussed in the next. The other counselor I had seen had none of this and after session was done it was done. No other help provided. This portal allows you to keep a journal which you can share with Rick if you choose. These tools are all very useful for keeping Rick updated with what's going on in your life. He also offers remote sessions over Skype or phone which I will be using when I move back to NC.

Where to begin - I was new to the area and going through a lot of big, life changes. I was hesitant to seek outside help but was open to the idea of meeting with a few therapists. I've had them in the past, none of which were a good fit or made me feel comfortable. Upon first meeting Dr. Rick he immediately set me at ease and took the pressure out of the situation. He was easy to talk to, patient, understanding and open to what I was looking for in a therapist. I‚Äôve been seeing Dr. Rick for almost a year now and am very grateful for his service. He has a way of making me aware of my own idiosyncrasies and gives me a thoughtful, outsider‚Äôs perspective. I am truly grateful for the time, effort and understanding he has provided.

Have met with Rick numerous times to help me process some personal stuff effecting my marriage.  His approach is straight forward, firm but fair.  He doesn't tell you what you want to hear but directs you in a positive way towards healing.  You have to do your part and that's where the work really happens.  He is faith minded but not overly so for those who don't believe.

We had an amazing year at Positive Steps. Our daughter has grown so much, and we‚Äôve seen so many positive changes. The entire staff helped her learn the skills she needed to enter Kindergarten. Her BCBA, Julianne was so supportive, caring, attentive, and truly made a difference. Forever thankful!

I‚Äôve had the pleasure of working with BCBA, Cassie Ziesk and Julianne Fernandez, both of which were patient, down to earth and super informative. They are a true treasure with the kids and are always on their game with updates and parent trainings so you can follow through with your kids at home. The RBT‚Äôs are all truly amazing, my child enjoyed every minute of his time here and their care made a world of a difference. I saw my child grow and improve a little everyday! He‚Äôs a brand new kid! A big THANK YOU to all the PSABA staff! I recommend them 10/10. I would definitely come back again!

Positive steps has been amazing! The progress my son has made is remarkable ! My favorite part is everyday when I drop him off I know he is with staff that truly cares about him. They are truly my village .He loves going everyday ! Thank you positive steps !

I can‚Äôt say enough amazing things about this place truly the staff have changed our lives in the best way possible !!!

From the beginning with my 3 year old who was diagnosed with ASD level 3, when I first called and spoke directly to the owner Irene who was amazingly sweet and informative made me confident to begin this journey for my daughter. After that I got in touch with Cassie the BCBA and clinic director who basically held my hand through it all sent pictures to ease my mind as I was so scared and nervous to leave my baby girl anywhere inpatient without me there but I‚Äôm so glad I trusted these wonderful people because it‚Äôs been almost a year and my daughter has surpassed milestone after milestone she surprises us daily sky is the limit with the help of what‚Äôs now become a second family to my daughter and honestly my whole family she LOVES it there. A huge shout out to Jenna and Bry just a couple of the awesome RBTs there they care and have created such a bond with my girl they deserve so much recognition. I can go on and on but to wrap it up I have never had a single issue since the beginning every staff member I‚Äôve come in contact with and witnessed interact with not only me and my family but all the other beautiful families who attend there have been extraordinary!

I know how scary this entire journey for all the parents and loved ones is but if I could give you this advice going with positive steps you will be happy and your loved one will be safe and grow into the amazing human they are inside and out. Thank you so much Irene, Martika (rockstar admin kindest I‚Äôve ever dealt with), Cassie, Bry, Jenna and the rest of my positive steps ABA squad ‚ù§Ô∏è what you do is appreciated and you do make a difference !

It's rather upsetting that the owner stated she has no recollection of me as a previous client after I've personally spoken to and emailed her prior to my son being enrolled here.

His spot at this location was given to another child and we were informed that we'd be contacted when another spot had opened up.  They chose not to hold his spot while he was on vacation which is understandable, but what's upsetting is that this was not communicated to us so that we could make changes in our schedule to accommodate this policy. Months had gone by just for me to find out they had actually been accepting children again and just chose not to inform us. Irene ignored my husband's phone calls for weeks and would not return voicemails, so I decided to personally text his therapist to see what was going on.

With that being said, you may want to think twice if you want to take your child on a summer vacation prior to enrolling them here.

Nonetheless, I do still intend to reach out to the owner. Maybe there's a chance she knew nothing about this.

Matthew is a really great Massage therapist.  He did a Neck&shoulders massage for me and I felt relieved immediately.

Mark has been a God send. I‚Äôve been going to chiropractors, other PT‚Äôs and pain management for years with little relief. After only a few visits with Mark my pain has decreased significantly. His expertise and dry needling have made a huge difference in my daily life. And the staff is always very friendly and professional. I am so grateful that I found Premier PT.

Mark Kosier has been my physical therapist for more than a year. He is very knowledgeable and professional. And he listens to my concerns and answers my questions in a way that I can understand. He is able to offer more than just the more routine PT treatments especially for someone with RA like me. In addition, Lori who works at the front desk is great, very helpful and always accommodates my scheduling needs. Lisa who is the other physical therapist at this office has treated me when Mark was out and she is equally professional and skilled. I strongly recommend Premier Physical Therapy to anyone.

In November 2024 Mark saved my life. He was treating me for a shoulder that wouldn't stay in place. At the third visit he examined me and told my wife to take me to the ER immediately. There I was diagnosed with my first staph aureus Sepsis. Had he not taken immediate action I would have continued to request PT and I probably wouldn't have survived. Still can't use your facility because the second Sepsis involved my spine so still recovering from a third surgery to rebuild my back. But if someone wants a highly qualified physical therapist who will provide the best of care then I highly recommend Mark Kosier and the caring staff at Premier Physical Therapy.

I observed several of the Physical Therapists and Physical Therapy Assistants this past summer and there are too many incredible things to say about this clinic. Dr. Kopp and his coworkers are extremely knowledgeable of their craft, constantly striving to get patients back to their full potential and beyond. During my time at Premier, the biggest thing I noticed was everyone's "out of the box" approaches and determination to create unique exercises for specific issues. You will not only leave Premier feeling stronger, but you will also become more knowledgeable of your physical capacities.

Whether you are a patient in need of a Physical Therapist or a student interested in pursuing Physical Therapy, I cannot recommend Premier PT enough!

Dr Mark is a master in the art of healing. His extensive training ( degrees in neurobiology and PT, doctorate in PT) and additional training with renowned Dr. Marano Rocabado explain his extensive knowledge.

He used a combination of targeted massage, gentle stretching, the best dry needling experience I have ever had. Instant relief!
He gave me simple techniques to do at home to promote circulation to the tissues.

An excellent diagnostition, after he examined me he explained why I was such a good candidate for having TMJ, gave practical advice on future more invasive treatments I was considering (that likely wouldn't help) and spoke in laymen's terms that I could understand.

Cancer treatment at the Mayo Clinic brought me to JAX & triggered my TMJ but what a blessing that I found this practice and this healer!

This office exemplifies the way medical practices used to be: tight- knit, personal and caring. They handled my insurance quickly and respond immediately to set up future appointments.

Dr Mark even found a therapist near my home with similar credentials for me to see but I will continue to see Dr Mark whenever I'm in JAX for cancer appointments.

If you suffer from any type of jaw, head or neck issue, THIS is the practice and this is the therapist you need to choose.

Awesome place from front office to back! Sean, Peter , and Troy are top notch physical therapists that worked with me post surgical left knee injury. I would highly recommend Premier Physical Therapy and Sports Medicine.

I was visiting Ormond Beach for the Month of Feb. and needed to cont.my PT.  The front staff were so friendly, checked my Insurance before I even arrived in Florida. Michele and Sean were my therapists, answering all my questions, and excelled in compassion, patience, while have strong clinical expertise. I would recommend Premier, an all round, enjoyable experience in Physical Therapy.

I‚Äôve (now we), been a longtime patient of Premier Physical Therapy (then University Physical Therapy). I recommend them highly. Their Therapists are the best in well rounded medical knowledge. They care deeply about their patients and their well being. You‚Äôre always given individual personal care to help you achieve your goals and move forward. Keeping in mind and responding to your appropriate pain level for your illness. I have always experienced extreme kindness and compassion. We are extremely fortunate to have Maria as our Therapist. She has it all and more. So grateful for her.
**A wonderful extra is a group feeling of warmth, humor and even laughter! Making a difficult experience much more comfortable to deal with. **

In late 2023 my knee replacement surgery was postponed for a year due to other health issues. I was hobbled with 2 bad knees and back pain. My family kept saying PT, PT and finally I looked into it. Tara got me started on exercises for my core strength but when I had to change my start time Amanda took over and after several weeks of working with her and at home my back pain was gone and I was walking with a lot less pain.
In February after a knee replacement I came back to Premier. Amanda, with help from Joseph worked with me on my strength, balance, range of motion and pain management.
I can‚Äôt say enough about how much Amanda helped me during this time. Not only with the knowledge of her profession but also with her knowledge of people. Her kindness humor and support were greatly appreciated. Thanks Amanda and thanks to the rest of crew at Premier. Tara, Joseph, Stephanie and Fred.
I salute all of you for the important work that you do helping people like me to live their lives stronger and pain free. Thanks guys!
I‚Äôll be back!
It's a beautiful facility and very knowledgeable therapist. Fred gave a really thorough exam and excersizes to help. Looking forward to feeling better. Thank you

Five stars to Premiere and especially to

review_text: I went to get physical therapy for my neck and shoulder about a month and a half ago . On the first and second visit I was given manual therapy. R. because the pain was so intense and I  was having intense pain on my lower back, like someone stabbing me.  I don't like going to the E R. So they decided to give me Hot Pads on my neck and shoulder. I stopped going because I got worse with the pain. You go to physical therapy so they can make you feel better. They should know how to treat each individual with different issues.

review_text: Varsity Rehab Team was incredible and helped me get my life back after knee replacement surgery.  Their knowledge and kindness is what makes them stand out above all of the others.  Always thankful for what they did for my recovery.

review_text: I have been coming to Premier as a result of severe knee pain. My experience with the Therapy's have been awesome; I, like the function of the machine's; they are very relaxing and therapeutic especially the water bed, but it makes me want to stay the night, if I, could have one I think I, wouldn't want to miss a day or a night on it. review_text: Love Dr. Hefter‚Äôs mobile services for my dog and cat but tried the new office today and it was great. It‚Äôs off Broward Blvd in Plantation past Pine Island. Super easy to get to. provider_name: Premium Vet Care - Mobile Animal Hospital
review_text: I had an amazing experience with Dr. Hefter and his team. We had initially taken my cat Pumpkin to another veterinarian because they were cheap and affordable. However, we paid the price in the long run because Pumpkin was misdiagnosed at that vet, and also given a long-lasting steroid injection which had caused her to ultimately be hospitalized there after reacting to it. Fast forward a few weeks and the original concern had returned for my cat. I scheduled Dr. Hefter to arrive at our house and the appointment could not have been easier! He was so wonderful to work with and speak to, the communication with him and his team was very quick and they were overall a joy to work with. After treating my cat for this concern, she has seemed much happier and healthier than I've seen her in a very long time. I wish we had scheduled with this veterinarian earlier before going down an expensive and unnecessary road with the previous vet clinic, this office will my go-to from now on!

provider_name: Premium Vet Care - Mobile Animal Hospital
review_text: Dr. Hefter was amazing with our cats! He was super professional, went above and beyond to help them, and made us feel really confident in their care. He was also very kind and courteous. I definitely won‚Äôt be switching vets again‚Äîhighly recommend!

review_text: We‚Äôre so grateful for the exceptional care our cat, Romeo, received. The veterinarian, Dr. hefter, was professional, warm, and went above and beyond to help us. provider_name: Premium Vet Care - Mobile Animal Hospital
review_text:
recently had the pleasure of availing the services of Dr. Blake Hefter from Premium Vet Care, and I must say it was an experience that exceeded my expectations. As a busy professional with limited availability during the day, their after-hours home visit was an absolute game-changer for me and my beloved feline companions.

One of the standout qualities of Dr. Hefter's service was their unwavering commitment to providing exceptional care, even outside of regular working hours. Their flexibility in accommodating my schedule by offering appointments after 5pm was a tremendous relief. This level of dedication truly distinguishes Premium Vet Care from other veterinary practices.

From the moment Dr. Hefter arrived at my home, it was evident that their passion for animal well-being was unparalleled. Their warm and friendly demeanor instantly put both me and my cats at ease, creating a comfortable and stress-free environment. provider_name: Premium Vet Care - Mobile Animal Hospital
review_text:
We can‚Äôt say enough about Dr. Hefter and the incredible care he provided for our beloved Delilah during the most heartbreaking time of our lives. From the moment she was diagnosed with terminal cancer, he was compassionate, resourceful, and truly went above and beyond to help us navigate her care.

Even in the most difficult moments, when we had to make the impossible decision to let her go, his expertise and bedside manner were a great source of comfort. He handled every step with such kindness, patience, and respect‚Äînot just for Delilah, but for us as well. It was clear that he genuinely cares, not only about the pets he treats but also about the people who love them.

Dr. Hefter is also the trusted vet for our other two, Samson and Athena, and we wouldn‚Äôt want anyone else caring for them. If you‚Äôre looking for a veterinarian who is not only highly skilled but also deeply compassionate, we cannot recommend him enough.

Thank you, Dr. Hefter, for everything.

provider_name: Premium Vet Care - Mobile Animal Hospital
review_text: I would give Premium Vet Care a million stars if I could! When Taki got a severe ear infection, I knew there is No Way I could place him in a carrier and take him to a regular vet clinic. Being an adopted feral cat, this would have been an extremely traumatizing experience for him and for myself. As soon as I called Premium Vet Care, I knew that I was on the right hands. Dr. Blake Hefter and his Assistant had an instant empathy with Taki.  When Dr. Hefter walked in, Taki didn't run away like he always does when other people enter our home, which was very surprising to me. Dr. Hefter was able to easily sedate him, confirm his diagnosis and administer his ear treatment. It hasn't even been 2 hours and Taki is already feeling so much better and enjoying his treats! As a feral cat mom of 3 boys, I know how important it is to find reliable vet care for reasonable prices when needed!  Strongly recommend Premium Vet Care! What a great service! Thank you again Pet Angels!

provider_name: Prevail Recovery Center - Alcohol & Drug Rehab Florida
review_text:
My experience at Prevail was wonderful.
Andrew and Anthony are both highly experienced professionals and truly care about each individual.
They even took us to the gym and worked with us individually as personnel trainers.
The techs there weren't so bad either, Adam would always take us to church, the beach, bowling, and even to a wildlife preserve.
Any bad reviews talking about getting kicked out is entirely due to the individuals behavior.

Even though I've been out for months, they still check on me often and make sure I'm doing what I'm supposed to.

It was/and will be my only trip to a rehab facility, but if you are looking at reviews to pick a place to go, definitely give this one a try. You will not regret it.

provider_name: Prevail Recovery Center - Alcohol & Drug Rehab Florida
review_text: My time at prevail was very beneficial for me. It allowed me to look at my life from a different perspective. It was about to focusing solely my addiction and the root of the problem. Facilitators and house staff are outstanding professionals in their field and give you the tools to heal if you allow them to help you. You are given task and exercises to exam your and make better decisions going and finding other outlets besides substance abuse. The curriculum can be intense and you have to face things in your past that are hard to deal with. Prevail can help you deal with the issues group sessions and allowing to go to outside meetings where you will find people who have similar stories. I enjoyed my time at Prevail and if you want help I think you will to.

provider_name: Prevail Recovery Center - Alcohol & Drug Rehab Florida
review_text: They helped me get the tools I needed to completely turn my life around. Amazing staff, dedicated therapists and ownership is awesome! Truly care about the patients and making a difference!

review_text: Prevail was a great program.  Multiple different group facilitators throughout the week kept it unique and engaging. provider_name: Prime Sports Wellness Physical Therapy, PT
review_text:
There aren‚Äôt enough stars! Prime Sports Physical Therapy, led by Eugene Jang, delivers an exceptional standard of care. Eugene is professional and attentive, really taking the time to understand each patient‚Äôs specific concerns. He utilizes a range of treatment approaches to address the root causes of pain, ensuring that progress is both effective and lasting.

The clinic itself is extremely well organized, appointments  are confirmed in advance and run on time, so the entire experience is efficient and stress-free. That level of attention to detail reflects the same commitment shown in treatment.

Eugene‚Äôs credibility and trust within the medical and athletic community speak volumes about the quality of care he provides. Thanks to his expertise and individualized approach, my pain has improved significantly, allowing me to return to baseline.

He consistently goes above and beyond for his patients, demonstrating both clinical excellence and genuine compassion. I highly recommend Prime Sports Physical Therapy for anyone seeking top-quality rehabilitation and support.

review_text: Outstanding physical therapy, place has highly educated and knowledgeable physical therapists that provide dedicated personal attention using traditional techniques as well as the latest technology. They are up to date on the most recent developments in the field. One of the few places that offer dry needling therapy, which was very effective for my situation. provider_name: Prime Sports Wellness Physical Therapy, PT
review_text: I (barely) walked in with a torn meniscus to the clinic    And I am now soo much better. Im strengthening my glutes etc and hoping to avoid surgery!!  They are all DPT‚Äôs highly knowledgeable and skilled. I would recommend this team to any one w a sports injury or any injury.

provider_name: Prime Sports Wellness Physical Therapy, PT
review_text:
I'm so glad one of my PTs at NYU Langone suggested I reach out to Prime Sports. I got hit by a car in July last year and it has been surprisingly challenging, especially as a professional dancer to find great quality treatment. My insurance is in NY so I've needed to be particular with paying out of pocket. In addition to noting the efficiency and quality of recovery (PS spends more time using customized manual therapy instead of just hooking me up to an EMS machine) - other places I tried had similar (or higher) prices but the PT works with different clients in the same hour. Here they are with you one-on-one the whole hour.

Eugene set me up with Lindsey who has been incredibly knowledgeable, encouraging and fun. I started going twice a week about a month ago. At that time, I was having a lot of difficulty sleeping every night, even with several painkillers. Which of course affects everything. This week I had the first string of days I've been able to sleep through the night without painkillers üôè.

I really appreciate the bright, friendly, professional atmosphere and am looking forward to getting back to dancing more & more with their help!

provider_name: Prime Sports Wellness Physical Therapy, PT
review_text: Not only is the physical care outstanding but Eugene, Ky, Danny and Sam are like family-friendly and supportive. The best ever.

Prism is a very special place we will forever hold dear to our hearts.  Our daughter attended Prism for a year and her growth was beyond any and all expectations. Fiona was diagnosed with stage 4 IVDD and surgery just wasnt an option for us. Dr. Reddy mentioned we could do laser therapy treatments and medications instead of surgery and just to give it time with strict bed rest.. I am so grateful we did! In the beginning fionas condition was so bad that she lost all mobility in her back legs. She couldn't stand or walk on her own and she was in a lot of pain. After 4 laser treatments, a few weeks of medication and bed rest, I am happy to say Fiona is back on her feet again! She is doing so much better and her legs are regaining strength everyday. The laser therapy treatments were extremely helpful and also very affordable. I am really happy there was an alternative to surgery. I also want to say that I am really thankful for Dr. Reddys knowledge and compassion. He has a great staff who really cares and I can't thank them enough. Best vet I've seen in 9 years.. and I've been to a lot.  They take care of both my girls.

They entire team is amazing and very professional. They take care of all our pets. They also just performed a surgery on our dog's leg and she recovered very quickly from the procedure. Privileged Critters was recommended to us by a neighbor and we are happy that they did! Thanks Privileged Critters Animal Hospital!!

The absolute best veterinarian and team I have seen in a long time!! Kind, caring, compassionate and reasonably priced.  They have treated several of our family fur babies.  I brought a sick stray kitten in today. They did their evaluation, put together a treatment plan, went over the price for approval and then treated/cared for her like she was a princess.  I am beyond grateful.  Thank you all for being so wonderful!!!

Privileged Critters Animal Hospital is the absolute best!! We have a ornery dog who only travels in his crate. The staff just love on him when he comes in and makes him feel very at ease. They have been our vet for many years and I would recommend them to anyone. They are amazing!!!

The treatment we received here was wonderful. They were willing to see us on a Saturday even though we were not a previous client. It is a smaller office but they more than make up for it with their service and care. I really appreciated the way that they genuinely listened and answered all of my questions and concerns. They didn‚Äôt try to perform any  unnecessary tests and made sure that my pet got the treatment he needed as fast as possible. Based on my experience there I highly recommend.

I‚Äôve had an amazing experience working with Natalie as my physical therapist. From day one, she was not only incredibly knowledgeable and skilled, but also warm, patient, and genuinely invested in my recovery. She took the time to understand my specific needs and created a personalized plan that helped me make steady progress.

Natalie‚Äôs encouragement, clear communication, and positive energy made each session something I actually looked forward to. Thanks to her, I‚Äôm feeling stronger, more confident, and much closer to full recovery.

I can‚Äôt recommend her enough‚Äîif you‚Äôre looking for someone who truly cares and knows how to get results, Natalie is the one

I was recently having a lot of back pain, having trouble working out and doing daily tasks. I saw Dr. Tyler at the North Tampa facility on Bruce B Downs Blvd, and was extremely pleased with my rehabilitation. The office is incredibly friendly, their front desk associate Hailey is warm and inviting. They were extremely organized and timely; I never waited over my appointment time. Dr. Tyler did an excellent job with not only designing the workout plans to provide exercises I was comfortable doing but also explaining how and why each were important to my success in getting rid of my back pain. If I wasn‚Äôt able to work with Dr. Tyler, Chris stepped in and did an amazing job as well. I looked forward to each visit. Even though my physical therapy appointments have ended, the exercises he provided me I still do each day. It‚Äôs been a couple weeks and they have kept me pain free since! I am back to enjoying my workouts and feeling confident again. I would highly recommend this office!

John is the most pleasant and positive doctor I have ever had. He was so calm and relaxed and upbeat about my diagnosed tennis elbow in both arms. I wanted to go in just to get some relief not just physically but emotionally as I had to deal with not being able to lift my two year old. I wanted to come back and only reason I didn't is bc my insurance changed and it would be more costly. All staff follows his upbeat positive attitude. Great company culture. Takes such good care of you! I highly recommend Pro-active. And for anyone looking to intern I would ask!

Pro-Active Physical Therapy is top-notch! I read all of the reviews about Pro-Active before selecting them as my care provider. While I am always skeptical about consistent high ratings, Pro-Active lived up to them. John Hisamoto  is a true professional and takes great pride in the work he does and I could not have felt more confident in the care and advice he provided. He and his staff are amazing. Thank you Pro-Active!

From the day I had my ACL repair until now months later Tyler and Chris have helped me feel normal again. Not a single visit except that they have made themselves available for every concern and happily answered my repetitive questions. They have pretty much a 1:1 interaction time very often. I went to other chains and they toss you into a big room with many clients at the same time and it‚Äôs very frustrating not to know exactly what you‚Äôre doing right and wrong. With Tyler and Chris every exercise and every stretch is under direct attentive guidance. They are a dream team. If I could do it all over again I wouldn‚Äôt go anywhere else.

review_text: Excellent place and professionals

Prodigy is an amazing ABA center for kids with autism. We have 2 of our kids at Prodigy. They are attentive and always kind. Their first priority is always the kids and how they can progress in their program. Our kids have had tremendous growth in such a short time.

I highly recommend this program and we are truly thankful to them.

They acted like they cared.
They turned their back on my child knowing she needs the ABA services.
When the office needs something from you they will most definitely call but if you need to get in touch with them. Good luck!
I'll be finding am ABA center whi treats me and my child like the humans we ARE!!

This is our third ABA company in three years and we will continue staying with Prodigy. The RBTs and BCBA have been helping us with our daughters toileting and we‚Äôve seen such progress in her time there. The team is knowledgeable in their areas and so welcoming.

At enrollment of our kids, we discussed our concerns/importance of maintaining consistency with school and other therapies which lead to afternoon sessions daily and one day of early dismissal for one of our kids. Later, we learn that we would need to move to the facility‚Äôs new ‚Äúblock scheduling‚Äù or not receive services. This required daily early dismissal from school where other therapies were being received so coordination with the school was necessary prior to this switch. Admin states that we did not agree to the new scheduling, which is true because I won‚Äôt risk their school attendance/placement. The school did not respond because of a hurricane and the county was shut down for days. Prodigy discontinued both kids‚Äô therapy until we got approval and even though, despite the words of the admin, the kids‚Äô spots were not held for them. Our kids went weeks without therapy.
Recently one of my kid‚Äôs days was eliminated with less than 24hr notice (coincidently the agreed upon early day), due to the unavailability of therapists for that day. Admin did call to speak on the changes the day of, but this was impromptu when I was at work and unable to fully discuss. A BCBA offered provide treatment, but Admin denied that idea and accommodation as ‚Äúit is not feasible to hire a new therapist.‚Äù Therapists appeared to be reassigned to accommodate other clients, which we found to be preferential discrimination.
As an advocate for my kids, I did have multiple chats regarding this matter which was considered ‚Äúaggressive behavior‚Äù with ‚Äúdefamatory remarks.‚Äù Admin claims that they have ‚Äúgone above and beyond by accommodating extended absences and accommodating an egregious amount of untimely late pick-ups.‚Äù Medical notes were provided when applicable and emergencies/death are unavoidable. Also, if they want kids to be checked out on time, therapists should be ready at pickup time and parents not waiting outside to be let it past the session ending time. Being distracted by using a mobile device to check out kids is disrespectful during the verbal update provided at the end of session.
Though the contract states to be upheld to the Ethics Code for Behavior Analysts, we found this to be false in our experience, specifically noting Ethics Standards 2.02 Timeliness, 2.08 Communicating About Services, 3.01 Responsibility to Clients, 3.04 Service Agreement, 3.12 Advocating for Appropriate Services, 3.14 Facilitating Continuity of Services, 3.15 Appropriately Discontinuing Services, 3.16 Appropriately Transitioning Services.
IN MY OPINION: The administration of this company has effectively displayed the lack of clientele care and compassion for kids of special needs to grow and build life skill. As parents, we have looked past the screen time during sessions and the acceptance of aggressive behavior towards my kids (apparently, it‚Äôs a constant learning opportunity but not when your child does not feel safe). With this review, admin might find it apt to redirect our issues, HOWEVER, I am a MOM of kids who need someone to advocate for them. Deflecting the issues at hand does not justify what we experienced. Lasty, I did research many avenues to act on so that my kid‚Äôs services would be reinstated. Unfortunately, the admin cannot be held accountable to the Ethics Code for Behavior Analysts (as listed in their contract) because they are not BCBAs. This negative experience brought us to find another company whose focus on routine, consistency, and overall patient first mindset better match our children‚Äôs needs and assisted in providing a seamless transition of services. It should be noted that the counselors do seem to genuinely care about their patients, but the same cannot be said for the admin team which ultimately led us to seek therapy elsewhere.

We had the most terrible experience here. Worst Aba center ever! Rbts are on the phone constantly i saw it at most pick up sessions instead of working with child. I'm glad i pulled my child out of this Catastrophe. I noticed something was off when i started seeing bruises on my child like restraint and reported it to them and they just wrote a report. They lacked empathy and fired some bcbas. I started seeing regression in my child too. Rbts here would roll there eyes at my child when she would have a tantrum. I am a very observant person and thats when i knew i needed to be seeking elsewhere for services. Till this day i thank God i did. These people are shady. Please dont bring your kids here. Our children deserve better services.

Winston and DeLanni love getting to go on walks with their staff, getting snuggles from their caring staff, as well as some yummy treats. Their system is very user friendly and their communication is top notch. I highly recommend Professional Pets for all levels of services.

Our boys, Milo and Cheddar, absolutely loved their stay-cation with Justine! She was wonderful‚Äîpatient, attentive, and so loving with them. We really appreciated the daily reports and all the adorable pictures she sent, which gave us peace of mind while we were away. When we came home, Milo and Cheddar were happy, relaxed, and clearly well cared for. We highly recommend Professional Pets Florida and will definitely be booking with her again!

I just moved to Florida and was need of a pet sitter. I lived in VA and I had the same pet sitter for 25 years so I was very concerned about getting a new one. As someone that values great costumer service and attention to detail when it comes to my babies (they are my childrenü•π) I was so happy with everything. Overall a great service and the price is reasonable for everything they doü§ç here is some picture of the high maintenance babies

I cannot say enough positive things about Professional Pets Florida! I treat my dog like she is my human child, which in turn means that to give another person my trust with her is BIG! My dog is anxious and super leash reactive, and Justine handles her with patience and redirection so that they can still have enjoyable walks together. I would highly recommend this company to anyone looking for a trusted resource to take care of their furry family members!

For nearly a decade, Professional Speech Associates has been an invaluable part of our daughter's journey. Susan, a true leader in speech-language pathology, and her exceptional team have consistently provided knowledgeable, creative, and compassionate care. Their dedication to helping our daughter, who is on the autism spectrum, has resulted in remarkable daily progress. We are profoundly grateful for their unwavering support.

Susan detected our 5 year old daughter's tongue tie which no other professional has done before her. The frenectomy procedure did wonders for our child, and Susan was amazing in helping her with the needed therapy sessions there after. Our daughter has already shown much progress in a short amount of time. Susan is an extremely caring and knowledgeable Speech Language Pathologist, as are her team of therapists in the office. If your child is in need of any speech or language therapy services, absolutely send them to Professional Speech Associates!! You will not be disappointed

Susan truly has a passion and really cares!

Great team and great staff. The location and establishment is wonderful.

Wonderful office with great staff. My son is making great progress and they made a diagnosis previously missed by another speech pathologist. The knowledge and care given is fantastic and a relief because it‚Äôs hard to find all round good service lately.  Susan and Clare know their profession and do a great job! Thank you!

As a clinician in mental heath, we have occasions to refer our clients to PSA and we only hear positive feedback from the capability and care of their staff. We are happy to have them as a good option for our clients because we know they will take good care of the kids. Thank you.

A Miracle Worker for Our Beloved Pups!

Whoever said you can‚Äôt teach an old dog new tricks clearly hasn‚Äôt met Alison! After our 10-year-old pup experienced a traumatic house fire, he was left with severe anxiety and reactivity issues. We were feeling hopeless, but then we found Alison, and the results have been nothing short of miraculous.

Alison employs a positive reinforcement approach, always prioritizing the well-being of the dogs in her care. Her gentle yet effective methods have transformed our anxious pup into a calmer, more confident companion. It‚Äôs been an absolute joy to witness his progress as he learns to navigate the world around him with newfound ease.

We also have a younger pup who has benefited tremendously from Alison‚Äôs training. Her consistent guidance has instilled a sense of control and discipline that has made a world of difference for both of our dogs.

If you're looking for a dog trainer who truly understands and cares for dogs, look no further than Alison. She is a true miracle worker, and we are incredibly grateful for everything she has done for our furry family members. Thank you, Alison!

I had the pleasure of working with Alison at Progress4Paws, and I cannot recommend her dog training services highly enough! From the very first session, it was clear that Alison truly cared about me and my dog. Her approach is patient, positive, and incredibly effective.

The training techniques she recommended and utilized were not only easy to follow but also tailored specifically to my dog's personality and needs. My dog, who is a little stubborn has made remarkable progress in just a few weeks. Alison took the time to explain the reasoning behind each exercise and provided ongoing support, which made me feel empowered as a pet parent.

What really stood out was how kind and compassionate Alison is with dogs. My dog loved her! She created a calm and structured environment that fostered trust, and it‚Äôs evident in the way my dog has responded to the training.

Whether you‚Äôre working on basic commands, behavioral issues, or something more advanced, this training program is a game-changer. It‚Äôs not just about teaching your dog; it‚Äôs about building a stronger, more positive relationship with your dog. If you're looking for a top-notch dog trainer, look no further‚ÄîAlison with Progress4Paws is the real deal!

Allison at Progress 4 Paws is the real deal when it comes to dog training, she has been able to successfully train our beagles which I originally thought was impossible. We are primarily training our 2 year old female beagle; from basic manners, to more advanced safety commands like "wait", to tricks like "shake" and "spin". She's even accomplished to teach our senior beagles to sit and stay, which proves you can teach an old dog new tricks.

Allison is very positive, warm, and friendly, she will be very gentle and patient with your dog until they get it. While this is training for your dog, it's also training for the owner, making sure we feel comfortable and knowledgeable on carrying out commands with our dogs. Allison is even gentle on us humans, when we may be hard on ourselves.

Allison understands and recognizes each dog breed is different and will train specifically to your dog's breed. She knows beagles are more food driven than anything else, where another dog might live for toys, balls, or praise.

She comes to our home to make the dog feel comfortable and it makes it easier on us to learn, because there are less distractions in our own home. She gives us the knowledge and tools we need to practice outside our home and when she is not there. Our 2yo beagle knows, sit, down, stay, spin, and wait after three sessions. I would highly recommend Allison at Progress 4 Paws.

I am so thankful that I found Alison & Progress 4 Paws! When I took on my foster pup, Mama, she had a few quirks! Upon, our first meeting, Alison made both Mama & I at ease and quickly assessed a plan for her! She started off with building blocks to create the foundation to success! Mama likes other dogs but has what is called, leash reactivity! After 4 weeks, there has been an incredible improvement! She is so much more happy and being her best self! I have been in the rescue/shelter dog business for nearly 8 years and by far, Alison is one of the best I have met! I wholeheartedly recommend her for any behavioral issues your pup might have or just looking for them to put their best paw first! Plus, she trained me too!ü§£

Alison was great with our training. She helped turn our walking time into fun time. There were a few other things she helped us with and those were very helpful. I would highly recommend Alison to be any one‚Äôs first choice with dog training.
Me Shiree and Thanos really appreciate her help

We had my son‚Äôs speech evaluation today, and the whole experience was great. The process went really smoothly, and the staff made both of us feel comfortable from the start. They were patient and kind while working with Kaiden, taking the time to help him troubleshoot and pronounce his words correctly. You can tell they truly care about what they do.

reviewer_name: Wife, Mom, Dog Mom and sushi lover Love
review_text: Our experience at Progressive has been exceptional.  Dr. Abby is a miracle worker, within days of starting PT I noticed an improvement in my 8month old. She is professional, knowledgeable,gentle and warm with children. She communicates well with the parents. I love how she educates the caregiver on what she is doing in each session and provide tips so the parents can feel involved.

My 3yo son was born at 25 weeks, needs assistance in a lot of areas including speech, occupational therapy, and feeding therapy. Our experience at this office has been exceptional, and he‚Äôs growing and learning with every session.
The Poinciana location: The therapists are very professional and work together to make it a successful experience. The staff are helpful and responsive.

My daughter sees Ms. Susan at Progressive Pediatric Therapy and has improved her speech in so little time. My daughter loves coming to her speech sessions with Ms. Susan and gets so happy to see her. I would recommend Ms.Susan to everyone that needs to bring their child for speech. I am so grateful for all her help. Ms. Susan is the best!

Outstanding visit today with Oscar. Initial evaluation. He also had a couple of students whom he taught  along the way,  seamlessly , and they were able to ask all appropriate questions.
Very thorough evaluation and excellent educational visit for me. Also saw the owner Mr. Greg Welch. Kudos for the magnificent administration of the facility..

It‚Äôs difficult to exercise when you‚Äôre in constant pain but this staff makes it so doable! There is always a great energy in the room and I genuinely enjoy going to PT. My therapists, Natalie and Luis, are absolute sweethearts and I can tell they really care about the progress of all their patients. They make me feel very comfortable and safe that I won‚Äôt injure my back further. They are happy to explain and answer any questions I may have. Everyone at Progressive is a joy to be around. The front desk staff are so kind and the owner, Greg, makes sure to say hello to everyone and ask how they‚Äôre doing. Today, Greg offered to put me on a specific bed where I could watch the Olympics while I did some stretches! What a kind and thoughtful staff! My back is feeling great, I highly recommend progressive therapy center :)

After undergoing extensive back surgery and a total hip replacement within the span of just seven months, I turned to Progressive Therapy to help with my rehabilitation. I couldn‚Äôt be more grateful for the care, expertise, and support I received during my recovery process.
From my very first visit, I was impressed by the professionalism and warmth of the entire team. The staff made me feel comfortable right away, which was especially important after such significant surgeries.
My physical therapists were Natalie and Luis. They have been exceptional. They have taken the time to carefully assess my condition and listened to my concerns, making sure I understood each step of the rehabilitation plan. The treatment plan was personalized to my needs, with a focus on both my back and hip recovery. They both were patient, encouraging, and always ensured that I was progressing at a pace that was safe and effective for me. The front desk staff have also been superb. They are courteous, friendly and on top of scheduling appointments. The PT assistants and students that have rotated through the center have all been great.
What has stood out most during my therapy has been the genuine concern the team had for my well-being. They took the time to answer my questions and made sure I felt confident and capable throughout the process. I always felt like I was in good hands, and the results speak for themselves and although I am still in recovery mode, I am now walking, moving, and living with much less pain and far more strength than I ever imagined possible just a few months ago.
If you will be needing physical therapy and recovering from surgery or dealing with any type of physical limitation, I highly recommend Progressive Therapy. Their knowledgeable and compassionate team is truly dedicated to helping you get back to your best self. I can‚Äôt thank them enough for all they‚Äôve done for me!

Caring, kind, and very professional service. Staff is warm, welcoming, and everyone greets you with a smile. Therapists, specially owners, Greg and Jackie, truly go above and beyond to get things done. I am very thankful I was recommended to Progressive Therapy for my rehab.

I've been coming to Progressive Therapy for over 6 months now and couldn't be more thrilled with the outcome and progress I've made to date! The staff is AMAZING! They are all so warm and friendly and always encouraging and motivating their patients.
Post surgey, I couldn't see the end of the road, and truly never thought that I'd get to the point I'm at now. Greg is always so energetic and bubbly and keeps the staff and patients smiling. His wife, Jackie is also nothing short of amazing and I love seeing them all work on the OT side.
I've had the pleasure of working with several PTs from Luis, to Oscar, and my all time favorite,  Natalie! They give challenging exercises that push you but nothing too painful that will discourage you as a patient. I also love that they leave you with exercises to do at home and do such a great job with follow up questions to check in next visit. At times I'd feel frustrated, they'd tell me, be patient, it'll take time. And this was totally true. It's going to be bittersweet when my last session comes. But I'll keep working on all things taught. If you're looking for a great facility to meet your OT or PT needs, Progressive Therapy is the place for you!!!

I can personally attest that Deborah Collins and her team at Project Hope are compassionate, kind, and skilled professionals who are dedicated to serving the ASD community.  Deborah has a team of very skilled RBTs who are always looking out for the learner's best interests.  Deborah is also very mission-driven, and her decisions are centered around what the learners and their families need. There are a lot of ABA companies to choose from, but if your family is looking for a small, person-centered, and relationship-driven practice, you won't be disappointed by Project Hope!

Project Hope has been the best experience of our lives, it is a great place where children are helped to grow hand in hand with the best team of professionals, it is a fantastic and welcoming place where my son felt at home, their professionals treat children with so much love that they make you feel like a big family, you will not find a safer and more reliable place for your children like this center, its quality in everything is excellent, we are eternally grateful to Deborah  , Rita , Nicole  Z, Rosi , Katy  , Sophia, Max ,and the entire team for the wonderful work they did with my son. God grant that many children with autism have the opportunity to be part of this great family of hope, because our children deserve the best and I am sure that this is the right place.
Best ABA around, my son gained so much in his 2 years, full time at Project Hope. Where some therapists actually set him back, Project Hope knew how to connect with him using his interests.

I am a former owner of an ABA business in another state, and I have worked with many providers across the country over the last 10 years. I am also an autism parent.

I am so impressed with the compassionate care that is provided by the team at Project Hope! Their dedication, positive attitude, and true love for the families they serve is obvious. Families should be very comfortable placing their children in the care of Project Hope.

A fantastic place where a child with the autistic spectrum receives all assistance for their evolution, the entire team is extremely professional, cordial and dedicated to the development and inclusion of these wonderful children in society.
I recommend.
Congratulations to D√©bora and all her team.

From age 2 to now 6, Project Speech has been a huge part of my daughter‚Äôs journey. Today, she‚Äôs excelling in school and has even been placed in the gifted program as a first grader!  Forever grateful for Project Speech and everything they‚Äôve done.

My daughter has been there a few months now, and I can see the world of distance! We've been working with Lauren, SLP and she's amazing! She's extremely patient and you can tell she loves children and what she does! The practice is clean and inviting. All the staff are kind. Glad I found this place.

My son has been with Project Speech for 3 years and I wouldn‚Äôt want him to be anywhere else. Amanda and her staff have gone above and beyond for our family, their primary purpose has always been helping my son achieve success in any way possible and he‚Äôs made such amazing progress and continues to do so. I highly recommend Project Speech!

We were concerned about my son's speech when he was 2 because he was not speaking like the other 2-year-olds. My son was three years old when he began attending Project Speech. Amanda was a God sent. She did a very detailed assessment. She gave us feedback on what she observed. It was very refreshing to know that she was very skilled in her craft. She is almost OCD when it comes to her patients. Amanda notices EVERYTHING about your child lol. I love it! She made me feel comfortable. She works well with kids, and she helped my son's speech sound intelligible. (We did not understand him 40% of the time when he first started).  The "Others" tried to label my boy something he was not. My son is turning 5 in a few weeks, and Project Speech graduated him. We are sad to go, because she is AMAZING. We are happy with our son's results. His diction, his sentences, he expressions all caught up with his age group because of her. We started going to her two times a week. When he got better at 4, she reduced his visits to once a week. Last thing: She is very knowledgeable about the school system, and she gave excellent advice. My husband and I had many questions, and we were anxious and lost. Amanda solved that. Project Speech is like family now.

I just want to share my experience with project speech. They have been incredibly kind and i have really seen a big chance in my daughter. My daughter isn't able to speak yet but shes improved so much. We were originally referred by our pediatrician because we think she may be autistic. She was not looking at us in the eyes wasn't producing any language, wasn't pointing or playing with toys appropriately. But let me tell you guys now she points, shes making lots of visual contact with us, she says bye bye and does the hand movement. She plays with her toys like she should. My daughter has truly made such big progress and my family and I are incredibly thankful and grateful for Mrs, Melanie Harvey she is our daughter speech therapist. My daughter is so excited to go see her on her therapy days and she always leaves super happy. Amanda was also so great when we spoke to her she explained the progress and the insurance part of it. Everyone is truly amazing and you can see how great they are, the kids that go there are always soo excited to see their therapist. I am foreever thankful and greatful for this place ! Thank you mrs melanie

I went there and i took some lessons, and i can tell you this place is amazing! Ciara took her time to make sure you could get a good grasp on what she taught you. If you fall behind on your board payments, beware of the harsh consequences. The barn may neglect your horse, withholding food and exposing it to the elements, leading to significant weight loss. They may also damage your tack by leaving it outdoors. Despite needing assistance to sell or rehome my horse, there was no help provided, and my horse lost 200 pounds over three months. This lack of professionalism and compassion from Dot Suto Graves the trainer at Razorback Equestrian Center LLC, who I believe should be reported for neglect, is unacceptable.

No reputable barn would handle financial delinquencies in this manner. Typically, the protocol would be to sell the horse at auction and legally pursue the owner for any outstanding debt rather than resorting to neglect. Unfortunately, unpredictable events can complicate financial commitments.

I sincerely hope no other family experiences this treatment while boarding at this barn.
