For the last year, every time I sneezed, I felt like something was about to snap in my lower back and I always had to brace myself so I wouldn‚Äôt fall to the floor. I just sneezed and felt no pain in my back!

Although I was slightly scared of how painful Rolfing would be, Yvette was great at making my fear dissipate right away. The moment she started to work on my body, it was constant relief that gave me chills multiple times. I started to feel spacious, not just in the section she was working on, but throughout the body.

Highly recommend her services!

My posture has significantly bettered, and I no longer experience the pain I once did. I feel more aligned, mobile, and pain-free. I asked a friend of mine if she had a contact for a good Pelvic Floor Therapist and she gave me Dr Garcias number. When I tell you I was at my ropes end with my postpartum incontinence I truly meant it. I was 2 years postpartum with my second baby but my issues started 7 years ago with my first baby. I spoke to Dr Garcia over the phone and immediately felt a sense of hope again for my very common but not normal urinary incontinence. My time with Dr Garcia was life changing, it truly was! She is such a great listener and communicator. Her bed side manners are excellent. Her assessment and plan of action to correct my situation was not only doable but sustainable. I can‚Äôt say enough great things about Dr Garcia. My UI has improved greatly to the point where I no longer need to rely on pads and diapers to keep me dry for most of my daily tasks. This is a huge win for me, anybody who struggles with Urinary Incontinence should reach out to Dr Garcia, she will change your life as well. Thank you Dr Garcia!

Life-changing experience!
I‚Äôve been working with Alexia Garcia for a  few time , and I can‚Äôt say enough about how much she‚Äôve  helped me. From the very first session, I felt heard, supported, and understood. Her approach is gentle, respectful, and incredibly knowledgeable. She  took the time to explain what was going on with my body in a way that made me feel empowered rather than overwhelmed.
Not only have my symptoms improved drastically, but I also feel more confident and connected to my body. If you‚Äôre dealing with pelvic floor issues, postpartum recovery, or just want to improve your core strength safely, I highly recommend Alexia Garcia.

Rose is amazing!!! She trained my lab mix to become a service dog to help me with my anxiety when I fly (diagnosed). Rose not only trained my dog but also taught me how to communicate with my dog on a whole different level. My dog (her name is Chespi), my wife, and I now live in Paris France and we are having a blast. Thank you so much Rose. Your training was a life changer for our family.

Rose has changed our entire family environment with her amazing training with our dogs!

A well trained dog is a happy dog and even happier owners. She actually trained us to know how to handle behaviors and how to get the results we wanted.

I am now training our rescue dog, Nala, to work as a therapy dog and perform skills I never thought was possible.

She is amazing, patient and so focused on getting results immediately!!!

Everyone should try her service and you will be amazed at what your four legged family member can do!

Way to go Rose!!!

When we first decided to get a dog we had no idea what breed to choose. The idea was to get a service dog for my husband to help with his mobility and mental wellbeing. At the time, we lived in a small condo apartment. Rose helped us choose the best breed for the job.
When we got Kona (Staffordshire bull terrier) he was nine weeks old and full of energy. Right there and then the training road began. Kona was a puppy trying to eat everything at home, jumping on furniture,  not listening to any command whatsoever, jumping on people, nipping people, pulling on the leash, approaching every single person or dog he saw. He is now a well-behaved service dog. He is now capable of bracing to help my husband get up from a sitting position, of pulling him when he needs assistance walking, of doing deep chest compressions when anxiety hits. I am not even going to mention that he listens when you give him a command. He walks close to us without pulling. He goes into restaurants and quietly waits for us to eat lying down under the table. What can I say, what progress!
When you hire Rose you better get ready for training. There is no such a thing as a training lesson without the owner. There is no sugar coating. She goes straight to the point and trains hard. You will be trained and then you will train your dog. She will advise you on best diet choices for your dog, and on the best training techniques you could find. Rose is a positive reinforcement trainer, rewards based.  You will need a lot of patience but it will definitively pay off. Your dog will learn; it is a fact. You will learn too; it is a fact.
We love Rose. We love what she did for us. Our lives are better because of her.

Rose it is an amazing dog trainer!! She gave us all the keys that we need for our new adopted doggy. She is patient, and she really cares about the dog and takes a personalized approach to your dog‚Äôs needs.

We are happy and grateful forever with her üòä.

Definitely recommended if you want your dog to learn from the best

Rose is fantastic! I contacted her after reading the positive reviews she had and I was greatly pleased with her work. First of all she is very reliable in terms of schedules. She always sends a confirmation message the day before the appointment and she always arrived on time. But the best part is the amazing technique she has for dog training. We took 3 lessons where our Simba (a 1.5 very energetic puppy) improved a lot. Her technique puts the respect for the dog at the center of everything and it‚Äôs really about teaching the owners how to understand and reward positive behaviors on dogs. We notice great differences right after the 1st session and by the end of the third, Simba was super responsive on all ‚Äúinside the house‚Äù commands and also on leash walking. She also gave us great recommendations on the type of treats to use to reward him, the best leash for teaching, etc.

I highly recommend Rose to any dog owner that loves the dog and wants to foster a better relationship with them.

Very disappointed.  Child really needs ABA help and took awhile for insurance to get approved. Sent PDF intake questionnaire 2 weeks ago and still can't get a return correspondence. Time to start all over again.

Follow up after reply from the business:
I see how you are trying to change the narrative. Google won't let me downgrade to a negative number comment. You speak of communication? After numerous messages and sending intake forms, I sent an email stating the clinic sent the report and I filled out the intake forms.  After waiting weeks and leaving messages, nothing. Now, a week after I leave a bad review, you finally reply? Horrible communication and follow up to messages. All it would have took is 20 seconds to say you were missing additional requirements.  I used to be a provider,  I know how it works.

The only one hurt by your neglect is my daughter's treatment.

I am extremely impressed with this company. My son has been kicked out of ABA clinics. I mention my story to the owners and they did not once make me feel like they couldn't handle my son. They wanted my son to start immediately. I love that they always keep me updated on my son‚Äôs day and show me what they‚Äôre working on. I also love that they schedule parent training meetings to show us how to deal with certain behaviors and make sure everyone is on the same page. This place is awesome. They have mention they are working on creating a homeschool program at their clinic for kiddos. My son‚Äôs moods have changed since I switch his ABA clinic. He still has behaviors. But I can see he is making progress and he has only been at the clinic for two months. I can tell he enjoys going everyday. I really appreciate Ruby Beach Behavioral Pediatrics taking my son in and treating him like their own. I highly recommend this place for anyone that has kiddos with special needs. They have great RBT‚Äôs and BCBA‚Äôs.

We couldn't be happier with the incredible progress our son has made at Ruby Beach. In just a few short months, we've seen huge improvements in his behaviors, eating habits, and social skills, and every week he continues to make even more strides. The team here is simply the best! The therapists (RBTs) are all so sweet, patient, and genuinely happy to be working with the kids, which really shows in their demeanor and in how excited our son is to see them every time we drop him off at Ruby Beach. We are always confident that he is having a good day when he is here!

The communication is outstanding‚Äîprofessional, detailed, and always helpful. The BCBAs and the rest of the team not only keep us updated with regular progress reports but also provide tips and guidance that have made it much easier to work with our son at home. We love the frequent updates and knowing how well he is doing each day.

Ruby Beach has been a true blessing for our family. We can't thank the staff enough for the amazing work they do and the love they show to our son, and for how much they have worked with our family! Highly, highly recommend this center to any family looking for a supportive, skilled, and caring team for their child!

The team at Ruby Beach has been fantastic with my daughter. The extreme care, professionalism and communication is beyond what I could have asked for. My daughter loves going here and seeing her friends while learning. If you are looking for a very caring organization for your child for therapy, this is the place you want to go. No one will take more care of your child. Thank you to everyone at Ruby Beach!!!
My son loves it here and has been making great progress. Everyone is friendly and very helpful.

Sofia is a true gem üíé I struggle to trust people with our dogs, but Sofia truly cares and wants what‚Äôs best for them.

Our frenchies, Anna and Charlie, have been going to her day school, boarded and trained with her, and done at home lessons (to include our more mature dog Cesar as well). They always run to the car all excited thinking they‚Äôre going to school!!

Ever since we started working with Sofia, we‚Äôve seen a tremendous positive change in our pups. Anna absolutely adored all the training with Sofia and truly became a well behaved, yet still wild in the best way, puppy because of her guidance and the effort Sofia put into training her. She mastered all the basic commands in no time and Sofia helped lay the foundation for fun trick training we could practice with her in the future.

Charlie, being deaf and with an unknown past, has  always been a challenge to us, but he has been making great progress with Sofia as well, and we feel confident that even though he requires a little bit of extra effort, he will get to where he needs to be thanks to Ruff Times.

Sofia takes such great care of our dogs while they‚Äôre with her, always sends updates, training progress, explanations, and a lot of cute videos and pictures. Her dogs ABBA and Gonzo are also super friendly and seem to be great assistants!

We sent our 9 month old shiba to Ruff Times for boarding and training for 3 weeks while we traveled and could not have had a better experience!

Although we missed our baby, Sofia was reassuring and sent almost daily pictures and videos so we could see how Susan was spending her day (training and safely playing with other dogs) and the new commands she was progressing on.

Shibas are notoriously hard to train, but Sofia worked with Susan and put a lot of time and effort into making sure she was getting through! Additionally, she sent thorough explanations of dog psychology, how to use the commands, and how to best work with Susan going forward.

My favorite part was that through her videos and messages, we could tell that Sofia really cared for our baby and she was getting the love that we couldn‚Äôt give her while we were away.

We‚Äôre happy to have Susan home and she is definitely still our playful puppy, but has been much better behaved since her stay at Ruff Times!

It‚Äôs so great to know that we can trust Ruff Times for boarding when we travel, and for support with training for Susan when we need it!

I can‚Äôt say enough great things about Sofia from Ruff Times Dog Training! She worked with my two German Shepherds while I was on vacation, and even though they were only with her for a short time, the results have been amazing.

Before training, I honestly believed my dogs just couldn‚Äôt be around other dogs without issues‚Äîbut Sofia completely changed that. She worked wonders with them! They are now so much more patient, especially on walks and when they‚Äôre near other dogs. I‚Äôve even started taking them to the dog park, something I never thought I‚Äôd be able to do without stress or worry.

Sofia clearly has a gift with animals and treated my dogs with the same love and care I would. I'm so grateful for the work she put in‚Äîshe truly gave me peace of mind and gave my dogs the confidence and structure they needed.

If you're considering training for your pups, I highly recommend Sofia. She's the real deal! üêæ

Sofia is an extremely talented trainer. You can get quick results and see your dog behavior improve Almost immediately after the first class. As an owner you always have to continue the training at home. I also experienced her onboarding services and you have the option to incorporate the training option at the same time and it was totally worth it. We came back to a more disciplined dog. They had a great time on the onboarding and she sent us a lot of pictures and videos with comments about the training she was applying. You really in good hands if you choose Ruff Times Dog Training to train your dog and for onboarding services. We still have a long road and we are excited we found Sofia to help us with it‚Ä¶

I had to travel to NY and Mila stayed 5 days with Sofia‚Ä¶ I am so happy how well she took care of her and trained her.  And when I came back she visited us at home and showed me how to continue with all the things Mila learned.
I super recommend Sofia and her training and boarding place.  ‚ù§Ô∏è

I was in a horrific car accident in 2018 and my dad was in a horrific tractor trailer accident in 2004 and Dr. Ruggiero got us both feeling better and back to normal. He is the best. He takes his time with his patients to really listen to their concerns and worries. He will spend as much time as he needs with a patient to put the concerns to rest. I was terrified after my wreak that my back and neck would be in constant pain forever and that I wouldn't feel any better. Dr. Ruggiero put those fears to rest explaining with the proper exercises and care that I would nearly pain free and only feel a few aches and pains occasionally or if I didn't take proper care of it. Because of him I'm virtually pain free. His staff is absolutely phenomenal as well.

I had an injury that for over a year orthopedic surgeons couldn‚Äôt figure out. One of my friends who is a bodybuilder recommended Dr Ruggiero so I went to see him.  He looked at the mri and x rays and knew within minutes exactly what was wrong with me.  It took many treatments and consistently going to ensure the muscles tightened and kept the bone in place. He fixed my injury that other doctors couldn‚Äôt figure out (many of them). I now drive over an hour to see him for routine maintenance. Excellent doctor.

For over 20 years I have been in chronic back and neck pain. The pain was caused by a horrible car accident, that left me with a neck fracture and multiple herniated discs. I started seeing Dr Nick 10 years ago and he fixed all of my problems from pain over multiple sessions for over a year. I felt like a new person again. After my choice of stopping treatment, the pain returned several years later, much worse than ever as I have continued to age. I started seeing Dr Nick again a few months ago, and with all his knowledge and advanced techniques, I went from not to being able to get out of bed, to feeling better than ever. I‚Äôve seen dozens of chiropractors around the country, and he is the only one I would ever recommend to anyone. If you are truly in pain, Dr Nick will fix you!!! I‚Äôm grateful for all he has done.

My family and I have been going to Dr. Nick for over 25 years. He‚Äôs treated my father with work related injuries,  my brother and I for gym injuries and literally performed a miracle on my grandfather who had to be carried in and walked out on his own after Nicks expert care and treatment!! I recently tweeked my back bad on a job and was agonizing over the weekend where I couldn‚Äôt get comfortable or sleep or escape the pain, if you know you know. It was miserable with a pain level exceeding 10!! I could barely  get out of bed let alone walk. Nick has the perfect trifecta consisting of knowledge, technique and strength whereas some chiropractors  just dont ‚Äúget it‚Äù, Nick delivers!! One AWESOME adjustment from top to bottom and the pain dropped down immediately to a 3!!! It was hard to believe what he can do in just one visit!! I cant tell you the relief you get when you know you can walk again and get a good nights sleep PAIN FREE!! A few more visits and Im back to work and the gym like nothing happened!! I thank God for Dr. Nick and his most professional, friendly and accommodating staff!! Love the new office too!! You have pain? Look no further!! Nick Ruggerro is the man with the plan!!!

I was rear ended in my car on December 8, 2018. Wound up with tears in my right shoulder and hip and problems with my neck and lower back. I was referred to Dr Ruggierio and all I can say is that he is truly amazing.
While it's true that the problems with my shoulder and hip will not go away without surgery, he has been treating all 4 areas and the pain intensity has gone down tremendously. He is a true professional and so
is his ENTIRE staff. He knows exactly which "buttons to push" on your body and how to push them. I know he treats the Florida Panthers, Miami Dolphins and many sports celebrities, among them Tiger Woods and If I could give him and his staff a "10",  I certainly would because they deserve it.

Our boy just graduated from Russell‚Äôs K-9 Academy and we couldn‚Äôt be happier with the results! Albert provided us with private, in-home training sessions that worked for our schedules. He is very knowledgeable and patient. We saw huge improvements in our dog after just a few sessions. We highly recommend Russell‚Äôs K-9 Academy to anyone looking for effective, professional, and personalized dog training!

Earlier this year we took a chance using Russell's K9 after finding a dog that was tied to a tree and left behind the year prior. Her name is Sunny, and unfortunately seems to have a background/history that was not in her favor which resulted in multiple behavior issues including agression towards men and control. We are glad we took that chance. Mr. Russell cares about these dogs at a deep level, and is up front and realistic. If you are looking for an easy fix, and not willing to work with your animal this is not the trainer for you and he will be direct and upfront about that. We took a dog that was nearly uncontrolable on a leash walking by people, to now walking our streets with no leash, and in full control with confidence. Saving her life was a mission of ours after finding her, and Russell's program has been a huge part of her progress. This is not a shock collar program, this training teaches your dog a solid foundation to respond to verbal commands / markers before even thinking about using the e collar. The e collar is a tool in the tool box rather than the only means of control, which is what we wanted instead of just punishment by collar.

Thank you for everything, and Merry Christmas!! - Brian / Cari.

Albert recently came to my home to work with my rescue dog, Daisy.  I moved to Margaritaville where many of my new neighbors have dogs.   I had a tough time meeting my new neighbors, because Daisy barked at their dogs, and they avoided me and Daisy.
I wanted her  to meet her new friends too, but after a few months, I called Albert.
After one 3 hour session,  she was not barking, but responding to his training.
Daisy is a work in progress, but if I remember what he taught me,  we are both enjoying our walks now.  I cannot stress how much knowledge he has in his 30 plus years of dog training.   My investment in helping Daisy was the best decision I have made.  We are both much happier and less stressed.

We adopted a medium size Chihuahua terrier mix two years ago and she became part of our family. She was very hard to train, ran out the front door at every opportunity, went to the bathroom inside regardless of our efforts and sometimes picked fights with our bigger dog. We hired Albert with Russell‚Äôs K9 for an intensive training in his home, he went above and beyond for us, and really cared about our dog! Our dog has now been home for two months or so and I am so happy to say that she retained the training that she received but also because our communication is much better, She is now queuing us when she needs to go outside and has not had an accident in the last month. She also walks amazingly!! Although we need to stay on her about bothering the big dog, she listens really well when we need her to calm down. We also took a roadtrip recently and she was able to be off leash and run free without us worrying about her running away. Our family is so thankful for the training we received with Russell‚Äòs K9! Thank you Albert.

We adopted a 45 pound hound dog mix from the county shelter.  She became extremely reactive and began resource protecting - although she is an utter sweetheart, she would bark aggressively at other dogs, children, bicycles - to the point we could no longer walk her in our neighborhood or drive with her in the car.  We were at our wit's end.  We tried one training center for a few months but because she was only there during the day, she was an angel with the trainers but would go back to her old tricks at home, and we were not receiving the proper training ourselves to make any training effective.  Thankfully we found Russell's K9.  She boarded with Al for 9 weeks - it was extremely hard to part with her for that amount of time, and to be consistent in our behavior when we visited for our training with her, after she'd been there a few weeks.  But I'm so grateful we stuck with it.  She's been home a few days and is definitely testing her limits - but we now know how to handle her so that she feels safe and does not react to external forces.  We can calmly walk her through our neighborhood, and with a simple "Nope" she restrains herself from her old behaviors.  I highly recommend Russell's K9 to anyone struggling with a reactive dog who is also dearly loved.  We can't thank you enough, Al!

I met Dr. Rossi when I was in my early 50s . I was working at a gym and he came once a week. I told him my sciatica had been out for a while and very painful. I said if you can adjust me and it goes away I am with you always. Problem solved.üòÄ
I left Florida for 3 years and I am back Dr. Russo was one of the first Dr. I called .He is the best , I have been a patient for 20 years I was in my 50s now I am in my 70s.
I highly recommend him .
üëçüòé

I have known Dr. Russo for 9 years and really enjoy working with him. He is the only chiropractor I know personally who has advanced degrees and post-graduate training in functional neurology and sports medicine, applying his knowledge and techniques across a wide variety of cases. What I like most about working with Dr. Russo is that he is a very friendly and approachable "straight-up" kind of guy, who will always give you an honest assessment of your condition and what he can do for you, even if that means referring you to another practitioner who he believes is better suited to treat your particular problem. His initial assessment is very thorough and usually includes x-rays or other medical tests that he needs in order to provide you with the best treatment plan for achieving the most optimal outcome. In my experience, Dr. Russo cares deeply about his patients and will take whatever measures are necessary to help his patients in attaining the highest level of medical improvement within that patient's physical limitations. I have been working with him recently after shattering my left kneecap. I wasn't improving until I began physical therapy with him. He designed an individualized program for me that, in 8 weeks, had my knee bending much further than it could on my first visit. I am a former administrative prosecutor for the Florida Department of Health and have seen many types of medical practitioners with varying levels of competence in practicing their profession. Dr. Russo is a rare gem, highly competent, and caring.

Dr. Russo has made a huge improvement in my wellbeing. I have lived with back issues for 10 years. I have had multiple epidural injections over the course of the last few years with no help insight. A friend of my Wife‚Äôs suggested Dr. Russo. I have never considered chiropractic care as I was afraid of something going wrong, but I was desperate. I started seeing Dr. Russo in January 2025 with a 10+ pain level, barely able to walk, and completely drained. In the last 6 weeks, my pain level has decreased weekly to a 0-1. Although my MRI‚Äôs show not much wrong with me, my body told me different. Dr. Russo listened to what I told him and not what X-rays and MRI‚Äôs said. I went from thinking the only way to get better was surgery, but now I have found an alternative. Dr. Russo has made a believer out of me in his straight forward, no nonsense care and I would highly recommend anyone that has back issues to give him a shot at helping before going under the knife. Thank you Dr. Russo for everything thing you have done for me and I look forward to our next visit.

I‚Äôve been under Chiropractic care for 30 years, primarily for maintaining posture and general wellbeing. More specifically, I‚Äôve been a professional and semi-professional drummer for 35 years and it takes a toll on the body. Dr. Russo is one of only a handful of doctors who understand their practice and craft far beyond their ‚Äútraining.‚Äù He thinks and has an intuition far outside what I have received from the common pale of Chiropractic care in this or any other city. He is deep, caring, and more than able in regard to his practice. He is all at once simple and boutique, depending upon what you need.
I was referred some years back by a trusted friend, and I would recommend him to anyone.

I am happy to have found Dr. Russo. I knew my body wasn‚Äôt feeling its best, but I didn‚Äôt realize how bad I truly felt. It has only been a month since I started working with him, and I feel better than I have in YEARS. One thing I appreciate about Dr. Russo is that he focuses on long term care versus acute treatment. This was not my experience with previous chiropractors. He was thorough in his evaluation to determine the root cause of my issues to create a care plan for me. He is knowledgeable, kind, and he listens. If you want to feel better he will support you in that journey.

Had a great time at Ruxton‚Äôs Ranch! The horses were very calm and friendly. Owners were nice and you can take pictures with the horses. Came here on a Sunday ride and it was a nice weather early in the morning. The horse I rode (forgot his name) was nice and he loves to eat! I recommend this place for anyone who wants to horseback ride. The horses are kept clean and well-mannered. Thank you for a great time! I will definitely come back.

We had such a wonderful experience at Ruxton‚Äôs Ranch! We visited to celebrate my daughter‚Äôs birthday, and it couldn‚Äôt have been more perfect. The owner was incredibly kind, patient, and thorough in explaining how to handle the horses, which made us feel comfortable and confident. Highly recommend‚Äîdefinitely a 10/10 experience! üòä
Such a nice experience, great trail loop, easy ride, the owners are very sweet and the horses are so relaxed

This was so amazing! Can‚Äôt say enough great things about this experience. The horses were calm and friendly. The trainer and owner, Lina, was so impressive she walked the whole was with us, we felt safe the whole ride. The horses love her! Will be coming back, highly recommend!

We had a great Sunday morning trail ride‚Äîpeaceful, relaxing, and perfect before the heat kicked in. The scenery was beautiful, and the horses were so well-behaved. It was a calm, enjoyable experience. My son‚Äôs already planning our next visit!

I've known Shane for a while and he is a great instructor. His knowledge of horses is outstanding . If you're interested in riding horses and learning about them very highly recommend SBT Horsemanship!

Shane is truly the best teacher I could have asked for. My experience with SBT horsemanship has been nothing but positive, and I am so grateful for the successes I have achieved through my time with SBT Horsemanship. Shane has shown me not only the immense progress I could achieve in a year, but also the courage and self-confidence I had all along.
Taking lessons with SBT Horsemanship will not only get you the best-of-the-best education in true Western horsemanship, but also a profound new sense of self. Some things are priceless, and Shane's lessons are just that.
SBT Horsemanship also provides camps for Spring, Summer, Winter, and some holidays. Having gone to one, I can say they are some of the most fun I have had and the best deal in the county!

Shane is an incredible instructor who has an undeniable gift for teaching. Patient with the kids and clear in his instruction, and he tailors his lessons to all levels. He has helped my daughter build immense confidence in herself, and in riding. Highly recommend him !

SBT Horsemanship stands out as one of the few dedicated western riding facilities in the area, offering a really enjoyable experience. Shane, the owner and head instructor, has created a remarkable haven for those passionate about western-style horseback riding. His passion for horses and western riding is evident from the moment you arrive. Shane has a talent for working with riders of various levels, creating a supportive and engaging learning environment.

The barn is very well maintained, with happy, well-cared-for horses. Shane's instruction goes beyond just riding techniques ‚Äì he helps riders develop a genuine connection with these magnificent animals as he teaches also about their psychology, how to properly care for them and understand them better. His knowledgeable approach, backed up by years of working with horses (both on the ranch and in sport), makes every lesson both educational and enjoyable. Shane's unique sense of humor definitely is an added value in here.

So, for anyone looking to learn authentic western horsemanship, this is a must-visit destination. Whether you're a beginner curious about western riding or an experienced rider seeking to refine your skills, SBT Horsemanship offers an exceptional equestrian experience.

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê Highly Recommended!

Shane has been teaching my daughter for sometime now and I must say he is literally the best horse trainer she has ever had. Her confidence and determination to succeed has sky rocketed with his level of commitment and training. He goes above and beyond and teaches her the importance of safety while in and off the saddle while having fun! Highly recommend!!

I had a great experience at SFR Physical Therapy. From the moment I walked in, the staff was welcoming, professional, and clearly knowledgeable. The therapists take the time to understand your condition and create a treatment plan that‚Äôs tailored to your needs.

The environment is clean, organized, and supportive, which makes recovery much less stressful. I really appreciated how they explained each exercise and its purpose, and they were always attentive to form and progress. Appointments run on time, and the front desk staff is friendly and efficient with scheduling and insurance paperwork.

Whether you‚Äôre recovering from surgery, injury, or just looking to improve mobility and strength, I highly recommend SFR Physical Therapy. They genuinely care about helping patients heal and get stronger.

I recently used SFR for therapy on my lower back. After my 8 sessions, I was better than new!!  It has been several weeks since my last session, and I have had no issues. I highly recommend SFR for any and all of your rehab or training needs. The staff is very professional and extraordinary.  If I could go every week I would.  And I will speak with them on their training services soon as well.

I can‚Äôt say enough good things about this physical therapy team. From the moment I walked in, I felt welcomed and supported after a week of foot surgery. The entire staff is professional, kind, and genuinely invested in their patients‚Äô success. I highly recommend them to anyone looking for outstanding care.

I've been going to SFR for about 3 weeks for a lower back injury, and I've already seen great improvement. The physical therapists David, Nikko, and Gabriela are knowledgeable, attentive, and really make you feel taken care of. The front desk staff is always polite and helpful, and the whole office has a friendly, welcoming vibe. The environment is clean and comfortable. Highly recommend SFR to anyone needing physical therapy!

I was a little nervous to come in for my first appointment. But when I got here, the receptionist was so welcoming and caring. Once I got to the back, the therapists made me feel cared for. The massages are a little painful, but are worth it at the end of the day. They will get you back to 100% in no time. I have been coming here for years now and they have helped with all my injuries. They do something different in every session to get you back to normal. I am always excited to come back. When I hurt my tricep, I started feeling better in just two sessions. From the workout to the deep tissue massages, I was able to feel normal again. I recommend for you to come try out South Florida Rehab and Training Center. I believe it is the best physical therapy place in South Miami.

provider_name: SHARE of Florida Therapy and Wellness
review_text: I am so grateful for this wonderful place. The environment is comfortable. The admin staff is lovely and easy to work with. They are inclusive and accepting.  My therapist, Theresa, has been an incredible support. My 12 year old is also in therapy with Danielle and she has been a lifeline during difficult times. I could not recommend them enough for any mental health needs. üíô

provider_name: SHARE of Florida Therapy and Wellness
review_text:
Share of Florida has been a breath of fresh air. All of the staff here is very welcoming and friendly.

They truly care at this place...and it's not just talk therapy where you keep going in circles. They actually give you tools and personalized homework designed to help you work through things and grow, so you can start healing and experiencing more of the good in your day to day life. So just be prepared to put the work in! It's worth it.

I started weekly sessions a couple of months ago with my therapist, Theresa Guy. She is a gem - a wonderful, compassionate person who makes me feel seen. I never thought I would actually look forward to therapy but I'm always excited to talk to her...because in every session she helps me discover something new about myself, my thinking patterns, and practical things I can do to heal my relationship with myself and manage my disorder.

I'm happy to say that in a relatively short amount of time working with her, I've been making significant progress. It's been such a relief to find this place, connect with my therapist, and FINALLY get the help I need after decades of suffering and white knuckling life with my disorder. Thank you Theresa and Share. ‚ù§Ô∏è

provider_name: SHARE of Florida Therapy and Wellness
review_text:
Going to share has changed my life. My therapist Theresa has not only changed my life, but actually saved it. I have never found a therapist that I connect with and she is definitely! Theresa is yet stern and will call me out on anything she sees that she needs to. She‚Äôs spiritual, intelligent and kind. Teresa is definitely the last Therapist I will ever have

Theresa,
Thank you for your kindness and leadership you have provided for me! You truly make a difference.

provider_name: SHARE of Florida Therapy and Wellness
review_text: I‚Äôve been going to SHARE Therapy for a while now and Emily Barbosa is the BEST therapist. She is so wonderful and she‚Äôs my favorite therapist I‚Äôve had. She‚Äôs excellent at talking through issues regarding personal growth and relationships. Can‚Äôt recommend her enough!

provider_name: SHARE of Florida Therapy and Wellness
review_text: i've been to numerous therapists throughout the years and yma is by far the best therapist i've had! she's patient, understanding, and supportive and has helped me navigate being neurodivergent. i sought therapy for agoraphobia, which kept me confined to my home. thanks to yma's support, i've been able to go from homebound to going on trips with no problems! her EMDR sessions have also helped me process events that previously weighed me down. my anxiety is no longer a major part of my life, and i couldn't have done it without yma!!

provider_name: SHP Rehab & Wellness Center - Dr. R. Kevin O'Brien DC
review_text: The therapist are very professional and sweet. I have had PT for 6 weeks, after surgery, and my range of motion has gained. I am so happy that the insurance company sent me to SHP.

I am absolutely thrilled to share my exceptional experience with my daughter and her improvement since starting at SLP 7 months ago. From the moment we walked in, the warm and inviting atmosphere made us feel comfortable and confident that we had chosen the right place for our daughter's speech development needs.

The staff at SLP are true professionals, displaying a remarkable level of expertise and dedication. Pilar is exceptional. The speech therapists are not only highly qualified but also genuinely caring and patient, creating an environment where children can thrive. My daughter immediately felt at ease under their guidance.

What sets SLP apart is their personalized approach. The therapists took the time to understand her unique needs and designed a tailored program to address her specific challenges. The progress we have witnessed in her speech and communication skills is truly remarkable, and we owe it all to the dedication and expertise of the therapists.

The communication between the therapists and parents is exceptional. We are always kept well-informed about my daughters progress, and the therapists are readily available to address any questions or concerns we may have. This level of transparency and collaboration has been invaluable to us as parents.

The facilities are equipped with all the necessary resources, making each therapy session engaging and effective.

In addition to the outstanding professional services, the administrative staff at SLP are courteous and efficient, Daniela is wonderful. Scheduling appointments, billing, and administrative processes are handled seamlessly, allowing us to focus on what truly matters ‚Äì our daughter's progress.

I wholeheartedly recommend this location to any parent seeking high-quality speech therapy services for their child. The passion, expertise, and personalized care provided by the entire team have made a significant impact on our daughters life, and we are immensely grateful for the positive changes we've seen. Thank you, SLP, for your continuous commitment to helping our child reach her full potential!

I want to start this review with the main point that all the therapists my son had, have done a excellent job. They are very flexible to fit one schedule. My son has improved immensly and quickly. He only did speech therapy for about three months and what an incredible outcome in such a short period of time. Thank you SLP Miami Therapy for your services and your awesome staff.

Our son was a non verbal autistic 4 year old. We started to believe that maybe he may not be able to speak. We left our country and brought him to Maria at SLP for consultation. We started treatment 1 month before he turned 5 years. Within the first 2 weeks he started talking and he hasn‚Äôt stopped learning to say new words every day. Every month we travel for 1 week and bring him to SLP because we believe in the work they do and the results speak for itself. Thank you so much Maria and the entire SLP staff for making the impossible Possible!!! Keep helping other children as you have helped our son. Rachael and Simon (Mom & Dad)

Words cannot truly express how content I am with this facility and its staff members. In the past, my child has attended other facilities with little to no improvement with the goals and milestones a child her age should have achieved. Here at SLP Miami Therapy Inc

, my daughter has not only been able to expand her vocabulary exceedingly, but she is also able to focus for longer periods during her sessions with her therapist; as well as the ability to engage with family members and others outside her sessions. My daughter is so excited to attend her sessions at SLP Miami Therapy

Inc, I, as her father, have never seen my child so eager about learning. SLP Miami Therapy

Inc, has such a great staff, devoted to working with families in need of support. Director Maria De Pilar truly has a team of professional, compassionate, and supportive members. My highest recommendation for anyone seeking speech therapy/ occupational therapy for their little ones.

I highly recommend SLP Miami Therapy. My son started in September 2020 and he has transformed into such a different kid. He is making eye contact and socializing now. He is trying to talk and imitating words. He also has low muscle tone and does occupational therapy and in just 2 months he has improved so much. The therapists always make it a point to tell you how the session went and give ideas of what could be helpful as they go through their journey. The therapists are all so nice, welcoming, attentive, and genuinely care about the kids. I am beyond happy to have found SLP Miami Therapy Inc.

When I thought i was going to Beach house I thought it was an actual beach house. Most of the food was terrible but overall it was an enjoyable experience staff were nice and the activities were fun! 8.59/10

Food was decent school was ok. But had a lot of of down time doing nothing except watching old kiddie movies. After 8 days I ran away with this girl we had a good time then all voulisa county police where looking for us took them 5 hours. Only found us because at that point the bugs where so bad we just went on the main road and waited. 0/10 would not recommend unless you run away with some cut girl then it would be 10/10 over if I had the same experience I would do it again learned nothing but had fun the last night. Will never go back I am permanently banned. Ha ha
Great place to get away from home. Personally I had only 2 family therapy sessions in my MONTH long stay. It has nasty food. 9/10 would come again.

Landed with severe anxiety and panic attacks after coming here, would not recommend to anyone. Kids are oftentime bullies and staff care more about the parents than the child's wellbeing. 'Oh your being abused at home? Well maybe do your chores-'
I'm impressed with SMA and how much thought they have put in the caring of their clients.
SOS has been an amazing resource for my three year old!

This place is great for your spirit and your heart!!!  It's warm and inviting.  The horses are super cute, along with providing an enlightning and educating experience.  Really it's just an all and all, one of a kind adventure. Thank you  Sue!!!!

We booked the mini horse experience and couldn‚Äôt have been happier!   Susan was great, you can really tell the level of care and love she gives the horses with how calm and obedient they are.   The looks and comments we got taking the minis for a walk down the trail were priceless.   We were big fans of Rocky the puppy too, haha.

I had a wonderful experience at Soul Haven Ranch on Valentine‚Äôs Day! We got to groom and walk miniature horses, which was so fun! Susan is so kind and helpful, and you can definitely see her passion for animals. I am not so experienced with horses, but am a huge animal lover. Susan was so patient and was there to help me every step of the way. I‚Äôm so glad we stumbled upon this hidden gem, and we are looking forward to staying in the guest house soon!

I had my wedding this past Saturday. I am so glad that my husband and I had Soul Haven Ranch as part of our exit from our church. They were punctual and the horse and carriage looked superb. This was truly a highlight for my wedding. Working with Susan was easy! and she did go above and beyond to make our ride through town so special.

We can‚Äôt wait to go back! If you are looking for a peaceful and unique setting (with all the miniature therapy horses) this is it. This country setting is close to the great restaurants of historic downtown Winter Garden and the West Orange Trail which is ideal for biking, walking and running. Susan is a great host and is very personable.  She has a lovely home inside and out with several places where you can sit outside and enjoy the natural beauty surrounding you while watching her horses graze.

provider_name: SOUTH FLORIDA COUNSELING AND ASSESSMENT - Fort Lauderdale
review_text:
Dr. T is an exceptional therapist. The time my former business partner and I spent with him was invaluable. I gained deeper self-awareness and acquired new tools to strengthen my support system, helping me improve and become a better version of myself.

Although our business partnership ultimately ended, the work we did with Dr. T has better equipped me for future relationships and challenges. I believe therapy is for anyone committed to personal growth.

I would highly recommend Dr. T and will not hesitate to use his services again, both for future business partnerships and in my personal life.

provider_name: SOUTH FLORIDA COUNSELING AND ASSESSMENT - Fort Lauderdale
review_text: Since the first time I spoke with Dr. Taborga I felt very comfortable and knew that that eas the right place for us. He was very patient answering all my questions.  Della is so sweet and knowledgeable, my daughter is very happy to have her as her counselor. The installation is wonderful!

provider_name: SOUTH FLORIDA COUNSELING AND ASSESSMENT - Fort Lauderdale
review_text: I have been meeting with Alex Iribar for over a year now. When Alex transferred to this practice 4 months ago, I spoke with Dr. Taborga and felt Dr. Taborga truly cares for all of the practice‚Äôs clients. Alex is a great counselor and I highly recommend him and this practice to anyone in need of mental health services.

provider_name: SOUTH FLORIDA COUNSELING AND ASSESSMENT - Fort Lauderdale
review_text: Dr. Richard has an innate ability to make you feel safe and understood. His guidance has been instrumental in my healing process.

provider_name: SOUTH FLORIDA COUNSELING AND ASSESSMENT - Fort Lauderdale
review_text: I had a wonderful experience at this counseling center. Dr. Taborga helped me through one of the toughest seasons in my life with care and compassion.

I cannot speak for the therapists, but as for the front desk staff and office manager, they have been extremely unorganized and unhelpful. My child‚Äôs doctor‚Äôs office faxed all the requested documentation in February 2025. They followed up with another fax in March 2025 to confirm whether my child had received services and to ask if anything additional was needed. They received no response.

In September 2025, I contacted the office to confirm my child‚Äôs status on the waitlist. I was informed by both Kaitlyn and Ayana that the required documents were ‚Äúnever received,‚Äù and therefore my child was never added to the waitlist. However, I was later told that while the referral was received, the diagnostic report was not. If that was the case, why did the office never reach out or respond to the March fax requesting clarification?

I reconfirmed with my child‚Äôs doctor‚Äôs office, and they verified that both the referral and the diagnostic report were faxed in February 2025.
When I addressed this with Ayana, her response was simply, ‚ÄúI‚Äôm so sorry, we never got it.‚Äù She also stated that the office manager is the only person with access to the faxes. This makes it even more concerning that no follow-up ever occurred.

As a result of this oversight, my son has now lost seven months waiting for services on what is already a year-long waitlist‚Äîonly to find out he was never placed on it at all.

Due to these reasons, I have decided not to continue with this provider and will be seeking services elsewhere.

Don't go here. Save your money, time & effort. This business shouldn't be allowed to operate.
I brought my toddler here due to him having severe feeding difficulties; he was refusing most solids. Speak Easy's website misleadingly says it has a feeding therapy program, but it is really not feeding therapy at all. Megan is no help with feeding and cares only about profit rather than helping your child progress. With my son being behind physically as well, she suggested "co-treating" him in a half hour session for both physical & feeding therapy. That sounds great in theory, but the reality is that she wanted to be able to bill us for both in one half hour session rather than two separate sessions. "Co-treating" consisted of myself, son, her and the physical therapist sitting around BS-ing, and with her saying, "We're not going to get to the food today" for no apparent reason. After several sessions of doing absolutely nothing with food (and really nothing in general besides sitting around talking), when I voiced my desire to split sessions into separate physical and feeding therapy, she tried to argue that that would be "too much" for my son. She also told me I need to bring my own high chair. What kind of feeding therapy makes you bring your own high chair? That is not possible considering I come to appointments alone carrying my son (who was not yet walking at the time) and two bags already.
I also found out after I stopped wasting my time going that I was taken before others who had been on a waitlist for longer due to the fact that my insurance paid her practice more than the insurances of the others who were still waiting.
The hardest thing about addressing your child's delays and doing what's best for them is navigating through BS practices like this place and therapists/owners like Megan who profit off of wasting your time and not actually furthering your child's development. Do yourself and your child a favor and take your business elsewhere, especially if feeding therapy is needed, as this place should not be allowed to say that they offer that.

Speak Easy -

What can I say? The main thing I noticed is the amount of care that they give. There is a genuine interest to help kids do better. Service is OUTSTANDING and yet relaxed.

There is a huge amount of love that goes into their services.
THANK YOU GUYS!!!!!!

My daughter‚Äôs been attending this therapy center for about a year and this review has been a long time coming. My daughter‚Äôs favorite therapy is with Mr. Dan, She looks forward to therapy and she responds to him in such an amazing way. The office staff is delightful, especially Casey coordinate schedules. She has always been so Patient and helpful coordinating the various schedule changes I throw her Way. I cannot recommend Speak Easy enough!

After 3 months or more on a waiting list, many follow up calls, and multiple mistakes made by the staff who schedules and verifies benefits‚Ä¶ my son had an evaluation on 01/09/25.
I requested in person, by phone, and via email the report of findings of such. I was told  the therapist had up to seven days to complete the medical note. As of today I have not received the medical note, the findings, recommendations. No follow up contact has been provided.
The office space were OT evaluation and therapies take place is very small, dirty and hot. Inside is a small table for children (suitable for toddler size only). OT office needed vacuumed, sanitation and  her desk was VERY messy. I wasn‚Äôt impressed with her higiene. Super concerning since we were seeking ‚Äúfood based therapies‚Äù
Per therapist, the initial evaluation was only for medical insurance purpose. She offered no feedback, did not address  my questions or her findings. When I asked how often she will recommend therapies she replied by simply asking me what type of medical insurance we had. In other words recommendations and diagnosis  will depend on the insurance policy?! I am very dissatisfied with the lack of professionalism and level of care offered by this place. All they seem to care is about billing insurance and generating numbers. We wasted  $70 copay + extra payment fee charged for paying with a card plus our time, toll fees, etc.  Also, a ridiculous amount of questions and paperwork were answered before appointment ONLY to have to answer more questionnaires provided during the evaluation.

WE LOVE THIS PLACE!!!!!!!!!!!!!
I am beyond thrilled with the experience we've had at Spot for Kids Inc. The progress my son has made has been nothing short of remarkable, and it's all thanks to the incredible team here. From day one, the staff has been exceptional, professional, caring, and dedicated to helping my son achieve his goals. Their expertise and encouragement have truly made a difference in his development.
I am so grateful for the personalized attention and innovative strategies they use to make each session engaging and effective. The improvement in my son's communication skills has been astounding, and it‚Äôs clear that this progress is a direct result of the passionate and skilled therapist!
Thank you to everyone on the team for your unwavering support and commitment. Your hard work and dedication have brought about amazing results, and we couldn‚Äôt be happier. Keep up the fantastic work!

I highly recommend this center. The staff work fast to get you ready to start and the specialist are all great. My daughter goes for Speech and OT almost everyday of the week. I will say she LOVES going, we call it play to make it more fun for her. She is always requesting to go ‚Äúplay‚Äù. I have also seen improvement in my daughter speech and self-regulation. If I can give 10stars- I would!

Spot for kids is the best of the best! My son has been working with Claudia for a long time and I couldn‚Äôt be happier with his progress. She is so kind and patient with my son and he loves coming to see her and all the staff. I love how they work with parents to keep us involved in each step of their progress. I cannot express how truly grateful I am to Ms Claudia, Ms Perla and Ms Maria for all the help they have given our family, I wouldn‚Äôt want to take my son anywhere else!

My son has been going to Spot for Kids since they opened early this year and has made massive strides with his development. They work diligently to make sure the kids can succeed and my son loves coming to therapy. Claudia, Perla and Maria and the whole staff always greet him with a smile and go above and beyond to ensure our whole family is involved in my son‚Äôs progress. They treat us all with the most loving and genuine care every step of the way. I highly recommend them if you‚Äôre looking for therapy for your kids‚Ä¶ you‚Äôll be so happy you did.

I recently had the pleasure of taking my child to Spot for Kids for occupation and speech therapy, and I must say, I am absolutely blown away by the experience. From the moment we walked in, we were greeted with warmth and kindness by the staff, instantly putting my child at ease.

The facility itself is bright, colorful, and inviting, creating a fun and engaging environment for children. The therapy rooms are well-equipped with a wide range of toys, games, and tools that are not only entertaining but also designed to aid in the development of various skills.

The therapists at Spot for Kids are truly exceptional. They are highly skilled, knowledgeable, and passionate about what they do. They took the time to thoroughly assess my child's needs and created a personalized therapy plan that targeted their specific areas of concern.

What impressed me the most was the level of creativity and innovation that the therapists brought to each session. They seamlessly integrated play and fun into the therapy activities, making it enjoyable for my child while still achieving the desired outcomes. It was amazing to see how my child's confidence and abilities grew with each session.

The communication and collaboration between the therapists and parents are outstanding. They provided regular updates on my child's progress and offered valuable insights and strategies that we could implement at home to further support their development.

which I found incredibly helpful and informative.

Overall, I cannot recommend Spot for Kids enough. The dedication, expertise, and genuine care that they provide are truly exceptional. My child has made significant progress in their occupation and speech skills, and I am grateful to the entire team at Spot for Kids for their incredible work.
Amazing place with caring staff!! My son's speech therapist has made such a difference in our lives at home. Anyone who needs their services will be in the best hands.

SPOT Therapy Associates are nothing but the best! It‚Äôs my kids second home. My kids love coming here and seeing everyone! My children have been attending therapy here for years and have been making amazing gains. You‚Äôll get nothing but the best here! From the amazing owner to the skilled office staff and extraordinary therapist. It‚Äôs nothing but amazing! I have never once felt left out or unaware of what was happening in the therapy sessions. The therapist are amazing and love the kids like they are their own. They take pride in knowing your child and becoming apart of their lives. They are very knowledgeable and give amazing advice and guidance. I personally couldn‚Äôt have done the special needs parent journey without them! We owe everything to Jen and her staff!

Two of my children have been attending SPOT for years, and I recommend them to anyone seeking therapy services for their children. The entire staff is incredibly knowledgeable, and they always go above and beyond to support my kids.

My son is 6 and he is autistic, he started attending SPOT for OT and speech
therapy when he was 3.  He was nonverbal and
Apraxia of speech was what his pediatrician mentioned at some point. Let me start off by saying my son would not be where he is at if it wasn‚Äôt for all the
therapists and staff that have worked with him at SPOT!  I have always said it they are our Earth Angels! Every single person, from the therapists (Shannon, Stephanie, Samantha, Cassidy) to name a few, the receptionist when assisting with insurance nightmares, even the doggies at Spot, I mean EVERYONE at SPOT
has had a positive impact on my son‚Äôs progress.  He was able to attend VPK just a year into therapy and is now thriving in school!
I was heart broken not knowing if he would be able to experience school with his speech delay and behaviors.  SPOT changed my son‚Äôs life and mine as well, they
gave me so much hope when I was broken with his diagnosis, I was lost and didn‚Äôt know how to help him.  My son is attending school and any
concerns I have the therapists have always been there to help me and give me suggestions.  If there is one place I would highly recommend for therapy it‚Äôs SPOT Therapies Associates, they are loving and caring people, they love my son and it shows, he is
one happy boy when he knows we are going to SPOT.  Thank you SPOT from the bottom of our hearts and keep changing lives!

Amazing therapy center and staff! Everyone is very knowledgeable and friendly. The therapists truly care about each child and it shows. My daughter has been coming to Spot for about one year and it has completely changed her life! I would absolutely recommend Spot therapy to anyone who is considering getting any extra assistance for their child‚Äôs needs. Very good experience!
My son has been coming here for Speech for a little over 6 months. The improvement in not just speech but sentences and task orientation has been tremendous. Plus he LOVES when it‚Äôs speech day.

I take my daughter to this location and love the therapists here. It‚Äôs well organized and they try their best to work with us to ensure my daughters best development. It‚Äôs been amazing to see the progress she has made while coming here! I would definitely recommend them!
I‚Äôm very grateful we found this place. My daughters specialists are amazing!
Be prepared to get a big bill at a later date from this company. Very questionable business practice. Spoke with Melissa in billing, regarding a new patient fee from over a year ago.

I do not recommend it. Very unprofessional. A relative was given an appointment on Monday morning, but on Sunday he started getting a severe case of the flu and had no way to cancel it. A relative called first thing Monday morning to say he couldn't make it, and all the secretary said was that he had to pay $100 for not canceling the appointment. No empathy, and I think they should make an exception when appointments are scheduled for Monday mornings and eliminate that high and unfair charge, since there's no one to call to cancel on Saturday or Sunday.
Mrs. Morgan is an absolute blessing for human kindness. She has a beautiful heart and soul. I am grateful we have her as a doctor.

The Dr is great! The only issue I have is when I have don‚Äôt have another visit for 2 months my refill has never been sent in. Just takes time to call and go thru the hoops if I forget before I run out.

visited this office seeking treatment for adult ADHD. While the staff were polite, I found the process frustrating and slow. I felt that my concerns about focus, motivation, and daily functioning were not addressed in a way that aligned with my needs. Additionally, I was advised to consider treatment options that I am not comfortable with, which added to my frustration. I hope the office can improve communication and flexibility for adult ADHD patients seeking evidence based care

Dr. Wilcocks is a delightful, warm, and compassionate therapist who is truly dedicated to helping others. I've had the privilege of witnessing her clinical skills throughout graduate training and continued consultations as a fellow practicing psychologist. She is my go-to, trusted colleague for referring pediatric clients (particularly children with diabetes) in need of therapy and evaluation, and is also known for her work with children and teens struggling with anxiety and depression. Her clients get well-rounded support thanks to her collaboration with their medical providers and incorporation of family therapy/support as needed.

If you are seeking a psychologist who is not only knowledgeable but also caring, empathetic, and dedicated to your growth and healing, Dr. Wilcocks is the perfect choice. I wholeheartedly recommend her to anyone in need of psychological support.

This school and staff is what my dreams are made of . An inclusive place that presumes competency. Believes in my child , empowers and supports them in their challenges. They dont see deficits they see abilities and opportunities to support my child to learn, make friends, socialize and be their authentic self! I couldnt ask for more.
Great company! The owners are special needs parents so it makes us feel at ease and that our kiddo is in the right hands!
Sacred ABA is awesome, really recommend them to anyone looking for a place for their children.  A+++

It‚Äôs the right place to have your kids, they really take care of them as if they were their own kids and loved what they do!

Congratulations!!!

The owners are extremely compassionate and are special needs parents. They are opening this company for the right reasons - to help families, while other ABA providers in this area are "big box" companies just looking to make a lot of money. The Clinical Director BCBA is amazing and very talented. You will not regret working with Sacred ABA - highly recommend.

provider_name: Sacred Space Therapy / Grounded Ventures LLC
review_text: Sandra is first of all professional. She has helped my bedridden mother so much so that I was able to get my mom into a pool!!! I‚Äôm so happy and excited about the future! Thank you Sandraüíú

provider_name: Sacred Space Therapy / Grounded Ventures LLC
review_text: Sandra, the owner, is the heart and soul of this beautiful venture. I have known and worked with her for over 2 years, now. Post-pregnancy, I developed some back issues and recurrent muscle spasms that I ignored for a while. I had tried other massage places in the area (Massage Envy, Hand & Stone) without much success until my mother referred me to Sacred Space. Sandra has helped me from a couple tough spots, even in just one day and somehow always knows the right amount of pressure and always finds the problem. In addition to being honest, humble professional and extremely knowledgeable, her compassion and holistic approach to the healing process is unique and meaningful. She is a love, a constant and a peaceful energy in our lives, and we are so grateful for her.

provider_name: Sacred Space Therapy / Grounded Ventures LLC
review_text: I had a great experience with Sandra! She was very attentive and set up a beautiful environment, paying attention to all the details. From the aromatherapy, the lighting, the weighted pillows, the heat applications‚Ä¶ amazing!. I felt very comforted and it was a soothing experience. The massage I had with her really helped my muscles soreness. I highly recommend !!

provider_name: Sacred Space Therapy / Grounded Ventures LLC
review_text: A client of mine referred me to Sandra and what a gift that referral was. I have been a repeat customer since day 1. Sandra is hands down (pun intended) the warmest, most skillful and intuitive massage therapist I've gotten to work with. The additional knowledge she incorporates from her work as a physical therapist is invaluable. She goes above and beyond with the use of crystals, essential oils and tuning forks - if that's your thing; she really tailors the experience to your needs. 10/10 recommend.

provider_name: Sacred Space Therapy / Grounded Ventures LLC
review_text: Sandra is a natural healer/teacher and her wide range of experiences and modalities creates the most unique and beneficial session. She is very compassionate and intuitive which always makes me feel so safe and cared for. Her ability to treat you hands on and then provide practices for you to do at home is also very helpful with carryover of benefits. I feel so lucky any time I can have a session with Sandra wether it‚Äôs for a therapeutic massage, an inspiring yoga class or a PT session to help me feel stronger and more pain free she‚Äôs always the BEST!!!!

Our family is beyond grateful for the incredible impact Yaisy had on our son‚Äôs progress. She was not just a therapist but a true advocate, going above and beyond to help him grow and succeed. Her dedication, patience, and compassion made a lasting difference in our lives.

What sets Yaisy apart is her ability to connect, motivate, and tailor interventions that truly work. Her passion for the field is inspiring, it‚Äôs even part of what motivated me to pursue a career as a BCBA myself!

We cannot thank her enough for all she has done. If you are looking for someone who genuinely cares and is exceptional at what they do, we highly recommend Yaisy! It has been over two years since my family has relocated and our son still remembers Yaisy and talks about her as if we never left. We will forever hold a special place for her in our hearts!!! My sons first BCBA üíô

Yaisy is an amazing therapist. I highly recommend her and her practice. She is very knowledgeable, dedicated, and personable. She‚Äôs truly passionate about helping individuals in the spectrum as well as their families improve their quality of live. She worked with our son when he was younger, and he made incredible gains. We are forever thankful to her for everything she did for our son and for all of us as a family. AMAZING!

Yasi C-Sade is an excellent Behavior Analysts who worked with my son in the spectrum. He made significant positive changes during her behavioral intervention with Yasi. I highly recommend her services if you want your love one improve the social skills and others behaviors that might be modified.
She always was on time . She helped my self as well to deal appropriately with my son.

We absolutely love Sade Behavior Therapy. Every single one of the therapists go above and beyond to help the child they are working with. We never had a problem getting an appointment time that worked for us. I could not recommend better people to work with your child,  and you, to help make life a little more easier!
Yaisy is a phenomenal therapist. She takes the time to know and understand the needs of every client to assure they receive the therapy they deserve. Yaisy puts her heart and soul into her job.

First, I discovered the many benefits of talk therapy in my early 30s.  I have been blessed with great therapists, thus great results.   After suffering two moderate-severe TBIs in 14 months, and losing my ability to speak, my courtroom days were done‚Ä¶or so I thought.

After four plus years of slow but steady progress in adapting to my new reality, I wanted to find a great PhD therapist in our area.  A family member found Sage, called the office, explained everything, and asked which therapist would be the best fit.   Dr. Nick Comeau was the recommendation.  I was even allowed to have a ten minute conversation on the phone with Dr. Nick, before scheduling my first session, just to make sure we were a good fit.  This is an important difference between Sage and others, and really helps to establish the best possible relationship.

He has been more active and responsive than anyone I‚Äôve seen before.  All I can honestly say is that he cares about his patients, he cares about our wellbeing and wants nothing more than to see us succeed.  At Sage, honesty, openness, and empathy are the norm, which is refreshing considering the way the world seems to be changing.

I‚Äôm a 54yo, retired/disabled attorney who benefits immensely from working with Dr. Comeau.  I would highly recommend Sage to anyone who genuinely wants to help themselves‚Ä¶they will facilitate your journey.

Thank you so much, Dr. Nick; it‚Äôs working!

Jenn and her staff are amazing! The atmosphere and office is very inviting and relaxing. I highly recommend for any needs you may have as they have a wide range of therapists to meet you where your at.

I had the pleasure working alongside Hannah in the past - Hannah is a great therapist. She is kind, compassionate, and dedicated to helping her clients reach their goals. Anyone would be lucky to have her!

Dr. Comeau is a fantastic therapist.  I've had the pleasure of working with him in the past, and his dedication to his work and his clients is unmatched.  If you choose him as your therapist, you'll be in great hands

I recently had the pleasure of visiting sage wellness, and I must say, it was an incredibly positive experience. From the moment I stepped in, I was greeted warmly by the receptionist, creating a welcoming atmosphere right from the start. I highly recommend this office to anyone seeking compassionate mental health care. Dr. Jen and her team have made a significant difference in my life, and I'm grateful for the positive impact they've had on my mental health journey.

The trainers use positive reinforcement and yummy snacks. I have used this group for 35 years to train my puppies, for agility, and taken my dogs into the obedience competitions and won. Working with S.O.S. my dogs and I have a never ending bond. My dogs are anxious to please after training. I am currently training my newest pup to become a Therapy dog and give back to my community.  Thank you to S.O.S.

After feeling hopeless and exhausted with training as a first time puppy parent, S.O.S. was recommended to me. I decided to enroll my 7-month-old Cavapoo, and what I learned has truly changed my relationship with my dog for the better. The training gave me tools I can use for the rest of his life, and I now feel empowered and confident as a dog owner. My puppy has learned so much, and I‚Äôm grateful to Brenda at S.O.S. for helping us grow together.

I have had a LONG successful history with Michael & Brenda Saling, owners and trainers of Salings Obedience school.  I first met Brenda way back in 1992 where we began training with Travis McGee as a puppy, next was McGee‚Äôs pal Meyer who also began obedience trading with Brenda as a puppy.  Meyer also became a first place confirmation winner but his claim to fame was being a weekly therapy dog at Shriners Children‚Äôs hospital for 11 years.  Sadly all three are gone now; Travis, Meyer & Shriners.  But the third puppy Brenda trained was Spencer & his role in my life now is my constant companion & best Buddy ever!  The love and devotion they have for ALL dogs in helping them become your best Buddy can‚Äôt be compared.  They offer classes and individual training sessions, give them a call you will NOT be disappointed.

Brenda and Mike are so amazing! They were so patient and kind with my dog Jack, and really helped us both feel more confident. Before training, Jack had trouble listening and would pull on the leash a lot. After just a few sessions, we saw a big improvement.

Over the years, I have heard nothing but Excellent School for dogs. What can I say about Brenda and Saling Obedience School? Professional school for my silly boys. I have been going to Saling since my boys were 8 weeks old. To this day we are still training for the Good Canine Certification. Mind you I have 2 German Shepherd boys. Brenda has done a wonderful job in training them and they LOVE HER! She even helps with other questions you may have about your pet. I even recommended her to the breeder for new fur babies. Brenda is the BEST IN TOWN and you will not regret your decision.
Thank you Brenda for everything!

We would like to extend our deepest gratitude to Eric Kane, the Sales Director for Salterra at Pinellas Park, for the exceptional support and guidance he provided during one of the most emotional and difficult times for our family.

From the very first meeting, Eric showed compassion, professionalism, and a genuine understanding of our situation. Finding the right assisted living option for our loved one was overwhelming, but Eric made the process not only manageable but comforting. He took the time to listen to our concerns, answered every question (no matter how small), and never once made us feel rushed or pressured.

What truly stood out was how personally invested Eric was in making sure our loved one would feel safe, respected, and at home. He coordinated tours, helped us navigate the paperwork, and stayed in constant communication. It didn‚Äôt feel like working with a salesperson; it felt like working with a trusted advisor and advocate.

Thanks to Eric, we found a community for our mother and our entire family has peace of mind. It‚Äôs rare to encounter someone who combines heart, knowledge, and professionalism so seamlessly. We are forever grateful.

‚Äî We cannot thank you enough for everything you did.

Richard Bon

Eric, at Volante of Pinellas Park took the time to give us a phenomenal tour of the building. While we were walking, he personally introduced us to many of the staff, including housekeepers, maintenance, caregivers, nurses and activity directors. He knew them each by name and remembered all of our names as well. You can tell he takes his job seriously and cares for what he does. The building was clean and well kept. The residents were just finishing lunch and everything seemed to be running so smoothly! The building was also decorated for Christmas so beautifully.

I would definitely recommend this facility (and Eric) to everyone!

Great meeting & tour with Eric & Ashley -
Toured the facility and we were looking at Memory Care. The facility was very clean -it was 5:00 pm on a Friday evening and the staff seemed very happy- the patients had just eaten and everybody looked clean and happy and we got many good vibes from our tour ! We even had a resident wheel up to us to tell us how much she loved living there !
Eric had rearranged his schedule to meet with us, and Ashley stayed a little bit later so that was greatly appreciated and both of them really love their jobs ! Thank you !

Visited a friend that is in the memory ward and surprised how active the staff interact with the residents there.  Place is very clean and well organized, staff really friendly.  Under new management (Baymeadws???? Something) and are adding on with property next to them.

This is my first time visiting Volante of Pinellas Park, I‚Äôm a social worker and I want to retire and move in! Eric Goodwin-Kane is phenomenal. He invited social workers to tour and judge the residents Xmas decorated doors. He introduced us to everyone from the housekeepers to the directors, which for me said volumes regarding his respect for each and every department and the worker and their worth, no matter their position. We met residents who by the way were all wearing smiling faces, engaging and happy. Clean and smelling fresh is how I would describe Volante‚Äôs environment. I‚Äôm super busy, but I attended this gathering because of Mr. Eric Goodman-Kane and his community involvement. He visits our properties, smiling, with important information, and I‚Äôve never heard a negative word from him. Volante gets a great big üëç

Miss Holly is an excellent speech therapist for my son, Ethan. I cannot express enough how wonderful she is in her work with him. Miss Holly always conducts thorough research to find effective ways to engage with my son. Ethan genuinely enjoys working with Holly.

Holly with Saltwater Speech Therapy is amazing, she has helped our child so much. In the past two years we've seen great improvements in Speech/language and communication. We love to see all the progression and accomplishments. Holly has alot of patience and will gain the trust of your child. She communicates updates and will provide more updates upon request (if needed for school) and keeps track of your child's goals. We will continue to use Holly's services and recommend her as trustworthy, safe/background checked, transparent, positive, cheerful, dependable and communicates well.

Holly is amazing! My son connected with her so well and he made fast improvements! I‚Äôm so lucky that I found Holly and can‚Äôt recommend her services enough. She has great energy and so knowledgeable in her field. Thank you, Holly!
