My fur baby Samson loved Smoochie Pooch. This place has great customer service all the girls are amazing! Megan and Tierra answered all my questions to its entirety. I got my baby a poodle stuffed animal in pink for him to play and he loves it! Lillian is an amazing groomer very detailed and informative! As a toy Poodle she prepped him up for a continental Poodle cut and he looks so handsome and fabulous! Thank you!

I‚Äôm very pleased with the outcome of the grooming of my dog.  Meaghan was very helpful scheduling the appointment for my elderly dog.  I had two bad experiences with a previous groomer and I‚Äôm so happy to have found Smoochie Pooch! Jillian was wonderful with Kramer and she is very knowledgeable regarding health issues of older dogs! Thank you for a wonderful experience!

I take Gizmo, my pomeranian, to Laura for grooming.  He is a senior and has mobility issues.  She always does such a wonderful job and is so patient with my sweet boy.   He loves his Laura!  I highly recommend Smoochie Pooch to anyone looking for a new groomer!

Edit: I'd also like to add that since I've left this review, the owner sent me a nasty email and when I called to cancel a long-standing appointment, they hung up on me. So definitely not customer service oriented. Won't ever go back.

I‚Äôve been bringing my dog to this salon since long before it became Smoochie Pooch, and it used to be our absolute favorite place for grooming. I was always happy to pay the higher prices because the quality and care were worth it.

Unfortunately, since the transition from Charlie‚Äôs Place to Smoochie Pooch, the experience has changed drastically. The new hours‚ÄîMonday through Friday, 8AM to 4PM‚Äîare completely unrealistic for working pet owners. When I called to cancel my dog‚Äôs pre-scheduled appointments, I was asked if I could take time off work. Take off work... to get my dog groomed? That‚Äôs just not reasonable.

It‚Äôs incredibly disappointing to see a once-wonderful salon become so inaccessible. We truly miss Charlie‚Äôs Place and the flexibility and care they provided. Sadly, Smoochie Pooch has made it impossible for us to continue coming here.

My Bubs, Romeo (Pug) loves seeing his girls! He's a little old man and loves coming for his spa day, the girls take such good care of him! Everyone is so nice and good at what they do! This is a great group of Girls at the Gainesville location. It is easy to go to any place to get a bath and nail trim, but when you find a place that you know your pet will be loved on and taken care of, you stick with them!

I came to Dr. Kirsten Little for neck pain from a mild C4‚ÄìC5 misalignment and later for chronic knee pain caused by early chondropathy under the kneecap. In just a few sessions, my neck improved dramatically thanks to her hands-on techniques, personalized exercises, and clear explanations.

When we moved on to my knee, she took a completely different and very thoughtful approach focused on hip alignment, something no other PT had done before. She‚Äôs professional, empathetic, and motivating, and she pushes you to do your best while always making you feel supported.

I‚Äôve seen several physical therapists over the years, and Dr. Little is by far the best, knowledgeable, caring, and deeply committed to helping her patients recover. Highly recommended.

First and foremost, I want to thank Dr. Hunter Thompson and the entire team at SoFlo PT. They are an exceptionally knowledgeable and caring group. From the moment you walk in, the staff greets you with a smile and is always eager to help. The atmosphere strikes the perfect balance between professional and friendly, which makes each visit a positive experience. This is actually my third time using SoFlo PT for my therapy needs.

Facilities:
The ‚ÄúRehab North‚Äù location is spotless and well organized. All shared equipment‚Äîmachines, tables, free weights, etc.‚Äîis thoroughly cleaned after every use.

Physical Therapy:
I was impressed that SoFlo PT was able to schedule my first appointment within just a few days. That quick start made a real difference, since my vertigo was beginning to interfere with daily life.

My case was assigned to Dr. Hunter Thompson. With her expertise and hands-on approach, she evaluated my condition and designed a treatment plan that included the Epley maneuver, balance exercises, and light resistance training. Each session was carefully tailored to my progress, and I noticed a major improvement in my balance after only a couple of visits.

The Good News:
Today (09/25/25), I ‚Äúgraduated‚Äù from my PT program! I‚Äôve made tremendous progress, and the difference in my daily life is remarkable.

Final Thoughts:
Overall, I couldn‚Äôt be happier with the care and results I received. I highly recommend SoFlo PT to anyone in need of physical therapy. On a personal note, I‚Äôll truly miss the staff, who became like extended family over the past two months. Best wishes to everyone! Special thanks also to Dr. Carson Kutuchief, the owner, for leading an excellent practice that clearly puts patients first.

Warm regards,
Mike Quinones

Riding in the classical dressage principle is a pursuit few can successfully accomplish.   Do yourself a favor.  Clear your mind of what you think you know and give Vitor and Sons of the  Wind an opportunity to share their passion and mastery of classical dressage. I promise, if you pay attention your life will be transformed.  You WILL be a better rider and your horse will benefit.  Dare to learn how to be one with the Lusitano horse.  All at a top notch facility with gracious en suite rooms and generous hospitality.

Just came back from the Three day Dressage Clinic. It was fantastic! The accommodations were very comfortable and immaculate. It was wonderful staying at the Farm. I loved waking up-looking out towards some of my favorite horses and hearing their sweet nickers. The instruction was top notch and a privilege to ride such outstanding school master horses. Between lessons I audited other lessons and watched the highly skilled grooms ride. I felt so lucky to be there and can‚Äôt wait to return for 5 days next time.

My three days at Sons of the Wind Farm were amazing and exceeded my expectations.  The facility is beautiful with everything you need onsite.   The dressage lessons with Vitor Silva ( 2 per day) were tough but not grueling, challenging but not overwhelming and in many ways transformative for my riding.  My own horse at home responded immediately to the techniques I learned from Vitor and my coach is delighted.  I look forward to returning!

It‚Äôs hard to put into words how transformative my week at Sons of The Wind Farm was. On more ‚Äúdressage‚Äù levels than one! This was hands down the best instruction I have ever received in my riding. Vitor & Maggie have created a riding school that is second to none. I rode twice a day for five days on 3 different horses. All of them were schoolmasters who immediately let me know what was working and what wasn‚Äôt. The focus on my riding position has never been as spot on as it was last week. I immediately ‚Äúfelt‚Äù my adductors and lower obliques getting turned on. That was a first! The instruction was clear, concise and consistent. It made sense and it worked. On my final day I was literally in tears. Tears of joy and truly a wide variety of emotions, that I would never have anticipated. Not only did I feel on top of the world as a rider, but I also felt a new sense of joy and purpose, both in and out of the saddle. So much that leaving was hard. I‚Äôm beyond grateful to be able to return next month. To a place that is magical, in more ways than one.

I honestly can't say enough about Vitor, Maggie and the staff at Sons of the Wind. From the very first day, they welcomed us in like family and have been truly invested in my daughter's success--not just as a rider, but as a horsewoman. They don't just teach; they care. They celebrate her wins, encourage her through challenges, and always push her to be her best in a way that builds confidence and love for the sport.

Their dedication goes beyond just lessons--they take the time to understand her goals, strengths, and even the little things that make her feel supported. They want her to succeed just as much as we do, and that means the world. It's rare to find trainers who are this passionate, patient, and committed to their students, but that's exactly what we found here.

The facility is amazing. Stunning in fact! Both locations are clean, well-run, and full of happy, well-cared-for horses. It's a place where riders and horses thrive, and you can feel the love and dedication in everything they do. The staff is superb. I can honestly say from the moment we met everyone, we knew we had found our home away from home.

And the horse they found for my daughter? Absolute perfection. They didn't just find a good horse; they found the right horse--one that fits her personality, skill level, and dreams perfectly. From day one, it was clear they were meant to be together. She's kind, talented, and everything we could have hoped for and more. Watching them grow together has been the most incredible experience, and we are beyond grateful to Vitor and Maggie for making that happen.

If you're looking for a barn that truly cares about their riders, their horses, and making dreams come true, this is the place. We are so incredibly thankful to be part of Sons of the Wind. We can't wait to continue to grow with them and watch my daughter flourish into the amazing young rider they know she can and will be.

The walk-in clinic was wonderful. The staff was very professional, concerned and helpful. Dr Ted Feldman reviewed my issues thoroughly and recommended a trip to the ER via ambulance for a stat CT, which confirmed his diagnosis and prescribed meds to mitigate the pain. Overall, a good outcome.

South Florida Wildlife Center is one of those rare organizations that genuinely goes above and beyond for animals in need. When I found an injured Eastern Screech Owl, I reached out to them expecting some basic guidance. Instead, they immediately offered to drive all the way up to pick up the owl themselves ‚Äî no hesitation, no excuses, just pure dedication.

After the rescue, they sent me a detailed update explaining exactly what they found and how they were treating it. Their team performed a full medical assessment, provided pain relief, fluids, and antibiotics, and kept the owl in their ICU under constant observation. They even mentioned that radiographs would be done if needed. It was clear from their communication that this wasn‚Äôt just routine ‚Äî they genuinely cared about giving the owl the best chance to recover and return to the wild.

What really stands out about South Florida Wildlife Center is their professionalism and compassion. They handle every animal like it matters, and they take the time to educate and keep you informed. They‚Äôre a nonprofit that runs entirely on community support, yet they operate like a world-class wildlife hospital.

If you ever find injured wildlife or want to support an organization that truly makes a difference, this is the one. Whether it‚Äôs donating, leaving a review, or adopting one of their ambassador animals, your help goes directly to saving lives. I can‚Äôt thank the South Florida Wildlife Center enough for their incredible care, professionalism, and heart.

South Florida Wildlife Center was amazing to work with! They were so helpful when I found an injured crow; they were kind and great about communicating. They even coordinated a pickup for the bird at the facility that I found it which was much appreciated. Sadly I just found out the bird didn't make it after a few days of care but I trust that they did the best they could and would 100% recommend them if you come across any wildlife needs! RIP sweet Crow baby

SFWC is amazing! Only in 2025 I brought 3 animals in need there and their help and dedication exceeded all expectations. They took in an orphaned baby opossum and gave it a second chance at life. They also performed surgery on an injured snake I brought in‚Äîhe recovered and was released back into the wild. Even though they focus on native wildlife, they kindly helped me with a non-native red-footed tortoise - provided the list of ppl / organizations and the tortoise finally found new home. Truly kind, knowledgeable, and dedicated people!

I want to express my heartfelt gratitude for the incredible work you did in rescuing the baby orphan raccoon. It warms my heart to know she is now safe and receiving the care she truly deserves. Thank you for making such a difference!

Called the South Florida Wildlife Center when one of the Wood Storks that frequent our yard appeared injured. They dispatched Nick right away and he was able to capture the bird and take it to their center. We're hoping it makes a full recovery. Lucky to have the SFWC in our community.

what a lovely spot! i worked with Whitnee who was very informative, helpful, and skilled. the process of setting up a time was easy and i really appreciate how south miami riding club emphasizes building a knowledge on caring for the horses and bonding with them. understanding the process of how to get the resources and supplies together to ensure that the horse was ready to ride was so helpful. i even got to give my horse a wash down and bring him back to his stall myself! this was exactly what i was looking for ‚ò∫Ô∏è

Dr. Elizabeth Mahaney is an incredibly knowledgeable, dedicated, and effective therapist. Beyond her knowledge and skills, what truly sets Dr. Mahaney apart is her authenticity. She is real, genuine, and nonjudgmental, creating a space where clients and supervisees alike feel understood and supported. Her commitment to professional excellence and her heart for this work make her an outstanding therapist and mentor.

I highly recommend Dr. Mahaney to anyone looking for a therapist who is both deeply skilled and deeply caring!

Dr. Elizabeth Mahaney is knowledgeable, experienced, and genuinely invested in the people she works with. She holds a number of state licenses and certifications, which speaks to how dedicated she is to her work. But beyond her qualifications, what really stands out is how deeply she cares about both her supervisees and clients.

She has an incredibly calming presence that makes every conversation feel safe and supportive. She creates a space where you feel heard, encouraged, and challenged in the best way. She‚Äôs insightful but never rigid, always guiding rather than dictating, and she trusts you to develop your own way of thinking.

Her ability to balance warmth with expertise makes her an incredible mentor and therapist. She brings out the best in her supervisees, not just in terms of clinical skills but also in confidence and self-awareness. If you have the chance to learn from her, take it!

If you‚Äôre looking for a truly transformative therapy experience, look no further than South Tampa Therapy. From the moment you step into her welcoming space, you are met with warmth, compassion, and a deep sense of care that immediately puts you at ease.

Dr. Mahaney has an incredible gift‚Äînot just in her vast expertise but in the way she listens, understands, and guides you through your healing journey with empathy and genuine concern. She and her team of therapists create a safe space where you feel heard, valued, and empowered to work through life‚Äôs challenges. Whether you‚Äôre dealing with anxiety, trauma, relationship struggles, or just seeking personal growth, they provide insightful, personalized care that truly makes a difference.

The environment at South Tampa Therapy is one of peace and healing, making each session a comforting and rejuvenating experience.

I can‚Äôt recommend South Tampa Therapy enough. If you are searching for a therapist who genuinely cares and has the expertise to help you transform your life, this is the place to go.

My husband and I are currently seeing Remy Francis virtually and have only just begun, however her personality, insight, and genuine interest in us and helping us fix our problems has been so refreshing and nice! We are excited to continue working with South Tampa Therapy and Remy!

In late March, I contacted this clinic by phone and in person seeking help for my 6-year-old dog, Gunner. He had been examined there just two months earlier, in January 2025.

Gunner was in severe pain, later diagnosed as a spinal infection. He weighed nearly 100 pounds, and any attempt to lift him caused intense distress‚Äîhe cried out and bit me several times. I asked the clinic for a small amount of medication to safely transport him or a house call. At first, they said a home visit could be arranged for $200. I agreed immediately. Moments later, they reversed course and said I‚Äôd have to bring him in myself.

I found another vet willing to come to my home. Gunner passed away on May 5.

I‚Äôm not blaming this clinic for his death. But the lack of compassion and unwillingness to help in a very reasonable situation said enough. I‚Äôve since moved my other two dogs to a different practice.

New to South Trail animal hospital. Very good staff. Dr. Cooke helped my Lola with stomach issues. Although it cost $700!! Labs were done and read immediately and she‚Äôs eating again and almost back to herself.

Ridiculous cost on top of cost!  They charge to write a prescription. Throw away swabs.  I'm surprised they don't start charging for parking. We have been taking our dogs there for decades and not anymore, we have spent $thousands there.

Charging for a prescription if we don't want to buy their overpriced medications.  Imagine if your doctor started charging you to write a prescription on tope of your exam, and making you buy the medication from him/her!

Shop around and you will see how they are highly overpriced in this market.

The team here is absolutely amazing. We have three dogs, and we finally took one in about a year ago rather than driving across town to the vet that we have always used.  We are so grateful that we did. They are amazing. In the last year we have swapped all of our dogs over to south trail.

Everyone is very friendly. Their approach with my dog that is nervous and timid at vets was great as our vet took her time to befriend him before doing anything intimidating. She also gave a whole gameplan and made sure I was good with it, along with an estimate before beginning the work. They did as much as possible for my dog to leave us with minimal stuff to do at home, as well as gave good advice. None of it felt rushed and she definitely did everything to make my dog feel comfortable there

provider_name: South West Florida Horse Rescue, Inc.
review_text: Went to this rescue today for a volunteer tour and it was such an amazing experience. Our guide knew everything there was to know about each one of the horses. They keep the stables and the paddocks were kept clean. They were getting ready to help a horse that was having an issue with their hoove, the gentleness of the men taking care of this horse was so heart warming. The horses love to see their caregivers coming and that speaks volumes. The care provided at this facility is absolutely incredible. I have scheduled my orientation and cannot wait to be part of their volunteer team! I highly recommend taking the time to either tour or volunteer at this rescue! Me and my husband had the most amazing time!

provider_name: South West Florida Horse Rescue, Inc.
review_text: I had a volunteer tour of the SWFL Horse Rescue facility. Therese was very informative about the history of the volunteer and the horses in their care.  You can tell from the volunteers working, the maintenance and condition of the facilities that the horses are all very well cared for.  I‚Äôm excited to get back into my  horse rescue volunteer work after my move to SWFL.  If you are looking for a volunteer program and you have a love for horses, you must visit SWFL Horse Rescue in south Punta Gorda!

provider_name: South West Florida Horse Rescue, Inc.
review_text: Beautiful run facility run by passionate staff and volunteers.  Some horses will live out their days in this sanctuary, while others are properly rehabbed and trained before becoming adoptable.  Please support this charity!  $10 a month goes a long way!

provider_name: South West Florida Horse Rescue, Inc.
review_text: Thank you for giving me and my family a wonderful tour!  The volunteers are very knowledgeable and passionate about the rescued horses---you can see they have developed a real bond with them. My hope is more people will visit, participate in their events or donate to them financially or in kind---especially for much needed veterinary services---to provide continued good care. Some horses are adoptable, but many are sanctuary, which means every dime counts for their nutritional and medical necessities.

provider_name: South West Florida Horse Rescue, Inc.
review_text: SWFHR is a magical place.  Each horse base their own pasture cleaned daily, their own stable, also cleaned daily and every horse is cleaned every day.  When a horse passes away, they are laid to rest on the ranch and there is a reflection area to sit and remember their lives.  All the volunteers work extremely hard each day and care immensely for the horses.   Matt and Tina have created a beautiful place for the horses to heal or just spend the rest of their life.  I thoroughly enjoy being part of the family of volunteers.

provider_name: Southeast Orthopedic Specialists Herschel Street Rehabilitation and Imaging Clinic
review_text: The staff is great. They are fast, friendly, courteous, and all around amazing. I was having a rough morning and they were very understanding. I'm claustrophobic they gave me headphones with music and offered me an eyemask to soothe the situation.

provider_name: Southeast Orthopedic Specialists Herschel Street Rehabilitation and Imaging Clinic
review_text: I had such a great experience at the Herschel PT location. From Mitch (reception) to Chris (PT) and Jill (PTA), everyone was friendly, professional and clearly passionate about their work. You can tell all of the staff genuinely enjoy what they do, and it shows in the way they treat their patients and support each other. A special thank you to Chris for his support; it was a good balance between being compassionate and giving me that gentle push I needed to progress. I never felt rushed or overwhelmed; instead, I felt genuinely cared for and motivated. I‚Äôm so grateful for the care I received and would absolutely recommend them to anyone needing physical therapy.

provider_name: Southeast Orthopedic Specialists Herschel Street Rehabilitation and Imaging Clinic
review_text: Conner is great at his job. Although he pushes me,, I walk out feeling looser and better. He‚Äôs also very professional, courteous & knowledgeable.

provider_name: Southeast Orthopedic Specialists Herschel Street Rehabilitation and Imaging Clinic
review_text: Emil was very patient, kind and knowledgeable. All the staff were super helpful. I would highly recommend this place for your rehab. When we come back, we are definitely seeing a Emil after surgery.

provider_name: Southeast Orthopedic Specialists Herschel Street Rehabilitation and Imaging Clinic
review_text: Like the rest of the SOS practice the are friendly professional and helpful. They listen and have gotten me pain-free multiple times in my life.

We had such a great experience here! From the first phone call and the moment we walked in, the staff and reception were so friendly and welcoming. The doctors were thorough, compassionate, and took the time to explain everything clearly. I loved the personal touches too‚Äîthey even had a welcome sign for my dog in the room, which was so thoughtful, and a coffee bar for us while we waited. It really made the whole experience feel comfortable and caring. Highly recommend this clinic and their amazing team! I'm so bad with names but both ladies at the front desk were great and the gentleman that first came in the exam room and both of the doctors - the first one was a young lady and I do know one was Dr. Wong. All of the staff were great, kind, and friendly. Friendly staff and doctors

We are very thankful to Dr. Maria Jaramillo and the SEVN team for their care of our golden retriever, Summer Rose. During our visit, Summer had a CT scan, and Dr. Jaramillo took the time to explain the findings with patience and clarity. She made sure we understood the urgency of moving forward with a biopsy and bone amputation to continue finding answers.

Her compassion, professionalism, and dedication gave us confidence in the next steps during a very difficult time. We highly recommend Dr. Jaramillo and SEVN to any pet parent who needs specialty or emergency care.

‚Äî Felipe, Stephanie & Summer Rose üåπüêæ

The kindness and professionalism shown at Southeast Veterinary Neurology have been outstanding. I have nothing negative to say about the staff or facility. It is a sad situation to have to need this type of veterinary care. I'm just glad that such a supportive and knowledgeable team is there to help our Nemo through it. To list a few examples:
1. Dr. Marocco has been so patient and took her time to explain / answer all of our questions.
2. We were able to be seen right away when I expressed the serious situation we were in with our baby Nemo.
3. It was raining 'cats and dogs' during our last visit, and the staff kindly gave us towels to dry off, and placed a heater in the room for our dog Nemo to be more comfortable.

I can‚Äôt thank Southeast Veterinary Neurology (SEVN) enough for their outstanding care, professionalism, and compassion during one of the most stressful times for me and my dog. From the very first call, I felt heard and supported. I spoke with their intake team for nearly an hour on a Sunday, and not once did I feel rushed. They patiently listened, asked thoughtful questions, and took detailed notes about my dog‚Äôs condition.

My dog had been experiencing intense neck pain after being attacked by a large off-leash dog that grabbed him by the neck. His primary vet performed X-rays, which showed inflammation around his C5 vertebra, and prescribed two weeks of crate rest and medication. When there was no improvement, I was referred directly to SEVN by another vet for specialized neurological care. I called on a Sunday and had an appointment scheduled for Tuesday‚Äîremarkably fast. Their team was responsive, flexible, and proactive in their communication every step of the way.

When we arrived, my dog underwent a neurological exam and MRI, and later that same day, he went into surgery for a slipped disc at C4‚ÄìC5. It was a whirlwind experience, but the SEVN team kept me grounded. They provided frequent updates, shared photos, and took the time to explain everything in clear, reassuring terms. Their transparency and compassion made an incredibly difficult situation more manageable.

He was discharged three days later, and although still in recovery, he‚Äôs clearly improving and more comfortable. The procedure and hospitalization were significant undertakings‚Äîemotionally and financially‚Äîbut I truly believe SEVN helped prevent further suffering and provided the expert care he urgently needed.

Dr. Kornberg, thank you for your expertise and for walking me through my dog‚Äôs diagnosis and treatment plan with such clarity and care. And to the kind team members at reception who handled my initial call‚ÄîI wish I remembered your names!‚Äîthank you for your patience and warmth. You set the tone for everything that followed.

A few suggestions to enhance the experience for future pet parents:
Clearer Cost Expectations: While I did receive an initial estimate, offering a broader pricing range‚Äîincluding high-end possibilities‚Äîwould help families better prepare financially and reduce stress when urgent decisions arise.
More Transparency Around Surgical Timing: I didn‚Äôt realize that surgery might occur immediately after the MRI. Knowing this in advance would have helped me feel more mentally and emotionally prepared, especially for the possibility of leaving my dog for several days.
Enhanced Pre-Visit Communication: Providing a clear outline of what the initial consultation may involve‚Äîsuch as same-day imaging and potential surgery, estimated recovery timelines, and hospitalization length‚Äîwould empower pet parents to feel more informed and confident throughout the process.
I‚Äôm very fortunate that my partner and I were able to prioritize our dog‚Äôs care when he needed it most. The financial commitment was significant, and the experience was emotionally intense‚Äîbut SEVN made it all feel possible. Their specialized, compassionate approach was exactly what my dog needed, and I‚Äôm endlessly grateful to have been referred to them when we were.

I was truly impressed by the consultation we had yesterday. The team was very technical and precise, but above all, deeply human. It felt like a truly "humanized" consultation ‚Äî one where empathy and professionalism went hand in hand.

Even while hearing such a difficult diagnosis, we left feeling relieved to have found a doctor who was honest, transparent, and someone we genuinely trust to take care of our dog's treatment. I wasn't expecting this level of humanity and care, and it left us both impressed and grateful.

Maria Jaramillo ‚Äî I was really impressed with how technical she was, but above all, incredibly human, kind, and attentive. Transparency

Matteo, our 3-year-old British cat, had seizures and I brought him for appointment. All personnel was kind, welcoming and caring. I got subscription and medicine, and received detailed instructions and advice from the doctor. The visit exceeded my expectations and Matteo also liked it and wasn't nervous at all.

I was very impressed with the facility and the staff. The office is very clean and modern. The staff is welcoming and knowledgeable. You really feel like you're in a place where they know what they are doing; certainly not "fly by nite". Well worth the long drive from Fort Lauderdale. If his condition worsens, I will surely drive up there to see Dr. Sanil. Yes, . . . . . . Dr. Sanil and her assistant were wonderful. I appreciated their expertise about my dog. I felt like the doctor, Sheena Sanil, DVM knew exactly what she was talking about. I appreciated her knowledge, and she definitely helped me make informed decisions about my dogs care.

I was extremely impressed with the staff, and especially, Dr. Sanil. She helped Ben and me get through what I thought was going to be an awful day. I found her compassionate, knowledgeable, positive, reassuring and helpful. She even went beyond her scope and discussed his other issues I had concerns about. I am thrilled that I found her to help Ben. I am also happy to see physical therapy is offered and will be starting that once he's able to. I can't thank you all enough! Awesome staff that wants what is best for your pup. Dr. Sanil gave me hope that he would be ok after all and I would not have to let him cross the rainbow bridge today.

This is by far the best veterinary care Bella üê∂  has received having her for 16+ years and I‚Äôm extremely picky when it comes to her vet care choices being I work in the medical field myself. She was diagnosed with a likely brain tumor (unable to undergo anesthesia for definitive diagnosis by MRI). They took the time to thoroughly explain condition and treatment plan, answering all of my questions with patience and compassion.

The comfort of knowing there‚Äôs 24/7 care available made such a HUGE difference during such a difficult time. The entire staff is incredibly caring, attentive, and genuinely concerned for both pets and owners. They call often just to check up on her and show they care.

I truly feel my pup is in excellent hands.If you ever find yourself facing a neurological issue with your pet, I can‚Äôt recommend this team enough!!!

I'm so grateful for the kindness and compassion that Dr. Reese and assistant Amanda showed to Rocky. Rocky is a wonderful dog who happens to be afraid of people. Amanda did his intake at the car so Rocky could be in familiar surroundings as long as possible and then Dr. Reese and Amanda did his physical evaluation outside for his comfort with us there. Their understanding of his stress level as well as ours made all the difference and I couldn't be more grateful. Amanda made our experience so much better than we could have ever expected. No judgment on a fearful dog, only compassion and understanding. I'll add that Dr. Reese was clear and direct with what he found and was helpful in guiding our choice of next steps.

provider_name: Southeast Veterinary Oncology and Internal Medicine - SEVOMED
review_text:
Extremely disappointed in the overall experience with Southeast Veterinary Oncology (both this location and the location on Beach Blvd), as our cat was seen at both locations.

Our cat had a tumor and they strongly recommended chemotherapy instead of surgery.

We agreed to that plan, but only after they specifically told us that the dosage would be administered slowly in order to minimize side effects and not degrade the cats overall quality of life, as the treatment takes about 12 weeks or so.

After the second week of treatment, our cat could not stop vomiting and having constant diarrhea, and then our cat became so sick that she went 4 days without eating and had to be taken to the emergency animal hospital for treatment.

How on earth does that kind of treatment plan help maintain quality of life for your cat???

Our beautiful cat (Cookie) died yesterday at the hospital.  She was 12 years old and will be truly missed by everyone.

provider_name: Southeast Veterinary Oncology and Internal Medicine - SEVOMED
review_text: Unfortunately our 10 year old Golden Retriever Chevy succumbed to his 3 week battle with Lymphoma last weekend. During that time he made multiple visits to SEVO. All staff were compassionate, caring ,helpful, and efficient which says a lot since they see this stuff all the time. Drs Miller and Newman were fantastic. I want to especially recognize Leandra who went out of her way to coordinate between clinics and doctors.  She truly cares and it shows. Rest assured that if your pet requires Oncology services he/she will receive outstanding care at SEVO.

provider_name: Southeast Veterinary Oncology and Internal Medicine - SEVOMED
review_text: Our baby (15 yo) boy was diagnosed with lymphoma 1 year ago (7-26-24). He started treatment in August and he went into remission a few months later. Finished treatment in January and he is doing so good! Every extra day is a blessing and we owe that all to Dr. Haas and the SEVO team. Dr. Haas is excellent and thorough and I can‚Äôt recommend SEVO enough!

provider_name: Southeast Veterinary Oncology and Internal Medicine - SEVOMED
review_text:
My cat had a nasal tumor late last year and we were advised by our local Savannah vet to speak to PetCure regarding Stereotactic radiation if we wanted to pursue that avenue. We arranged a video consultation with Dr Molly Holmes. She explained our options and her concerns that his prognosis might not be as long since our boy was older and had previously had surgery to remove a portion of his lung earlier that year. The phone calls and the consultation all went according to plan and everyone called when they said they would. Treatment plans and payment plans were set up and we elected to proceed with the radiation as it was really our only choice to extend our cat's life.

My disappointment is with the aftercare or  lack of it. He seemed to suffer horribly from the treatment and really didn't improve as techs or the doctor thought he could or should. We brought him two to three times a week to our local vet to seek some advice. Although he told us this was way out of his wheelhouse, he offered us advice and empathy. His frustration with PetCure/SEVO was apparent when he reached out to them to express how they had not been there for him or for us.

We made the two and a half hour trek down to Orange Park multiple times to be seen by Dr Tisdelle. I have no clue who Dr Haas is in these reviews as we never heard her name once. We were told that Dr Holmes (who does the radiation remotely) was actually in the Orange Park office one day while we were there with Muffy and she did not even make an effort to meet us in person.

We let our beautiful boy go in February of this year after suffering for 3 months with radiation side effects and not improving the way we were told he should have. He was exhausted from the constant medications being shoved down his throat, in his eye and up his nose around the clock and so were we. Sadly, it is now July and not one single individual from this office has reached out to us in any way to offer condolences or even send a sympathy card. I don't even know if they are aware he died. How quick and efficient they were at the beginning when payment plans were discussed. Absolutely disappointing from a human standpoint where a little support, empathy and outreach would have gone a long way.  Rest in peace Muffy. We love and miss you.

provider_name: Southeast Veterinary Oncology and Internal Medicine - SEVOMED
review_text: They seem more focused on money than on the well-being of your pet, so proceed with caution. I had a bad feeling about this place from the start, especially when instead of being brought to the back in a private room, a nurse will come out and publicly discuss your pets condition in front of the entire filled lobby. They only send you back to the room when it's time to discuss payment. When the doctor finally came in to "talk" to me, she left without thoroughly explaining all of my treatment options. Instead, a nurse came in with 3-5 different  options, but the doctor never took the time to walk me through each one. I am not a medical professional and I need guidance and understanding of each choice of treatment, not just numbers thrown at me on a paper and say "pick". I had anxiety and asked a nurse to help me but she panicked too and said "I have no idea" and it always turned into a battle of her running back and forth between me and the doctor rather than the doctor just assisting me. Given how high and variable the costs are for each option, I would have appreciated it if Dr. Haas had personally explained all of them. Instead, the nurse just ran back and forth, which felt extremely unfair, especially considering I paid $110 for a "recheck consultation" each time. To make matters worse, they repeatedly got my pet‚Äôs prescriptions wrong, kept pushing me off on "temporary doctors" that were in the office because Dr. Haas was "busy". and put her on the wrong course of treatment which ultimately killed her. I truly believe that if I would have taken her elsewhere she would still be alive. They gamble with pet's lives too easily.  If I ever have another pet diagnosed with cancer, I will drive anywhere else to avoid this clinic. There is no wonder that Dr. Walls left, I don't blame her at all.

Maighen Hosey is the absolute best! She has been working with my son for 2 years now, and we have seen so much improvement. She is patient and so kind! I highly recommend her for any of your child‚Äôs speech/language needs!

Maighen has been absolutely wonderful for my son and frankly, our family. Two years ago my son was barely speaking and the words he was speaking were not understandable to anyone outside of our family. Maighen and her team have been so patient with my son, developed a specific care plan to meet his needs, discussed my son‚Äôs development, and so much more. I‚Äôm not sure what we would have done without her or where our family would be today. I‚Äôll recommend the Southern Speech Co team to anyone and everyone I know!

I cannot say enough about this fantastic team of therapists.  My now-11 year old worked on /s/ with Meghan when she was in kindergarten, and my now-5 year old has been working with SSC (first with Maighen and now with Meg) since she was 3.5 on lots of sounds.  These clinicians are so warm and loving, while also providing exceptional services and parent education.  My youngest gets so excited to go to school on days that "Ms. Meg is coming" and always comes home chattering excitedly about what she has learned.  Thank you, Southern Speech Co!

My daughter has been working with SSC (Shout out to Maighen!) for two years now and it has been an incredible asset to and facilitator of her language and speech development. What I love about SSC is they get to really know your child and what strategies work to keep them focused and motivated. SSC also collaborates with parents and schools to garner insights into your child's progress to make adjustments to therapy goals to ensure that they reflect challenges in the various settings our kids are in. My child loves her time spent with Ms. Maighen and we have seen tremendous growth over the years.

Highly recommend!

My daughter has been coming to speech here for over a year. Her speech has improved tremendously. I love her therapist Maighen, she has so much knowledge and patience with the kids. My daughter still has a ways to go and we will not be taking her anywhere Southern Speech and Ms. Maighen.

My wife just posted about our weekend trip to Southernwinds and let me tell you, we cannot say enough about how amazing our experience was.  I have been a long time GSD owner and have always sorta rolled my eyes anytime someone got alllll pretentious about their dogs bloodline.  Again I have owned several GSDS and none were from high end kennels, yet we had amazing dogs.
Well Jen and Cecilia showed me the difference.  Every single dog we saw was not only stunningly beautiful, but they were also amazingly well behaved, temperament unlike anything I have ever experienced.
I now believe in the whole bloodline argument.
Best example I can give you is this, a Volkswagen is a very well made German car and it will get you where you wanna go.  But a Volkswagen is not a BMW or Mercedes.   At Southernwind, every dog is a BMW.
Southwind is the first and only kennel we visited and we have no interest in visiting another.  Our Luna will be a Southernwind dog.

We had been researching German Shepherds for quite some time. My husband is a lifelong GSD enthusiast, while this would be my first experience with a large breed. When we came across Southernwind Kennels‚Äô website and saw all the wonderful reviews, we were excited to learn more.
After sending a text, we received a prompt call back from Jenn, who was very kind and helpful in scheduling a meet and greet. When we arrived, I was amazed by how beautiful and well-behaved all the dogs were‚Äîtheir temperament truly stood out.
At first, I was a bit hesitant, but the moment we were welcomed by Cecilia, the owner, all my concerns disappeared. She took the time to speak with us and introduce us to some of her dogs, while Jenn provided valuable information and guidance.

It was an excellent experience overall, and we‚Äôre thrilled to say that if everything goes well, we‚Äôll be getting our Luna from Southernwind Kennels!

From start to finish it was a seamless process. Cecilia and Jennifer were great, very knowledgeable, and still available for any questions we have. We love our beautiful intelligent fur baby Zuko. üíï 10/10 recommend Southernwind Kennels

I have gotten three Shepherds from Cecilia at Southernwind.  They have all been extremely smart, anxious to please, have exceptional conformation, and naturally protective behavior.

Additionally, Cecilia is very helpful with any questions that arise, and provides very prompt  return calls and texts.

I routinely refer my friends and veterinary  clients to Cecilia and Southernwind Kennels.

Roberta Swakon, DVM

I recently purchased this beauty from Southernwinds two weeks ago. Southernwinds  is very legit.  They raised this pup along with his siblings and put them through their puppy program.  This program is phenomenal it really shows through the puppy. This puppy has all the bells and whistles.  He is very sweet , smart , his courage and confidence is through the roof, very well behaved and so on. They really love there dogs and it really shows. I would do this all over again no hesitation.  It's very true what they say once you get a dog from them it's not the end of the road you become a sothernwinds family.  They are always there to help. Thank you sothernwinds . I highly recommend them...

Love this place! They genuinely care about your child. The facility is always clean. The therapist are extremely knowledgeable. The front desk are always helpful. Most importantly they accommodate your child‚Äôs needs and constantly advocate for them! They truly go above and beyond! We are grateful to have found this place.

I bring my two children here , I highly recommend this location for occupational and speech therapy. I have seen a huge improvement with both of my children. The owner is so sweet and supportive. All the therapy specialist are amazing and listen to your concerns. Thank you for everything yall do for the children. Bringing my children here has been the best decision I‚Äôve made.

Wonderful place. Staff are very friendly and accommodating. I love the fact that they are very personal and let me as a mom come inside and feel at ease. Their smiles and gentle approach is what I have been looking for to help my homeschool kids ease back into the norm after the pandemic.

Southshore Bilingual Therapy‚Ä¶if I were to have to put into words, Amazing! My daughter started SP with Luz in September 2020 when she was 2 years old and then later on started OT with Vanessa. They are both amazing and very sweet along with the other staff and front desk. Luz and Vanessa really listen to your concerns about your child and their needs. They really try their best to make connections with the children and definitely help the parents as well, help them understand what they can also do at home to help their children. My daughter definitely loves them! They are not the pushy or talk over you type like I‚Äôve experienced with other doctors, they really do genuinely care and that is very hard to find these days. In the passed couple of months there has been a huge difference in my daughter and I can say that I am truly happy that my daughter has these two wonderful women in her life. If you are considering on going with the Southshore Bilingual Therapy staff just go for it, I guarantee you and your child would both love it!

Words can't express how I feel about Mrs. Luz. She stepped into my son's life 2 years ago and turned him into a successful toddler. She is very caring, patient, kind, helpful in all areas and truly a gift. she took my son and worked  very hard side by side in helping my son with speech, sound, words, alittle bit of everything. She is always available to help in any way. My son is now entering kindergarten. I feel very confident in his success because of her. She's worth more than 5 stars.we love her and greatly appreciate everything she has done for us.

The doctors, assistants & front desk staff are very friendly, understanding & knowledgeable. The office is very clean & decorated with obvious love of animals. My dog & cat are patients & my daughter's new 6 week old kitten & older cat who is very difficult to handle are patients. We're very happy with our choice for a veterinarian.

I just want to thank Dr. Burgess and the rest of the amazing team at Southside Animal Clinic for being such wonderful, compassionate people. I used to come here many years ago with my animals that have since passed away. I only recently returned once my kitty, Fred, developed a life-threatening blood clot. We weren‚Äôt expecting him to survive a week, let alone another couple of months. Although we did not get the outcome we hoped for in the long run, I am beyond thankful for the attentive care that was given to us. So much that I have switched all of my pets back over to this clinic. For the past 4 years, I had switched vets in an effort to save money. But you get what you pay for and you cannot put a price on excellent care for your fur babies!! This clinic is THE best and I‚Äôm forever impressed by this establishment and the people that run it. We are happy to be back!

My Preston had an emergency and needed to see a vet quickly. Called the one nearest me and it was Southside Animal
clinic. They seen him right away. Preston is doing great now and very happy! I can't thank Dr. Burgess and Southside enough for what they did.

We are new to the Jax area and we were apprehensive about a new vet for our pups. Everyone was very friendly and professional, the facilities were super clean and our pups loved the vet and vet techs! They got right down on the floor with our big bulldogs and gave them lots of love. We were so happy that we chose this place. Prices are reasonable for the professional care that they give your pets.

Southside Animal Clinic is extremely professional, and they always test my dog to be sure that what they prescribe for his skin problems is targeted SPECIFICALLY for that type of skin allergy or infection.  Dr. Begg is so very, very nice and compassionate, and his staff is always friendly,accommodating, and sincerely empathetic.  Their rooms are clean, they don't smell badly like some other vet's exam rooms did. I look around while I"m waiting, and everything looks clean and top-notch.  Dr. Begg is the best vet my dog has ever had, and his staff is very good, too.

The best trainers in Florida!! Rusty, Dee and Sue have so much experience and knowledge of all aspects of dog training, health and how to help you with your specific needs.
The classes are fun, yet structured and you and your dog will learn a lot.
The trainers are great about checking in with you to see how you and your dog are progressing.
Other owners will also help you to provide suggestions and support. Some students have been coming for years and it makes it like a family who all support your journey with your dog.
I‚Äôm glad to have SWFL K9 Services for our dog and ourselves. Our black GSD feels at home here and so do we.
Thank you Rusty, Dee and Sue.

We have just finished our 3rd class with Dee and we could not be happier ! Dee takes time with each dog , going over the training thoroughly and making sure the desired result is correct. She is encouraging to both the dog and the human. She is friendly, fun and exactly what we want in a trainer. I don't know who is more excited for the training each week..us or our dog.

Before we got our new pup, Daisy, we had decided we would do as much training with her as I could.  Knowing I had a lot to learn before I could train her, I went in with the idea that dog training is for me to learn how to train my dog, not for them to train my dog for me.
We were luckily enough to be recommended to southwest Florida K9 services. For the last year I have been regularly attending Saturday classes with Daisy.  The trainers are all knowledgeable and have helped me to train Daisy to the point where she is now my service dog!! This is big for me as I didn‚Äôt think that was a possibility.  I will always be grateful for the knowledge and skills they have given us.
Although Dee, Suzann, and Rusty usually take different groups or classes they make a great team of trainers as they are all different personalities and all have different ways of explaining things.

The little man child that answers has ZERO respect for anyone, especially people with disabilities. My friend with Cebral Palsy called to ask about what services are available for training his new dog to be a full Service Dog, and the boy on the phone told him to "call back when he sobers up" due to his different way of speaking. I called shortly after to try to explain to him why my friend talks the way he does, and let him know how unprofessional and disrespectful he was towards my friend, at which point he was rude to me as well, telling me that he didn't need to be bothered with a call to be told that and rudely hanging up. He definitely won't be getting any business from anyone in any of our families or friend circles after this!

Just had our 1st visit and we are so impressed with their knowledge and training methods!  And it is obvious how much they lIve dogs! I highly recommend them for your dog training needs!  Barbara (Scotty) Marshall

provider_name: Spark Pediatrics Medical Daycare (PPEC) - Clearwater, FL
review_text: Working at Spark pediatrics is such a rewarding experience. Every child deserves to feel included and "normal". At Spark, kids of all abilities are able to interact and have the daycare/preschool experience while also receiving quality medical care. Seeing our patients learn, grow and overcome challenges every day is amazing. I really love how the kids recognize each others medical needs and celebrate them together. We love our babies!!!

provider_name: Spark Pediatrics Medical Daycare (PPEC) - Clearwater, FL
review_text: We found Spark Pediatrics on some advice from a counsellor when investigating services for hip dysplasia. Our daughter was in a cast, then brace for a few months. Then has to re-learn to walk. Spark have gone above and beyond chasing paperwork for insurance. They are a delight to see every day. They genuinely care about our daughter and all the kiddos there, and are so happy to see her improve. They are great with communication. We highly recommend to anyone who has a permanent or temporary need for specialised medical daycare.

provider_name: Spark Pediatrics Medical Daycare (PPEC) - Clearwater, FL
review_text: Spark Pediatrics complex medical daycare in  Clearwater, Florida is an amazing second family to me! I love working here alongside nurses that truly provide the best care and treat their patients like their own children. We also work closely with our patients‚Äô doctors, nurse practitioners, nurses, therapists, home health care nurses, and various other health care teams to advocate for them, and provide the best possible medical care to each of them daily. We go the extra mile to assess kids outside of the facility if needed, answer parents texts and phone calls at all hours, and try to accommodate them in the best way we can. Our patients‚Äô families know they can contact us at any time for advice, support, or just to be there for them or their child. We also work alongside some amazing therapists in house at the center Monday-Friday through First Words Therapy LLC. including speech therapy, occupational therapy, and physical therapy. Each of our therapists provide amazing individualized therapy services to cater to all of our kiddos‚Äô specific needs that qualify for therapy services. We love to keep parents updated on their child‚Äôs progression, especially while in therapy! We often get compliments from families about how they love receiving the pictures and videos from us of their children making great progress while in speech therapy, occupational therapy, and physical therapy services. I cannot emphasize enough how much Spark Pediatrics is an absolutely amazing family and a great place to work too! We work together and thrive as a team to provide the absolute best care for our children. Feel free to check us out or call us if your child or someone you know has a child with medical diagnoses requiring skilled nursing needs. üòä We are always open to welcoming new patients to our Spark Pediatrics family. ‚ù§Ô∏è

provider_name: Spark Pediatrics Medical Daycare (PPEC) - Clearwater, FL
review_text: SPARK is an amazing facility! My son has been going here for about 3.5 years now and I am so blessed to have found them. Finding a daycare for a special needs child is hard. I toured a few other facilities and they were horrible looking but then I found Spark! It is clean, spacious, and eye apealling ! I don't think there has ever been a staff member i haven't loved! They care for these kids like they are their own! It's very evident these women love what they do! Very thorough with the kids and always loving them! Melissa is amazing and has always done such a good job with the kids and facility! The new DON Cat is also amazing and super sweet! We love the therapy staff as well my son has made leaps and bounds with them! Michelle, Amber , Pam and Jade are so good with the kids . They have special holiday parties for the kids, last year they even had a real santa come and give all the kids presents it brought me to tears! They go above and beyond for these babies! I 10/10 recommend this facility! Thank you ladies at spark we love you!

provider_name: Spark Pediatrics Medical Daycare (PPEC) - Clearwater, FL
review_text: Spark has been my home away from home over the last 2.5 years and what an honor it has been to serve my patients, their families and our community! I tell everyone that I have the absolute BEST job and I cannot wait to wake up and go to work everyday. I truly believe in what we do. "We believe every child deserves a childhood' and we do everything we can to make a positive impact in these kiddos lives, while ensuring we create a safe and healthy environment. I have a background in early childhood education and prior to becoming a nurse, I was a preschool teacher and nanny. I'm also a momma x2 so I completely understand how hard it can be to find the right fit and the trust you have to put in others hands to care for your child. Here at Spark, our team is so dedicated and passionate about what we do! :)

provider_name: Spark Pediatrics Medical Daycare (PPEC) - Palm Springs, FL
review_text:
As a therapist who has worked with many PPECs, I can confidently say that the DON Nicole Martinez and staff at SPARK PEDIATRICS are among the best I‚Äôve had the privilege to collaborate with. The DON leads with professionalism, compassion, and a deep understanding of pediatric care, creating a supportive and efficient environment for both staff and families.
The nursing team and support staff are outstanding in their dedication to the children. They prioritize each child‚Äôs health, safety, and development while fostering a warm and welcoming environment. It‚Äôs evident that they care deeply about their work and go above and beyond to ensure the best outcomes for every child.
From a therapist‚Äôs perspective, the collaboration at SPARK PEDIATRICS is seamless. The team values input from all disciplines and works hard to create individualized care plans that address each child‚Äôs unique needs. This level of teamwork makes a huge difference in the progress and happiness of the children we serve.
I‚Äôm grateful to work alongside such an exceptional team, and I highly recommend SPARK PEDIATRICS to any family seeking a caring, skilled, and well-run facility for their little ones!

provider_name: Spark Pediatrics Medical Daycare (PPEC) - Palm Springs, FL
review_text: I must say the care that I have received from Pediatric Sparks has been beyond phenomenal, words cannot even express how happy I am with the with them! The director of the center Nicole is a sweetheart and she's is always available for her parents and that as a parent is important to me. There has never been a time that I have call with a question and never gotten a quick response. The center has paid very close attention to my child, if there is anything that was needed they made sure to reached out and got her the services that's need at that time. If I had a concern about my child's health, Nicole and her staff has always made sure it was taking care of or corrected. Toni the speech pathologist is such a sweetheart, she actually sits and listens to your concerns and she does her best to address your concerns and I can't for get about the respiratory therapist Ruben, he's also very nice and gives a quick response to your questions. Now as for the nurses and staff that care's for my child I must say they treat her as if she is one of theirs. When I tell you she doesn't come home with a scratch on her, the same way she leaves the house is the same way I get her back, and let's face it as a parent that is very important to me to know that my child is safe and is being cared for in the right way. If I had to do it all over again pediatric Sparks will always be my pick!

provider_name: Spark Pediatrics Medical Daycare (PPEC) - Palm Springs, FL
review_text: As a medical professional, I've had the pleasure of dealing with this facility location several times for my patients and have had a great experience as well as wonderful patient feedback. The director Nicole has exceptional communication skills and the passion for helping the children is evident both in her demonstrations and that of her staff. They are truly dedicated to going above and beyond for their patient population. I would highly recommend this center to those seeking similar care and I often do.

provider_name: Spark Pediatrics Medical Daycare (PPEC) - Palm Springs, FL
review_text: I highly recommend this daycare I fell inlove with the way they care for my daughter like they were their own they‚Äôre truly are my village.my daughter loves Mrs.Idana and her cuddles. Yordania and everyone teaching her Spanish too. It‚Äôs hard and scary being a first time mom especially a Nicu‚Äôs mom at that, but Nicole and her team been there for me the whole step of the way. I can count on Nicole for anything advice anything she doesn‚Äôt care if it‚Äôs during or after hours she will be there for you and I admire her so much and grateful god put her in me and keyshawna life. Don‚Äôt hesitate to bring your child her she will be safe, cared, and  love in their care.

provider_name: Spark Pediatrics Medical Daycare (PPEC) - Palm Springs, FL
review_text: Within the months that my son has been attending this facility I can honestly say that the staff have become people of value to us. We hold everyone that pertains to this facility within a very high esteem. The attention they offer is beyond what is requested of them. The communication is phenomenal and aids with easing you down when you get those nervous waves that come with leaving your child else where and you aren‚Äôt present. Every nurse and staff member works very well with attempting to accommodate the needs of the child and make you the parent feel secure with their stay every single day. Transportation is super safe and easy due to the constant attention to detail that is applied for the children. The staff allow the children to sporadically always do activities to make things fun and exciting for them. Not to mention it melts my heart when my little one brings me home cute crafts on special holidays. If you‚Äôre looking for a clean, stable, and welcoming atmosphere for your child then I would recommend you take a tour for yourself and see what Sparks Pediatrics can offer your family.

Casey, Erin, and the whole team have been life-changing for our kids. They are so knowledgeable and help each child progress in ways we never thought possible. We are so grateful for Speak Outside The Box and how much they have positively impacted our lives.

Casey and her team at Speak Outside the Box have been nothing short of amazing for our son. Not only does he LOVE going to speech therapy, but his expressive and receptive language has exploded. We have been working with Casey for less than a year and the progress we have seen is remarkable. To know that we have someone in our son‚Äôs life who is just as invested in his success as we are is priceless.

Casey and her entire team are the absolute best when it comes to speech therapy! We originally worked with Emily one on one. Emily was so creative, intentional and supportive, it was really great to see my daughter so focused and interested during their sessions!  We are now doing the summer program and I wish it lasted all year. It‚Äôs so wonderful to get daily notes of how camp went and seeing the pictures and videos of her having so much fun dancing and interacting with other kids! They truly care about your child and it shows!

Speak Outside the Box has been life changing for our family. Casey and her team truly value connection and embracing each child with love and care in a fun and nurturing play based naturalistic approach. Her team is full of bright, positive, passionate, dedicated therapists who are so genuine and compassionate. They are constantly sharing new professional development books with families and finding new ways to collaborate on what works best for each individual child‚Äôs needs. We feel so lucky to have them be part of our son‚Äôs story.

The staff and therapists at Speak Outside The Box, where our daughter goes for speech and OT, are phenomenal!  In our years of searching for the best learning environment, we've never seen anything else come close to Casey and her team!  It is perfect for our daughter, who is on the spectrum.  The welcoming and caring staff are exceptionally trained, and the intervention and teaching methods used are both cutting-edge and down-to-earth.  Our daughter begs to come back to "speech school," and she is flourishing!  The curriculum and learning pace is uniquely developed for each student. We love everyone there and couldn't have wished for a better place to grow and learn.  Taylor and Abby are incredible with Kaley!  They both go above and beyond! They make it so much fun for our daughter! I highly recommend Speak Outside the Box!

Thank you, Casey and the whole team at Speak Outside The Box! The Matthews family.

I do not appreciate the negative reference you gave me. Because I did not want to change schools. It has been agreed at the beginning of my contract that I would be at that one school.  Then a complaint was fabricated and I was not informed prior to change of schools. You broke the agreement so I was under no obligation to coninue. You need to retract your negative reference or I will obtain legal assistance
Dedicated volunteers assist special needs children & adults in riding horses. They do a variety of activities & enjoy leisurely time riding. Great program my autistic son enjoys very much.

Such a fantastic place to take your loved ones. The people are compassionate and understanding. You can tell right away that they know how to do their jobs very well, a lot of experience amoung them. Always a feel good place to go.

This place is full of miracles! I volunteered with my nursing school classmates and loved watching the clients having so much fun in their horses. I plan on coming back with my kids sometime to volunteer some again.

Beautiful facility with such good people , there to help those that can benefit from their very special, loving, and patient Horses, so that others can smile, and feel so proud of being with these wonderful animals!!
Exceptional program. I volunteer 2 days a week when I can. VERY rewarding to be with these students and instructors and be a part of such an AMAZING place.

I was there fixing a broken drain pipe and snapped a few pictures of the animals that started following me as I was going back to my truck. I didn't know much about the organization until I went to their website at Specialheartsfarm.com and found that they teach farming and gardening to students with disabilities. They teach them skills for employment in the farming industry. Please check out their website for a better description of all they do.
Proud to know that Orange County Public Schools partners with them to make this possible.

This is not a petting zoo. The farm is an adult day training program for individuals with disabilities. They do have a store where they sell goat milk soap, candles, wood signs, sugar scrubs and eggs. These are all made by individuals with disabilities. Store is open from 8am-2pm. Such a wonderful program.

I love this place. I purchased lots of soaps to give as gifts.  It's  wonderful  that these special  children and forever  young  adults create these.  A wonderful  program  for  these blessed to be a part of it.
This place is been so far the best experience for our son with special needs - everyone here is super friendly and welcoming.
My son is in the day program here. Amazing program and staff, we are very grateful to have this program available to us and excited about their future growth.

I love Ms Christina! She has been amazing with my son and is such a happy person. I heard about her through my son‚Äôs chiropractor and felt she is what he needed because she also does myofunctional therapy. He was getting chronic ear infections and has difficulty pronouncing certain sounds. Myofunctional can help with both! He‚Äôs been seeing her for almost 2 months and is improving.

Dr. Christina has been an absolutely blessing to our family! Our middle child, who tends to be very selective in who she likes, has made such a progress with her speech and absolutely loves going to session! We can‚Äôt recommend Dr. Christina enough!

Our boy has made incredible progress on a speech delay since we began coming here 4 months ago. Dr. Christina Colonna is truly exceptional- she knows exactly, how to keep him interested and working on his sounds, it doesn‚Äôt feel like work to him and he loves coming to see her. She also knows exactly how to address his difficulties to get him to overcome them. I am so happy we made the choice to come here, 1 of the best decision in my life! Thank you üôè

I strongly recommend Dr. Colonna as a skilled and knowledgeable speech therapist. She has made a significant impact on my son's communication and language development. Dr. Colonna quickly identified the key areas for improvement and created a clear, effective plan for our sessions.
She excels at working with children, engaging them in a way that keeps them focused on their goals. Dr. Colonna is patient and takes the time to work with each child individually, offering valuable feedback to parents. Her approach is sincere and dedicated, with a clear focus on helping her clients make progress.

We are so grateful for Dr. Colonna who went out of her way for my son in an unexpected time of need! She turned a time of anxiety for us into a pleasure abdnd you can tell how much she truly cares about people, even before we net her. She is knowledgeable and understanding, a true find!

provider_name: Specialists in Companion Animal Neurology (SCAN) - Clearwater
review_text:
I can‚Äôt even begin to say how incredible SCAN is. They got us in within a day of calling & had a same day MRI. We had answers to mystery problem and an immediate plan of action. Dr Laifer, you are such an incredible veterinarian & surgeon. I was hysterical throughout this entire process from consult to getting the call that my boy made it through surgery and you handled all of my questions and tears with empathy and patience. You went above and beyond with extra testing to ensure our senior boy was getting exactly what he needed. You left no box unchecked and thoroughly explained everything both the how‚Äôs and whys. I can‚Äôt thank you enough for getting us through to the other side. Kelli, Jess, Brenden, you guys are amazing. Thank you for every single photo, every update, every extra second you spent with him, it meant the world to me to know how well taken care of he was and being kept updated as much as I was. I don‚Äôt know of anywhere else who would have walked rylie and myself through this like you both did. This is a gut wrenching experience to go through and you all made the time between talking to Dr Laifer so much easier to bear.

To anyone who is needing a neurological clinic, look no further. Putting a 13 year old large dog through surgery is not an easy decision to make. We traveled two hours to be there and it was the best decision I could have ever made. The staff is incredible, the care and communication is above and beyond, I am so happy to have found you all and can‚Äôt thank you enough for saving Rylies life.

provider_name: Specialists in Companion Animal Neurology (SCAN) - Clearwater
review_text:
I am writing to express my sincere gratitude for the outstanding care my dog received under Dr. Laifer and his staff's attention. After Lola was diagnosed with IVDD and stopped walking, he promptly accommodated us on a Saturday morning and performed surgery.
I truly believe he has magic hands, and it is evident that he is a devoted dog lover. Despite my dog's challenging temperament, he managed the situation with utmost professionalism and compassion.
We are very happy with the results; she started walking again in less than two weeks. Of course, we diligently followed all your instructions, which contributed to her recovery. Thank you for your exceptional care and kindness.

provider_name: Specialists in Companion Animal Neurology (SCAN) - Clearwater
review_text: I would absolutely recommend SCAN for all of your pet‚Äôs neurology needs. The staff here is compassionate, realistic and provide astounding care. Time was taken to thoroughly examine our Moonpie and formulate a care plan. Everything was very well explained and bedside manner was top notch. These people really love what they do! We cannot thank Dr. Lind and Nurse Jessica enough!

provider_name: Specialists in Companion Animal Neurology (SCAN) - Clearwater
review_text:
SCAN has been absolutely wonderful! From agreeing to see our dog Colby on a Friday afternoon, to doing emergency surgery till 8pm the same night, and constantly updating us on how he is doing. We could not have asked for a better team to take care of our baby. All of our questions & more were answered and we felt at ease. Colby is doing amazing and it is all due to the wonderful team at SCAN.

Colby went from being partially paralyzed on Friday to up & walking less than 48 hours post surgery. The team is amazing & big shout out to Christina & Dr. Cook. Everyone was super friendly & professional but also loving to our baby. Wouldn't change a thing!

provider_name: Specialists in Companion Animal Neurology (SCAN) - Clearwater
review_text:
Update: It's now been over 3 years since Fritter had his spinal surgery here; and he's still going strong. Other than needing a little help peeing and dealing with his incontinence, he is my most energetic dog by far. Forever grateful to the team here for working their magic.
--
The staff at this location are all very compassionate and caring of animals. I took my little Fritter in over some back pain on the weekend. They had hoped it was treatable with medication. Sadly it was not. I came back with Fritter late at night on Monday after he lost function in his legs. Dr Lind arrived at 10-11pm to care for Fritter and run MRIs and check ups on him. She's very thorough and makes sure you are fully informed of your options before proceeding.
I am very grateful places like this exist. I felt like my world had come to an end very suddenly and they've given me hope I might still have some time with my Fritter after a little TLC.
Also shout out to Susan at the front counter who is just a ball of energy and good vibes and the other staff who were more than accommodating at all times.

They even sent me a photo of my baby after surgery ‚ù§Ô∏è

The very best agency to work for the staff is fabulous the boss Carlos and Warren are the best two people to work for theytake the highest interest in staffing there workers to the family to there specific needs best agency in south Florida
Thank you Carlos for the opportunity I have  to work with specialized nursing service.we are the best üëå üåü üåü üåü üåü üåü

I Manuel Pouparina, would like to state that after having a long conversation with the President and owner of this Home Health Agency , MS Lopez , I made the decision to continue with their care for my frail mother. I accepted her sincere apologies and praised her for that, and I am looking forward in continuing her PT with MR Willis, whom my mother and sister liked a lot . I wish them the best Manuel Pouparina M.D.
Friendly and Professional my mother looks forward all there advice and visits.
Provides exceptional services for patients.

provider_name: Specialized Pediatric Care PPEC & Specialized Therapy Center
review_text:
Specialize Pediatric Care is an amazing PPEC center. My son has been going there for about three years now. My son has autism epilepsy and cerebral palsy. The therapist there work really hard to help my son reach his goals. Their professionalism amazes me, Director Senua Rodriguez and Office Manager Susan Rodriguez are excellent with communicating with me
from my sons individual care plan to any questions I my have. They are also very involved with all the activities and trips that they plan for the children at the center.

provider_name: Specialized Pediatric Care PPEC & Specialized Therapy Center
review_text: I love this place so much. They are the best. Very clean and beautiful location. The kids never want to leave because of the amazing bond with the therapist.  The interaction with parents is remarkable. The staff are always friendly and in a cheery mood. I recommend anyone the bring their little ones here. Just adore this atmosphere.

provider_name: Specialized Pediatric Care PPEC & Specialized Therapy Center
review_text: üáßüáºAs an immigrant single mum to a special needs baby, this PPEC has been nothing but a life saver for my daughter and I. I am sooooo grateful for all the help I get. From transportation, taking my daughter to medical appointments and keeping me posted about everything. Their staff is everything. I met Susy when my daughter was still very young, she couldn‚Äôt get into the PPEC as yet because of our insurance, but Susy held my hand throughout the wait, calling to check up on my daughter, sending encouraging messages and just being kind to us. I am so grateful for her because finding strangers with such beautiful hearts in this era is very rare. She continues to move mountains for us as parents, making sure that our children are well attended and we get the best help. The nurses are also hands on, and they keep me engaged. Juan helps me take my daughter to the car, he insures my daughter is secure in her car seat and even goes out of his way to help with anything we need help with, Leidi is always by his side giving my daughter the same attention and love. She makes sure I know how her day went. Dayana also keeps me updated on how my daughter is doing, she also goes out of her way to provide any necessary information and suggest resources that can further improve my child‚Äôs wellbeing and development. I can confidently say I found a family in this PPEC. I am grateful to raise my child with all of them.

provider_name: Specialized Pediatric Care PPEC & Specialized Therapy Center
review_text: This therapy center is helping my daughter with her speech and she has been improving in making sounds and understanding words

provider_name: Specialized Pediatric Care PPEC & Specialized Therapy Center
review_text:
My grandson attends SPC and we couldn‚Äôt be happier with their services. My daughter is a single mother and they facilitate transportation to and from the center including Saturdays.
My grandson is surrounded by loving health care professionals whom he always wants to hug and kiss hello and goodbye. I can tell by his behavior he is happy at the center and loves the nurses and therapists that are there to assist. We have access to the office staff who are just a quick phone call or text away, it feels like an extended family.
