provider_name: The Dog Man - Pro Dog Training
review_text: I highly recommend The Dog Man for dog training. Pat and his pack of precious pups had such a tremendous impact on my dog, Hazel. I rescued Hazel from the SPCA and she just needed a little help with basic training and socialization. It was wonderful seeing her learn commands, as well as gain confidence playing with Pat's dogs. The 1:1 style of training worked really well for us, too. Pat is charming, funny, and knowledgeable. Working with him and his dogs was a joy. It was an awesome experience!

provider_name: The Dog Man - Pro Dog Training
review_text:
I have a six and a half month old Cane Corso and I knew when I purchased her that I was going to have to get professional training. After researching local trainers, I decided to go with Pat and I am so glad I did. He gives personal one on one training and gives you the owner the confidence that is needed to responsibly own a dog and the ability to handle any situation that you may encounter with having a dog as a pet.
I was even able to bring my Corso to work with me this past week without any behavioral issues at all. If you are undecided about dog training, yes you need it and you will not be sorry if you go with Pat The Dog Man.

provider_name: The Dog Man - Pro Dog Training
review_text: Pat has been amazing! What a difference since I brought Winston in! I had to bring him because he was becoming aggressive and I could not take him to a ‚Äúgroup‚Äù class setting. So, having individual class from Pat was perfect. Pat showed me commands and ways to handle Winston to give him the correction he needs with love. He also provided me with collars to correct his behavior issues and showed me other tools to use for him and my other dog (even though I‚Äôm not taking the other dog for lessons). Pat truly cares for the well being of my dog. He even checked his teeth!!! Our lives have been simpler and better ever since I took Winston to dog training with Pat. I recommend him 100%. Do not hesitate!

provider_name: The Dog Man - Pro Dog Training
review_text:
Pat is a miracle worker. My chihuahua mix is a rescue who was abandoned by his previous family for having a SEVERE case of ‚Äúlittle man syndrome‚Äù. He would get very aggressive and bark/charge whenever he saw any other dogs in an attempt to assert dominance.

After just ONE session my dog is now able to sit quietly next to other dogs and behave like the loving sweet little guy that he truly is. Pat has a handful of well trained service dogs at the facility that were able to assist my dog with his training and confirm that he could keep his cool around a variety of different types of dogs.

I truly can‚Äôt recommend this guy enough, the one and only THE DOG MAN! üëçüèº

provider_name: The Dog Man - Pro Dog Training
review_text: We received real-life help with our pup. Training tailored to our needs and wishes. We gained confidence and harmony after the first session. We highly recommend the Dog Man for anyone who needs help with specific scenarios, behaviors, interactions with their dog to improve everyday life and gift their dog with their full potential.

The dog stop is great! They take care of my large dog, Sassy when I go on vacation.  She also gets groomed. Sassy has some big anxiety, and they never complain about her and handle her well! Other places I have brought her did not know what to do with her when she gets anxious. I love that you can watch the dogos on the cameras during open hours.  You can pay for extras like walks and cuddles, and they follow the diet plan you provide! I wish they were open a little longer hour on weekends for the dogs who are being boarded. Other than that, I have no complaints! Thank you to everyone who helps take care of my baby!

Sarah is awesome with Bentley. I recommend her highly for grooming. When we first brought Bentley for grooming, he was not a happy camper. Sarah has earned his trust as did the other employees at Dog Stop. Dog Stop is our go to for grooming and boarding.

First time using this facility for our dogs. Are we board them and had them at the daycare and later had them groomed. We were very happy with all the services. Everyone there is so dedicated to the dogs and it shows! Our dogs can be difficult to work with, and we were able to see them flourish! Highly recommend The Dog Stop.

We were nervous about dropping our puppy off for daycare, but the Dog Stop staff were great. They were patient with her during her evaluation (the other dogs barking made her nervous) and kept an eye on her during the rest of her visits. Our kitty got sick, so we ended up taking our pup to daycare every day for a week. The staff were friendly at each drop off and pick up, and even told us that the first 3 visits were free! We had no idea and they could have easily charged us for them. The playrooms are separated based on size and energy level, and they have access to an outside play area as well. There‚Äôs space for dogs to be taken out of the play area if they need to eat or just take a break from playing. It is reasonably priced and available all day during the week (shorter hours on the weekend). I especially love the playroom and yard cameras so I can check in on our girl whenever I want to. Can‚Äôt comment on the boarding as we don‚Äôt need that service, but we‚Äôll definitely be using them periodically for daycare. Great socialization for our girl and she comes home tired every time!

They showed genuine care and interest in my young puppy that is high energy. When she was testing the boundaries of the facility, they took her and kept them with them personally. Wish there was a little more interaction or enrichment for the animals, but give me great peace of mind to know that my dog is safe and is getting some level of interaction/socialization

Absolutely thrilled with our experience at The Dog Training Clinic LLC! We signed up for the Silver Package for our pup, Rusty, and the transformation has been incredible. Rusty has always had a sweet temperament, but now he‚Äôs truly a well-rounded, obedient, and confident dog ‚Äî thanks to their amazing team.

From day one, the trainers were professional, reliable, and genuinely invested in Rusty‚Äôs success. They worked patiently with him and gave us the tools we needed to reinforce training at home. Rusty loved every session, and it showed in his progress each week.

I highly recommend The Dog Training Clinic LLC to anyone looking to build a better relationship with their dog. We‚Äôre beyond happy we made the decision to trust them, and we‚Äôll definitely be using them again down the line. Thank you for helping Rusty shine!

Danielle is great! She trained my 3 year old pitbull mix, Luca, and turned him into one of the most well behaved dogs you‚Äôll ever see! He was always a sweet boy but definitely stubborn before the training. The work Danielle has done is amazing! If you are considering to get professional training for your dog, get your dog trained here! Luca has special medical needs which was a concern at first, but the team at Dog Training Clinic went above and beyond making sure they would cater to Luca‚Äôs health needs.

It‚Äôs been a little over two months since our Shiloh went through the adult program training with Armani and I‚Äôve lost count on how many compliments we‚Äôve gotten on her behavior. She has so much self control for a puppy! Armani did a phenomenal job with her, he walked us through all of her commands at her graduation and set us on a path to success. Thank you Richard, you have an amazing team and an impressive facility (doggie hotel with A/C and cameras). I‚Äôll never go anywhere else!

We dropped off our 12-week old Bernedoodle, Wynnie, for a 2-week puppy training. Our trainer was Danielle. We picked up Wynnie on Saturday and have been thrilled with her progress. She is better behaved, excellent heeling during her walks and much improved at potty training. We would highly recommend this place and Danielle. We plan on boarding her at this location in the future. You can tell they genuinely care about the dogs they are watching. It was an excellent find!

So incredibly thrilled with our experience at The Dog Training Clinic, LLC
My dog and I have had nothing but positive and professional experiences with the entire team.
Can‚Äôt recommend them enough to anyone looking for top quality training and experiences for both dog and handlers!!!!!

I brought in a 2 year old rescue that had anxiety and a fear of men. Patrick was his trainer. He did a wonderful job teaching him basic commands, building confidence, socializing him and taking my dog on amazing adventures. I‚Äôve done the two week training with two other companies, this experience was exceptional. I‚Äôll be continuing group training, and highly recommend both the dog wizard and Patrick.

I‚Äôd give 50 stars if I could. Bri was incredible with my dog Kenji! This was a dog that nipped someone in the house sending them to the hospital with stitches, plus maliciously attacked another dog in the house. He had a case of resource guarding! He‚Äôd pull on the leash real bad! They also helped me identify that he‚Äôs an anxious dog. He‚Äôs come back to me a new dog. I got pictures and updates all along the way! I literally can‚Äôt recommend the dog wizard enough. We went from a vet suggesting I may have to put him down to literally being the best trained dog I‚Äôve ever seen. Like people should be jealous of my dog now üòú.

Bri is hands down the _best_ trainer you can send your dog to, I will forever recommend her to anyone that'll listen!
Our 4.5 month old pup graduated day camp today and I have nothing but amazing things to say about Bri (and really all of the staff at the Dog Wizard). From evaluation (at 12 weeks old) with Corrie to actual sessions each week and daily follow up with Bri we felt comfortable through the entire process and that every penny was well spent for the value of time and care they put into training the dogs.
Zoe is a completely different dog than she was 6 sessions ago. We sent in a typical stubborn puppy with some bad habits we didn't know we created and came out with a fantastic well behaved baby (that still tests her limits but that's to be expected üòÜ).
We humans got just about as much training as Zoe did (if not more) so we knew how to handle puppy better but Bri was there every step of the way to tweak what we were doing and answer all of my frantic "why is she doing...[insert whatever crazy thing Zoe does at home but not at the facility]" texts! We look forward to the continued support of TDW & Bri with their weekly classes and pack walks!

Photos: Zoe day 1 learning Place, "down" on graduation day, and her grad picture ‚ô°

We cannot say enough great things about The Dog Wizard Fort Myers! Our 5-year-old, highly anxious mini Goldendoodle, Teddy, spent nearly 3 weeks there, and the transformation has been incredible. His amazing trainer, Briauna, took him back to basics with training and helped him work through his fears ‚Äî especially making grooming a much less scary experience.

As owners, it was definitely hard being separated from him, but we quickly learned to trust the process. The entire team at The Dog Wizard is truly dedicated to setting dogs (and their families!) up for success so they can live their best doggy lives. Communication throughout the program was excellent ‚Äî we especially loved getting photo and video updates, including all the fun field trips to dog-friendly places with his new doggy friends!

The aftercare support has also been outstanding. When Teddy came home, we were given plenty of time, guidance, and tools to keep the progress going. Consistency is key, and it‚Äôs so comforting to know we‚Äôre not doing it alone. We're really looking forward to joining the weekend graduate social meetups too!

Thank you again to Briauna and everyone at The Dog Wizard Fort Myers ‚Äî you have truly made such a difference for Teddy and for us!

Kat at The Dog Wizard was amazing with our dog, Aldo. He went through the Jumpstart program and came home with excellent skills because of her connection to him. She has also been very informative and supportive in helping us to feel more confident and comfortable keeping up with his training. We're so grateful to Kat and would recommend her to anyone looking for a patient and professional trainer who truly cares.

Before training with The Dog Wizard Tampa, Miya was a handful‚Äîlots of jumping, pulling on walks, and getting overly excited around people and other dogs. It was tough to enjoy walks or have guests over without her getting too worked up.

After working with Deirdre, Miya has made such great progress. She walks calmly on a leash (even in stores), listens better, and can hold her place when people come over. It‚Äôs been a huge difference!

We just got a new puppy, so we know we‚Äôll need to keep up the work with Miya, but we feel way more confident now thanks to the training. The after-support from Dog Wizard has also been super helpful‚Äîwe really appreciate knowing they‚Äôre still there for us if we need guidance. Highly recommend them!

Saying Reece transformed our dog Pickles‚Äô life would be an understatement. We approached the process cautiously hopeful, as we had a very fearful dog who was reactive and uncertain about the world around him. We chose the two-week board-in program and are grateful we did. Reece was incredibly compassionate and gentle with him, taking extra time to ensure he got the best possible start. Now, we have a more confident dog who follows all commands and walks calmly on a loose leash. There‚Äôs still progress to be made, but with new tools and lifelong support, we have peace of mind. Thank you to all the trainers at Dog Wizzard for caring so well for Pickles.

We brought our 4 month old puppy in for training with The Dog Wizard and it was the best decision we‚Äôve made! Teddy had problems with his confidence, as well as biting, leash pulling, and listening to commands. His trainer, Amado, was incredible! He came home as a confident, well trained puppy. During his training he learned to sit, go to his crate, go to his bed, properly walk on a leash, and most importantly, stay during all of these commands until told to break. He got to play with other puppies and go on outings to stores and parks, which helped so much with his socialization. I can‚Äôt recommend The Dog Wizard enough.

Thank you so much to Amado and the team!

Our experience with dog trainer Deirdre at The Dog Wizard was incredible. We have a 1 year old English Setter named Murphy, that had unlimited energy and needed serious obedience training. We were dealing with issues related to leash pulling, no recall on/off leash, barking, on leash reactivity & all the normal puppy behaviors. After our two week board & train program experience - I couldn‚Äôt recommend Deirdre highly enough - as she was a dog training expert and the nicest person to have worked with. Murphy is now able to follow all basic commands (on AND off leash), has 100% recall off leash, more comfortable in public surroundings around dogs and remains right by my side during walks. Deirdre provided unlimited Murphy updates (videos, pictures), provided clear easy to understand psychology for her methods as well as explanations for Murphy‚Äôs behavior, showed Murphy love/compassion/proper leadership - and more importantly taught ME how to be a better dog handler. I couldn‚Äôt recommend her services highly enough if you need help with any kind of dog training - she treated Murphy like he was her own!

This is our second time using the dog wizard, and this was more for ensuring our dog felt comfortable around our toddler and was less reactive. Deirdre was our trainer and really great to work with. She was able to help us with feeling more confident around managing various scenarios in our home and reducing his anxiety around new environments. The videos from class of working with our dog was a really great way to keep us up to date on how his training was going, as well as review when trying to recall training tips. She was also very flexible with working with our schedule and is a great teacher. We would recommend the Dog Wizard to anyone wanting some help with understanding dog behavior.

My husband and I adopted Katherine (Kat) a 6 month Catahoula mix. She was joining a pack of three senior dogs and we wanted to make sure she was trained well and fit in with our other rescue dogs. Knowing her breed needs a lot of exercise and wanting to take her everywhere with us, my husband and I did a ton of research and found The Dog House LLC. Kat went to the three week Distractions Program and was trained both on and off leash for maximum flexibility for future adventures. I cannot express enough how wonderful the experience was. Both Liz and Carrie are amazing trainers. They truly care about a personalized approach to training to ensure every dog receives the right pathway for success. Not only were Carrie and Liz amazing to work with Kat absolutely loves them. Every time she sees they she lights up. Since graduation Kat has been on many adventures and specifically loves the beach and swimming. Her training has allowed her to be off leash safely with an electric collar which has provided her ample opportunities to exercise and enjoy nature. The extensive training, her recall abilities and the collar  saved us when she got spooked by a stranger and took off. She recalled and sat as she was trained without incident. Sending Kat to the Dog House LLC was the best decision we‚Äôve made for her. Five stars isn‚Äôt enough!

Everyone is amazing here! Carrie and Liz are extremely knowledgeable, very transparent throughout the entire process, and are able to provide feedback on all your questions about your dog and dogs in general.

I thought my greyhound was too independent and he would not listen. But after 3 weeks, he learned so much and had so much progress. I absolutely would come back to Carrie and Liz for any training needs.

The Doghouse kept our family together! We were having a difficult time acclimating our 5 year old golden retriever, Theo, to our newest addition to the household. After months of considering rehoming our ‚Äúfirst‚Äù baby, we contacted Carrie and Liz about our situation. Theo went through the foundation full service program and it was like picking up a different dog at its conclusion. It has now been a few weeks of everyone under the same roof again and Theo is thriving. He has a clear role and purpose in our family and his demeanor is night and day different than before. We can‚Äôt thank The Doghouse enough for investing their time and effort into Theo and we would highly recommend anyone in a similar situation to choose this program.

We rescued Lucy after she was abandoned on the side of the road as a puppy. She likely came from a hoarding breeder situation and was not provided with that human interaction as a young pup. She was dumped with 11 other doodles and animal control found that she had barbed wire stuck in the hair on her neck. She was around 6 months old when we rescued her in November of 2023. She was timid when we got her and over time she got worse. I was the only person she liked. She would run from my 2 kids and husband. She would hide in her crate and not come out. Sometimes for more than 24 hours. She would refuse to go outside to go potty even though she was potty trained. We couldn‚Äôt put her in the car because she would poop in the car. She was stressed out all the time, even at home.

We finally found Liz and Carrie and the obedience they taught her through foundations training probably saved Lucy‚Äôs life. She is a totally different dog now. She is much happier and allows everyone to love on her. She no longer hides in her crate and loves to be in her ‚Äúplace.‚Äù She is no longer stressed out all the time and loves sitting shotgun on car rides. We cannot thank Liz, Carrie and team enough!

I can't say enough good things about The Doghouse! We put our 3 year old pit/staff mix and 8 month old JRT in the distraction program and we couldn't be happier with the results! From our initial consultation and evaluation, to each training session and drop off, we felt informed and supported. Carrie and Liz are incredibly knowledgeable, professional, and communicative. They took such great care of our babies and truly cared about their development. Thank you so much!

provider_name: The Florida OCD Autism and Anxiety Treatment Center (FLOAAT Center)
review_text: Dr. Gayle and her team were incredibly accommodating and even offered me a weekend appointment to fit around my work schedule. More importantly, they were genuinely kind and compassionate. As an adult seeking testing, it can be difficult to find practitioners who are patient and understanding, but Dr. Gayle and her team were different. They took me seriously from the start, and now, six months post-diagnosis, I finally feel like I‚Äôm making real progress in reclaiming my life

provider_name: The Florida OCD Autism and Anxiety Treatment Center (FLOAAT Center)
review_text:
The FLOAAT Center is outstanding! From the first contact, you‚Äôre met with kindness and professionalism. Dr. Gayle and the clinicians are compassionate, thoughtful, and thorough, taking the time to understand each client‚Äôs unique needs.

Their expertise in diagnosing and treating autism, ADHD, OCD, anxiety, and more is exceptional, making them a trusted resource for children, adolescents, and adults. They create a comfortable, supportive environment that makes seeking answers much easier.

I highly recommend the FLOAAT Center for anyone seeking excellent care or considering joining their dedicated team!

provider_name: The Florida OCD Autism and Anxiety Treatment Center (FLOAAT Center)
review_text: I have had a great experience working at the FLOAAT center. Dr. Gayle is very knowledgable and compassionate, and she truly cares about creating a supportive environment for everyone.

provider_name: The Florida OCD Autism and Anxiety Treatment Center (FLOAAT Center)
review_text: Working at the FLOAAT center has been such an amazing experience and a true blessing! They have an amazing clinical team with a wide range of background experiences, providing clients a comprehensive approach to care! Their dedication to helping others is reflected in their high-quality of work! So happy to work alongside side the FLOAAT care team members! ‚ô•Ô∏è

provider_name: The Florida OCD Autism and Anxiety Treatment Center (FLOAAT Center)
review_text: It is a pleasure working with and for Dr. Gayle. She strives to provide compassionate, comprehensive, and professional care to each and every client that seeks her services through FLOAAT.

I‚Äôm thankful for The Gallery and their staff.
I moved my mother who is suffering with Alzheimer‚Äôs and Dementia into The Gallery Assisted Living June 2024. This was after she lived with me for ten months. At the time, The Gallery was going through upper management changes for the better. The new Director Stephanie Smith took the reins, hiring a new Director of Nursing, Jen, and other staff where needed. Stephanie has a lot of management experience handling the issues of a Senior Care Facility. She and the current staff are very customer service oriented. Seems more like a hotel, than a senior care facility. For awhile, mom actually thought she was in a hotel.
I went through 10 months of H3ll with mom when she lived with me. I couldn‚Äôt get help from her primary and memory care doctors. After mom moved into The Gallery, her different symptoms of her disease manifested themselves.  Stephanie, Jen and Tabitha were there to help mom, which helped me. I was at my ropes end with mom. Because of their experience, they were able to get mom the help she has desperately needed. Currently, mom is advancing with her disease and has moved from Assisted Living to Memory Care Wing.
Right now, I highly recommend The Gallery. Thankful for the care, support and cleanliness of the facility.
I highly recommend considering The Gallery for your loved one.
Best wishes! Dan S.

After a recent week long visit I wanted to update my review.  The current staff could not be more attentive and caring! Jody the activities director is an amazing caring soul that takes the time to understand and attend to the independent needs of each resident.  She keeps a watchful eye and is sure to provide family with first hand knowledge of our loved ones.  My Aunt has been a resident in the Memory Care at The Gallery at Cape Coral for almost five years and loves it!  She recently celebrated her 91st Birthday and team member Julie Carver went out of her way to make the birthday memorable!  She helped us in ordering the cake and even picked it up and took wonderful photos for distant family members to view.  The nurses and caregivers are all very attentive and quick to inform family of any potential issues.  So many people have nightmare experiences with Assisted Living facilities for their loved ones - I feel the current team is attentive and quick to remedy an issues.  I am grateful to Julie!  And the activities personal also top flight - engaging the special needs of seniors with memory care issues. All of the aides especially Brenda and Ingress are attentive and quick to offer assistance.  I feel confident in the care we are receiving!

The Gallery of Cape Coral is absolutely amazing! The rooms are beautiful and always spotless. The staff is incredibly attentive and quick to respond to any questiom or concerns. They offer extensive activities, along with delicious food that my grandmother truly enjoys. She couldn‚Äôt be happier here, and that gives our whole family such peace of mind. We highly recommend The Gallery to anyone looking for a caring and vibrant community.

The Gallery AL took real good care of my Mom.  From, the staff who cared for her daily, to the nurses, and even the front desk staff, I felt she received excellent care.  The rehab she received in their gym was also outstanding.  The staff listened to my suggestions and implemented some of them (a fryer in the kitchen, for chicken tenders!) I also felt the facility, was very well maintained and CLEAN!

Recently we moved my Mom to Memory Care from Assisted Living at The Gallery, Cape Coral.  The Memory Care unit is amazing.  My Mom stays active with their many activities with Jody, the activities director! She is fantastic!! Lots of energy and gives out lots of love!!!  The Director of Memory Care, Julie Carver is also wonderful and very very focused on the residents!!  She works well with her staff and her residents. I love how she has subtle suggestions to help my Mom as she advances through her disease.  She is VERY approachable and always available.  The food and staff are the best.  Thanks Julie!!  My Mom loves it there and is very comfortable.  I would highly recommend The Gallery Memory Care Unit in Cape Coral!

Genius Kids in Hallandale Beach is truly a gem! My son absolutely loves going to school every day, and it‚Äôs heartwarming to see how much he‚Äôs learning and growing. The teachers are caring, patient, and incredibly dedicated, creating a safe and nurturing environment. The curriculum is engaging, and the fun activities keep my little one excited to learn. We‚Äôre so grateful for this wonderful preschool! Highly recommend Genius Kids to any parent.

A great school. Our son loved it. The teachers are very dedicated and loving. I would recommend this school for families where both parents have full time jobs. Their schedule is very accommodating. Thank you so much for taking care of our son. He still talks about Ms Luz and his friends.

Discovering this preschool has been the best experience for my whole family. The knowledgeable staff not only recognized my daughter's unique needs but also guided us through the journey of understanding and addressing them.
As my daughter is now prepared for kindergarten, I am immensely grateful for the positive impact The Genius Kids Academy has had on our lives. The early intervention and personalized attention have not only facilitated improvement but have also gained a lot of  confidence and love for learning. I highly recommend school to any parent seeking a preschool that goes beyond academics, fostering growth and readiness for the next educational milestones. Thank you, The Genius Kids Academy, for being the light that guided us toward a brighter future.

My daughter is member for 3 years already. They learning every day something new.
Our child was going to other ballet school, but she just loves ballet with Claudia. Claudia is the best ballet teacher.
We love our child teachers and we are very happy.
Thank you!

Wonderful kindergarten! My son loves to go there, wonderful teachers. Children do physical education, do crafts. The kindergarten has a wonderful atmosphere for children. We like everything very much, I highly recommend it.

February 2025 Review: Because I've had physical therapy twice before (Shoulder & Foot), I feel I have something to base my experience on. The location was a bit smaller than what I have experienced in the past. Sitting down at a community table to discuss my therapy & to have my bandage opened & changed among everyone else there was something I had never experienced before. Private health information & wounds were always cared for privately. Of course, the therapy itself was in a large open room similar to the one at Hale Hand Clinic... Karen was very kind and knowledgeable. I was pleased with my therapy & my progress thus far... Can't wait to see her Friday to show her what I can do now!!

MARCH 2025 Review: PAPERWORK... Should be offered to be filled out BEFORE arriving. The first time I went in February, I had left-hand surgery & could still use my right hand to fill out the paperwork... However, less than a month later I had right-hand surgery and could NOT use my right hand to fill out paperwork. Thank goodness there was someone kind enough to fill out the paperwork for me, but if given the ability to fill out the paperwork online before the appointment - it would've been MUCH easier & more comprehensible!

JUNE 2025 Review: I'm done! Both hands are feeling great! I needed some Iontophoresis therapy & that utilizes electrical currents to deliver  corticosteroid through the skin, to reduce inflammation and pain in my hands. Karen would massage both hands (palms), wipe off the lotion with alcohol, inject the Dexamethasone onto a pad (with a built in battery) that was connected to the Iontophoresis machine (using electrical stimulation (electrodes). Ions in the substance use the charge of the electrical current to deliver the medication by repelling each other like magnets.), stick it to my hands, & then put the 2nd electrode pad will be filled with saline & placed on my arm to help conduct that electrical connection, so to speak...

THERAPIST: Karen is Awesome! Sometimes there are double bookings of clients, but don't worry! For instance, when I was on the Iontophoresis machine, there wasn't anything she could do for me, so she was with someone else, but was always Very Close by to help if needed & pay attention...

This place is Great!

I‚Äôm glad that I was referred to The Hale Hand Center they all knows what they are doing and it shows, each of the therapist is passionate and provide good customer service and very good bedside manners. All the therapists at The Hale Center ‚ÄúYou all Rock including the owner ‚ÄúYou rock for hiring such caring healthcare workers. All I can say is my doctor sent me to the right place I have no regrets. Even my baddest days are my good days because everyone is so polite and well mannered.
I

The Hale Hand Center did an outstanding job in helping me get my range of motion back in my finger after surgery. They were always caring and very knowledgeable, especially Sadie whom I had most of my visits. Would highly recommend them for Therapy.

Knowledgeable and friendly therapists.  Appointments consistently start on time.  Great variety of techniques to address hand issues.  They worked collaboratively with my surgeon to ensure alignment on rehab.
Hale hand was an awesome place to receive Physical Therapy to recover from shoulder surgery. I would highly recommend Sadie and staff to anyone needing a great physical therapist.

Dr. Beth is the best chiropractor I have been too. Her holistic approach and knowledge of the body makes her adjustments exactly what I need at that time.
I weight train, so some days it's my hip and other times it could be my shoulder, and each time she realigns the exact area that's needs attention so I can keep going. She is my secret to being healthy and mobile.

As both a massage therapist here and someone who sees Dr. Lexi in action every day, I can confidently say her patients are in the best hands. She combines skill with genuine compassion, tailoring each treatment to what the body needs. The way she works with chiropractic care and how it complements massage is AMAZING !  I‚Äôve seen so many clients find real relief. Dr. Lexi is a wonderful chiropractor and person!

Jen Hamilton

Dr. Beth is absolutely incredible! As a mom of 3 with twins on the way, she has saved me during this pregnancy. Before I came to see her I couldn‚Äôt even cross the street due to such excruciating pelvic pain at 3 months pregnant. Now I‚Äôm 9 months pregnant and I can confidently say that she is the sole reason this pregnancy has been the easiest on my body compared to my 3 prior pregnancies, and this time there‚Äôs two babies in there! She‚Äôs incredible at what she does, she‚Äôs knowledgeable, she‚Äôs kind and she listens to you, she‚Äôs truly an outstanding chiropractor. She really goes above and beyond. Honestly, the whole team does, everyone at Healthy Family Chiropractic is so friendly, I feel like part of the fam. A fantastic team that does fantastic work! I wouldn‚Äôt ever go anywhere else.

Would not recommend it. Patients should feel like they are being cared for at each visit not pushed through quickly. Felt like I was just another number to get through, not a patient who deserved time and care.
The practice manager was very rude and dismissive. Each time I tried to ask a question, she interrupted me before I could even finish, which left me with unanswered questions. This is not the level of professionalism or care I would expect from a healthcare office.
When I tried canceling my treatment plan I couldn‚Äôt just easily sign the paper I had to set up an appointment to meet with the doctor and practice manager which during I felt interrogated with questions about why I wanted to cancel, which was very uncomfortable and unnecessary in my opinion.
On your first visit they are so welcoming and friendly, after that patient compassion is out the window.

I had a wonderful experience at The Healthy Family Chiropractic! Dr. Beth was fantastic, very knowledgeable and caring. The staff is so friendly and welcoming, and the office is clean and comfortable. Highly recommend!

Lynn is amazing! She has such a calming, kind energy and really takes the time to understand what‚Äôs going on in my life. She uses a mix of mindfulness, breathing, and other holistic tools that make each session feel really unique and personal.

If you want a therapist who truly cares and looks at the whole picture, Lynn is the one to see!

Lynn Nelson has been a results-driven therapist for many years, guiding me like a coach through life's journey. Just as no athlete steps onto a sports field without a coach, Lynn helps me navigate life challenges with clarity and support. Her wisdom and tools have been transformative. I highly recommend Lynn and her team.

Lynn Nelson Provides such valuable lifetime tools. If you‚Äôre looking to make some changes, want to really feel comfortable during a therapy appointment, and get unexpected cool results, she‚Äôs your GotU. You‚Äôll really enjoy your session. I‚Äôve worked with her on and off over the years and every time it‚Äôs fabulous.

Brittanie is an outstanding therapist. She creates a safe and welcoming space that encourages openness and honesty, which has allowed me to explore challenges I have struggled to work through on my own. Her ability to listen with genuine empathy while also providing thoughtful, practical guidance has been invaluable in my personal growth. What I appreciate most is her balance of compassion and insight. She doesn‚Äôt just listen, she helps me uncover patterns, reframe perspectives, and develop tools I can actually use in daily life. Since working with her, I‚Äôve experienced meaningful progress in my healing journey, and I feel more grounded, confident, and capable than I have in years.

I highly recommend Brittanie to anyone seeking a therapist who is not only caring and supportive but also deeply skilled and effective.

Thank you Brittanie.

I am so thankful I found Holistic Mental Health and Brittanie! I have made more progress in a few months with her than I did in almost 2 decades of therapy before coming here. I have recommended EMDR to everyone who will listen because it has truly changed my brain and helped me to recover from trauma I had been carrying my whole life. I truly could never thank her enough.

I have been seeing Dr LaPorta for 5 years and he is very compassionate and he has helped me through a lot of difficult times that I have had in the last few years. He is always giving me insight on how to deal with the situation

I came to Dr laporta a broken person who thought my past experiences would shape who I was forever. He helped me in so many ways from genuine support person to person as well as helping face these problems and move on with my life. He never pressured me to keep making appointments and taught me how to care for myself properly. I stand today a better healthier human for knowing him ‚ù§Ô∏è

Dr. LaPorta is a very experienced, compassionate and caring doctor who is sensitive to his patients needs. I am a very private person and feel very comfortable talking about anything. It is very refreshing to have a doctor who is passionate about what he does and actually wants to help his patients. He is also exceptional in working with children. My daughter is also a patient and has benefited from his extensive knowledge as well. I strongly recommend Dr. LaPorta if you need a psychologist

Dr. LaPorta has extensive experience in helping clients but more important he is compassionate and listens.  He helps his clients with a calm and steady presence, no matter how difficult or overwhelming the topic or frantic I felt I always knew 'Dr. Lou' would be there with a calm and encouraging word.  Dr. Lou's support helped me to regain my life, to go from being a person dependent on disability to working full time, graduating college and pursuing a graduate degree.  Words can never express my gratitude.

I've been going to the LaPorta Center for a few years now to help combat my social anxiety and agreeing to start seeing Dr. Laporta was one of the best decisions I‚Äôve made. With his help, I‚Äôve made great strides towards a future that not too long ago I thought was completely out of reach. Throughout every session with him I‚Äôve never felt that he was just going through the motions or was at any time at all disinterested. He truly cares about his clients and will continue to help you, help yourself no matter how long it might take, or how many times you have to try again.

My 3 year old daughter has improved greatly since starting her sessions at the Language Loft for speech delay. She started a little over a year ago at 2 years old with maybe 5 words in her vocabulary. She could barely communicate at all, which caused frustration and major behavioral issues. She has become a new kid after working with Lindsay and Jenn. She can now have conversations! She can identify what she wants and asks for it. She not only improved on her comprehension and language skills, but her behavior and manners have come so far! She has learned to take turns, and express how she feels with words. She no longer has full blown tantrums! Lindsay and Jenn do a great job of communicating with each other and customizing my daughter‚Äôs next session. For example, Lindsay will notice in her session that my daughter enjoyed a certain activity or she will hear me mention a toy she likes at home and then all of a sudden Jenn will have it set up at the next session with her. Jenn might note something that‚Äôs needs more attention and next time we come in Lindsay will focus on that in her session. I notice these little things and I really appreciate it. I was so happy to find the Language Loft. They give custom one on one help in a very comfortable setting. Lindsay made me aware of extra resources available to my daughter and guided me through the process of getting her set up with extra help through the school system to prepare her for the future when she enters kindergarten.

My daughter was diagnosed with Autism and Expressive/Receptive Language Disorder shortly after we began speech with Lindsay and Jenn.  She has been receiving services for just over a year now and has made huge strides in her speech!   We are so grateful for their kind and fun approach to learning, which they adapt to her interests and preferences to keep her engaged and motivated.  As we started the new school year with the same pre-school teacher, even she commented on how much more expressive she since the short summer break.  I can't recommend these ladies enough.

We absolutely love the language loft! My daughter spent a year with Lindsay before we moved out of state. Lindsay was always very attentive, kind and understanding. She kept her engaged during sessions which was miraculous because our daughter has autism and when we started she couldn‚Äôt sit for longer that a minute. She learned so much during her time with Lindsay and it was so hard for us to leave. We recommend the language loft as often as we can! It is definitely the very best place for your child!

Our experiences at the Language Loft have been amazing. My preschool-aged son came to Lindsay with a lot of language and social issues, and she has been patient, kind, knowledgeable, and professional in every regard. My son has improved in his language skills, which was our original reason for reaching out to Lindsay, but as a result of her work with him, he is now answering questions, taking turns when playing games, and staying engaged through the entire 45-minute session. Lindsay has some kind of magic, and I cannot recommend her highly enough!

My son has been coming to the language loft and has made huge strides forward in his receptive and expressive language skills. Lindsay and Jen have worked with my son‚Äôs needs, offered me resources and have always accommodated us. It‚Äôs a very friendly office where they provide an explanation of how each session went and how we can work with him at home. Really happy with their professionalism and care of my little guy.

We are beyond grateful that we transferred our 2-year-old to this daycare! We especially owe our thanks to Mrs. Nicole and her amazing team for taking the time to communicate with us and work alongside us to support his growth. Our son even comes home happier now and often asks to see Mrs. Nicole‚Äîthat alone speaks volumes!

We highly recommend this daycare to anyone looking for a supportive, patient, and caring environment for their child.

The Learning Experience in West Melbourne has been such a blessing for my family! From the moment we walk in, Ms Lori is always so sweet and respectful her warm energy never goes unnoticed. My daughter absolutely loves her VPK teachers Ms. Zoraida, Mrs. Tiffany, and Ms. Karen. They are incredibly patient, nurturing, and truly invested in the kids‚Äô learning and growth. Thank you to the entire team for being so welcoming, professional, and committed. It really means a lot to have such a positive and safe space for my child every day!

The name of my son's preschool speaks for itself! When my mom spoke to Ms. Deb on the phone her greeting was phenomenal! There was no need to go to visit any other preschool. Considering other preschools we give a five star plus and thank you for The Learning Experience! ‚ù§Ô∏è

The Learning Experience of West Melbourne has exceeded my family‚Äôs expectations in every aspect. We are so grateful that this high-quality, secular facility exists in our neighborhood.

The toddler program at The Learning Experience is exceptional. It is designed to foster cognitive, social, emotional, and physical growth for each child. Moreover, The Learning Experience takes great care in providing nutritious meals and snacks. Knowing that my child is well-fed, hydrated, and safe gives me peace of mind, allowing me to focus on my work.

Thank you TLE for joining and bringing such heart and thoughtfulness to our preschool and daycare community.

The Learning Experience has been wonderful for my family! As a mom who has spent most of my infant‚Äôs everyday life with her, I had a very difficult time with the thought of daycare. TLE‚Äôs willingness to reach out with any questions or updates throughout the day has given me the opportunity to stress a little less, while someone else is caring for my child. I receive constant updates throughout the day, IE: diaper changes, what she had for breakfast, snack, lunch, bottles. I receive photos of my child as well. They also are willing to let you stop in and visit to view your child‚Äôs classroom whenever you feel the need (which many daycares want a heads up, and don‚Äôt let you go to their room).
I arrived the other day early, and got to watch my child playing and smiling with Ms Jennifer and Ms Sonia and it made my heart smile. My child has also had difficulties with the crib and they have been so willing to work with her. They‚Äôve rocked her during nap time and have started to lay her on a mat to work on the process of the crib.
My daughter comes home every day with a smile on her face and another smile when we arrive in the morning.
Ms Cassie and Ms Lori have been extremely helpful, and so understanding of the first time daycare experience for a child. Always, willing to answer questions and leave the communication open for any concerns.
When making such a huge decision on daycare, we made the right one! Would most definitely recommend TLE.

We love the Learning Pavilion so much!! Our experience at the Baby House over the past year for our 1-yr-old was fantastic. Her teachers truly care about her, so many other staff know her by name, the classroom is a joyful place every time I walk in, staff and teachers take time to interact and play with the children, and all meals and snacks are included (if you‚Äôve ever packed lunch for a toddler you know how helpful that is!!). Our daughter is so excited to go to ‚Äúschool‚Äù every day and see her friends and teachers. We are so thankful for the amazing staff and fantastic environment they create!

Over the past few summers, I have been going to The Learning Pavilion to volunteer for a few weeks in the baby house to get community service hours. Overall, I had a really great experience. From the moment I called to inquire about a spot for my son I had a good feeling about this school. Ms. Faye was very kind and patient with our son who is special needs. She had him on a routine and he was doing well, but he was suddenly moved out of her class. He went from excited to clinging to me crying most days. One woman wouldn't even acknowledge us when we dropped him off. It was a big difference; Ms. Faye would explain what he did that day and was getting him closer to potty trained. She knew what each child ate and how much. After he switched classes I received more updates through the app but they were always pictures of other children. I also had a difficult time getting info; I'd have to speak to three different people usually before I got an answer to any questions I had. We ultimately decided to enroll him in VPK elsewhere due to this. We did like the fact that they offered meals and the facility is very clean. One big plus is the on-site therapy. Rachel is very communicative and would leave updates for us.

I have had the pleasure of being in the pre-K building several times in the past 3 months and . Seeing the interaction with the teaches and administration with the children is simply amazing. I would recommend the school to all of my friends and family.

Guys! Goodmorning & I just had to let you know about the lighthouse project. I have a 5 year old with ADHD & my toddler has autism and they have walked me every step of the way and have gone above and beyond for my kids so many times over and over. It truly brings tears to my

They are amazing, very professional and great people to work with. I have seen how they work and everything is organized and well planned. They find the most comfortable way to make your kids feel welcome.

I‚Äôm so excited about the different groups she‚Äôs now offering at her new clinic space! If you‚Äôre in the Tampa area, I highly recommend using Little Years Therapy!

We got our sweet Goose from loyal paws and can‚Äôt recommend them enough. A paradise for both rescued animals and the humans that love them! Best experience to have!! From holding bunnies to feeding the goats. And I‚Äôm not normally an outside girly. Plus staff and owner is super sweet.

i honestly wish a facility like this didnt exist as someone who, at the time of writing this, is in it. one of the first problems you will run into here is not receiving medication. one client who is epileptic didn‚Äôt get their medication for their epilepsy for at least 3 days, resulting in them having 2 seizures, at least that is what they told me. the lack of communication between staff and clients its actually apalling. most times two members of staff on the same shift won‚Äôt even have the same information for you for the same exact question. one of the worst cases of this is their system, or lack thereof, for passes. one day passes aren‚Äôt permitted during group hours at all, but numerous people are out on pass during group when you were just told that you can‚Äôt. then the next day someone is being punished for the pass they were allowed to go on by being told to attend night classes for missing morning group, but then the next day no one in the morning group can attend night group unless they‚Äôre working. one day you have to turn your pass in the day before you intend to leave, the next it has to be the day of and you‚Äôre gaslighted into believing you weren‚Äôt getting them submitted the day before for weeks. then multiple people who got jobs get demoted to iop and ‚Äúdischarged‚Äù aka kicked out within a week and have nowhere to go. sometimes your counselor forgets to put in your pass and then revokes them to cover their own ass! happened to me! their cups used to test clients repeatedly provide incorrect results, but you will be punished regardless. but the worst part of this program has to be the snobby, disrespectful, unprofessional, nasty clinical director. he‚Äôs amongst the shockingly high number of staff who aren‚Äôt in recovery and have merely studied it. whoever his higher up is allows him and his staff to cultivate a culture of gossiping about clients. i‚Äôve been called a liar and an unhappy person both by dr. b in front of multiple other clients, due to false information spread by his staff, and i had the audacity to be upset that nothing was done to fix the situation. not getting my passes back, excusing his counselor not putting my pass in, and even going as far as to quote some uncited study that marijuana only lasts in your urine for a week‚Ä¶ and incase you‚Äôre like me and despise ai, dr. b is perfectly fine with his counselors and doctors using chat gpt in front of clients to fill out our charts or to even give us a response back on what we just said. ontop of the toxic and dysfunctional environment, the place is also crawling with predators. my third day here i was given a tech‚Äôs phone number telling me to ‚Äúkeep it between us.‚Äù thank god i was wise and secure enough to report it, but who knows how many other clients were not like me in that regard. they charged a client‚Äôs insurance twice, use names of doctors who don‚Äôt work there on their paperwork, and the mentality there is to have each others backs against any complaints or concerns from clients, even when their wrongdoing is clear as day. this is just what i‚Äôve been made aware of and what has happened to me. i sincerely beg anyone who considers this facility, or any other facilities that would refer their clients here, STAY AWAY!! DON‚ÄôT GIVE THIS PLACE ANYMORE MONEY! my heart aches to think of all the people that will come through their doors and have to suffer through this program. there are countless other treatment centers in broward county and in south florida, save yourself the headache and go ANYWHERE else.

The 2 star rating in no way reflects my opinion of the message of hope that recovery programs convey. There were several bright spots. Scott and Dan, the 2 primary facilitators, were living, walking examples of hope on a daily basis. In spite of the chaos they endure daily, they were able to demonstrate patience and tolerance consistently day after day. Novak and Rebecca also displayed nothing but tolerance and professionalism on a daily basis. Thank you Wayne and Jaz and the few clients I met that gave me hope. The simple truth is this! The organization is poorly managed. I repeat, the organization IS POORLY MANAGED. Technicians are too few for too many. The female you speak with when you initally inquire will answer your questions dishonestly. Beware of any facility that does not vet the clients prior to admission. The patient to non patient ratio is sadly left wanton. This being magnified by the patient's that are enrolled not for recovery purposes but for free lodging and food. The environment is more akin to a "homeless encampment".  28 to 60 year old patient's with grade school life skills, and ALL BELIEVE THE WORLD OWES THEM MORE.  Constant group disruptions and behavior's you would expect at a preschool. Total lack of structure and zero consequences for behavior's that would result in jail or prison in the outside world. Rampant drug and alcohol use in housing, unchecked. Career hardened criminals caught red handed stealing repeatedly are allowed to stay in spite of the crime. I am mentally exhausted after a 33 day stay. That was my experience. I spent time at 2 of the 3 male residences and they are both absolutely FILTHY and infested with cockroaches. I was told that the residences were professionally cleaned every 3 weeks, which is totally untrue. I was also told all 3 male residences were totally remodeled within the last 90 days. Also untrue. I was told by the female "recruiter" that they limit the number of occupants in the men's residences to 7. Sadly, another lie. 16 men, 2 bathrooms, appliances that do not work, sinks that do not drain, bunk beds, and disgusting interiors of the transportation vans all were contributing factors to my discomfort. I was also told there are weekly recreation nights. Movies, dinners out, and beach trips . Yep, you guessed it another lie. This is definitely not a luxury rehab.  The facility occupies two suites in a strip mall that appears to have been built in the late seventies or early 80s. DO NOT BELIEVE WHAT YOU READ ON THE WEBSITE as it pertains to the facilities. And definitely do not believe anything the female recruiter tells you. During the day there are approximately 60 to 70 patients crammed into 2 suites of a strip mall and only 2 bathrooms and 2 facilitators. If you are serious about recovery, Look elsewhere!

My experience started out rough but that changed and as hectic as it gets the staff shows up for us. Ed gave me hope, Dan gave me experience and strength, Scott gave me knowledge and Jamie gave me his time when no one else could along with a great tool through a video he suggested that showed me some new coping methods!! Tenisha was my therapist and she listened to all my shit with a smile along with good coping skills she gave I had a good experience ! PUT IT THIS WAY THE STAFF ARE ALL HUMAN ! Yes there are flaws and the owner is responsible for most of them! BUY A VAN OR TWO ! Sometimes it is good to clear the way for new employees that are stagnant and not helping but hindering and causing a lot of added stress and more problems for the clients ! Oh Charlton always made the long rides fun and got me laughing when I was sour ! Shawna has a huge heart and she and I relate on things and I could go to bed anytime! Thanks to all the Luminous staff I will leave tomorrow with 95 days sober!

I want to thank Luminous Care center for being the turn in my recovery. I especially want to thank Edward when I arrived I was physically and emotionally depleted Edward was the one person who helped me get into a detox and was very supportive his compassion is truly what addiction centers need I know he genuinely cares for the clients.I couldn't thank him enough .I've learned so much from Dan's groups I thank him for the tools I've learned . I was able to successfully complete the program due to the structure and support I received there thank you so much Luminous Care

My first time in treatment and my last time. With all the resources given and provided, i am more than confident to return back home to continue my recovery not just on my own but with a great forever support team. With the help of my therapist, Sean McCray, his groups and sessions dug real deep; through acceptance I have no need to take any pain back home with me.Dan, one of the facilitators, runs very impactful groups.Although all groups with Dr.B are Scott impressionable. Angie and Miranda, the case workers, took care of everything with me(food stamps, court and probation). Shout out to my house mom, Shauna, she so understanding and a recovery cheerleader! Shout out to ALL THE TECHS! And shout out to Ed, the Alumni coordinator, ‚ÄúIf he can do it, you can do it‚Äù! And the new therapist Lisa, shes got great input and advice.‚ÄúPain isn‚Äôt tragic, its magic‚Äù! Thank you for that and THANK YOU LUMINOUS!

Casey has been wonderful since the first time we communicated. She‚Äôs incredibly knowledgeable and helpful. I first contacted her when I had tweaked my back and didn‚Äôt end up seeing her for it ‚Äî a few months later I tore my Achilles and she basically helped me cope through it all. After doing a few PT sessions through my insurance plan I then did private sessions with Casey. I would recommend these to anyone because there‚Äôs nothing better than getting a physical therapists 100% attention. She gave me a lot of time and consideration as well as homework :)

I not only trust Casey to help me heal but also gained a friend in the process!

Casey is amazing! She really took her time with me and wanted to understand exactly what was going on with my lower back so she could tailor the treatment plan specifically to my needs. She‚Äôs incredibly knowledgeable and she looks at things with a holistic perspective, which I so appreciate! It‚Äôs hard to find medical professionals who not only have the knowledge and skill to be the best at what they do, but that are also intent on treating the whole patient, not just a specific symptom or problem. I couldn‚Äôt recommend Casey more!!

Doctor Casey,
Never have I felt more confident and comfortable with a PT / Doctor. She really is an amazing person and not only cares about rehabilitation of an injury, but treating into the future to strengthen muscles needed. Very personal, very intelligent, doesn‚Äôt sugarcoat the truth and finds solutions to problems. Would recommend to everyone I know. Hard to find a good physical therapist that pushes you, challenges you & gets to the root of the problem. One of the best.

I‚Äôve worked with a lot of strength coaches/trainers, and Casey is by far the most knowledgeable one out there. I first came to Casey after years of chronic neck pain, and Casey knew exactly how to allow me to continue strength training without triggering my pain. Since working with Casey, the episodes of pain are so few and far between, and when they do happen, I recover much quicker. My strength and stamina have both improved significantly, and Casey makes each workout so much fun that it‚Äôs the highlight of my day. I‚Äôve never had another trainer that not only works with me on strength and conditioning, but can also attend to my needs when it comes to therapies like cupping, dry needling, soft tissue work, etc.

Many people dread going to the gym, but I get so excited every day that I get to train with Casey. Each plan is customized to your individual history, goals, and lifestyle, and I would recommend The Movement Lab to anyone and everyone!!! It will be the best thing you can do for your body, and anyone who gets to experience working with Casey is so lucky!

Casey has been such a gift to my family. She began treating my 13 year old daughter after her foot surgeries. Casey didn‚Äôt just focus on her feet but instead took a whole body approach to her healing. She has treated my daughter like she was her own. I am confident that my daughter will be a healthier and better athlete because of Casey‚Äôs care. Casey is truly a wealth of knowledge and her passion for Physical Therapy is inspiring. I have loved working with her so much that she is now treating my husband and I as we train for a marathon. She is the best of the best!!

Dr. Amy is just amazing. We started seeing her when my son was about 3-4 months old for torticollis. He was going to a well established local PT center but we were seeing little progress with traditional therapy. We started working with Dr. Amy and saw so much progress. Each time we seemed to be plateauing our other PT would ask when we would be going back to her. She takes a whole body approach and it makes all the difference. Our son needed oral ties released and she was upfront but compassionate when talking to me about it, exactly what a new mother needs. She worked with us on reaching milestones, overcoming torticollis and pre/post release bodywork. My only wish is that we had started working with her sooner. I think our breastfeeding journey may have been successful and it would have saved us a lot of time and stress overall. I can't recommend her enough.
Amazing work by Dr.Amy. Great communicator and provided visual homework so that my son can get better. She takes in-depth notes so that you get the most out of each session. I highly recommend her!

Not sure where to begin, she‚Äôs amazing for newborns and adults alike. Amy is a warm, fun, welcoming person and it‚Äôs clear she loves what she does. Our son had tongue, lip, and cheek ties causing his torticollis, she was essential in preparing him for his release and even more so afterwards. I found I had the same issues as my son and had my tongue tie cut and started seeing her. After years of massages, the chiropractor and trying many other things, she‚Äôs been the most instrumental in helping me heal from trauma of past injuries and overcoming any plateaus in my progress. It‚Äôs amazing how much tension we store in our nervous system from stress and trauma, and she‚Äôs helped me understand and work through this. I‚Äôm shocked at how these simple approaches and stretches are so important in our emotion and physical healing. It‚Äôs 100% worth trying, for yourself and for your kids. Thank you Amy.

Dr. Amy helped us identify what milestone our child should work on and how to tangibly meet that goal. She spent a great deal of time with us to ensure we felt comfortable doing various exercises. She is a valuable resource and we would highly recommend her services. Thank you!

Don't walk. Run to Dr. Amy's! My little guy was able to progress after seeing many specialists with in a day of working with Dr. Amy. She really has a way to individualize and dial in on a child's specific needs. She is so caring and also makes sure you leave well informed and feeling completely supported.  I wish we lived closer I would have weekly sessions with her at the very least. Sending all my love to all the mamas and papas out there. You have come to the right place!

Here on Sunday, April 6, 2025. Is there new ownership again? My husband and I were the only ones in the store for 5-10 minutes. Younger guy at the counter never looked at us or said anything. Not even when we walked right by him. He was too busy looking at his phone I guess. I have never until today had a bad visit here. Did not purchase anything.

Both my cat and dog ABSOLUTELY LOVE THE FOOD FROM HERE especially the goat milk ! Every time I walk in, the service is unbeatable and they really do care about your pets ! Petco and Petsmart could never compare to the high quality products they sell

Knowledgeable and friendly staff, they listen and give advice to help you. I called looking for something to assist in giving my pet her meds, she got sick and refused to eat or take her meds. I tried everything I could to mask the pills. They suggested a pill paste that had good feedback. I picked some up and it worked! The paste can cover any size pill, it has a smooth texture, and it smells good like bacon. Our dog enjoys it. I really appreciate their advice and help. Thank you!

Go here! SUPPORT LOCAL!!!! The service I received is the kind of CUSTOMER SERVICE every other should have out of their employees! I bought a harness and I was showed how to put it on her and many other useful tips! I'll be back there for sure!!

.. it's hard to believe i haven't written a review on this store before this. my wife did her usual diligent due research and got us to Naturally Healthy Pet store years ago. i'll drive by at recent count 9 pet food stores to shop with local owners Jerry and Basil their knowledge and expertise in pet food and supplies is unmatched .. our current dog Maggie is always greeted with a smile a pet and loves to shop for her favorite treats and food..  thank you for the personal touch and attention.

provider_name: The Neck and Back Pain Institute
review_text:
I visited Dr. Bass with my husband because I had been experiencing persistent lower back pain for over a year. My husband also had pain, though in a slightly different area.

Dr. Bass asked me a few questions and then surprised me by suggesting that, in addition to my back pain, I might also have discomfort in my groin area where the leg bends. To my astonishment, he was absolutely right! I had been dealing with that pain for over 20 years, but I had grown so used to it that I barely noticed it anymore. In all these years, no doctor had been able to explain the cause or offer a real solution. No one even considered it‚Äîbut Dr. Bass identified it right away! I was genuinely shocked.

After performing a few assessments, he showed me that I had a misalignment in my lower back, which was causing one of my legs to rotate outward. This, in turn, contributed to both my lower back pain and the pain in my groin area. It was a complete revelation to me that everything was interconnected! Dr. Bass recommended a course of acupuncture treatment, and of course, I agreed.

My first acupuncture session was a fascinating experience. Tiny needles were placed in key areas, connected to electrical stimulation, and gently heated. It wasn‚Äôt painful, but I could feel specific muscles in my back that had been tense for years gradually relaxing throughout the session. After just one treatment, I felt a bit strange at first, but something incredible happened‚Äîmy back pain disappeared!

For the first time in a long while, I‚Äôve been sleeping on the same mattress (which I thought might have been the problem), wearing the same shoes, and yet‚Äîno pain! Before, even after regular massage therapy, my pain would return within a day or two. But this time, I don‚Äôt feel it at all!

I will absolutely complete the full course of therapy with Dr. Bass and share my further progress. But so far, he is the first doctor I‚Äôve met in South Florida who truly understands his field inside and out and takes his patients' concerns seriously.

If you're struggling with back pain, Dr. Bass is the one to see!

provider_name: The Neck and Back Pain Institute
review_text: Hi there! When i visited dr Bass the first time i couldnt walk properly,turn,sleep or do anything that a normal person would.the pain was unbearable due to a backneck injury.dr Bass and his crue took the best care of me,i dont think i have ever been treated like this by a dr and nurses in my whole life.the level of knowledge,experience and care is on a different level.i even gave my doctor the nickname Bruce Lee haha cause one quick move would take care of the problem for the day. His decompression chair works wonders!and here we are weeks later walking,sleeping and being myself again! A huge thank you to all the nurses! Sue and Lynn always worked their magic running up and down making sure im feeling good and comfortable.all the staff is above and beyond! So once again THANK YOU!

provider_name: The Neck and Back Pain Institute
review_text: I have suffered for years with back/neck problems. Everyone I have seen only ever treats a tiny portion of what‚Äôs wrong and I never get better. I went initially without high hopes but to try someone new. I cannot believe how lucky I am to have found this spot. Not only have I found a doctor who is so knowledgeable as to look at the big picture but his staff area dream. They care ona different level. They are exceptional. Because they are able to do so many modalities you are truly healing. Only 5 weeks ago I could not lay flat and lift my left leg at all. I can now lift it even with pressure being put there. I will never be pain free and fully healed because I have been mistreated for so many years that the number of issues are such that a complete fix is unattainable but because of the proper treatment now I am starting to move again and feel better. I am truly grateful to each person there and cannot recommend them enough.

provider_name: The Neck and Back Pain Institute
review_text: I visited Dr. Bass throughout both my pregnancies and had such a positive and relaxing experience.  He was so gentle and kind and his staff was so professional and easy going.  The office is very clean and well maintained.  I have continued to see him even after I had my daughters to help with those every day pains of bending and holding them and I feel great!  I highly recommend his office to anyone!

provider_name: The Neck and Back Pain Institute
review_text: Dr.Bass has changed my life! I have been living in pain for over 10 years. I have had multiple surgeries and seen multiple doctors and no one knew what it was. Finally, after coming to Dr. Bass he took xrays and started treatment right away. I am finally feeling relief for the first time in 10 years!! Thank you to Dr.Bass. His office is super clean, friendly office staff and I felt right at home. I highly recommended him to others!

**‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê Life-Rebuilding Expertise After Spinal Cord Injury ‚Äì A Physician‚Äôs Perspective**

> "As a physician who sustained a C5-C6 incomplete spinal cord injury 2.5 years ago, I entered The Neurohub with profound limitations: crippling spasticity had rendered my upper extremities functionally useless ('like pretzels'), and unrelenting pain overshadowed daily life. Today,  I write this review typing independently, with drastically reduced pain and regained autonomy ‚Äì a testament to Doro, Kristy, and their extraordinary team.

They crafted a neuroscience-backed plan targeting spasticity, range of motion and neuropathic pain. Their interventions blended advanced modalities (like neurofacilitation techniques and precision splinting) with relentless optimism.
When progress plateaued, they innovated ‚Äì adjusting strategies weekly based on my feedback and objective metrics. Their persistence mirrored my own.

Beyond physical gains, they restored my agency. Celebrating micro-wins while I rebuild my identity as both healer *and* healing patient.

> What truly distinguishes The Neurohub? As a doctor, I recognize *exceptional* care:
Their mastery of SCI neurorehabilitation exceeded academic benchmarks I‚Äôd studied but never personally witnessed.
Their empathy wasn‚Äôt protocol ‚Äì it was genuine.

If you seek OT that merges clinical excellence with profound humanity ‚Äì **start here**. They didn‚Äôt just treat me; they rekindled my belief in medicine‚Äôs transformative power.

The Neuro Hub has an AMAZING team that deeply cares for each and every client. As a caregiver, it‚Äôs so refreshing to see the support, encouragement and dedication that the OTs bring to each session with my client. Their approach to OT is personalized to each patient‚Äôs abilities, and they are constantly thinking outside the box to determine new and creative ways to make therapy FUN!  My client suffered a brain stem stroke and has been working with Doro and her team for over 5 years. We have seen significant strides in arm mobility, and are quickly approaching the goal of self feeding! Doro and her team truly go above and beyond to help their clients reach their goals.

This place is more than five stars WOW the service  one gets here is amazing. Rachael the instructor is TOP NOTCH A1 !! Thank you Rachael simply amazing, could not have asked for a better instructor. I went to Neuro Hub with knowing nothing about this , Rachael was so good passed the driving test with a breeze. Highly recommend and thank you again!!

I heard about The Neuro Hub in the podcast Noggins and Neurons, which is a simply fantastic podcast for stroke survivors.  I suffered a stroke in September of 2018, and I have been in therapy ever since.  Fortunately, I have excellent insurance and I have been able to stick with skilled therapy for longer than most survivors I know.  The stroke destroyed my motor cortex, so I was told that recovery of my shoulder, arm and hand would be very difficult, and that‚Äôs been my experience.  When I heard about The Neuro Hub, which works with chronic stroke patients, I was determined to go there for one of their custom intensives.  Finally, in October, I was able to make the trip.  I‚Äôm so happy that I did!  When you‚Äôve worked hard for almost five years and still don‚Äôt have the use of one hand, it‚Äôs quite discouraging.  Planning a trip to The Neuro Hub was a wonderful lift for my spirits.  I‚Äôve done a lot of reading about stroke rehab and brain computer interface (BCI) just makes sense.  I was optimistic that it would be a way to jumpstart my recovery, and indeed it was!  I just got home from three weeks at The Neuro Hub, and not only did I get improved active range of motion while I was there, I had what felt like a lifting of the brain fog that has been with me since the stroke.  Today I had a therapy session with MedRythms, which is a gait training therapy based on neuro music therapy.  My neuro music therapist noticed immediately that my walking was better.  I realized that the BCI had jumpstarted my walking, too.  I cannot say enough about the wonderful team at The Neuro Hub.  If you‚Äôre a chronic stroke survivor, or have a chronic stroke survivor in your family or circle of friends, you owe it to yourself to check them out.  The technology is amazing, and the traditional occupational therapy is equally wonderful.  I learned things about my body that I hadn‚Äôt known, much of it very encouraging.  I came home with a rigorous home exercise program so I can continue the high repetitions that are needed for rewiring my brain, and I‚Äôm happy to say that I‚Äôm off to a good start.  If I continue, I‚Äôm convinced that I will see more improvement.  Stroke recovery is certainly a marathon and not a sprint, but The Neuro Hub is a wonderful way to get a boost to continue running that marathon.

I have just completed my adaptive driver rehabilitation program and received my new driver‚Äôs license. it was all to the credit of Rachel Penn who through her professionalism, skills and patience guided me every step of the way even being with me up to and including passing my driving test. Rachel instructed me on the use of the hand controls necessary for breaking and accelerating and steering attachments. Rachel is an asset to The Neuro Hub and I am more than happy to recommend Rachel and the Neuro Hub for for driver rehabilitation.
Cindy was amazing and got my teeth 3 shades whiter! She is super sweet and accommodating while doing my teeth whitening service

I was a client at PBI for detox and residential / inpatient treatment. I absolutely would recommend this facility.  The staff goes above and beyond to ensure you have all that you need during treatment. The sessions and activities create a great atmosphere to truly learn tools needed to continue after treatment. Everyone is very supportive and very very genuine. Also,  I was very excited to have continued support through the Alumni program. Ashley ensured to stay in touch with me to keep me engaged. It is an awesome feeling to be an Alumni and stay connected! I am very happy with my continued journey!

Hi all!  My experience at PBI was great.  The staff, clients, alumni, and the program as a whole are super welcoming.  Being new in Florida, this was very important to me.  All events are supportive and fun, and geared toward establishing a sober network and success.  Your recovery and time there are what you make of it, take full advantage of every day!

Through detox, residential and partial housing, Palm Beach Institute was very caring, helpful and understanding! The housekeeper Dee was very respectful and hands down the best worker who needs to be acknowledged with her work. ALL the techs in residential living are so sweet and hard workers also. The food is amazing and the scenery is great. The therapist are by far the BEST I‚Äôve seen anywhere! The housing manager at housing is amazing keeping her clients on the straight and narrow track and Brooke who runs alumni is awesome! Thank you everyone who helped me through my recovery. I can‚Äôt put in words  how much this facility has saved me!

My experience at PBI was AWESOME! I gained a new appreciation for life that I had never felt before, and it was all thanks to every single staff member there, from the kitchen staff to the clinical team. The care they put into listening and advising is unmatched, and I can‚Äôt thank them enough.

provider_name: The Pediatric Feeding Institute of South Florida
review_text:
Pediatrics Feeding Institute of South Florida is the one and only best institute for feeding therapy and occupational therapy. When my daughter was diagnosed with Dysphagia,
Sever Acid reflux, and failure to thrive I was told that she would need intervention. I was referred to various occupational therapy providers in and out of state but I felt like they wasn‚Äôt experience enough or knowledgeable to help my daughter recover. My daughter will be crying in pain and refused to eat. I use to feel lost and helpless at times because I didn‚Äôt see my daughter getting better and none of the therapy were working. I got fed up and I knew that I had to advocate for her. I knew there was help out there the right one I just had to keep looking and not give up. I am so grateful that I found Pediatric Feeding institute of South Florida. They knew right away how to help her with her therapies. They used different Techniques to help
