Achieve her sensory food aversions and motor skills. Andrea helped me as well by referring me to the right doctors to help
my daughter get the right treatments. I learned so much with Andrea about my daughter eating disorders. It helped me to feel confident and to apply those skills at home when I was feeding my daughter. I‚Äôll have to say it wasn‚Äôt easy it was a long recovery but I knew I was in good hands with Andrea. But now I can say my daughter is doing so much better and no longer have no more eating problems. She is happy and enjoying her meals. Thank you so much Pediatric feeding Institute of South Florida !!!

provider_name: The Pediatric Feeding Institute of South Florida
review_text:
A Miracle in Boca Raton: A Mother‚Äôs Day We‚Äôll Never Forget

There are moments in life that redefine everything you thought you knew about love, hope, and faith. For our family, that moment came through a small boy with a big spirit‚Äîour sweet three-year-old grandson, Aiden.

For months, we watched Aiden struggle. He wouldn‚Äôt eat‚Äîonly drink milk. Mealtime became heartbreak, and our hearts ached watching this beautiful boy cry, tantrum, and turn away from food. We prayed endlessly, asking God for guidance, for strength, for a miracle.

And God answered.

He sent us to the Pediatric Feeding Institute of South Florida in Boca Raton. He sent us angels on earth, Ms Cam, Taylor McKenna and Kayla McKenna extraordinary women who not only helped Aiden, but loved him like he was their own. And how could they not? He‚Äôs a light, full of life, and it just needed to shine.

From the front staff to the therapists, every person in that office treated Aiden with patience, joy, and unwavering support. They created a space of healing, of hope. They gave him a chance.

Aiden entered an intensive feeding program. It was hard. It was emotional. But through God‚Äôs grace and the hands of these dedicated women, he passed with flying colors. Today, my grandson is eating grapes. He‚Äôs eating turkey sandwiches, eggs, fish, pretzels‚Äîand even a cupcake. A CUPCAKE!

He still loves his bottle of milk, but now he will joining  us at the table. He eats breakfast, lunch, and dinner. He smiles. He laughs. And he no longer cries at mealtime. It is nothing short of a miracle. This Mother‚Äôs Day, I received the greatest gift of all watching my grandson enjoy a meal with us, something we only dreamed of before.

To my son and his girlfriend: thank you for never giving up. Your strength has been incredible.

To the Pediatric Feeding Institute: no review, no rating, no words could ever express what you‚Äôve done for us. You deserve a hundred stars, not just five.

To any parent reading this, wondering if help is possible, yes, it is. The Pediatric Feeding Institute offers more than therapy. They offer love, understanding, and transformation. Don‚Äôt lose hope. Miracles still happen. We are living proof.

Thank you, God. Thank you, Ms. Cam, Taylor and all Therapists.Thank you, Kayla. Thank you to every single soul at the Institute. You changed our lives.

And Aiden? He‚Äôs just getting started.

provider_name: The Pediatric Feeding Institute of South Florida
review_text: Our family cannot thank The Pediatric Feeding Institute of South Florida enough for their unwavering support for the two months our son, Keegan, was in their care.  At the age of 2, shortly after his birthday, Keegan stopped eating altogether for an unknown reason.  For 4 ¬Ω years he would only drink from a baby bottle, which was his sole source of nutrition.  Following an autism diagnosis and several years of therapies that proved unsuccessful, we decided that we needed help from feeding experts.  In opening our search nationwide for a feeding program, we felt very fortunate to find this clinic a few hours from our home.  Andrea and Taylor are absolute angels!  Not only did they tackle helping our son to eat again, but they also worked through the pushback behaviors with such grace.  If Keegan was having a particularly difficult day, they moved heaven and earth to find a place/way to make him comfortable and centered for his therapy.  After 8 weeks of intensive feeding therapy, identifying a retracted tongue, performing exercises to loosen his neck (and tongue) muscles, Keegan can eat pureed food with assistance!  He has also become very enthusiastic about trying solid foods as well!  Andrea and Taylor did not give up on our son and provided us with the necessary tools to continue expanding his feeding journey.  People like Andrea and Taylor only come along once in a lifetime, and we are so very thankful that we were able to meet them and share in their company/expertise.  We would also like to thank Abrielle (OT) for keeping Keegan on track while he was away from his regular therapies.  You were a bright spot in his day!  For anyone who is contemplating reaching out for help, please don‚Äôt hesitate to do so.  I promise it will be the best decision you‚Äôve made for you and your loved one.  Keep on shining Pediatric Feeding Institute of South Florida‚Ä¶ we love you so much!

provider_name: The Pediatric Feeding Institute of South Florida
review_text:
For over 3.5 years, my son struggled to eat. He had severe sensory challenges that caused him to gag on just about everything, as well as poor oral motor coordination that prevented him for chewing properly. His diet consisted solely of Pediasure, milk, a handful of pantry (junk) foods and some purees that he ate with much difficulty. After years of failed traditional outpatient therapy, his attitude toward food only continued to worsen. The local children‚Äôs hospital overseeing his care had no remaining option for him other than a feeding tube.

In my relentless research and pursuit to get my son to eat, I stumbled upon the Pediatric Feeding Institute of South Florida and decided to get him assessed for their 8-week intensive program, to which he was admitted.

My son graduated from their intensive a few days ago, and I can‚Äôt recommend it enough. Taylor and Andrea are absolute pros at everything feeding. They used incredible food chaining methods to help my son build upon the few foods he was willing to eat, and desensitized his overactive gag reflex. They did oral motor exercises and taught him how to chew. They helped modify his extremely negative mealtime behaviours and managed his tantrums kindly and firmly. They also taught me and my husband how to feed our son so we could copy their methods at home. As a bonus, the intensive program included daily OT sessions that gave my son an outlet to release his energy and regulate his sensory system. He adored his OT, Diane ‚ù§Ô∏è

Today my son eats various types of meats, eggs, cheese, pasta, rice, all kinds of bread and spreads, different snacks, some fruit and is working his way up towards vegetables. Taylor and Andrea accomplished in 8 weeks what could not be done by all kinds of therapists over the course of 3.5 years. They have literally changed my son‚Äôs life and that of our entire family. They were the answer to my prayers. And while the work still continues here at home, my son is finally free of Pediasure and on his way to making a sustainable, healthy recovery.

Thank you, Pediatric Feeding Institute of South Florida. You are forever in our hearts and we will never forget you.

provider_name: The Pediatric Feeding Institute of South Florida
review_text:
Our 4-year-old son, Connor, attended the Pediatric Feeding Institute of South Florida for 6 weeks in May/June 2024. He entered the program eating only a few solids, receiving most of his nutrients through his 4 feeds/day of formula through his g-tube. Andrea, owner & lead therapist, was able to diagnose Connor through a virtual evaluation with oral dysphagia & indicate that he wasn‚Äôt jaw grading his food, & immediately I knew this was the right fit for us. In just a few minutes, she was able to get him to do something no one else could get him to do, & 2 weeks later we were in Florida!

Andrea & Taylor are exceptional in every way. Their knowledge, methods, & ability to adapt to each child‚Äôs needs are unmatched. They work so hard to ensure every child is successful & do not give up. They use combined approaches that include oral motor, sensory, & behavioral. Their approach was strict & firm but in a soft & positive way. It was the opposite of what I expected from ‚Äúintensive feeding.‚Äù There was a lot of playing & fun while learning about new foods & eventually trying those new foods, & no vomiting, crying, or force feeding. They use an approach no other feeding therapist had ever tried, a technique called food chaining. They start with a food your child is comfortable with, & make small changes to get them to eat new foods. Through this method Connor learned about, tried, & eventually ate so many new foods. Connor averaged 1100-1400 calories/day orally, never lost weight, and hasn‚Äôt had a tube feed since day 7 of the program. He began the program weighing 27 lbs, & continued an upward trend finishing at 31 lbs. Over the 6-week program Connor ate 30+ different new foods! As a parent I was thrilled to watch him eat a variety of healthy/protein rich foods. We no longer need to strap Connor to a feeding pump 4 times/day anymore.

Connor loved his therapists & was excited to go to ‚Äúfeeding camp‚Äù every day. They took the time to get to know each child, their likes/dislikes, & how they operate. For the little ones, they use a sticker reward system where they get to go to treasure box at end of the day. This was a great motivator for Connor! He was so proud at the end of each day.

His therapists made sure that I was comfortable replicating their methods at home & allowed me to sit in every session to observe & be a part of. They understood the anxiety I felt just trying to get him to eat, and they reduced so much of that & made the entire experience enjoyable. The hardest part is transferring their new-found skills to home, but if you stick to the program, you will be successful. Connor still tests me at home a lot but I am firm & stick to everything they taught me. We have had very few setbacks, but he remains tube free!

Children in the intensive program have 1 occupational therapy session/day in one of their two gyms equipped for climbing, jumping & all other sensory needs! The occupational therapist was incredible, she gave Connor lots of heavy pushing & pulling work which really helped him sit & eat during feeding sessions, and my son loved going to the gym each day. She answered all my questions & gave me lots of ideas for at home self-regulation & tools to use!

The location is perfect, the facility is located near so many shops & restaurants, so many well-maintained playgrounds, splash pads, & trails that are all within 15 minutes of the facility. The beaches are beautiful & a great place to take a break on the weekends! Even though we were there for intensive therapy 5 days a week, we truly enjoyed the location & amenities nearby!

Choosing this program was the best decision we could have made for our son, our lives are forever changed, and we are so grateful for the experience & help we received from Pediatric Feeding Institute of South Florida. Our only regret was not finding them sooner. Andrea & Taylor are so passionate about what they do & it shows in their work. They are the absolute best ‚Äì the dream team! We HIGHLY recommend this program!

-Parent of Connor

provider_name: The Pelvic Trainer - Jae Physical Therapy
review_text:
I am currently in my fourth pelvic floor therapy session with Jae, and the improvement I‚Äôve experienced has been incredible. From the very beginning, she has guided me with a personalized and kind approach, making me feel comfortable and supported every step of the way. In this short time, my breathing has improved significantly, my posture feels more aligned, intimacy has become more comfortable, and even everyday activities have gotten easier.
She has also been a great help in other areas of my well-being, offering guidance and practical tips that I truly value. I would recommend her to anyone going through a similar situation because she has helped me regain confidence in myself. Her step-by-step guidance has been exactly what I needed to feel in control of my recovery, and I am deeply grateful for her dedication and expertise.

provider_name: The Pelvic Trainer - Jae Physical Therapy
review_text:
I had the opportunity to be treated by Dr. Joselyn Rodriguez during the first trimester of my second pregnancy due to a uterine prolapse. I needed someone knowledgeable in pelvic floor exercises to help strengthen and correct my pelvic floor weakness, and Dr. Rodriguez was the perfect fit.

After just five sessions, I was off the treatment table with a full understanding of lower abdominal pressure management and a clear daily exercise plan to continue my progress. This not only improved my condition during pregnancy but also set me up to reduce complications postpartum.

I will definitely be returning after the birth of my son to continue caring for my pelvic floor and to focus on preventative, rather than reactive, care.

If you are looking for someone who is truly an expert in her field, look no further‚Äîyou‚Äôve found her. I hope this helps, and I wish you the best on your own journey.

provider_name: The Pelvic Trainer - Jae Physical Therapy
review_text:
As someone living with endometriosis and mixed connective tissue disease, I've long struggled with the debilitating effects of a weakened pelvic floor. The chronic pain and discomfort significantly impacted my quality of life. That's why I'm incredibly grateful to have found Dr. Rodriguez, a truly exceptional pelvic floor therapist who has provided me with outstanding care.
From my very first appointment, Dr. Rodriguez impressed me with her genuine dedication and comprehensive approach. She didn't just treat my symptoms; she took the time to understand my unique story, my medical history, and the specific challenges I faced. This thorough understanding allowed her to create a highly personalized treatment plan that directly addressed my needs.
What truly sets Dr. Rodriguez apart is her ability to deliver not only targeted therapy but also significant pain relief. Her expertise and compassionate approach have made a profound difference in my daily life, alleviating much of the discomfort I once thought was inevitable.
I wholeheartedly recommend Dr. Rodriguez to anyone experiencing pelvic discomfort. Don't wait for your symptoms to worsen. If you're struggling, do yourself a favor and book an appointment with Dr. Rodriguez immediately. Her expertise and patient-centered care can provide the relief and support you deserve.

provider_name: The Pelvic Trainer - Jae Physical Therapy
review_text: I did the dry needling and electrical stimulation on my lower back. I had only done it once but to be my first time it helped tremendously. I would like to continue with this therapy. Dr. Jocelyn is very professional and makes you feel comfortable. If you're scared to needles, you barely feel like needles, it feels like a pinch. I recommend her 100%.

provider_name: The Pelvic Trainer - Jae Physical Therapy
review_text:
Dr. Rodriguez is an absolutely wonderful doctor of physical therapy who has improved my quality of life immensely. Not only is she extremely professional and accommodating to patient needs, she has committed herself to mastering her craft by continuously adding new skills to her repertoire. She is very friendly and polite and has been a wonderful resource for all of my pelvic floor health needs.

I have recommended her to lots of expecting and current moms and have even referred my husband to her. She has helped me tremendously postpartum and again for my second pregnancy. I cannot thank her enough!

provider_name: The Play Clinic: Speech, Feeding, Occupational, and Physical Therapy
review_text: We held our daughters Third birthday at the play clinic ‚ù§Ô∏è Sirena is wonderful and made sure we had a comfortable and fun atmosphere for the kiddos. She made every effort possible to make sure all were happy and having a fun time. Having a child with autism can prove to be challenging when going to establishments, not all truly understand the accommodations that one with autism may need, but at the play clinic, I do not have to worry about a thing, and my daughter can be herself, in a safe environmentüíï

provider_name: The Play Clinic: Speech, Feeding, Occupational, and Physical Therapy
review_text: After looking for a suitable feeding therapist for my one year old daughter who refused to try and eat solids, Sirena was wonderful and very patient with her! Took a while for our baby girl to eat but we finally succeeded and happy to see she enjoys eating what we eat at home now. Highly recommend!

provider_name: The Play Clinic: Speech, Feeding, Occupational, and Physical Therapy
review_text: These people are atrocious. Months on end to get my son into this place, we got told that are insurance doesn‚Äôt pay or doesn‚Äôt pay well as they are in network. Lies, then they had him waitlisted to get OT, months, now that provider quit and sorry , so I‚Äôm not sure how long now. I will report this place, im disgusted with your unethical practices, and I‚Äôm reporting this owner to the board of medicine. Shame on you shame on you. Dr. Masterman will know how bad you treated us.

provider_name: The Play Clinic: Speech, Feeding, Occupational, and Physical Therapy
review_text: Ms. Sirena is professional, knowledgeable, and she really shows how much she cares for my daughter. My daughter is currently receiving Speech Therapy/ Feeding Therapy services and within these last few months she has been absolutely thriving! She went from barely speaking to using 3 word phrases in less than 3 months! We look forward to our sessions and we have lots of fun learning!  I‚Äôve seen an incredible improvement and I couldn‚Äôt be happier with choosing The Play Clinic! I say, look no further for an overall outstanding Therapist!

provider_name: The Play Clinic: Speech, Feeding, Occupational, and Physical Therapy
review_text: We love The Play Clinic and Sirena! We've had our 6 year old here for speech therapy and we've seen great improvement in her overall confidence and communication development. Sirena is the owner but also a SLP who has worked with our daughter from the beginning through her evaluation up to this point and we can't say enough good things about her. She's worked with our family so much, been accommodating in everyway possible while giving our daughter quality care, modifying her approach with her when we hit a few road blocks, always includes us as parents in the process explaining everything she does and why, giving us education on language development and our daughter has just continued to blossom. She vets her therapists thoroughly so I feel confident in all the therapists she hires to work with the kids. I recommend this clinic all the time as I work in ABA and come across a lot of parents looking for similar services so if you're looking for a great place for your child know we love it here!

We brought our first dog Baxter to the Puppy Ladies 13 years ago, he was the best trained dog I‚Äôve ever had. Now we‚Äôre back with Archer and have high hopes for another lifetime of success. Jean and Carwen are so gracious with their time, sadly Jean be retiring soon so I wanted to make this post to say thank you for all of your years of service to our community!

Blue has become a totally different puppy from week one of puppy class to graduation. He has really came out of his shell and is a much more confident puppy. Jean taught us the best ways to socialize Blue in a safe manner so he can be comfortable. She answered all questions we had after class and really personalizes her approach to your puppy and their personality. We are so happy we came to Puppy Ladies!

I love working and taking my dog to classes with Mrs. Jean. She is very nice and knows a lot. She will help you with whatever you might be thinking about. The way she does her training is incredible and it's so nice to see the dogs get better and better every week! Our family has taken classes with her ever since we had our first dog, who recently passed away but she was such a great dog but full of energy. We took classes with her and it made such a difference. I have my own dog now and he has taken 2 different classes and a therapy class with her. Im even helping her in puppy classes now. Thank you so much!!!

Jean and her crew do an amazing job training the puppy parents!  We put three dogs through her classes, and she has had suggestions that helped with any issues we have encountered.

She is incredible with the dogs

I cannot recommend The Puppy Ladies enough. Jean is extremely knowledgeable and helpful. Thanks to her, I have a well mannered,  sweet and happy labrador. My lab was a real handful as a puppy but Jean taught us how to navigate both through the puppyhood and the awkward teenage stage. As a first time dog owner, Jean‚Äôs guidance was invaluable. The awesome thing about Jean‚Äôs classes that puppies get to both learn obedience and socialize in a safe way. We learnt a lot about dog‚Äôs body language and their needs in general. Jean‚Äôs methods are top-notch and based on good canine science. If I get another pup, the first thing we will do is book with Jean.

Traci is always a pleasure to work with. She consistently greets me with a smile and is always willing to help with anything I need. Her positive attitude and helpfulness truly stand out and make every interaction a great one. I‚Äôve had a consistently great experience with this team. The staff is always friendly, professional, and incredibly helpful. They take the time to answer all of my questions thoroughly‚Äînever making me feel rushed or like an inconvenience. What stands out most is that everyone I‚Äôve interacted with does their job with a genuine smile and a positive attitude. Their commitment to great customer service really shows, and it makes a big difference. Highly recommend!

The staff is exceptional, but every time I come in I see Traci truly engaging and getting things done. I‚Äôve never had a bad experience at the clinic. The atmosphere and energy is always the best! Thank you guys !!

This clinic is the best in town. They are always very responsive and take the time to make sure you understand everything. Traci is always very kind and informative. Definitely get your medical card with them at the Releaf clinic.

The releaf clinic is the place to go no matter who you are. Customer service and pricing is exceptional. I have yet to jave a bad experience in person or telehealth. So if you want a Dr's who care ans want to make life easy on you go woth the releaf clinic. Veteran approved

This was my second visit with Releaf, so 14 months  with them. They make it so easy!! And prices are comparable to other in same arena.

They follow up, tell you exactly what you need to do or send and repeatedly tell you if there are any issues, contact them ; thought I‚Äôve not  needed to as they make it to seamless.

I didn‚Äôt realize how awful my previous doctor was. Well, he was great. His office staff left it up to the patient to call,  track  renewal and/or recs needs. I had to send my card info via text which always made me uncomfortable.

RELEAF is professional but also not a stuffy office , if that makes sense. And they do the reminder calls/emails . I am very happy to have Releaf recommended to me  via social media. I have started recommending it to others and I know I‚Äôm in good hands with Releaf.

Danielle is absolutely wonderful! She is patient and caring. She takes time to listen and explain everything. She is very knowledgeable and thorough. She has greatly helped me. Her office is very clean and peaceful. I would highly recommend her for any pelvic floor therapy issues.

There is no way I can express the life changing difference that Danielle has made in my life. For 75 years I was told that my constipation issues were related to my diet, or my exercise or‚Ä¶.., but Danielle did not dismiss me ~ she used her extensive knowledge to solve my issues instead of just blaming my diet, etc.
Although she is dealing with a sensitive region of the body, I never felt uncomfortable. She is extremely respectful of your privacy, yet is able to do her job to address your issues.
My only regret is that I did not find her sooner.

Dr. Danielle has been nothing short of amazing! She is extremely knowledgeable and kind, and definitely makes you feel comfortable. She takes her time, each session never feels rushed and she very thorough at keeping track of your progress. 10/10 recommend her!!

Danielle is a fantastic physical therapist! She is kind, knowledgeable, and truly cares about her patients. She made me feel comfortable every step of the way and helped me regain strength and find relief. I highly recommend her!

I started seeing Danielle for pelvic pain related to adenomyosis and possible endometriosis. She is a wealth of knowledge and really takes the time to listen and figure out the best course of action. I highly recommend her!

I go to to laser removal and everytime I go im happy! Jessica is very professional, nice and kind. Im very glad i came here. Also the front desk assistant, Daniela is extremely sweet,knowledgeable and caring. They deserve a kudos! Customer service like this is apreciatte it and i will
Keep comming. Thank you so much girls!

Getting the full body laser treatment was the best thing I ever did! First of, it was not painful at all and it didn‚Äôt take a long time to get it done. Each session was less than 2 hours long. Claudia is the best at what she does. She makes you feel comfortable and gives you the best results possible. It took a year for my treatment to complete but now I am hair free and I feel so much better about myself. I am beach ready at any time and my skin is so smooth and soft. Even the texture of my skin looks so much better. Best of all it is affordable and it really works. Highly recommend!

Claudia is amazing! Very knowledgeable and patient. I‚Äôve done 6 sessions with her for laser hair removal and have great results. This place has the BEST prices in Tampa, clean office and great customer service. Also, their laser hair removal machine is top of the line.
Highly recommend!
amazing clinic. Laser technicians are very professional and easy to be around. The sessions go really smoothly, all the staff is welcoming and professional. great results, great prices

Had an amazing experience at Right Spinal Clinic! Claudia is an experienced specialist who will give you an honest opinion about your individual needs and provide a great service after! I started seeing results after the first treatment already!!! Recommend 10/10

provider_name: The Scott Center for Autism Treatment
review_text: Tina, Dr Fraser, and the rest of the team were wonderful throughout the entire testing process.  I could not have asked for a better experience for my son and myself, I just wish that I would have found them sooner. Thank you for the gentle way that you approached the testing and diagnosis with us and the thorough report that you provided for us in the end.  I am so grateful for you all.

provider_name: The Scott Center for Autism Treatment
review_text:
Mylissa Fraser was incredibly insightful and validating throughout the entire process. I was able to get a diagnosis for my daughter the same day and a ton of resources along with it. Mylissa Fraser is not only intelligent but she‚Äôs kind, sweet and helpful. I would recommend this facility to anyone.
10/10

provider_name: The Scott Center for Autism Treatment
review_text:
Most unprofessional. Should hire someone with experience for evaluations. The child avoided me when I wished to speak with her. The receptionist is so over the top fake it is ridiculous.
Go to Orlando if you can.

They better hope the delay doesn't indicate liability or I will be speaking with a malpractice attorney

provider_name: The Scott Center for Autism Treatment
review_text: My child attended this facility for 2 1/2 years . She was labeled as severe and billed that way but not cared for that way . I have been told she would need to possibly be institutionalized and medicated and a therapist asked me how long I would keep her for . We were left without in clinic services and pushed out for 7 months  . It‚Äôs a business and only if your child looks good on their charts ... look at other options .

provider_name: The Scott Center for Autism Treatment
review_text: This place is great!  Their testing is top notch and they have all types of therapy available.  Just beware of the wait list. It can range anywhere from 5 months to a year to either get evaluated or receive therapy.

The Sonder Autism Center is one of the best centers in Brevard county! Our son has been attending for almost 2 years and we have seen such great results and he‚Äôs learning everyday from services! He is always excited to go to school in the morning. The staff is always friendly and courteous and I would recommend to anyone who is looking for ABA services for their child!

Good luck getting your child enrolled into this place they lack professionalism to a high degree they sent me 1 email with the intake forms to get my son enrolled. I promptly sent them back the next day over a month passes by I never received any further communication from them so I start calling to inquire on when my son could possibly start the program. The manager told me she would call me back the next day after I called only for two more days to pass with no call from her. I call back again for an update only for her to email me with a fabricated story of how I never sent the documents back in that were requested and that they don't accept Health First insurance mind you my insurance is not health First. Then at the bottom of the email I am told for no apparent reason that they won't allow my son to enroll him now this is unjust and unfair as I have done absolutely nothing to be treated in such an unprofessional way. My son was recently diagnosed with autism and is in need of ABA services to get him where he needs to be and yet I'm not understanding why the staff at this place is so difficult to work with. However I have reached out to the director in orlando for assistance.

Communication at this school is ridiculous. When they were verifying my daughters insurance they couldn‚Äôt find her information. I had to have my sister log on to the website her self from work and print it out otherwise they wouldn‚Äôt been able to verify anything! Also, you rarely get a call back regarding any questions you have pertaining to registration or forms your trying to provide. The receptionist Pam couldn‚Äôt find our paperwork for over 2 weeks! That‚Äôs after I had called to follow up. So that was a 5 week period of nothing getting done. I can‚Äôt comment on the education or schooling but the administrative part of this school is a circus act. By the way, all this and I asked multiple times what tuition range is and the will not give out that information so you will be going in blind until your done with all the paper work and placement. I wish I was financially able to open a school like this.  They provide a service that‚Äôs needed but the reality is we parents are being taken advantage of with the costs of these school.  It‚Äôs a real shame.

My son went here from 7th grade to 10rh and the people who ran this place has promised it was going to be a school for special needs children and my son would get his diploma and a education but it ended up being a centEr for Autism Wich is fine but don't wasn't 4 years of my son's life and education and the Gardner funding that was supposed to be towards a school
We are so blessed to have found The Sonder Academy!! The staff is amazing. This school has been a life changer for my daughter!

provider_name: The Spine and Wellness Centers of Coral Springs
review_text:
I cannot say enough good things about my experience at The Spine and Wellness Center of Coral Springs. From the moment I walked in, the staff was welcoming, professional, and very caring. They all took the time to really listen to my concerns, explained everything clearly, and tailored a treatment plan that addressed not just the symptoms, but the root of the problem.
What really sets this clinic apart is their holistic approach and dedication to patient education. I now better understand how to care for my body outside of appointments. The office is also clean, modern, and runs on time.
If you‚Äôre looking for a chiropractor who is knowledgeable, compassionate, and truly committed to your well being, I highly recommend The Spine and Wellness Center of Coral Springs.  You won‚Äôt regret the it!

provider_name: The Spine and Wellness Centers of Coral Springs
review_text: SCHEDULE YOUR APPT ASAP! Dr. Cohen and his team have been treating me after my accident, and I have nothing but great things to say. Not only were they able to identify the accident impacted areas, but they focused on making a plan for my overall health. From the front desk staff to the break room, overall superb patient experience.

provider_name: The Spine and Wellness Centers of Coral Springs
review_text: Dr. Cohen and staff are amazing. They truly care and treat you like family. I've been dealing with lower back pain and for a few months now. . Cohen took the time to explain everything to me and what would be the best course of action. I truly do feel so much better and are able to get back to doing the things I love to do. I would definitely recommend to anyone who want to live pain free. Thank you for everything.

provider_name: The Spine and Wellness Centers of Coral Springs
review_text:
If you are ever in need of a chiropractor or physical therapy the Spine and Wellness Center of Coral Springs not only take care of your  physical needs but also your whole self. It is incredible how many treatments they have available to cater to take care of your whole self.

Their staff is incredible!! As you see there, they even got me a cake for my birthday.That is my crazy wonderful Dr Rena. She's amazing. So is  Dr Yael. The entire staff is just top notch. They treat you like family. This is definitely the place to go.

Shhh...They even have a red light therapy machine that works wonders.

provider_name: The Spine and Wellness Centers of Coral Springs
review_text:
Dr. Jared and Dr. Rena are honestly some of the best chiropractors I‚Äôve ever met‚Äîmaybe even the best in Florida. They‚Äôre not only amazing at what they do, but they also make you feel so welcomed from the moment you walk in. The rest of the staff is just as friendly and warm, especially Rachel‚Äîshe always goes out of her way to make sure you‚Äôre comfortable. Every visit, I leave feeling lighter, more relaxed, and ten times better than when I came in. I‚Äôve been coming here for years now, and I can truly say I‚Äôm hooked.

If you're in need of a chiropractor then definitely visit the spine and wellness center!!

My 3 year old son has been in speech therapy with Speak 2 Me for the past ten months and it has been a great experience working with this company from the start. I was having a bit of difficulty finding a speech therapist that could provide in home therapy, but as soon as I reached out to Stephanie she was able to sign us up and get us started right away. Our therapist, Cassidy, is a wonderful and professional young lady. It has been a pleasure every time she comes to our house for therapy services and we have seen great improvement in our son‚Äôs speech. He wasn‚Äôt saying much at all when we first started, but he has been steadily progressing thanks to Cassidy and Speak 2 Me Speech Therapy!!

Definitely the best facility for therapy for your children. The finest therapists are Arlene and Edwards. Arlene is incredibly lovely, and I adore her. My children adore her. Today is 07/23/25, and Edwards is not present, and you can see his absence. I've never met a better therapist in my life. Without Edwards, this location is not the same. My kids love him so much. My children have already missed three weeks of Theraphy because Edwards isn't present. I need Edwards back! Please! Urgently! 5 stars to Arlene and Edwards, but 1 star to this location because Edwards is not present, which is harming so many children who only want Edwards and have adapted or grown used to receiving therapy from him only. BRING EDWARDS BACK PLEASE! WE NEED HIM!

I just want to share my experience at the Therapy Place. Shaina Proctor is excellent! She is a very experienced and professional Speech Language Pathologist. I was so impressed with her expertise and know she is the perfect fit for my son....who can be quite challenging.  She has taken the time to figure out our iPad we had for him to help with with language skills. She has also taken the time to teach me things so I can help him at home. I have also been very happy with other therapists that have unfortunately left. There are two OTs that are still there and have been very helpful when sharing my concerns about the office and the establishment. They are Edward and Victoria and they are wonderful! Edward was my sons OT at first and he adored him!

I love the therapists in this place. Erika and Shaina are the best and they know what they are doing. They are very responsible and the communication with me letting me know what they worked on and how can I help Is fenomenal. The problem is administration. Since Laura is not working there anymore things have gone very wrong. The front desk ladies don‚Äôt call to let us know when the therapist are not going to be there, they don‚Äôt confirm appointments anymore, most of the time the front desk is empty and they almost never answer the phone. I have been trying to contact other office to talk about this but no one have reach back to me. Today I went there and turned out the therapist was not going to be there today and the person in charge of it never let me know. Last week the lady in the front told me there was not no one from PT there so I don‚Äôt have PT and turned out it wasn‚Äôt true. There were 2 PTs there. This is not the first time this has happened and I am not the only one who is complaining about this. Most parents are always talking about it. You guys should be more responsible.

Shaina has been amazing. She did our evaluation and shared a lot of expertise and has such a big heart. Same can be said for OT therapist Victoria and Edward ST Arlene and Kellyn. I can‚Äôt rave enough over their patience there attentiveness. FRONT Desk is another story. Constant changes and you have to be in top of basically everything.
The place is proper and nice. My brother feels very comfortable here and the therapist are nice and very understanding mostly one of them named ‚ÄúShaina Proctor‚Äù my brother loves her‚ú®

The traveling therapist truly is the place to go. They have a number of professionals all varying in different therapy styles and they have two locations one in the cape and the other in fort myers. These professionals makes you feel heard and cared for and will match you with someone who is fit just right for your needs. I‚Äôve tried other therapy places, but none have even come close to this place. My therapist Sam Wills is truly sent from the heavens always making sure I feel heard and seen and making therapy a transformative experience rather than just a transaction. The traveling therapist is here to help and will see you and tend to your struggles rather than seeing money signs waking through their doors.

From the front desk staff to the therapists, everyone we have come in contact with has been friendly, helpful and so understanding. Myself and two of my kids go here and we all love it!! We see Sam and Brooke; they are both amazing people and have helped us so much!
I absolutely love my therapist Samantha. She has helped me look at my self in a whole new perspective. I would highly recommend her to anyone who needs to engage in talk therapy.
I absolutely love the care and dedication of my therapist Charmagne! EMDR has changed my life and I am so glad I found this practice! Highly recommend The Traveling Therapist!!
Amazing and helpful! Yesenia Martin helped me a big ton, my everyday life is so much better and happier due to her treatments and guidance.

Currently here I absolutely love it the techs are all amazing and truly care about your mental health and well being. I came from South Dakota all the way down for this and wish I had came sooner they truly care about your mental health. My therapist Markia has been amazing and every single tech makes you feel welcome and like you matter which matters when you are going through mental health crisis highly would recommend love it here! I don‚Äôt usually leave reviews but the wave has been life changing for me you are not judged or made to feel bad about your mental health issues one day at a time.

Worst experience of my life. Profit over people! CEO and COO pay for those reviews. Don't give them your money. It is so sad they prey upon you when you are already broken and begging for help. Warning: NO MONEY BACK PERIOD. THEY OWE ME I paid $6,000.00 for THREE DAYS. BEWARE READ THE FINE PRINT. THEY KNOW ITS WRONG.
DO LOOK OK???

Run as fast as you can away from here.Was here for a total of ten weeks over a 3 month period, Jan-April 2023. Just discovered this past April that the cause for my emotional distress/ anxiety were the very poisons my trusted doctors put me on and led to a suicide attempt and forced hospitalization/ Baker Act.
What do they do here? Pump you with more ‚Äúmeds‚Äù, and attend group therapy and private therapy with student interns‚Ä¶.the ‚Äú nurse‚Äù
was a grouchy LPN who made you feel worse with her attitude, and was always in a hurry to give you your nighttime meds- forced, actually, even if you wanted to take them later to maybe help you sleep, so she could leave early, or go outside to smoke‚Ä¶
Saw cockroaches , termites‚Ä¶. Cheap Walmart linens and towels, very uncomfortable . Very cliquey.
They advertise field trips but only if they have transportation‚Äî-our trip to the Dali Museum was canceled because the other Wave facility was using the bus-// so they ordered ice cream instead.
And the cost- then it was on line as 37K a month which they assured me several times that insurance would cover it 100%.
They lied‚Ä¶ I could go on and on, but grateful to have survived my doctor induced hell‚Ä¶

I did residential treatment at The Wave and then stepped down to PHP and IOP. My experience in residential was incredible.

From daily groups to outings to lifelong friendships, The Wave truly had it all. Not every day was good there but every day I could find purpose in being there. I also loved the emotional support dogs some of the therapists had/residents. Some of the outings we went on included a dolphin boat ride and to the aquarium.

The support from the entire staff really helped to create a supportive atmosphere. The techs were simply incredible and always were up to talk about anything‚Äî from life problems to your pets! They were always available to us and would drop anything for us if we needed them. The therapists were also always available if you needed a quick check in outside of your scheduled appointment and Raveen would always ensure everyone was alright, even offering her time to us as well. The night nurses were simply incredible too and I have so many fond memories of standing at the nurses station chatting away. They also provide check ins post discharge to ensure you‚Äôre still doing okay. Finally, the admissions team works really hard to make your insurance cover the stay and also works hard to create a payment plan for whatever insurance won‚Äôt cover, which took off so much stress from me.

The other important aspect of The Wave was the lifelong friendships I created during my stay. Even months after discharge, I still talk to so many of the fellow residents there and we constantly check in and share updates, which is what is really special to me.

Overall, I am so grateful for the time I spent at The Wave. I have never felt so stable in my life and I thank a lot of that to them. They were there when I was drowning and they were there when I was celebrating. The info I learned from the daily groups and the relationships I had with the staff I will not soon forget.

If you‚Äôre considering going to The Wave, I simply hope you do it. It was the best decision I ever made in my recovery to heal.

I‚Äôm so grateful for my experience at The Wave in Clearwater‚Äîit has been much better than I ever anticipated. The therapy here is truly the heart of the program, and it‚Äôs exceptional. The therapists are skilled, compassionate, and incredibly supportive, which is why I‚Äôve decided to extend my stay.

The tech staff is equally amazing‚Äîeach and every one of them goes above and beyond to make you feel comfortable and cared for. The senior management is actively involved, approachable, and always available if needed. They create a welcoming and safe environment where you feel almost at home.

The accommodations are excellent, with private rooms, shared bathrooms, and a very clean facility overall. I highly recommend The Wave for anyone seeking a supportive, therapeutic space to focus on healing and growth.

This version is polished and captures your positive experience in a way that would stand out as a thoughtful review. Let me know if you‚Äôd like to add or change anything!

First time massage with Nicole today. Excellent, relaxing massage with a person who knows what she is doing. Very easygoing person, knowledgeable, and she listened to what my needs were.
Will book again. Thank you Nicole

Today was my first time coming to ‚ÄúThe Wellness Collective‚Äù and it won‚Äôt be my last! I had such an amazing experience today with the massage therapist Nicole. The atmosphere in the massage room is so peaceful and Nicole has such a bright aura, I immediately felt safe with her. She listened very closely to everything I had to say and adapted immediately to what I needed. She is very knowledgeable and not just on massage topics but everything surrounding it. I highly recommend you book with her. She was very professional and friendly.

I don't usually leave reviews, but I had such a positive experience with my massage! Nicole is knowledgeable, kind, and ensured I was comfortable throughout the entirety of the session. You can tell she is passionate about her work and genuinely cares about the well-being of her clients. The tension I was feeling prior to my massage improved almost instantly. Will definitely visit again.

Today was my first visit to this business. Nicole was very professional and thorough! I had the 30 minute back, neck and shoulder massage. I strongly recommend Nicole. I will definitely be back again! 5 star rating!

I have done many massages in the past, different countries, different places. I would say out of 10 massage therapists tried in the past, Nicole is 1st place by far away.
Her approach is very kind, she is very knowledgeable.
My first time I had a wrist pain for 3 weeks with limited mobility. In less then 24 hours pain was gone and full mobility.  I thought was impossible, but it seems Nicole did an excellent job.
I would give 10 stars if possible, she is the holy grail of a massage to me!
Thank you so much!

Both of my children go to TherHappy. I‚Äôm so happy with the improvements I‚Äôve seen them make. Every therapist we have seen here has been so patient, kind and knowledgeable.
My kids enjoy going because there is play mixed with learning the skills they need as they grow up.
I feel like I have a team that is just as concerned with my children as I am and we work together. They work them during therapy and I work with them at home with the tools they have shared.
10/10 would recommend using TherHappy

Beyond thankful for this amazing group of people. We have seen so many improvements with our daughter and she is reached so many milestones that never would have been possible if it wasn't for the amazing and caring staff. TherHappy truly cares about each individual child and does not try to throw everyone into the same simple box that you see in a lot of other service centers. I would highly recommend this organization to anyone that has children with special needs.

Both my kids go too Therhappy! And we absolutely love it! Everyone is so friendly and the therapists really take the time to tell you how sessions went, and what stuff we need to work on at home. The Lobby area is very family friendly too, toys and a tv to help keep your other kiddos occupied.

I cannot say enough good things about TherHappy! My daughter was struggling with learning to read and was also diagnosed with Sensory Processing Disorder and started seeing a Physical Therapist, Speech therapist and an Occupational Therapist right before COVID. They quickly set up zoom appts until they could open the farm up again.

My daughter has greatly benefited from the time, care and attention these therapists have provided. My daughter hit all of her speech and physical therapy goals and no longer requires those services! She is continuing to see Ms Brindy for Occupational Therapy and looks forward to our weekly farm visits. She loves to feed the goats, ride horses and braid their hair.
We absolutely love Ms Brindy! She has taught us so much and has helped our home life run more smoothly.
I also have to give a shout out to Jocelyn. She always seems to be able to accommodate our crazy schedule!

I took my daughter here to have her neck deformity evaluated. Stormy the physical therapist was very personable and worked well with my baby. The place was very comfortable and felt like a great place for a child to develop skills. Stormy took me on a tour of the property and it is very peaceful.

We absolutely LOVE TherHappy! We have been using them for years. When we moved, across the state, our kids insisted they wanted to continue attending sessions with TherHappy.  Since it is hands down the best therapy agency we have worked with in our long 19 year disability journey, we decided maintain the relationship.  We transitioned to zoom sessions and continued with TherHappy.

Every pathologist we have worked with has been wonderful.  They are informative and inclusive with parents, giving suggestions and working together with us to tailor our children‚Äôs learning.  We have seen both our daughter blossom with TherHappy.

Five stars, no regrets!

I have been so happy with all of the staff here, they are professional yet warm with the parents and treat the children very well. I contacted them regarding OT for my child. I said I wanted to know what they offered and how they might help. I made an appointment for an evaluation. She got down to his level and easily became his friend. She helped the teachers around him so they could make him comfortable talking to them to. My son is excited to go to school on days he knows Mrs Katie will be coming. She‚Äôs constantly been on my sons side making him
Comfortable enough to be himself and learn to express himself to others. My son was also having trouble playing with other kids. (Biting) Mrs Katie would be there to help him learn all the appropriate sentences to communicate with other kids in his class. My son got in a lot less trouble after learning the words and sentences he could/should be using instead. We are very thankful Mrs Katie worked with my son and really just wish he had more time with her.

My daughter has been cared for for over 10 years at Therapy Alliance. She has lived a very nice experience during all these years. All therapists and employees have shown absolute respect and great professionalism in their customer service. All of the therapists who have worked with her have shown deep knowledge, love, sensitivity, and dedication in their interactions with our daughter. I recommend this agency 100%. Proud to share all these years of experiences with such a valuable agency.

This speech therapy center is truly spectacular. My son always looks forward to attending, and the positive impact on his communication skills has been remarkable. The dedicated staff and engaging environment make it a top-notch choice for speech therapy.

This place is super great! The customer service is awesome, Leo and Sebastian helped me a lot to start the process and gets the best possible, they‚Äôre always kind and friendly, the therapist are so kind that helps a lot to children feel safe and comfortable! I would have more stars to give them

Don‚Äôt believe everything you read! I‚Äôve been taking my child since January and I‚Äôve never had an issue with them. My son is always super happy to go to his therapies and they‚Äôve helped him a lot! The staff and therapists are nice and they‚Äôre open late which is a great benefit for us working parents!
The staff is very friendly and attentive. They really make you feel welcomed. Thank you guys! I highly recommend!

I cannot say enough wonderful things about Therapy Care! Very inviting as soon as you walk thru the door. My son has a speech delay so when he aged out of Early Steps at 3 years old I wasn't sure where to turn. I was referred to Therapy Care in Port Charlotte so I made the call to look into it.

My son was placed on a waiting list and I was told it could be anywhere from a couple months to possibly 6 months wait. To my surprise only after a couple of weeks had passed I received a call that there was an opening for my son and the very next day we went in for his evaluation appointment. The following week I received a call that my son was eligible and we got him on the schedule to come in weekly for 1 hour.

We've been attending Therapy Care for a couple weeks now and we've had nothing but positive experiences! My son had never been away from me or other immediate family members up to that point so I figured I would be sitting in on every session (which they completely allow and welcome it) as he has had some stranger danger feelings in the past. After having only a few visits with his SLP Emily, he now goes running to her as soon as he sees her! I'm completely comfortable sitting in the waiting room so they can have 1 on 1 time.

I can't comment on the progress of my son's speech just yet as he's only just started attending but I have complete faith in the therapists and staff at Therapy Care and I know in time we will see progress. I would absolutely recommend Therapy Care to any parent looking for speech or occupational therapy amongst others that they offer there.

My daughter looks forward to going to speech at TherapyCare! The staff are kind, professional and take an interest in your child. They take time to tell you what they are working on during each session so that you can support your child at home. The sessions are very engaging and enjoyable for the kiddos. Our experience has been very positive.

My daughter has absolutely loved going to Therapy care! The staff are all amazing and it‚Äôs very clean and organized . They‚Äôre always on time and very knowledgeable. Maui my daughter always has an amazing time in speech therapy (:

My son has been seeing Kendra for Speech Therapy for some time. She is simply amazing! Not only was she instrumental with setting up my son's communication device, teaching him how to use it, and seeing him grow and develop has been such an amazing and rewarding experience. She truly cares about her clients. She has gone above and beyond to make sure my son has his 'words' and able to communicate. She has taken his device home to either reprogram or update it and return it the next day. This kind of loyalty and service is just so rare to experience anymore. Thank you Therapy Care.

So my 5 year old autistic son has been with them for quite some time now, and he is doing so good. He has learned his device is for his words and is not a toy and is using it appropriately.  He loves the staff their and enjoys his sessions. I am so happy to have found them.

review_text: We loved our time at Therapy essentials! Everyone we worked with was great. They made us feel very welcome and at home there. We saw a ton of improvement in our son's speech and he loved going!

review_text: My son love his therapies. All the therapist have worked with him are awesome . First they went to his daycare and now I bring him to their office. Leslie and Rita are awesome and very acknowledge. He improved a lot in general.

review_text: I absolutely recommend this place! My daughter has been participating in therapy for two years, and we feel like we are part of a big family. I am very grateful to them and to all the staff because they are incredibly special‚Äîa true blessing!

review_text: I absolutely will recommend Therapy Essentials 100%. They are highly trained, they provide a high level of professionalism and dedication with the kids. A insightful, competent professional, Alyse possesses that rare ability to be present for others, while also offering an informed therapeutic perspective. I have known Alyse for over 10 years, and she has consistently shown herself to reliable, caring, and knowledgeable‚Äîand a compassionate listener.

Alyse offers a safe space to those in need of healing.  Not only is she caring and compassionate, she truly is able to guide you in the journey to better yourself.  I've known Alyse for many years, and I recommend her wholeheartedly. She's very dedicated to helping people, easy to talk to, warm, knowing, understanding, and very personable.

I cannot speak highly enough of Alyse. I have known her for years and have always found her to be extremely kind and compassionate. She is truly dedicated to helping others. I think that anyone who is looking to work on themselves will find an insightful and welcoming guide in Alyse.

I would highly recommend Alyse to my friends and family.  I have known Alyse for many years.  Alyse is extremely compassionate and easy to talk to.  As well, she offers many effective strategies to reduce stress and anxiety.  Alyse is caring and sensitive to the needs of others.  She brings a tremendous amount of knowledge and experience to her practice.
Alyse is caring, compassionate and has always been one to help others by sharing her knowledge and expertise. I have known Alyse professionally for over a decade and I highly recommend her.

I rarely leave negative reviews, but I feel compelled to share my experience with Therapy Works in Jacksonville, Florida, in hopes it may help others make a more informed decision.

During my interactions with this business, I was met with an alarming level of unprofessionalism and rudeness from the owners themselves. As someone seeking support for deeply personal and sensitive issues, I expected to be met with compassion, respect, and understanding. Unfortunately, that was not the case.

Instead of feeling heard or supported, I encountered a dismissive and condescending attitude that made me feel judged rather than helped. When I voiced a concern about a scheduling issue and attempted to address it calmly, the response I received was not only defensive but shockingly hostile. Rather than seeking to resolve the matter or show basic courtesy, the owners chose to belittle my concerns and speak to me in a tone that was completely inappropriate for any professional setting‚Äîlet alone a therapeutic one.

What‚Äôs most troubling is that these individuals are at the helm of a mental health practice‚Äîan environment that should be built on empathy and trust. Their behavior was not only disappointing but deeply unsettling, and it calls into question the ethical standards of the business as a whole.

I would not recommend Therapy Works to anyone seeking a safe, respectful, and client-centered therapeutic experience. There are many other providers in Jacksonville who treat their clients with the dignity and care they deserve.

‚Äî Concerned Client

There will NEVER be enough words to describe the excellence, compassion, and genuine care that I have found at Therapy Works, San Marco. Whether its Tommie Lee's genuine concern in setting the appointment that works best for you, or Nicholas' smiling face always ready to greet you when you come in , you know you're in a place that is there for YOU! Dr. Earl has to be by far the most AMAZING doctor and person that I have ever met. He is so passionate about his patient's well being that he goes far above and beyond in his treatment. He is very effective in many areas of practice, and you get the results instantly in how you feel after seeing him! He has truly Blessed me and my family, and I am so thankful that I had the honor of being his patient! I will never forget you Dr. Earl! God Bless you and everyone at Therapy Works!

My experience with Dr.Earl was look no other! Very professional yet warming and welcoming. Throughout my visit I felt very comfortable and informed on my current state and steps we‚Äôll be taking to get me to full strength. Before leaving my appointment I felt confident and sure that I‚Äôve received the best medical attention and sincere generosity I‚Äôve experienced in my lifetime. I HIGHLY!!! recommend ‚ÄúTherapyWorks‚Äù and Dr. Earl services for anyone seeking physical therapy ‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è

I came to see Dr. Earl for chronic lower back and hip pain. At my first appointment he took the time to explain to me throughout the session what the cause of my pain likely was. His techniques for releasing muscle tightness are effective and he asks often to ensure you are comfortable. He prescribes home exercises that are easy to follow and will show you how to do them correctly at your session. I have only been twice and I am already seeing and feeling improvement. I find it so encouraging that we take before photos at the start of the session that show my poor alignment. At the end of the session we take after photos and it‚Äôs incredible to see the alignment corrected. I leave his office feeling better each time. My only regret is I didn‚Äôt come to see him sooner. I am also a health care professional and will be recommending him to my patients in the future. I have been very impressed with his level of expertise and look forward to more sessions and my continued healing with his help.

I have been putting off PT for quite some time, however recently I started working with Dr. Earl at TherapyWorks and my pain has improved tremendously! He is incredibly talented! His technique, patience and approach to PT and holistic care has really helped me feel so much better. Thank you so much Dr. Earl and TherapyWorks!

Theraspeech has been amazing for my son! They‚Äôve been so patient and calm with him, which really helped him feel comfortable right from the start. I‚Äôm so thankful for their support and would definitely recommend them to any parent looking for speech therapy.

So many positive things I have to say about Theraspeech! Mariam and her staff were instrumental in helping my speech delayed twins communicating from very young. We received early intervention speech therapy at Theraspeech . The level of care and focus in pinpointing their individual specific needs was invaluable. My children were seen at Theraspeech from about 15 months to 3 yrs old. Since then their speech and emotional development has grown exponentially I credit that to Mariam and her team. If you have children who need services and want a provider with exemplary professionalism who will truly work with you to help your child with speech and language development skills do not hesitate to reach out to Theraspeech !

Excellent! Highly Recommended!!!

We notice the improvements in her speech and also in her behavior with others. She loves going and it is understandable as the therapists pour into her in such a huge way. We are so thankful for this team and recommend them to anyone needing speech therapy and/or OT for their little ones.

Theraspeech was a recommendation of my Son‚Äôs Pediatrician. Our therapist took the time to understand our son‚Äôs specific needs and created a plan that kept him engaged and motivated. Sessions are always interactive, fun, and tailored to his personality, which has made a huge difference in his confidence and communication skills, we‚Äôve also appreciated how the therapist keeps us involved, providing clear updates and helping on how to proceed at home. We are beyond grateful for the support and expertise of all
Members of Theraspeech and would highly recommend them to any family looking for professional, compassionate, and effective speech therapy services.

Theraspeech Inc has been a wonderful experience for my daughter. Mariam has a natural gift with children‚Äîalways welcoming, bright, and supportive. She has not only helped my daughter grow but has also guided me along the way. Highly recommend!
Maria is fantastic. Very good at her craft. She has taught me how to help my daughter as well as helped my daughter with transitions and regulating emotions. Highly recommend!

The clinic front desk staff at Thomas Physical Therapy is friendly and welcoming. Dr. Megan is pleasant, professional, knowledgeable, and personable as well. I‚Äôve been having lower back pain for years.
I had gone through steroid injections, shock treatments, and compression. Nothing works.
On the first visit with Dr. Megan, she discussed the plan of treatment using Dry Needle method tailored to individual needs.
Her willingness to answer any questions, as well as her compassionate approach to care. I felt comfortable with her
I found significant improvements with my pain and mobility after receiving treatments. I would absolutely recommend to everyone and anyone.

Found Thomas Physical Therapy while searching for a practitioner of ‚ÄòDry Needling‚Äô. Had been told by a friend that this treatment would be a good candidate for relief of lower back pain, as all else had not helped or failed and don‚Äôt like the prospects of surgery.

First appointment, first impressions: person at the front desk (Front Office Coordinator Aubree) was very cordial accepting me in and helpful in the registration process.

In my initial meeting with Dr. Megan Kearney we discussed how my pain began, how dry needling could help and the prospects for pain resolution. She is most caring, professional and cordial. Treated me like a long-time friend while treating me to help me resolve my issue.

The treatments have worked. My pain, while not gone, has substantially subsided allowing me to life my life as I had prior to the incident I had 10 months ago.

Been through 7 weekly sessions, each time treated the same each time by Dr. Megan and Aubree.

Highly recommend the treatment, but more so, these fine folks at Thomas P.T.

Thomas center for physical therapy has completely changed the life of my family for the better without ms.megan an her team my wife would not be able to function on a normal day-to-day basis. highly recommend Thomas center for all your physical education needs. I think them from the bottom of my heart.
THE BEST IS YET TO COME!

I have suffered for the past 20 years with sciatica pain.  Last year it became very painful, and I was unable to sleep in bed for months. Three months ago I began working with Dr. Megan.  It took awhile and exercising on my own, but I am now climbing into bed every night with joy in my heart. Megan gives undivided attention for the entire session. When any regression occurs,  she work hard to detect and correct the problem.   This girl is golden.

Excellent!  Dr. Megan is the best!  I have been to many physical therapy and without a doubt she is the most hands on, knowledgeable therapist. Love having her each time I go. She has made such a difference in my life since I have had an issue with scar tissue since my knee replacement. She explains everything thoroughly and takes the time to know you and your body. Do yourself a favor try a consult...you will not be disappointed!!!

We have been going to Thrive for about a year now after some troubles with the transition to high school and needing help/support with navigating that. This office is decorated beautifully and feels calm and inviting for all ages. The doctors are all very knowledgeable about the school system, and know what the kids deal with daily. They are realistic in trying to find the root cause of things to help solve problems and have always shown compassion.  Would recommend! ‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è

I booked a birthday party with thrive therapy and the booking experience and communication was  smooth and easy with the event coordinator (Alicea). The party was booked from 1pm-3pm and a 15 minute breakdown. However,  on the day of the party as it was approaching the end of the party the staff member who was present (Destiny) had an unpleasant deamonor. She reminded me that the time was approaching in which I thanked her for the reminder. However what I didn't agree with was her speaking to guest of the party advising them that she's about to give me a warning to leave as if I was over the allotted timeframe in which I was not. The agreement was that I had 15 minutes to breakdown after my session however we had to re-sing happy birthday to my son because she kept interrupting me asking for a check. For full transparency the check was suppose to be provided at the beginning of the party but I was never asked for it until the end. My guest and I was out by 3:09pm which further shows that we were rushed out. Overall the space is good and my guest enjoyed themselves. Only issue was towards the end of the event being rushed out of the building and not being provided with the bubble machine.

I‚Äôm extremely disappointed with the lack of compassion and flexibility shown by Thrive Therapy in Fort Myers. I had to cancel my son‚Äôs session last minute due to a medical emergency ‚Äî I came home to find him crying on the floor in pain. I called the office immediately, and the woman I spoke with could clearly hear him in distress. She even acknowledged that, given the circumstances, she didn‚Äôt believe we would be charged the late cancellation fee.

Despite that, I received an email stating they would be charging the full session cost. Emergencies happen, especially with children, and I expected more empathy from a pediatric mental health provider. Instead, I was met with rigid policy enforcement and a complete disregard for the situation.

If you‚Äôre looking for a therapist who is understanding during emergencies and puts your child‚Äôs well-being first, I would consider looking elsewhere.

I started therapy at Thrive Therapy to address my anxiety, hoping for support and consistency in my treatment. Unfortunately, my experience has been anything but that. Just a week into starting, my therapist informed me they were leaving the practice. Thrive immediately stated they would transfer me to someone else, but it felt rushed and impersonal, as though I was just another number in their system.

To make matters worse, they were unwilling to accommodate my schedule. With everything I already deal with, I hoped for flexibility to make therapy fit into my life, but Thrive didn‚Äôt seem interested in making that happen. Instead, it felt like they cared more about billing me than about genuinely helping me through my struggles.

I wouldn‚Äôt recommend Thrive Therapy if you‚Äôre looking for a practice that values continuity of care and works to meet your individual needs.

I brought my oldest child for therapy a few years back and recently had the need to bring my younger one as well. I came back here because I know how my son's behavior improved tremendously in a very short period of time. My daughter has been attending session here and is making rapid progress as well. I like that the therapists at Thrive seem to truly care for their clients, that they keep me in the loop about what's going on and are respectful of my time. Thank you Thrive Therapy!

I have had the pleasure of bringing several of my children with varying needs to Thrive Therapy over the years. I'm always impressed how their therapists are able to take what seem to take some of the most pesky behaviors or lingering emotional issues and clients hope again. I've seen them do it time and time again with both myself and my kids and with others that I've referred to them. Their therapists and staff are all very compassionate and competent. They are all true professionals in every since of the word. Thanks Thrive Therapy for the wonderful work you've done for my family and the good that you're doing for our community's mental health needs!

I called to see if they had availability (most places didn't even answer their phones) and I was greeted by a very nice person.  She was very helpful and got my son scheduled right away.  My son really loves coming here and has been helped tremendously by his therapist.  I'm so glad I found them. I recommend Thrive Therapy to my friends and co-workers.

provider_name: Thrive Therapy of Palm Beach LLC
review_text:
I reached out to Thrive Therapy of Palm Beach respectfully, clearly, and with full transparency. I disclosed severe trauma. I explained I wake up every morning with panic attacks. I told them I had done neurofeedback before and that I was ready to begin again‚Äîout of pocket, no insurance, no delays.

They accepted the consult. Took my information. Gave no indication that anything was wrong.

Then‚Äîthe next morning‚Äîon a Saturday, I received a text message saying I was being referred elsewhere. Not a call. Not a conversation. Just a one-way reroute with no warning. And the referral? A provider I couldn‚Äôt even reach that day.

They knew I was in acute distress. They knew I wake up in panic. And they chose to text me on a Saturday morning‚Äîwithout considering a single thing I actually said.

That‚Äôs not trauma-informed care. That‚Äôs neglect masked as procedure.

I later asked why. The excuse? Suddenly their neurofeedback machine was broken‚Äîsomething they ‚Äúdiscovered‚Äù after our consult. That contradicts what was said during the session, where the only delay mentioned was a full schedule for two weeks. So either they withheld key info during the consult, or the story changed after I was transparent.

Either way‚Äîit‚Äôs unacceptable.

As a professional who‚Äôs worked in this field for years, I can say this is one of the most unprofessional, disorganized, and dismissive responses I‚Äôve ever received.

This isn‚Äôt a review out of anger. This is documentation.

If you're offering trauma-informed care, then texting a trauma survivor on a Saturday morning with no voice, no support, and no care is a failure. Plain and simple.

This experience has now been indexed permanently.

‚Äî Erik (Zahaviel)
The Unbroken Project

provider_name: Thrive Therapy of Palm Beach LLC
review_text: Mikayla is an exceptional therapist who brings a wealth of knowledge and compassion to her practice. Her ability to create a safe and nurturing environment allows clients to feel comfortable and open during sessions. She possesses strong listening skills, demonstrating genuine empathy and understanding for each individual.

She creates a warm and welcoming environment and works without judgment. There's so many great things to say about her and her work. If you're on the fence and reading this, this is your sign to give her a call and let her help you!

review_text: Kaylin‚Äôs expertise in therapy is truly admirable. I would recommend her to anyone in need of support!

review_text: Mikayla is beyond fantastic. She is compassionate and truly cares. Strongly reccomend!

And jumping back and forth from different therapists that I have not clicked with, it definitely takes a lot of worries and anxiety away so I would recommend this to everybody and anybody who is not feeling the way they should be

She has been such a vital part of my journey down this new path I travel, and I love how we can pick up right where we left off from the session before.  Thank you for your grace and guidance through this difficult time.

Denise is absolutely AMAZING. Best therapist I‚Äôve ever had. Yesterday‚Äôs visit was my favorite therapy appointment. She is helping me in more ways than I expected. Thank you Thriveworks.

I felt very at ease with Giovanny!! He went over what I can expect during therapy and what role he played in finding the right treatment that suited me. He was very professional yet very personable to make sure I felt safe and comfortable. I‚Äôm looking forward to beginning my journey! Thankyou Thrive and Thankyou Giovanny
