I first wanna start off by saying thank you for taking care of my father the way you did he was there a month and at that time he looked good he was always clean. The facility was clean. He met some friends along the way. I would recommend this facility to anyone that‚Äôs needing to put a loved one in a rehab or for health reasons.He is part of you family now! Your going to miss him soooo much!!! If for some reason or any reason he needs to go back to a facility, you guys are the place. I will bring him. I highly recommend this facility to anyone searching for a caring and loving place. The staff was unbelievably friendly and was at my dad‚Äòs every need. Any time I needed answers to questions whether it was case managers or administrator I got a call back in a timely manner and resolved my issues. Thank you again for that and closing. I am highly recommending this facility for your loved one. Thank you to everyone there in the staff for going above and beyond for my father. I mean that from my heart, you guys are the best.

provider_name: West Melbourne Health and Rehabilitation Center
review_text: I  came here after being in the hospital I was worried at first but then I met the nurse manager Sheri and my mind was at ease. She truly cares about her patients and spends time with you she even gives you and your loved ones  her cellphone number if you need anything she is absolutely amazing I would come back here again if needed and send a family member here. They are lucky to have Sheri ! The PT department is wonderful as well I'm much stronger thanks to them .  Sandy CNA wad the BEST! She takes great care of her patients ! Nurses Bill he's new here but he was great and Tina was awesome! The staff on the Rehab is awesome!! Thank you for a wonderful stay!  Matthew

provider_name: West Melbourne Health and Rehabilitation Center
review_text: Lastnight I was told .... spoken to abruptly... by a nurse... that said they were too busy to get me a pain pill. That she would be back to give it to me when my meds are due. Last week I waited over 3 hrs for a pain pill. I broke my pelvis in 3 places.

Hunter has been coming to West Palm Dog since he‚Äôs been about 5 months old. He will be 3 years old in May. Marti and Ben are absolutely a godsend. I have no idea what Hunter and I would do without them and their staff. They are so warm so genuine and so kind. You can clearly see how much they all love what they do and how much they care about the animals. The passion and dedication that they put into what they do is absolutely amazing. I cannot wait for them to open their new location so Hunter can have even more fun. Hunter goes there five days a week Monday through Friday from 7AM to 5PM. Hunter has worked with Ben, Marti, and a bunch of the trainers going towards becoming a service dog and getting CGC certified. As well as he‚Äôs done the board and train, private lessons, he‚Äôs even done obedience class. Hunter absolutely loves it there and loves playing with his best friends. This is the best place for dogs to be!!

We just finished the puppy class at West Palm Dog and couldn‚Äôt be happier with both the training and the overall experience. Marti was incredible‚Äîknowledgeable, patient, and truly passionate about helping dogs and their owners build strong foundations.
For the same price we would have paid at a corporate pet store, we received a much more personal, effective, and hands-on experience. The classes were well-structured, and Marti took the time to address each puppy‚Äôs individual needs, which made a huge difference in our pup‚Äôs progress. We walked away with not only a better-behaved puppy, but also the confidence and tools to keep up the training at home.
Highly recommend West Palm Dog to anyone looking for quality training in a supportive, friendly environment! We are going to check out their doggie day care and registering for Puppy Class #2 today!

I have worked at several different dog daycare facilities within Broward and Palm Beach Counties. West Palm Dog is the most exceptional facility imaginable. The work environment is fantastic. There's always work to be done (which means there's never a moment to be bored). Ben and Marti genuinely care about the pups. They're both extremely intuitive to the animals. It's as if Marti is a dog whisperer because the most difficult dogs become the most wonderful under her guidance. I highly recommend this facility to anyone looking for training, boarding, or daycare services for their pup. You truly cannot find any better than West Palm Dog

Being an active 69 year-old who still travels for work, it was important to find a place that can take care of my dog while I was gone that I would trust. That place is West Palm Dog. From the three week initial training after I got my puppy to several boarding  visits I am extremely happy. And I also feel very lucky.

I am SO happy that I found West Palm Dog. After doing weeks of research for good board and train programs, I was able to connect with Ben (one of the owners) -- who gave me the whole rundown of how West Palm Dog operates as well as their training philosophy. One amazing thing about this place is that unlike larger dog daycares/boarding facilities, it's not a big, massive warehouse or building -- it's run out of a home in a nice, quiet neighborhood. There aren't 100 dogs running around -- they pride themselves on keeping smaller, controlled play groups so dogs can have more positive experiences. After bringing my dog (Lincoln) there for a week of daycare to get acquainted, he began the intensive 2 week board and train. I could not be happier with the results -- my pup (10 months old) came back home with more confidence, amazing leash etiquette, basic commands down pat and a calmness he hadn't had prior to the program. Trainers Caitlin and Patricia were pros with him -- sending videos on YouTube of his progress every night. The best part about the program is that during the 2 weeks, they have the owner come twice for lessons -- once after week one, and once upon pick-up. This helped build my confidence in training, as well (it was also so nice to be able to see my dog halfway through to see his progress IRL!). Importantly, the program is also $1K cheaper than most similar places. Post-board and train, I bring my dog there 1x a week for daycare and plan to bring him regularly for boarding when I am travelling. I highly, highly recommend West Palm Dog and couldn't say enough good things about all of their staff, ownership and etc. I am excited for their new location to open soon!

Amazing place. I was so nervous to leave our German shepherd puppy for the first time. I said no to a few places before being recommended this place. The owner is fair, trustworthy and knows what he‚Äôs doing. Along with his daughter. Taking vacations are not stressful at all when it comes to having a place to leave our pup now. I know he‚Äôll be taken care of and getting some training. They truly care about your pet here.

I have had two dogs at West Point K-9 for Boarding and training.    They have been very well taken care of and I was very happy with the training. There is room to play in the fenced in playground. The kennels are very clean and airy.   The staff is very caring towards the dogs. Highly recommend it.

We had an in incident with our Golden Retriever and quickly realized he needed more training than we were doing. My boss recommended West Point since she has taken her dog there for training. From the first visit I loved the grounds and Melissa and Juan. We ended up having to leave our baby there for 3 weeks (which I wasn‚Äôt sure I would be able to survive but I knew it was best). Marcos the trainer was working with our dog as well and Juan and Melissa and they were amazing! They kept us informed sent us videos and pictures and we were able to visit as often as we liked. We took our baby home Saturday and I can see a HUGE difference in him already.  We truly love the whole staff! They were super professional and treated our dog like one of their own. I recommend West Point 10000% and will bring any dogs we have in the future directly to them for training! They have clients for life!

Absolutely love, and trust Juan and Melissa so much! Have been taking my dogs there for many years and wouldn‚Äôt leave them anywhere else for boarding or training. My German shepherd went from night to do in behavior, after extensive training and I have the utmost peace of mind when leaving on vacation and knowing she is there. (The non stop tail wagging says it all when I drop her off). Can‚Äôt go wrong and the many years they have been there says it all! Ty guys!!!!!

I adopted a pitbull mix from the shelter about a year ago that had absolutely no training. I tried training her at home as much as I could but eventually realized I didn‚Äôt have the skills to do it. One of my coworkers recommended West Point K-9 and I‚Äôm so thankful for them. I did the board and train option and am so happy with the results. They really work with you to make sure you have all the tools and skills you need to be consistent with your dog. My dog loved coming in every weekend after we picked her up for the weekly sessions. Definitely a worth it investment.

Jan and I moved here in December of 2024 leaving a house in Orange Park where we had lived for over 42 years. It was a difficult decision and an emotional move for us but we are thankful that we made this move to Westminster Woods on Julington Creek. We are so very happy here with our neighbors in Magnolia but also with the staff. Everyone we meet whether it is staff or resident, is friendly and courteous. Living in Magnolia is such a blessing to both of us as we enjoy our privacy but we also enjoy the social times in the Magnolia lobby.

The property is rustic in places and pristine in other places which makes it very special. We love walking the areas.

Our apartment is very spacious and even though it took some planning, we have found a place for just about everything that we need. Jan is a great organizer and she has it under control so we can live comfortably here in Magnolia. We love our new home.

My husband and I moved to Westminister Woods on Julington Creek in December of 2024. We are very happy with everything ‚Äî our apartment in Magnolia and how spacious it is but especially the incredible view of the water. We love to take walks through the lovely grounds as we appreciate the hard work of the people who care for the grounds. The staff is amazing especially the tram drivers and the dining staff. We love the Director of Philanthropy‚Äîwe actually are happy with everyone on the staff.

Magnolia is a wonderful place to live with a family-like atmosphere. These people are now our family and we are very comfortable here. This is our home.

My husband and I came to Westminster Woods on Julington Creek because of the full range of medical care levels offered on this campus. We first made use of the brand new Memory Care Building and the creative program offered there for residents with memory challenges. Now, my husband is in Skilled Nursing and quite content, and I am in an apartment for independent living residents. We enjoy walks on the beautiful campus‚Äîfilled with flowers and various wildlife. There are many events offered and we take advantage of them!  Our family members visit often and they enjoy the dining and walking around the lovely grounds.

We‚Äôve lived here for over eight years and have been very happy in this environment ‚Äìspace,,trees, communal spirit with many new friends. We enjoy activities on and off campus. There‚Äôs plenty to keep us living a happy life. The environment is beautiful as you can see from the photos, Come and visit, you‚Äôll be impressed!

Is it perfect here? No.  Am I glad I moved here? Absolutely.

When I started visiting CCRCs Westminster Woods on Julington Creek was one of the ones where I felt most comfortable.  The longer I have been here (5+ years now) the more convinced I am that it was the right choice for me.  There are certainly communities that are ‚Äúfancier‚Äù, but they generally come with larger price tags.  There are communities that are newer but don‚Äôt have the location and charm.

When researching Continuing Care Retirement Communities in Florida, as well as several other states, I came to several conclusions, including: (1) Florida has some of the best consumer protections for CCRC residents; (2) Non-profits with a history of good fiscal management were desirable; (3) The associated Skilled Nursing facility should be Medicare 5 star rated.  This community scored ‚Äú5 stars‚Äù for all these criteria.

One thing that impresses me about this community is the number of second-generation residents I have met here.

There are plenty of opportunities for residents to be as active as they want.  For physical activity we have a fitness center and several instructor-led fitness classes every day.  There are also resident managed activities such as pickleball, aqua-volleyball, bocce, putting, etc.  The grounds provide plenty of space to walk (or bike) and there are off-campus retail, restaurants, post-office, banks, etc. within walking distance.  There are also many ‚Äúofficial‚Äù and many resident-led more sedentary activities.  If you are bored here, you aren‚Äôt trying very hard.  I have always been welcomed if I wanted to try out a new activity.  In general, "Welcoming" is a great description of this community.

Residents are encouraged to participate in the Residents‚Äô Council and its various sub-committees.  When residents participate their voices are heard.  I can attest to this from personal experience.

Westminster Communities of Florida has about a dozen communities throughout the state of Florida.  A person looking into CCRCs won‚Äôt go wrong with any of them.  Some are larger, some are smaller.  Several are more ‚Äúup-scale‚Äù, some are more urban.  For me WWJC is the Goldilocks solution ‚Äì not too big, not too small; not too urban, not to isolated ‚Äì but just right.

This is Florida, we are on the water (Julington Creek at the confluence with the St Johns River) so I will leave you with a picture of someone visiting the community.  From past experience I can tell you that he (she?) will be encouraged to move along if he (she?) hangs around in Turtle Lake too long.  He (she?) is not a turtle.  In the mean time he (she?) is a good conversation starter for pedestrians walking across the dam.  One neighbor has suggested we should charge visitors for swimming and sun bathing privileges.

provider_name: Westshore Physical Therapy aka. Ewing and Thomas
review_text: I just completed approximately 6 month of PT for issues with my shoulder and neck.  The staff were all very pleasant.  The receptionist always had a smile.  My initial evaluation was with Henk who explained everything thoroughly to me.  The next few weeks were with Alexis who did an excellent job an made you feel "special".  As time went on both Henk and Alexis were on top of my issues and addressed them "heads on".  They make you feel like family and know what they're doing.  I'd highly recommend them.

provider_name: Westshore Physical Therapy aka. Ewing and Thomas
review_text:
A Truly Exceptional Physical Therapy Experience

In  the land of dinosaurs, I stumbled upon this physical therapy office, and to my delight, had a truly wonderful experience. From day one, I never once dreaded attending PT, thanks to the uplifting and fun atmosphere created by the incredible staff and therapists.

I‚Äôve never been a fan of medical or health-related environments, but this place completely changed that for me. Here, I was treated as a person‚Äînot just another file or number to be processed and sent on my way. The unwavering support and confidence of the team paved the way for my success in overcoming my physical challenges.

Henk, in particular, made it easy to understand my issues, their root causes, and the best approach to resolving them. On my first visit, I walked in feeling like a 90-year-old, weighed down by aches and pains. By my last visit, I walked out feeling like my youthful self again.

If you're searching for a physical therapy office that genuinely cares, uplifts, and helps you heal, I highly recommend choosing this one!

provider_name: Westshore Physical Therapy aka. Ewing and Thomas
review_text: I was a patient and my experience was excellent. I had a full hip replacement and my first session was 2 days after surgery and I knew this was the right place for me. Henk and Alexis were my therapists and they treat you like family and Gabby up front for scheduling is fun and great to work with.  They follow a strict therapy session geared to your needs. I highly recommend and would definitely go back for any future needs.

provider_name: Westshore Physical Therapy aka. Ewing and Thomas
review_text: Just graduated today from 6 weeks of PT for lower back issues. From the moment I walked in the door I was impressed. The receptionist was very pleasant. Then met Hank who gave me the initial evaluation. He was very engaging and explained everything thoroughly. Then I spent six weeks with Alexis who did an excellent job. She made it fun and I looked forward to going to every season with her.  Everyone makes you feel very comfortable. All in all it was a very positive experience and I would (and have) recommend(ed) them highly.

provider_name: Westshore Physical Therapy aka. Ewing and Thomas
review_text: As a deaf patient, this office is HIGHLY recommended for anyone including the deaf community because they provide interpreting service for my physical therapy sessions without any hassle.  I learned so much with numerous questions from Dr. Rosheuvel and his staff.  Friendly and supportive staff.

I feel incredibly lucky to have found this amazing horse therapy center for my child with special needs. From the very first visit, we were made to feel completely at ease. Robin is absolutely wonderful‚Äîkind, patient, and so attentive to both the children and parents. She has a natural way of making everyone feel safe, understood, and supported, and her presence alone brings such a calming, positive energy to the experience.
The entire staff is equally attentive and caring. They take the time to get to know each child and tailor the sessions to their individual needs, always ensuring that safety and comfort come first. It‚Äôs clear that everyone here is passionate about what they do and genuinely cares about the kids.
My child looks forward to every single session. It‚Äôs been such a joy to see the confidence, coordination, and happiness that these sessions bring.
The horses are exceptionally well cared for. You can tell they are treated with love and respect, which speaks volumes about the integrity of the program and the people behind it.
Great place highly recommend for therapy. I have witnessed them do a great job on multiple occasions!

I think this is one of the best places in all of Miami for children with Special Needs. The staff is kind, the facilities state of the art amazing, and the quality of riding therapy, instructors and administrators could not possibly be better. My daughters  progress has been beautiful to watch in a short time.
Thank you Whispering Manes for all you do for the volunteers and our special needs children THANK YOU SO MUCH üòä
Wonderful place and amazing staff

Truly one of the best places in all of Miami for children with Special Needs. The staff is kind, the facilities state of the art amazing, and the quality of riding therapy, instructors and administrators could not possibly be better. My students progress has been beautiful to watch. We couldn‚Äôt ask for more. Thank you Whispering Manes for all you do for us!! We appreciate you!!
What a great day with Gratitude america.  Thankful for the staff at the horse ranch.

Over the past 8 years we have gotten 3 JRT puppies from Whispering Meadows, the last one as recently as 3 weeks ago. Debbie is always so nice and a pleasure to work with, and my dogs are all so well tempered and healthy. I'd never considered owning this particular breed before because I've heard how high energy they are, but all of mine are so chill, but still have very hig personalities. We highly recommend!

A wonderful place. The love and compassion shown by the owner's and staff isn't only felt but visible which is becoming more and more rare in today's society. You can tell they not only love their "work" but also rejoice in their client's achievements, small or large, along with the geniune support of the caregivers. I wish every community and person in need had a place comparable to Whispering Pines available to them. It would be very hard, in my humble opinion, to come close to a comparable staff though. They are the best. I hope to see them continue to thrive and as long as I'm part of this community I will support their mission wholeheartedly even if their services become not needed. I can't even begin to speak well enough of them. They are a blessing to our community. This smile speaks volumes in itself.‚ù§

This ranch accomplishes its purpose the moment one arrives.  It's heavily shaded property with trails, sitting areas and well trained horses compliment its owners intent for children with unique needs.

This wonderful place that is totally non-profit  opens their property to individuals with disabilities and veterans. They provide riding lessons, hands-on horse care, crafts, and so much more for these individuals. Mr. & Mrs Davis and their daughter Kristine are just wonderful with all involved. It's a great place to volunteer some time. It is truly a unique setting nestled in the woods.

I have boarded at White Horse Farms in North Fort Myers for 6 months. Only leaving to move out of state. I highly recommend. Excellent horse care, staff, barn manager. Owners who care and are making continuous improvements to property. 2 nice areas, well maintained, trails, and friendly boarders. 5/5 recommend!!

Had a great time for my daughter‚Äôs birthday! The owners are very friendly and super easy to deal with! They brought out multiple horses for the kids to look at and pet. Very clean compared to all the other horse farms I‚Äôve been to!

Bear was my favorite he is super friendly and sweet. The girls got to ride George in the arena and they loved it. Then they all got to put their hand prints on the horse and had a scavenger hunt! All in all I‚Äôd recommend this farm to everyone.

Wow!! Our instructor Brittany and her helper Zack, were amazing. We had been on trail rides before, but decided to take the lessons. She took her time with us, and Zach really connected with my two kids. We will be back for more lessons. The farm is well kept, there are new owners who seem to be doing a great job, and the horses and people seem happy. Thanks for a great experience. We all learned a lot.

Excellent service! Jimmy and his family are extremely nice! Britney took care of us like no-one else! Very sweet and friendly. my daughters loved they way she explained everything and of course...the ride! We will come back! Thank you White Horse Farm! Andro & Family
I‚Äôve had my horse for 16 years and Whithorse farm is by far the best boarding facility I have ever had! Color me happy! Amazing!

Dr. Jody has a kind and gentle spirit. I had my first appointment today and she made me feel comfortable and at home in her office space. She encouraged me throughout my appointment and empowered me that I will be able to restore my back. She genuinely cares for her patients and you can tell she pours her heart when helping them. Dr. Jody is amazing and I would 1,000/10 recommend her.

I had an amazing first time experience with Dr Carrie.. During our initial consultation I felt like she ‚Äú got me‚Äù like she really understood what has been wrong and could explain better to me about the root cause of my pain than any other doctor has in 20 plus years. Dr Carrie also has a plan to improve and correct my condition that makes sense to me.. And its all about fixing the core problem instead of just covering up the symptoms... She was so easy to talk to and she really listened.. Love this Place!!!!

I was beyond pleased with my first experience at Wholistic Motus- not only with Dr. Carrie but with the whole setting and physical space.  If you are looking for focused attention on your whole body wellness, without the usual chaotic zoo feel of most busy therapy practices who hand you a schedule of appts that do not take YOUR schedule/life into account first and foremost- look no further.
Dr. Carrie takes a true interest above and beyond to find the best way to help you. I can‚Äôt wait for my next session! ‚ù§Ô∏è

The two therapists I have the pleasure to work with are wonderful! They are so knowledgeable, experienced and thorough. They are hands-on when required yet also possess the skills to communicate verbally so I completely understand the exercises and the reasoning for them in order to correctly do them at home.
Dr. David is outstanding in that he listens and knows just what to do to help improve my problem whether it be alleviating pain, correcting the position of my arm, suggestions for different exercises, whatever.
I have been to at least 10 different locations for physical therapy during my 40 + years in Lee County and I am honestly saying these are the best physical therapists with whom I have ever worked. Wholistic Motus is the whole package - caring, knowledgeable, friendly, professional and respectful of the patient's needs!

Jody is a very gifted physical therapist who individualizes her treatments to meet each patient‚Äôs unique needs. She listens, evaluates, and continuously adjusts her treatments using her great wealth of knowledge and expertise. She keeps up with the latest knowledge and techniques by attending conferences and seminars with trainings on cutting edge procedures. I have made significant progress and am amazed how well her treatments have improved my quality of life. Jody is brilliant with tremendous knowledge, experience, and training. She is compassionate and caring. She even suggests exercises, programs, and products to continue my progress on my own at home. No matter how much pain and weakness I have when I arrive at Wholistic Motus, I feel so much better and stronger when I leave.
We thought we would try a different approach with our Little Oreo.

Dr. Carrazzino is great with my dogs. Even my shy girl likes and trust her. She takes her time with each animal and works to find a remedy to bring the dogs system back into balance, rather than prescribing a bunch of drugs. In addition, she is a great help on nutrition for those of you raw feeding and provides alternatives to monthly pesticides.

Dr. Cannizaro is the best. She really cares about her patients, including the people who love them. Robin helped both our dogs, Sofia and Chloe, helping Sofie to loose weight naturally when no other vet could figure it out. In addition, later, Chloe was the opposite. She had serious tummy issues and kept losing weight. But Robin skillfully came up with a program to help her to regain the weight and lead a very happy and energetic life. We recommend Dr Cannizaro wholeheartedly.

At first I didn't know what to expect being a first time visit. I was very impressed with Dr Robins knowledge of wholistic care. She explained everything to me I didn't understand. She treated my pet like it was her own. I would highly recommend  her.

This lady contacted me via email, had an entire conversation with me and I canceled my appointment via email, after finding out the pricing and issues she was already giving me. My appointment was 2 weeks away.

She calls me 2 weeks later and says I was a no call no show. She miraculously received all of my emails and admitted she remembered speaking with me via email, but somehow didn‚Äôt receive my last email advising to cancel the appointment.
Uu
Then, she proceeded to tell me that she doesnt communicate with anyone via email when she reached out to me via email. She also stated that I can‚Äôt cancel via email.

She wrongfully charged me a $100 no show fee, which I am disputing. I have proof of our email thread. This lady is bad business and was rude to me about it.

I‚Äôll be telling everyone about her unprofessionalism. Don‚Äôt go here! Shes overpriced anyways at $226 an hour. What a joke!

If I could give 100 stars, I would!! They are extremely knowledgeable, so kind, compassionate, and helpful, the facility is always so clean and updated, and you can tell every single person in that building cares for animals!
I have been with Wickham animal hospital the past 3 years, ever since I moved to Florida. My baby had pre-existing conditions and new conditions and they always educated me and made getting medications incredibly easy!! Scheduling appointments was never difficult and I was always able to get in within days of me calling. They also use an app that is super convenient with your pets profile and records. Whenever I called with questions, or for any reason, they were always quick to answer my call or call me back! They were always so gentle and kind with my baby, and you could always feel the love for animals when you walked into that building.
Unfortunately my baby has crossed the rainbow bridge, but I love and recommend Wickham Animal Hospital to everyone!! Doctor Rosen and Doctor Hadley are absolutely wonderful, incredibly helpful, gentle and kind. The entire staff is great! They are quick and patient, they always greet you with a smile and they are so compassionate to you and your animals! I am so grateful for Wickham animal hospital and everything they did for Spotty and I.
When you enter Wickham Animal Hospital, you are not just a customer, you become part of their family! Thank you always!! ‚ù§Ô∏è
This is the place for you.  My Boston love his new vet.  My fur baby had some problems my previous vet ignored.  Now he‚Äôs all better.  Thank you to you and all your caring staff

I took my 162 lb high strung, fearful, and protective rescue Great Dane, Lux, to Wickham Animal Hospital today for his Rabies vaccine, anti-anxiety and heartworm prescriptions, bloodwork, and treatment for a yeast infection in his ears. This was Lux's 3rd appointment there in a 3 year span of time.The front office staff was wonderful in orchestrating how to get Lux into an examination room without a lot of unnecessary human or pet contact. Then Dr Seth Schwartz thoroughly cleaned Lux's yeasty ears, and administered the ear medication and vaccine while Mike, who luckily is a big strong man, wrestled and held my muzzled Lux. The new Vet tech, Anjunie, was so helpful and brave from beginning to end, and per my request took my payment to the front desk staff while Lux and I stayed in the examination room so we could avoid contact with other humans or pets. The Vet tech, Randi, was a huge plus because she owns a 150 lb Great Dane with a temperament similar to Lux. Randi kindly took the time to share and offer guidance about our dogs similar behavioral issues, tweaking the dosing for the anti-anxiety meds, etc. That really lowered my stress and anxiety level while I was there! Having to take my big, high strung, fearful Great Dane to the Vet is challenging and stressful. I commend all of Wickham Animal Hospital's staff for rising to the occasion in every way imaginable, and for being so kind, patient, caring, understanding, and accomodating to Lux's and my needs. I'm hoping Lux will be a welcome life long patient at Wickham Animal Hospital.

The team at Wickham Animal Hospital are the best! Dr. Hadley is so kind and has helped so much over the last few years with Chloe‚Äôs MCT cancer journey. Chloe is even excited when she arrives. Which says a lot about how comfortable she is with everyone there.

Fantastic staff. Friendly knowledgeable, compassionate. Clean easy access . Practical no nonsense care. No hype,  doesn't push you for needless care. Parking is tight. Large lot, 15 spaces but still almost full. Tells you about the quality of care with all the clients.

What a wonderful experience for me and my dog. Dr. Ashley was incredible. My dog was experiencing a soft tissue injury and she handled him perfectly, while also explaining everything. He feels better and we look forward to seeing her in a week.

We absolutely love Ashely. She has helped us learn so much about our dogs health around chiropractic care. Ashely explains everything clearly and takes her time; we never feel rushed. She is gently and patient with our dogs! We highly recommend Ashely to anyone looking to optimize their dogs health and make sure they are feeling their best!

I recently brought my cat, Carl, in for his first visit to Wildlife Chiropractic, and I couldn't be more impressed! The clinic was spotless! Ashley M. was amazing from start to finish. She was incredibly friendly, informative, and welcoming, making both Carl and I feel right at home. She took the time to explain everything she was doing, ensuring Carl's comfort the whole time. It was clear she genuinely cares about the animals she treats.

After just one visit, I've already noticed a slight improvement in Carl, and we're definitely going to be making this a regular stop for him. I highly recommend Ashley and Wildlife Chiropractic for anyone looking for top-notch care for your pets!

Our three-year-old mastiff Aries was a little wobbly on his back legs, so Ashley came highly recommended. I went online and made the appointment. She is very knowledgeable, professional, and made Aries feel at ease.

Dr. Ashley is a skilled, honest, kind doctor.  She is easy to communicate with and delivers precise, effective adjustments to reduce nerve interference and get her patients' bodies functioning better. Animals respond beautifully to chiropractic.  I have had all my animals checked and adjusted for the past 40 years and have had the help of many different chiropractors who work with animals. Dr. Ashley is amazing. Highly recommend.

I absolutely love WildHeart riding school. I started horse riding as a birthday present to myself back in May and i just cant stop. I go every week. The instructors are all very helpful & professional. The owners who i got to talk to on multiple occasions, are very kind and care about their customers. They try to accommodate to all your needs and maintain a great line of communication. The horses are well trained and well taken care of. Great school and I cannot wait to continue learning from the best!

We love Wildheart Riding School!!
I‚Äòm so happy we found this place for my daughter to learn to ride.
The trainers are amazing! They are so patient, meet everyone at their level and most of all they make it fun! There‚Äôs no pressure, but lots of learning!
The horses are the sweetest and I love that they don‚Äôt get overworked. You can feel that everyone there loves these animals.

I love love love love this place.

Love the trainers, love the environment, always feel super welcomed, and really enjoy my horsemanship time‚Äîespecially when I‚Äôm the last one to leave and can spend time washing a horse.

The owners are very welcoming and make me feel at home. I‚Äôve been to different places in Orlando, and this is the first one that isn‚Äôt mean and isn‚Äôt pushy. It's my happy place!

We've tried several riding schools in the area, and we found WildHeart instructors to be the most knowledgable, empathetic, patient, and skilled at helping our two daughters progress rapidly.  The owners are involved in the day to day activities and make the whole experience fun and enjoyable.  The horses seem happy and well loved/cared for, and there are a lot of horses to work with.  We absolutely love the fun atmosphere, the staff and instructors, the owners and the horses. Highly, highly recommend this place!!!

Huge fan of this place! I‚Äôm so happy I found this place. I‚Äôve always been a country lover and wanted to try riding a horse, but my biggest problem is that I‚Äôm deathly afraid of heights. Luckily for me, I found just the right place. It‚Äôs not only a place to ride but also where you learn how to properly treat and care for horses while riding safely. I was so nervous for my first lesson, but I‚Äôm so glad I didn‚Äôt back out. They made it an unforgettable experience by keeping my nerves low and giving me the confidence to get on the horse. The trainers did an amazing job walking me step by step through all the proper techniques and positioning. I not only left with the confidence to ride again, I also left with a new friend. His name is Scooter. I would recommend Wildheart Riding School to anyone and everyone!

Wildflower is such a wonderful place for therapy services! Their kitchen setup is perfect for practicing feeding and OT skills, and the gym is unique and thoughtfully customized to the space. The staff have both the tools and the knowledge to support a wide range of needs, and it‚Äôs clear they truly care about the families they serve.

We couldn't be more pleased with the care our children have received at Wildflowers. Our children have used multiple resources from this office to include occupational therapy, physical therapy, and speech therapy. The therapists go above and beyond to help my children with their individual needs.

My son previously went to this office and had Mrs. Jennifer for stuttering! We saw wonderful improvement in just a short amount of time! We went 2 times per week and saw wonderful progress! The office staff is so kind and very wonderful to work with! We highly recommend this office!

My son has been going to therapy at Wildflower for almost 4 years now. At this point, they are like family to us! Lauren and her team have been there for the struggles but also the victories. They care for not only the child, but the parent as well. That is pretty rare at clinics these days. Her staff is so understanding with scheduling when life happens. I can‚Äôt say enough good things about this clinic. Caring, compassionate, uplifting, positive atmosphere for the entire family! Thank you Wildflower Therapy!

Wildflower is a gem of a speech therapy clinic. We see Ms. Alanna and she is so knowledgeable. She really  knows how to motivate and encourage kids and make speech an enjoyable experience. She provides a lot of praise to the kids and she‚Äôs a pleasure to work with.

My 4 yo grandson had a tremendous experience at Wildflower.  The atmosphere was always positive and affirming and the staff was very accommodating to our schedule.   Ms. Abigail made her lessons interesting and was excellent at adapting them to his mood or interests, sometimes during the session.  He met all of his goals in a reasonable amount of time and will miss Ms Abigail and his Thursday sessions.  5 stars

They never pick up the phone. I have had so much trouble trying to schedule an appointment that I can‚Äôt even say anything about the actual service they provide because it‚Äôs been a month and my referral still hasn‚Äôt gone through! The auto responder is horrible and they never actually get back to you. If they weren‚Äôt the only occupational therapist in the area, I would have found somewhere else ages ago. By the time I actually got in contact with them today, after a month of struggling, I was informed that they no longer provide the service I required.

Visited and it was the best experience ever to see those beautiful big cats close.  To see the love and care they have for the animals.   Amazing experience can't wait to go back.  Animals are fed and well taken care of.  The couple that does the tour very sweet and sociable.   I highly recommend this place.  Keep up the great job.  Thanks for sharing your precious babies with us.

This sanctuary is a nice loving home to these creatures in need. Staff was knowledgeable about the animals history but didn‚Äôt talk as much about the specie itself unless you asked.  This sanctuary is basically in the middle of nowhere so  if you plan on doing something afterwords I definitely don‚Äôt think it‚Äôs going to be in this area. There aren‚Äôt many stores or quaint little shops‚Ä¶ So your best bet is driving to Tampa or Saint Pete. Also when you drive-in you‚Äôll see a gate on the right with a sign that‚Äôs their‚Äôs but you‚Äôll want to enter through the second gate on the right. The tour will take two hours and takes you through A lemur exhibit, panther,  Monkey, lion, pig, turtle and ostrich exhibit. They also give you a nice little free gift at the end of the tour which is a Your choice of a picture of one of the animals laminated.  I just wish that the staff was a bit more presentable when working‚Ä¶ (There wasn‚Äôt a streamlined uniform  )As well as sometimes our tour guide would just say two or three small things about the animal and just wait. They do take photos with your camera if you want a close up photo of the animal

It was such a hot day today.  I am from NY and my friends suggested going to Rainbow Springs.  I was nervous because of gator warnings, but it was clean, beautiful and refreshing.  The water is so clear that you can see the bottom which is 10 feet below.  The water is always a steady 72¬∞ because it is spring fed.  Very nice on a hot day.  We swam with noodles because you can't touch bottom and will get tired eventually.  I LOVED it there.  It's so beautiful and there is a gift shop, an area to change, restrooms and trails to walk on all for $2 per person.  Have fun!!

It was pretty good, my friend and I went with a groupon. They limit each tour to around 20 people. I didn't hear or see anything about requiring masks but the group stayed fairly distanced from exhibit to exhibit. The leopard was the best. It was too cold to see the tortoises because they were in their burrows. The emus were friendly. The pot-bellied pig was somewhat friendly and free roaming but small.

The variety of big cats are
excellently cared for in large habitats in pairs. The walking tour is leisurely with time to take pictures or sit on a bench. There are lemur, tortoises, tigers, panthers and more. The tour guide is interesting & will take close up pictures on your camera. A great experience!

I have been riding for 8 years and I have always loved horses. My aunt came to town and I wanted to take her for a trail ride. After a lot of looking I found Willows Way. This place was so nice. It was organized, the horses were comfortable, the tack fit, and the guide was very knowledgeable. I loved this place and will definitely visit again.

I had the pleasure of visiting Willow‚Äôs Way Stables today and meeting Nikki and her staff. Everyone was courteous and helpful. The horses were well adjusted and at ease in the large fields available to them. I‚Äôm excited for my wife‚Äôs first lesson with them in September. They are a great addition to Wakulla üôÇ

Nikki is a great trainer! She is very patient and kind towards her students. My daughter loves going to her! Nikki also trained my daughter‚Äôs barrel horse. She did an amazing job for the two+ months she had him. She was very attentive and looked after him like her own horses. Would highly recommend her!

I found Nikki through a local recommendation for lessons for my daughter and, although was reluctant because of the distance from my house to the stable, I knew I had made a great choice. My daughter had been taking lessons elsewhere and we were both getting discouraged and were made to think the problem was my daughter and that she may not be cut out for horses. After a few lessons and getting to know Nikki, we absolutely knew that was not the case and my daughter is now flourishing. After that, I decided to send my horse to her for training. In just 3 weeks, my 4 yo green OTTB now has multiple buttons that Nikki is also teaching me to use! I am incredibly happy with the outcome this far in both my horse and my daughter's training. Nikki also helped us find an amazing horse for my daughter to use for barrels and 4H. She is knowledgeable, yet respectful of our decisions, and extremely helpful when it comes to caring for horses and her students. I currently am boarding 4 of my horses there and she takes great care of them when I can't be there because of the long distance. Nikki is multi talented in what she does! This just goes to show that just because a stable is close and convenient, doesn't always make it the right one. I can't say enough about Willow's Way Stables. Thank you Nikki!
So amazing, the horses were so nice and so were the people helping us. Even as a beginner I felt super safe and I 100% would recommend and come again.

My daughter just started horseback riding lessons July 2nd at Windemere. She absolutely loved her first lesson! The trainer was very friendly and knowledgeable. It's not just a place where they put you on the horse and ride in a circle. They teach you how to clean their hoofs, brush them,  put a saddle on, walk them and put them up afterwards. You learn so much more than just riding. Everyone there was so friendly and encouraging. There are updates going on as well. A covered arena is in the process of being built and it looks like other updates around the property have recently been made.
My daughter can't wait for her next lesson!

This center is an amazing place to ride at! I've been riding pretty much my whole life but wanted to start riding English. Brooke has been amazing helping me with the very different transition from one discipline to the other. I'm really enjoying all that I am learning and every horse I've ridden has been amazing!

My Daughter and I started riding at Windemere this June and absolutely love this barn! Teresa has established a professional, safe, and fun environment for anyone wanting to learn horsemanship. The facilities are incredible and their school horses are all super agreeable. Brooke is not just an amazing Trainer but a wonderful role model of Grace. I‚Äôm truly thankful God brought this place into our lives and we look forward to what the future holds!

Windemere is the most professional and well kept barn and equestrian center I have been to in the Jacksonville area. I started lessons at Windemere after turning 30! As an adult, learning to ride and care for horses has been an incredible experience and one of the things I look most forward to after a busy week. I chose Windemere over other establishments 1.To be able to learn safely with the most experienced oversight and 2.To learn caring for horses in preparation of keeping my own. Teresa, Brooke, Joan and the team are 100% focused on safety and humane treatment of the horses. It is a pleasure to have this hobby, especially at an age where I cannot afford any injuries. As far as the reviews that mention any yelling or rudeness- this is a dangerous sport- and anytime someone has yelled in my direction it was ALWAYS to keep me and my horse safe. I am grateful for the awareness of the staff and their well intentions on keeping all who work and play here out of harm.

My kids have been taking lessons here weekly since the start of The Covid lockdown just as something to do. It has been a fantastic outlet! The trainers and horses are great. I love that they offer experienced ponies for smaller children to start on. This is a wonderful family friendly place for your kids to learn all of the ground work that goes into basic horsemanship + a full hour of ride time every lesson. I am very impressed with them and highly recommend them.

Vet care here is top notch. Staff is always polite and Dr. Winters is so compassionate with his patients.
My 2 Boxers have no problem going in, they know they will be loved on.
Rubble the male, was just diagnosed with hip Dysplasia at the young age of 3 1/2 üòí
Isabel my female brindle was there for moral support. She was laying on top of him to make sure nobody came in & got him without her knowing üòÜ
This is truly the best Animal Hospital I've ever used.
Keep up the good work üëè üëç

The Staff and Dr. Winter are too knotch and the facility is beautiful. I‚Äôve never walked into a Veterinary office that actually smelled like flowers! The best part is that my dog is scared of everyone and she was not upset at all! The day after they saw her, I got a follow up call wanting to know how she was doing! I‚Äôve never had customer service like that before. I‚Äôm so glad that I was referred to Dr. Winter they go above and beyond!

3 yrs ago my lab started to experience Ibs and severe dermatitis. Since then Ive struggled to find a vet that would actually listen and understand my pups very unique needs. The prices were more than fair and best of all my pup hasn‚Äôt itched or vomited since she was in the care of winter vet staff. They‚Äôre compassionate and have the experience to treat and help your pet.
Great people. While traveling they got us in right away and took care of the problem. So grateful.

Dr. Winter and his team of professionals have provided veterinarian care for 5 cats and 7 dogs over the past 20 years.  Regardless the situation or concern I bring to Winter Animal Hospital, I am treated with kindness and respect and so are my pets.  The thing I value the most is Dr. Winter's willingness to give his time to educate me about keeping my pets well and taking away fear when my pets are injured or ill. When there is trouble, he takes his time and presents the most current information to me so together we are able to make the best informed decisions about my pet's care. Thank you Winter Animal Hospital for many happy and healthy pets 20 years running!

Love going there to get my chicken feed. The people there are so kind and I never have to put things in my car. Their prices are fair compare to other places. When I had a dog, I used to get my dog food there and I can see that they still sell quality dog food. My kids like going there for the mechanical horse.

This is an awesome place with friendly, helpful people and an incredible variety of useful inventory. Everything from tools, hay, ammo, shoes/boots, and hats to critters and honey. Stop by and find what you didn't realize you needed.

The staff at the store were extremely helpful and courteous. They proactively loaded the heavy dog food into my trunk and even ordered a specialty, expensive brand they don't usually stock. Additionally, they recommended a more affordable alternative, which I plan to explore further. Thank you!

Staff great. But he didn't tell me about something. I bought a fifty lb bag of peanuts for the squirrels at my house. He put them in the trunk of a 2024 Kia K5. When we got home and opened the trunk their were worms and moths everywhere. Long clean up job. I put the peanuts in a new trash can with a tight lid. I've been fighting these worms and moths for about two to three weeks now. Squirrels don't seem to mind but I do. Don't get peanuts here. I'm so sorry for the bad review. I like the staff. Jay‚òπÔ∏è

They have all the great wild bird food, peanuts and corn for the squirrels. I miss the lady who used to work there, she made it a point to know my name and was super friendly. I get the big bags 40lbs of bird seed and the guys just put it in my trunk no hassles. I enjoy checking out their chickens and browsing the store for different things. Prices are reasonable and I hope they stay friendly and attentive.

My pup and I have completed the basic and intermediate dog training classes with Wisney and both have been excellent. The training techniques work well and he provides effective feedback during class to help keep training on point. I found the intermediate class to be especially helpful with the commands to sit stay and down stay with distractions. Training is really a journey not a destination, and these classes provide the tools to make the journey fun and enjoyable. I highly recommend these classes!

We are not new to having dogs or getting help from trainers. Needed some help after bringing home our new 4.5 month old puppy. Wisney came recommended. Easy to book online too! He was incredibly fun, kind and helpful! Already made huge progress in a few skills after one session! I am so grateful. I needed him to help tweak what I was doing specific to our new puppy. And it has paid off! Thank you, Wisney!

So far so good! Wisney has wonderful energy and training techniques! Our 9 week old pup is already house trained, sitting, laying down, and walking on a leash like a well behaved dog! And we have only done 2 weeks of training!!! Cannot wait to see how well we are doing after 7 weeks. I'm sure we will sign up for intermediate and advanced classes. Also, completely affordable and reasonable pricing. If you need dog training, look no further!!!

Wisney came to our house for in home lessons and went above and beyond to make sure all of our concerns with our dog were addressed! He is truly a dog whisperer! His training is simple and super effective. I could not recommend him enough!

I highly recommend Wisney as a guide to help you train your dog! He is very kind and is very knowledgeable about all types of dogs. My dog use to grab socks and take stuff out of the trash can and now she will never do it again. She has improved so much and is such a good girl. Thank you so much to Wisney for helping me fulfill my doggy training dreams!
I recommend this agency because the team are professional with clients and always willing to help their employees to perform a good therapy services.

I have always found myself calmed by Jenny‚Äôs presence. She is just someone who is easy to talk with and shows incredible empathy and understanding. Everything that I bring to Jenny to talk about is met with a balance of understanding, open dialogue, and ideas to move above and past what is dragging me down. I would recommend seeing Jenny to anyone who is seeking a balance of kindness and action based work in a therapist.

Jenny Banks is an outstanding counselor who‚Äôs compassion and tenacity makes her an incredible person in an individuals‚Äô mental health arsenal. Their expertise in queer issues, compassion, and tailored approach make them an excellent choice for anyone seeking support in this community!

Lisa is awesome! Helped me with so much over differing stages of my life. Would recommend Lisa to anyone, especially those in the LGBTQIA+ community, like myself, looking for a safe and accepting counseling environment.

provider_name: Wolff's Kennel Inc, K-9 Boarding & Training Center
review_text:
‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è Amazing Training with Fidel!

Fidel was fantastic with our Bernedoodle! He‚Äôs patient, knowledgeable, and truly understands dogs. Our pup is now calmer, better behaved, and happier. Fidel made the process easy and enjoyable‚Äîhighly recommend him to anyone looking for a great trainer!

We especially appreciated how Fidel tailored the training to our dog‚Äôs personality and gave us clear guidance to continue progress at home. His passion for what he does really shows, and the results speak for themselves!

provider_name: Wolff's Kennel Inc, K-9 Boarding & Training Center
review_text: If you are looking for someone who both is knowledgeable and enacts an actual change in behavior of the way your dog responds and interacts with you this is the place to go. Fidel is an incredibly hard working and super nice person to deal with. This is the second dog we‚Äôve had trained with him and we could not be happier. Our house began to feel like chaos with a puppy and two older big dogs, we have finally felt at peace again. We couldn‚Äôt be more grateful!

provider_name: Wolff's Kennel Inc, K-9 Boarding & Training Center
review_text:
IF YOU CARE ABOUT GIVING YOUR DOG THE BEST LIFE, THIS IS THE PLACE!
I have had 2 other GSD that were SCH trained and understood the level of intelligence they possessed. After waiting almost 10 years to get another I had to go through the process of finding the proper training team to provide him. I spent 2 months going and meeting over half a dozen training facilities in the SE US. None met my standard of care and experience I wanted for my boy. Fortunately I knew 2 people that have had their dogs go through Fidel's training, both of which were the most well behaved and happy dogs I have ever met. I met and spoke with Fidel on several occasions and found his level of support and care for animals was beyond measure.  So I decided to send my young, full of energy boy to spend the next 20 weeks with him. And though I was sad and missed him terribly, Fidel communicated regularly and sent pics and tons of videos to help with my transition. Dog was fine, me not so much! LOL. In very little time he was able to undo the many mistakes that I have created and turn my baby boy into the GSD I thought he could be. A bad a** dog that does so much more than I thought was capable. I would see the videos and be like, "is that my dog?!!" He can be off leash, in public, at stores or restaurants and I can feel confident in my dog behaving. My GSD dog is simply "ON POINT"!
He spent all the time necessary with me to understand the system so that I was able to command the dog properly and happy to let me know when I wasn't. Spent a week with us both before giving us the green light.
They really love your dogs! I will be taking my boy "NIKO" back to visit Fidel as he was greatly cared for and NIKO misses him too!!!!
Thank you to Fidel and Wolff's Kennel for giving me my "Dream Dog"!

provider_name: Wolff's Kennel Inc, K-9 Boarding & Training Center
review_text:
Fidel the owner and trainer has trained 4 of my dogs (each over 80lbs), and several dogs within my family and friends. When you meet him you will see it obvious it more than just a job. He has a genuine love and strong passion for what he does. He treats all dogs as if they were his own. His training abilities is unlike any other, he is the true dog whisperer. This is why even though I relocated to California I flew to Florida with my pup because Fidel is worth it every penny and I trust no one else with my dogs more than him.
My current 8-month Shepard Rotti named Rocco when I dropped him off was stubborn and suffers from hearing issues. During his training Fidel would call and provide updates along with photos of my pup.  He kept me informed throughout the entire training process. When I dropped off Rocco he was uncontrollable, and I feared for his life if he ever got out because he could not hear me call him. I just picked him up from training and he is the same happy pup I left but now has manners and extremely well trained. I can place him at a sit stay 5 houses down and stand out of his line of site and he doesn‚Äôt not move. I can now communicate with him, and I can recall him if he were ever lose without fear anymore. Not only did Fidel train him but he spent 3 days training and educating me on how to communicate with my pup what to do to keep up with his training. He set us up for success and even checked in with me after I left with Rocco multiple times. He adapted his training to accommodate to Rocco‚Äôs hearing issues and my pup now responds by reading lips, hand signals, and recall using a whistle.  He is like a new confident pup.  Fidel even went a step further and showed me what I how to integrate my pup with my current two other dogs and be able to walk with all 3 of them (all of which are over 80lbs).  People see me with my three dogs and are so impressed how a women mange‚Äôs three large dogs and how well behaved they all are.  I will never go to any one else no matter where I live, I will go the extra mile for Fidel as he always done for me, my family, and all of my friends.

provider_name: Wolff's Kennel Inc, K-9 Boarding & Training Center
review_text: Fidel the training has helped our Lab Sushi.He is truly a dog whisperer. Before we started training, our puppy was so crazy that she wouldn‚Äôt even sit still long enough to put his leash on. After just a few sessions, Fidel had our puppy responding to commands. He is extremely gentle and loving with   Sushi. You can tell that he truly loves what he does and the results speak for themselves. Very, very impressed!

My daughter went here for months before we had to move. She was in the specialty center for speech and OT and the two ladies, Hallie and Denise, were the kindest, sweetest, most patient people ever. They truly care about the progression of your little one who needs some extra help developmentally. If there were more stars to give I would.

I wish everyone could experience a Dr Chima. Anytime we have to come to the ER for my son I pray he‚Äôs the peds Dr on call. He knows our names and faces, knows exactly what‚Äôs going on and doesn‚Äôt make us do a thousand unnecessary tests or jump through hoops. He came in today hugged my neck asked if my son had his ‚Äúsame thing‚Äù going on I said yes (it‚Äôs been a year since we‚Äôve been here and he still remembers). He had a nurse in our room with IV zofran and a bag of fluids within 5 minutes. He is hands down the best doctor I have ever seen.
Our daughter goes here for therapy and we absolutely love and my papa was also here when he was sick. The care is amazing. I‚Äôd bring my whole family here no matter the issue.
This place is a complete joke. Unless you're under 20 or over 65, they'll just let you sit in the waiting room with a head injury. Don't bring your loved ones here.

provider_name: Wolfson Children's Rehabilitation - Baptist Medical Center Beaches
review_text:
I was nervous not knowing what too expect when having my daughter seen the first time, but my mind completely changed and I was at ease, I would recommend Wolfson too anyone. I love the therapist heather she has done and amazing job with our daughter, her speech and her ability to pay attention longer has progressed so much in the 1st 2-3 weeks.
I'll be very sad when our journey has to end this place and heather have been absolutely amazing! Definitely give them a call, they have the nicest, friendliest & most polite people I've ever met or spoke too on the phone they will make you feel comfortable & safe! (:

provider_name: Wolfson Children's Rehabilitation - Baptist Medical Center Beaches
review_text: My son has been going for a year now. His therapist treat him as one of their own child. He loves going and he has made many great strides.

My daughter and I love this place. Thank you Megan and Amanda for the amazing work that you do! I recommend this place to anyone inquiring about ST and/or OT.

provider_name: Wolfson Children's Rehabilitation - Baptist Medical Center Beaches
review_text: Appointment at 8:30am ‚Ä¶. My son had a meltdown after we said good morning twice to both receptionist today and neither one of the receptionist were friendly or would say good morning or hello. They both just ignored us and continued a conversation with another patient. I felt invisible so I‚Äôm sure my son with autism felt invisible as well. ü•π Gave 3 stars because my son‚Äôs speech pathologist is awesome üòé and so good with my son.

provider_name: Wolfson Children's Rehabilitation - Baptist Medical Center Beaches
review_text: No one ever wants to take their child to physical therapy, but if you have to this is the place to go. Everyone is so kind and understanding. The staff will do whatever they can to assist you and your child to get to where you need to be. I personally love the after visit notes to see how my baby is progressing. This is out 2nd time through. 1st was for possible torticollis and now for delays crawling. Madi Jones is amazing. She is so relatable and demonstrates the stretched and exercises really well for parents to understand what they need to focus on. Highly recommend.

provider_name: Wolfson Children's Rehabilitation - Baptist Medical Center South
review_text: Great friendly staff, very kind compassionate and helpful

provider_name: Wolfson Children's Rehabilitation - Baptist Medical Center South
review_text: We had been going to this practice for years with a small kid who needed help due to speech delays and language delays. The first several years the therapists and administrative staff were wonderful. Appointments were scheduled and were made available so we can combine several together, and our insurance was charged correctly without any issues. This past year 2023 everything changed. The appointments were constantly not available to be combined, and we didn't have a constant schedule. The worst thing though was the office messed up our insurance coding or else even worse as they claim, they did some therapy procedures that weren't covered by insurance without our approval. This resulted in a big bill and no matter how many times we tried to get this resolved it was just denied. Also, they miscalculated the number of appointments we have covered. Even our insurance called and explained our coverage but they still wouldn't understand. The previous years same exact coverage and insurance plan worked just fine. We have sadly stopped going there. Our child is still in need of therapy and it's sad that the entire hospital system failed to care about what's best for my child.

provider_name: Wolfson Children's Rehabilitation - Baptist Medical Center South
review_text: Our daughter has special needs due to a rare genetic condition, so we are frequent flyers here for her physical therapy. We love this team so much. Thank you for helping us take care of our girl!!

review_text: I take my son to get his therapy and the receptionist  always says he is not insured  which he is and makes me drive 1 hour 30 min for nothing I leave and I get called by billing and the lady scheduled  my apt I was like are u sure he is covered because  I went and suppose he is not and she said yes ok so I drove to his apt and the receptionist  made me wait at the window with her smurk  and laughing  at my face and  saying he is not covered I called insurance  on her and they told her he is covered  and has been is it weren't for the nurse who does his therapy she told her to let him get his therapy  as I drive far  the receptionist  name is sylvia

provider_name: Wolfson Children's Rehabilitation - Baptist Medical Center South

provider_name: Wolfson Children's Rehabilitation - Drew Bradbury Center
review_text: After our son's ASD diagnosis, we searched for the correct therapy to fit his needs. Wolfson has by far been the best option. The early intervention program and therapy has made such a positive impact. Beyond that, the entire staff is caring, considerate and kind. Our son is finding his voice and able to understand the world around him better. Lauren and Diane have been a fantastic team, supporting his speech and occupational therapy needs. He is also working with Paige now, who is a great addition to the team. He received ABA at Wolfson as well with Dr. Robinson, who is wonderful. The front office staff is exceptional. All of that combined has been a blessing to our family.

provider_name: Wolfson Children's Rehabilitation - Drew Bradbury Center
review_text: The staff‚Ä¶ They are amazing from the front all the way to the back staff. Front staff are super friendly and helpful always willing to help in anyway. Diane is amazing we love her she is so caring and knowledgeable and we did love Rayna but she had to go on bed rest and we didn‚Äôt get to tell her bye‚Ä¶Aja took her place she is caring and super knowledgeable and helped us a lot Remi grew to love her as well. Everyone in there knew my child‚Äôs name and greeted him when we came in even Ricardo. I can‚Äôt not sing the praises of this clinic enough. They have helped my sons progress so much and I know it‚Äôs their jobs but they make you feel important and like you matter. Thank you!

provider_name: Wolfson Children's Rehabilitation - Drew Bradbury Center
review_text: My grandson & I are very familiar with Wolfsons. He was diagnosed with cerebral palsy before he turned one & with autism before he turned two.  He is now 2.5 years old. So he‚Äôs been going to various kinds of therapy there for quite a while. Can‚Äôt say enough good things about this place. The therapists are amazing. Very sympathetic, considerate, kind, understanding of your situation. And with my grandson‚Ä¶ It‚Äôs just the right balance of hard work with no room for pity & careful consideration of his limits. His physical therapist, Elisabeth, has 30 years of experience & she is soooooo good with Kameron. We see him do things in therapy for her that would never happen at home. Because he knows her expectations & no amount of fussing is going to change them. When he started therapy again six months ago after a 4 month break, he was crawling. He‚Äôs now walking with a walker!!!! THAT HAPPENED IN SIX MONTHS!!!! This place & the therapists, nurses & doctors who work here are amazing. Lots of great people that make Wolfsons the phenomenal hospital that it is. I say a heartfelt thank you to all of them. You are truly changing people‚Äôs lives. God bless you all.

provider_name: Wolfson Children's Rehabilitation - Drew Bradbury Center
review_text: Maggie has been part of the program for just 7 weeks and we have watched her grow tremendously in that short time. We are greeted cheerfully by the entire staff but when Ms Hannah and Ms Francesca come out Maggie takes off running to them without looking back! My husband and I watch in awe of the creativity, the patience, and love shown and taught to Maggie. Maggie is the youngest of three girls and the only one with ASD so this experience has been brand new to us. The entire staff at ANC has gone out of their way to aid and educate us in any way possible. We love it here!

provider_name: Wolfson Children's Rehabilitation - Drew Bradbury Center
review_text: Hannah does so well with my son. She has implemented some really good ideas to use at home and that works. She is absolutely the best. We are so very grateful for her!

provider_name: Wolfson Children's Rehabilitation - HealthPlace at Nocatee
review_text:
I would like to express my sincere gratitude for the exceptional care and professionalism demonstrated by every member of your facility. It is evident that each person possesses a wealth of experience, which greatly benefits all the patients.

We are especially grateful for the additional skills, techniques, equipment, and dedicated effort applied in Berkley‚Äôs treatment. The progress we observe after each visit is profoundly encouraging, and we deeply appreciate it more than words can convey.

As parents of a child with special needs, it can be challenging to maintain a positive outlook. However, your Nocatee team consistently helps us shift our focus away from these challenges.

Each therapist genuinely cares about the advancement of their pediatric patients, finding joy in celebrating every achievement, no matter how small. It is clear that your work is rewarding, and it is equally rewarding for us as parents to witness your dedication.

provider_name: Wolfson Children's Specialty Center - Columbia County
review_text: The staff is friendly and respectful at Wolfson children specialty center. My son has been progressing nicely with his speech therapy. The speech therapist Leslie who helps him is very caring and patient with him when he tries to not do his work.

provider_name: Wolfson Children's Specialty Center - Columbia County
review_text: I love how quickly the problem is identified and corrections are made. It's kinda hard for my son to pay attention and the activities they do and making him feel comfortable is super effective. Our therapist is so kind. provider_name: Wolfson Children's Specialty Center - Columbia County
review_text: Ms Pam is an amazing therapist that goes above and beyond. My kids love her. She gets them focused and working. They have so my fun with her.

provider_name: Wolfson Children's Specialty Center - Columbia County
review_text: My son attends physical therapy here with Ms. Pam. She works so well with kids incorporating fun activities that keeps their attention and also benefits the child and their therapeutic needs. She has done wonders with toe walking and strategies to keep him flat footed. The whole staff is always friendly and all the kids seem to enjoy their time there. The facility is newer and always clean. I always see staff wiping objects down frequently and in between sessions. Overall great experience and would recommend for therapies. They have a lot to offer including physical, speech/feeding, and occupational therapies.

provider_name: Wolfson Children's Specialty Center - Columbia County
review_text: My son Ethan (3 yrs old) attended speech therapy there for a little over a month. He always looked forward to seeing Maggie and always was excited to see her. Maggie was able to incorporate "playing" in with his speech sessions and he left her office with a huge smile on his face. Maggie is the sweetest person and has an amazing personality which made him feel comfortable with her. I already can see improvement with my son and I also learned some tools I can take home to help him with his speech. Ethan can sometimes be shy and unsure of other people but he warmed right up to Maggie within a few visits. I was able to get my son into the FDLRS program so the sessions were no longer needed but I highly recommend this facility and we had a wonderful experience there with everyone!  :)

Kristen is absolutely incredible at her craft. I had treatment back 5 years with Kristen for infertility and the same month was able to conceive naturally after many years of trying. I saw Kristen again recently and she has an incredibly holistic and thorough process. She views you as a whole person, and will give holistic feedback. As a practitioner, she is compassionate, sensitive, and intuitive. I drove from hours away just to get treatment from her--that's how amazing she is!!!

My experience with Dr. Kristen Bell was nothing short of transformative. She holds such a rare depth of attunement and presence that I felt truly seen, heard, and understood in ways I haven‚Äôt before. Our time together was deeply meaningful, I walked away with wisdom, insight, and a renewed sense of trust in my body‚Äôs own messages.
At Women‚Äôs Wisdom Integrative Wellness, there is such a refreshing approach: instead of masking symptoms or feeling dismissed, you are invited to explore what your body might be communicating - whether through pelvic pain, irregular cycles, digestive issues, or other ongoing struggles. Dr. Bell‚Äôs care is empowering, compassionate, and rooted in helping you uncover the deeper causes so you can heal in a more whole and lasting way.
I am so grateful for this experience and cannot recommend Dr. Bell highly enough to anyone seeking true integrative support and guidance on their healing journey.

Dr. Kristen has been a catalyst for my emotional and physical healing journey. I first saw her in December 2022 for a few different issues. I loved how she took the beginning of the session to get to know me and what was going on emotionally before jumping in to the physical work. I was a little nervous before going to the session, but she made me feel so comfortable. I felt like I was in the home of a friend which is a stark contrast from the sterile-feeling and impersonal vibes of typical doctors' offices. She exuded so much feminine wisdom between her pelvic floor and visceral manipulation work. Since that session, my eyes were open to the mind/body/emotion connection to the pelvic floor. Since I don't live locally, I was able to find other healing modalities, like massage and yoga. I also practiced the emotional and physical healing work that Dr. Kristen suggested. I then saw her again in February 2025 and was so excited to share with her how much I have healed many of the issues I had come to her with a couple of years before. This time I was pregnant and she helped assure me of my mind/pelvic floor connection and showed me how to prep my pelvic floor for a natural childbirth. Dr. Kristen is well worth my 2+ hour drive!

I loved my session with Kirsten.

What a great experience, she is so knowledgeable, helpful and kind.

I really felt in safe hands with her I loved how she had such a wealth of information about the physical, energetic & emotional factors.

Most of the people I‚Äôd seen up to this point were not incorporating all of these together, I was delighted to find someone like Kirsten who is passionate about an integrated approach to helping women.

Kristen is incredible. She makes you feel right at ease and she has this gentle and peaceful way about her. She takes her time to explain and talk through any proposed treatment plans or PT, always making sure you feel involved in your care. Could not recommend enough!

provider_name: WonderKids PPEC | Prescribed Pediatric Extended Care
review_text: I am incredibly grateful for the exceptional care my daughter receives at Wonderkids. They specialize in children with special medical needs and go above and beyond to meet each child's unique requirements. The staff is not only dedicated and professional but also truly family-oriented. The administration takes it upon themselves to learn about and connect with each family, ensuring a personalized experience. The owners always looks out for the kids' best interests, making Wonderkids a truly outstanding place. I highly recommend Wonderkids to any parent seeking specialized care for their child.

provider_name: WonderKids PPEC | Prescribed Pediatric Extended Care
review_text: The center has a fully trained staff to assist children with special conditions. Friendly staff that feel like family. It is an excellent center I recommend it. Its a Wonderfull center.

provider_name: WonderKids PPEC | Prescribed Pediatric Extended Care
review_text: Great nursing staff and management team, the patients care and parent satisfaction is a priority to Wonderkids

provider_name: WonderKids PPEC | Prescribed Pediatric Extended Care
review_text: This school is very special to us. We are very happy with their help. Our baby has learned many things. We are very grateful to God for placing Wonderkids in our path. We recommend them 100%. They are very professional and special with children. I feel very safe leaving my little girl here. She is very happy because they give her so much love and dedication to her development. All the therapists, nurses, and staff are super special.

provider_name: WonderKids PPEC | Prescribed Pediatric Extended Care
review_text: It's an excellent place, I recommend it 100%. They're so loving with the children and care deeply about them.
